original: gzugs la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'o //
translated: Form and so on.

original: de'i rang gi ngo bo ni rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de'i rang gi ngo bo ni rang bzhin no //
translated: Its intrinsic reality is its nature.

original: de gang la yod pa de ni de skyed ngo bos min te dngos po ni de nyid do //
analyzed: de gang la yod pa de ni de skyed ngo bos min te dngos po ni de nyid do //
translated: That which has that is not a producer by intrinsic reality, because a thing is just that.

original: gzhan de skyed par byed pa'i ngo bo gang yin pa de dang 'bral pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gzhan de skyed par byed pa'i ngo bo gang yin pa de dang 'bral pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: That which is a producer by another intrinsic reality is called ‚Äúdevoid of that.‚ÄùüîΩIn one sense, it is that and it is a producer, so it is a producer of that.

original: rnam pa gcig tu na de yang yin la skyed par byed pa yang yin pas de skyed do //
analyzed: rnam pa gcig tu na de yang yin la skyed par byed pa yang yin pas de skyed do //
translated: It is a producer of that and it is an intrinsic reality, so it is a producer by intrinsic reality.üîΩMoreover, since the intrinsic reality of that is not a producer of that, it is devoid of that.üîΩOr else, since the intrinsic reality of that is a producer of that, it is not devoid of that.üîΩSince the intrinsic reality of that is not a producer of that, it is devoid of that.üîΩSince the intrinsic reality of that is a producer of that, it is not devoid of that.üîΩSince the intrinsic reality of that is not a producer of that, it is devoid of that.üîΩSince the intrinsic reality of that is a producer of that, it is not devoid of that.üîΩSince the intrinsic reality of that is not a producer of that, it is devoid of that.üîΩSince the intrinsic reality of that is a producer of that, it is not devoid of that.üîΩSince the intrinsic reality of that is not a producer of that, it is devoid of that.üîΩSince the intrinsic reality of that is a producer of that, it is not devoid of that.üîΩSince the intrinsic reality of that is not a producer of that, it is devoid of that.üîΩSince the intrinsic reality of that is a producer of that, it is not devoid of that.üîΩSince the intrinsic reality of that is not a producer of that, it is devoid of that.üîΩSince the intrinsic reality of that is a producer of that, it is not devoid of that.üîΩSince the intrinsic reality of that is not a producer of that, it is devoid of that.üîΩSince the intrinsic reality of that is a producer of that, it is not devoid of that.üîΩSince the intrinsic reality of that is not a producer of that, it is devoid of that.üîΩSince the intrinsic reality of that is a producer of that, it is not devoid of that.üîΩSince the intrinsic reality of that is not a producer of that, it is devoid of that.

original: de ni de skyed par byed pa yang yin la ngo bo yang yin no zhes las 'dzin par byas la dgag pa dang tshig gsum gyis 'bru 'bras bu mang po par byed do //
analyzed: de ni de skyed par byed pa yang yin la ngo bo yang yin no zhes las 'dzin par byas la dgag pa dang tshig gsum gyis 'bru 'bras bu mang po par byed do //
translated: Since the intrinsic reality of that is a producer of that, it is not devoid of that.

original: yang gang gi de nyid 'bras bu de la nges par 'gyur ba 'bras bu gcig bya ba la mig la sogs pa phan tshun ma 'chol ba'i skyed par byed pa'i rang bzhin de nyid ga las 'ongs snyam du dogs pas de la nges pa zhes bya ba smos
analyzed: yang gang gi de nyid 'bras bu de la nges par 'gyur ba 'bras bu gcig bya ba la mig la sogs pa phan tshun ma 'chol ba'i skyed par byed pa'i rang bzhin de nyid ga las 'ongs snyam du dogs pas de la nges pa zhes bya ba smos
translated: Since the intrinsic reality of that is not a producer

original: te / gzhan du tha dad khyad med phyir //üîΩrna ba la sogs kyang de yi //
analyzed: te / gzhan du tha dad khyad med phyir // rna ba la sogs kyang de yi //
translated: But if they are different, why is it not accepted that the ear, etc.üîΩare also

original: skyed par byed pas cis mi 'dod //
analyzed: skyed par byed pas cis mi 'dod //
translated: productive?

original: ces gang smras pa de ni 'dis bsal ba yin no //üîΩde lta bas na tha dad na yang rang gi ngo bo nges pa la 'ga' zhig skyed par byed par 'gyur gyi gzhan @78a * //
analyzed: ces gang smras pa de ni 'dis bsal ba yin no // de lta bas na tha dad na yang rang gi ngo bo nges pa la 'ga' zhig skyed par byed par 'gyur gyi gzhan @78a * //
translated: This is the refutation of that.üîΩTherefore, even if they are different, there is no contradiction in saying

original: ni ma yin no zhes bya ba la 'gal ba cung zad kyang med do //
analyzed: ni ma yin no zhes bya ba la 'gal ba cung zad kyang med do //
translated: that a certain one is productive of a particular nature, but not another.

original: yang gal te rang bzhin gcig rjes su 'gro bas tha dad kyang mig la sogs pa skyed par byed par 'gyur ba de'i tshe /üîΩde dag gi skyed par byed pa'i rang bzhin gcig po de rgyu gcig la yang yod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yang gal te rang bzhin gcig rjes su 'gro bas tha dad kyang mig la sogs pa skyed par byed par 'gyur ba de'i tshe / de dag gi skyed par byed pa'i rang bzhin gcig po de rgyu gcig la yang yod pa'i phyir /
translated: Moreover, if the eye, etc., were productive because of the commonality ofüîΩa single nature, then, since that single productive nature would exist in a

original: gcig po de nyid las 'bras bu skyed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gcig po de nyid las 'bras bu skyed par 'gyur ro //
translated: single cause, the effect would arise from that single cause alone.

original: de lta yin dang lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu lhag ma don med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta yin dang lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu lhag ma don med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, it would follow absurdly that the remaining cooperative causesüîΩwould be purposeless.

original: ci ste khyad par gzhan ma tshang ba'i phyir gcig las 'bras bu skye ba ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste khyad par gzhan ma tshang ba'i phyir gcig las 'bras bu skye ba ma yin no zhe na /
translated: But if you say that an effect does not arise from a single cause because the other specific causes are incomplete,

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: that is not so.

original: khyad par gang dag yin pa de dag ma tshang ba med par 'dod de /
analyzed: khyad par gang dag yin pa de dag ma tshang ba med par 'dod de /
translated: Because we accept that the specific causes are not incomplete,

original: de dag nus pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag nus pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are not capable of producing the effect.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: tha dad pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: tha dad pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because they are different,

original: nus par mngon par 'dod pa'i rjes su 'gro ba can gyi rang bzhin las gzhan yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: nus par mngon par 'dod pa'i rjes su 'gro ba can gyi rang bzhin las gzhan yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: because they are different from the nature that is the basis of the capacity that is accepted.

original: nus pa med pa ma tshang bas mi skyed par rigs pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: nus pa med pa ma tshang bas mi skyed par rigs pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is also not logical that an incomplete, incapable cause produces an effect,

original: 'ga' zhig kyang mi skyed par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig kyang mi skyed par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow that any cause could produce any effect.

original: yang ci ste kho bo cag gis spyi dang khyad par phan tshun shin tu tha dad par mi 'dod de /
analyzed: yang ci ste kho bo cag gis spyi dang khyad par phan tshun shin tu tha dad par mi 'dod de /
translated: But if you think that we do not accept that universals and particulars are completely different,

original: de bas na tha dad pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs su ma grub pa yin no snyam na /
analyzed: de bas na tha dad pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs su ma grub pa yin no snyam na /
translated: then the reason ‚Äúbecause they are different‚Äù is not established.

original: ji ltar / tha dad na yang ma tshang min //
analyzed: ji ltar / tha dad na yang ma tshang min //
translated: As it is said:

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Even if they are different, they are not incomplete.

original: khyad par rnams spyi las tha mi dad par khas len na /
analyzed: khyad par rnams spyi las tha mi dad par khas len na /
translated: If one accepts that the particulars are not different from the universal,

original: 'o na khyad par gzhan ma tshang ba'i phyir gcig skyed par byed pa ma yin no zhes brjod par mi bya ste /
analyzed: 'o na khyad par gzhan ma tshang ba'i phyir gcig skyed par byed pa ma yin no zhes brjod par mi bya ste /
translated: then one should not say, ‚ÄúOne does not produce it because the other particulars are incomplete.‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir spyi de ma tshang ba med par gnas na de dang tha mi dad pa'i khyad par rnams kyang ma tshang bar ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir spyi de ma tshang ba med par gnas na de dang tha mi dad pa'i khyad par rnams kyang ma tshang bar ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because if the universal exists without being incomplete, then the particulars that are not different from it also are not established as incomplete.

original: gang zhig gang dang grub pa dang bde ba gcig pa ma yin pa de ni de'i rang bzhin du rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang zhig gang dang grub pa dang bde ba gcig pa ma yin pa de ni de'i rang bzhin du rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: That which is not established and does not have the same well-being as something else is not suitable as its nature.

original: gzhan yang thal bar 'gyur ba 'di ni khyed cag la yang mtshungs pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang thal bar 'gyur ba 'di ni khyed cag la yang mtshungs pa nyid yin te /
translated: Moreover, this consequence is the same for you.

original: rjes su 'gro ba khyad par med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba khyad par med pa'i phyir /
translated: Because there is no difference in their following.

original: thams cad thams cad skyed par byed pa ci'i phyir ma yin te /
analyzed: thams cad thams cad skyed par byed pa ci'i phyir ma yin te /
translated: Why don‚Äôt all things produce all things?

original: ji ltar khyed la rjes su 'gro ba khyad par med na yang thams cad thams cad kyi skyed par byed pa ma yin pa de bzhin du kho bo cag la yang yin pa de'i phyir 'di ni ci yang ma yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar khyed la rjes su 'gro ba khyad par med na yang thams cad thams cad kyi skyed par byed pa ma yin pa de bzhin du kho bo cag la yang yin pa de'i phyir 'di ni ci yang ma yin no //
translated: Just as for you, although there is no difference in their following, not everything produces everything, so too for us, therefore this is nothing at all.

original: gzhan yang tha dad par khyad par med na yang 'ga' zhig skyed par byed pa yin gyi gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir skyed par byed pa'i rang bzhin nges pa gcig nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan yang tha dad par khyad par med na yang 'ga' zhig skyed par byed pa yin gyi gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir skyed par byed pa'i rang bzhin nges pa gcig nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, if there is no difference in their distinctness, then the nature of the producer would be ascertained as just one, because one is a producer but the other is not.

original: gcig gi @78b rang bzhin gang yin pa de gzhan gyi ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig gi @78b rang bzhin gang yin pa de gzhan gyi ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the nature of one is not the nature of the other.

original: de lta yin na cung zad kyang 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: de lta yin na cung zad kyang 'gal ba med do //
translated: If that were so, there would be no contradiction at all.

original: gang gi tshe rjes su 'gro ba'i gcig nyid skyed par byed pa yin pa de'i phyir tshe gcig 'bras bu gcig la skyed par byed pa nyid dang skyed par byed pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba sgrub pa dang dgag pa ji ltar rten gcig la rigs rten
analyzed: gang gi tshe rjes su 'gro ba'i gcig nyid skyed par byed pa yin pa de'i phyir tshe gcig 'bras bu gcig la skyed par byed pa nyid dang skyed par byed pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba sgrub pa dang dgag pa ji ltar rten gcig la rigs rten
translated: When the single identity of following is a producer, then at one time, the producer and the non-producer are established and refuted, just like the one who is to be established and the one who is to be refuted. How could this be reasonable?

original: tha dad pa la ni 'gal ba med pas de'i phyir gcig la zhes bshad do //
analyzed: tha dad pa la ni 'gal ba med pas de'i phyir gcig la zhes bshad do //
translated: But if they are different, there is no contradiction, and therefore it is said, ‚Äúin one.‚Äù

original: yang ci ste gang gis gcig gcig la skyed par byed pa dang skyed par mi byed pa'i 'gal bar 'gyur ba kho bo cag gis gcig tu 'gro ba nyid ni mi 'dod do //
analyzed: yang ci ste gang gis gcig gcig la skyed par byed pa dang skyed par mi byed pa'i 'gal bar 'gyur ba kho bo cag gis gcig tu 'gro ba nyid ni mi 'dod do //
translated: But if you think, ‚ÄúWhy is there a contradiction in one thing being both productive and un-productive of another? We do not accept that they are the same.‚Äù

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: Well then, what is it?

original: 'di la tha dad pa las yin te /
analyzed: 'di la tha dad pa las yin te /
translated: It is different.

original: des na skyed par byed pa ma yin pa nyid mi 'gal lo snyam na /
analyzed: des na skyed par byed pa ma yin pa nyid mi 'gal lo snyam na /
translated: So there is no contradiction in something being un-productive.‚Äù

original: tha dad pa'i yin la rag mod /üîΩci skyed par byed pa'i rang bzhin tha dad pa de skyed par byed pa'i bdag nyid kyi rjes su 'gro ba 'di nyid yin nam /
analyzed: tha dad pa'i yin la rag mod / ci skyed par byed pa'i rang bzhin tha dad pa de skyed par byed pa'i bdag nyid kyi rjes su 'gro ba 'di nyid yin nam /
translated: It may be different,

original: 'on te gzhan yin zhes bya ba brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'on te gzhan yin zhes bya ba brjod par bya'o //
translated: but you must say whether the difference in the nature of the productive is the same as the nature of the productive or whether it is different.

original: re zhig de nyid ni ma yin te /
analyzed: re zhig de nyid ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not the same,

original: dngos po rang gi ngo bo las ldog par rigs pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: dngos po rang gi ngo bo las ldog par rigs pa ni ma yin te /
translated: because it is not tenable that a thing is different from its own nature,

original: rang bzhin med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow, absurdly, that it would be essenceless.

original: gzhan tha dad pa yin na skyed par byed pa'i rang bzhin ma tshang ba med pa de skyed par byed pa ma yin pa nyid du yang rigs pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan tha dad pa yin na skyed par byed pa'i rang bzhin ma tshang ba med pa de skyed par byed pa ma yin pa nyid du yang rigs pa yang ma yin te /
translated: If it is different, then it is not reasonable that the complete nature of the producer is not a producer.

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the absurd consequence.

original: yang na de nyid rang gi ngo bo las tha dad pa yin du chug mod /
analyzed: yang na de nyid rang gi ngo bo las tha dad pa yin du chug mod /
translated: Or, let it be that it is different from its own nature.

original: de lta na yang gcig skyed par byed pa dang / skyed par byed pa ma yin pa 'gal ba ma bsal ba kho na ste /
analyzed: de lta na yang gcig skyed par byed pa dang / skyed par byed pa ma yin pa 'gal ba ma bsal ba kho na ste /
translated: Even so, the contradiction of producing one thing and not producing it is not removed.

original: 'di ltar tha dad pa'i phyir gcig po de byed pa po de ma yin par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar tha dad pa'i phyir gcig po de byed pa po de ma yin par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: Because of being different, it would not be the agent of that.

original: 'on te gzhan rjes su 'gro ba med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'on te gzhan rjes su 'gro ba med pa ma yin no //
translated: But it is not that it does not follow another.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then?

original: de nyid rjes su 'gro ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de nyid rjes su 'gro ba yin no zhe na /
translated: It follows that very thing.

original: de lta yin dang gcig skyed par byed pa dang skyed par byed pa ma yin pa 'gal ba de nyid so na 'dug pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta yin dang gcig skyed par byed pa dang skyed par byed pa ma yin pa 'gal ba de nyid so na 'dug pa yin no //
translated: If that is so, then the contradiction of producing one thing and not producing it remains.

original: rjes su 'jug pa zhes bya ba ni rjes su 'gro ba ste /
analyzed: rjes su 'jug pa zhes bya ba ni rjes su 'gro ba ste /
translated: Following is following after.

original: skyed par byed pa nyid kyi rang bzhin la brjod kyi /
analyzed: skyed par byed pa nyid kyi rang bzhin la brjod kyi /
translated: The nature of the producer is stated,

original: gzhan la mngon du phyogs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan la mngon du phyogs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: but not the nature of the non-producer.

original: gzhan yang rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag gis khyad par nyid las 'bras bu grub pa de dag kho na mtshan nyid du rigs kyi spyi ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan yang rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag gis khyad par nyid las 'bras bu grub pa de dag kho na mtshan nyid du rigs kyi spyi ni ma yin no //
translated: Moreover, the effect is established by the presence and absence of the specific property, and it is reasonable that those are the characteristics, but not the universal.

original: dngos po nyid kyi mtshan nyid ni don bya ba byed pa nyid yin pa'i @79a * //üîΩphyir ro ; / de lta yin dang ci spyi rang gi mtshan nyid las tha dad pa yin nam /
analyzed: dngos po nyid kyi mtshan nyid ni don bya ba byed pa nyid yin pa'i @79a * // phyir ro ; / de lta yin dang ci spyi rang gi mtshan nyid las tha dad pa yin nam /
translated: The characteristic of an entity is the performance of a function.

original: 'on te tha mi dad pa yin zhes don byed pa don du gnyer ba de la tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa'i bsams pas ci zhig bya /
analyzed: 'on te tha mi dad pa yin zhes don byed pa don du gnyer ba de la tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa'i bsams pas ci zhig bya /
translated: If that is so, what is the use of the thought of difference or non-difference for one who seeks the performance of a function, asking whether the universal is different or not different from its own characteristic?

original: gang gi phyir don byed par rung ba'i rang bzhin gang kho na mngon par 'dod pas don byed pa don du gnyer ba'i skyes bu 'jug pa don du gnyer ba rnams kyis tha dad pa dang tha mi dad par der brtags pa nyid bsam par bya ba nyid
analyzed: gang gi phyir don byed par rung ba'i rang bzhin gang kho na mngon par 'dod pas don byed pa don du gnyer ba'i skyes bu 'jug pa don du gnyer ba rnams kyis tha dad pa dang tha mi dad par der brtags pa nyid bsam par bya ba nyid
translated: Because only those who seek to engage in the activity of a certain object, who seek to engage in the object of desire, will consider whether that object is the same as or different from the object of desire.

original: yin gyi zhen pas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yin gyi zhen pas ni ma yin no //
translated: They will not consider it out of attachment.

original: de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin te /
translated: If it were otherwise,

original: gal te ma brtags pa'i tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa dag mi 'dod pa de'i me /
analyzed: gal te ma brtags pa'i tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa dag mi 'dod pa de'i me /
translated: if one did not accept the difference or nondifference of the object of desire when not analyzed,

original: don byed par rung ba de'i bdag nyid kyis te rang gi ngo bos tha dad pa don dam par yod pa nyid dang / ldog pas te rnam par rtog pa'i blo la snang ba'i ngo bor byas nas mtshungs pa nyid du rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: don byed par rung ba de'i bdag nyid kyis te rang gi ngo bos tha dad pa don dam par yod pa nyid dang / ldog pas te rnam par rtog pa'i blo la snang ba'i ngo bor byas nas mtshungs pa nyid du rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: then the object of desire would be ultimately existent, different by nature from the object of engagement, and the same in terms of the opposite, that is, in terms of the nature that appears to the conceptual mind.

original: de'i dngos po nges pa yin no zhes bya ba la brtsad pa med pa kho na'o //
analyzed: de'i dngos po nges pa yin no zhes bya ba la brtsad pa med pa kho na'o //
translated: There would be no dispute over the fact that it would be a definite entity.

original: 'di tsam nyid kyis kyang don byed pa don du gnyer ba'i tha dad pa dang spyi'i bsam pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir don bya ba mi byed pa'i spyi tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa bsam pas ci zhig bya /
analyzed: 'di tsam nyid kyis kyang don byed pa don du gnyer ba'i tha dad pa dang spyi'i bsam pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir don bya ba mi byed pa'i spyi tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa bsam pas ci zhig bya /
translated: Since this alone fulfills the thought of the general and specific purpose of those who seek to accomplish the purpose, what is the use of thinking about the general and specific non-performance of the purpose?

original: yang spyi ste dngos po nyid spyi'i yin la rag mod /
analyzed: yang spyi ste dngos po nyid spyi'i yin la rag mod /
translated: Moreover, it is certainly the case that a thing is a universal.

original: log pa brtags pas ci zhig bya snyam na /
analyzed: log pa brtags pas ci zhig bya snyam na /
translated: What is the use of imagining a false universal?

original: dngos po zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: dngos po zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúIf a thing‚Ä¶‚Äù and so on.

original: gal te bum pa la sogs pa snam bu la sogs pa la rjes su 'gro bar 'gyur ba de'i tshe sbrang rtsi dang chu la sogs pa 'dzin pa don du gnyer ba rnam bu la sogs pa la yang 'jug par 'gyur ba'i phyir 'jug pa 'chol bar thalüîΩbar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te bum pa la sogs pa snam bu la sogs pa la rjes su 'gro bar 'gyur ba de'i tshe sbrang rtsi dang chu la sogs pa 'dzin pa don du gnyer ba rnam bu la sogs pa la yang 'jug par 'gyur ba'i phyir 'jug pa 'chol bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If a thing such as a pot were to be concomitant with cloth and so on, then those who seek to hold honey, water, and so on would also engage in cloth and so on, and therefore it follows that engagement would be random.

original: sogs pa'i sgras skye ba dang 'gag pa la sogs pa mtshungs par thal bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras skye ba dang 'gag pa la sogs pa mtshungs par thal bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The term ‚Äúand so on‚Äù indicates that it follows that arising, ceasing, and so on would be similar.

original: ci ste bde bar gshegs pa rnams bzhin du gzhan dag gis kyang /
analyzed: ci ste bde bar gshegs pa rnams bzhin du gzhan dag gis kyang /
translated: were to understand the meaning of the Vedas,üîΩthen the Vedas would be useless.

original: de'i phyir gang dang gang las don //
analyzed: de'i phyir gang dang gang las don //
translated: But if the Vedas are not understood by anyone,

original: ldog pa de yi skyon can gyi //
analyzed: ldog pa de yi skyon can gyi //
translated: then they are useless, like the speech of a mute.üîΩIf the Vedas are understood by some,üîΩthen they are not useless.üîΩBut if the Vedas are understood by some,üîΩthen they are not useless.

original: rig byed de yi khyad par ni //
analyzed: rig byed de yi khyad par ni //
translated: But if the Vedas are understood by some,üîΩthen they are not useless.üîΩBut if the Vedas are understood by some,

original: rtogs 'gyur ba dag rab tu byed //
analyzed: rtogs 'gyur ba dag rab tu byed //
translated: then they are not useless.üîΩBut if the Vedas are understood by some,

original: ces bya ba 'di 'dod pa de la bshad pa /
analyzed: ces bya ba 'di 'dod pa de la bshad pa /
translated: then they are not useless.üîΩBut if the Vedas are understood by some,

original: rtogs pas bkod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: rtogs pas bkod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: then they are not useless.üîΩBut if the Vedas are understood by some,

original: sna tshogs pa zhes bya ba ni tha dad pa'o //
analyzed: sna tshogs pa zhes bya ba ni tha dad pa'o //
translated: then they are not useless.üîΩBut if the Vedas are understood by some,üîΩthen they are not useless.üîΩBut if the Vedas are understood by some,üîΩthen they are not useless.

original: gang tshe gser por zhes bya ba la sogs pas gzhon nu ma len gyi lugs kyi dogs pa bsu ba yin te /
analyzed: gang tshe gser por zhes bya ba la sogs pas gzhon nu ma len gyi lugs kyi dogs pa bsu ba yin te /
translated: But if the Vedas are understood by some,

original: des smras pa /üîΩdngos po thams cad skyed pa dang gnas pa dang @79b 'jig pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir gsum gyi bdag nyid yin te /
analyzed: des smras pa / dngos po thams cad skyed pa dang gnas pa dang @79b 'jig pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir gsum gyi bdag nyid yin te /
translated: then they are not useless.üîΩBut if the Vedas are understood by some,üîΩthen they are not useless.üîΩBut if the Vedas are understood by some,üîΩthen they are not useless.üîΩBut if the Vedas are understood by some,üîΩthen they are not useless.üîΩBut if the Vedas are understood by some,

original: gcig las kyang dga' ba la sogs pa 'bras bu gsum 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig las kyang dga' ba la sogs pa 'bras bu gsum 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: then they are not useless.

original: 'di ltar gang gi tshe /
analyzed: 'di ltar gang gi tshe /
translated: But if the Vedas are understood by some,

original: gser phor bcag nas gdu bur byas pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gser phor bcag nas gdu bur byas pa de'i tshe /
translated: then they are not useless.

original: gser phor don du gnyer ba mya ngan skye la /
analyzed: gser phor don du gnyer ba mya ngan skye la /
translated: When one seeks a gold bowl, one experiences sorrow.

original: gdu bu don du gnyer ba dga' ba skye zhing gser don du gnyer ba ni bar mar gnas so //
analyzed: gdu bu don du gnyer ba dga' ba skye zhing gser don du gnyer ba ni bar mar gnas so //
translated: When one seeks a bracelet, one experiences joy. When one seeks gold, one remains neutral.

original: gal te dngos po gcig gi ngo bor gyur na /
analyzed: gal te dngos po gcig gi ngo bor gyur na /
translated: If it were the nature of a single thing,

original: de'i tshe gcig gi rnam pa can gyi blor 'gyur gyi gsum gyi rnam pa can 'di ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i tshe gcig gi rnam pa can gyi blor 'gyur gyi gsum gyi rnam pa can 'di ni ma yin no //
translated: then it would be the cognition of a single aspect, not the cognition of three aspects.

original: gser phor ni snod kyi khyad par yin la /
analyzed: gser phor ni snod kyi khyad par yin la /
translated: A gold bowl is a particular kind of vessel.

original: gdu bu ni rgyan gyi khyad par yin no //
analyzed: gdu bu ni rgyan gyi khyad par yin no //
translated: A bracelet is a particular kind of ornament.

original: 'di snyam du gal te gsum gyi bdag nyid do zhes bya ba bsgrub pa de'i tshe 'jig pa la sogs pa'i ngo bos gsum gyi bdag nyid do zhes bya ba 'di ga las she na /
analyzed: 'di snyam du gal te gsum gyi bdag nyid do zhes bya ba bsgrub pa de'i tshe 'jig pa la sogs pa'i ngo bos gsum gyi bdag nyid do zhes bya ba 'di ga las she na /
translated: If you prove that it is the nature of three things, then how is it that it is the nature of three things by the nature of destruction and so on?

original: 'jig pa med na mya ngan med //
analyzed: 'jig pa med na mya ngan med //
translated: If there were no destruction, there would be no sorrow.

original: ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: And so on.

original: des na spyi ni rtag pa nyid //
analyzed: des na spyi ni rtag pa nyid //
translated: Therefore the universal is permanent.

original: ces bya ba ni gang gi phyir gnas pa med na bar mar gnas pa med de bar mar gnas pa med na mi 'byung ba des gser gyi spyi rtag pa nyid du rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni gang gi phyir gnas pa med na bar mar gnas pa med de bar mar gnas pa med na mi 'byung ba des gser gyi spyi rtag pa nyid du rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: This is because if there is no enduring, then there is no middle that endures, and if there is no middle that endures, then it is understood that the universal of gold is permanent.

original: de ltar de yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed de /
analyzed: de ltar de yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed de /
translated: In response to this, he says, ‚ÄúIn that case, that also . . . ,‚Äù and so on.

original: rten mi mtshungs pa yin phyir ro //
analyzed: rten mi mtshungs pa yin phyir ro //
translated: Because the basis is not the same.

original: zhes bya ba 'di ni bshad par bya ba'i tshig yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di ni bshad par bya ba'i tshig yin te /
translated: This is the statement that requires explanation.

original: 'di 'chad pa ni /
analyzed: 'di 'chad pa ni /
translated: The explanation is:

original: gang phyir skyes dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gang phyir skyes dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Because arising and so on are not different.

original: gal te dngos po gcig kyang skye ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyis gsum gyi bdag nyid du 'gyur na de'i tshe phan tshun 'gal ba'i skye ba dang / gnas pa dang 'jig pa rnams cig car 'byung bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: gal te dngos po gcig kyang skye ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyis gsum gyi bdag nyid du 'gyur na de'i tshe phan tshun 'gal ba'i skye ba dang / gnas pa dang 'jig pa rnams cig car 'byung bar 'gyur la /
translated: If a single thing were the nature of three things, such as arising and so on, then at that time arising, enduring, and disintegrating, which are mutually incompatible, would occur simultaneously.

original: 'gal ba dag ni gcig la cig car yod par rigs pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'gal ba dag ni gcig la cig car yod par rigs pa yang ma yin te /
translated: But it is not logical for incompatible things to exist simultaneously in one thing.

original: de lta ma yin na 'gal ba nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na 'gal ba nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were not so, they would not be incompatible.

original: 'o na ji ltar blo gsum skye bar rigs she na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar blo gsum skye bar rigs she na /
translated: Well then, how is it tenable that the three thoughts arise?

original: ji ltar rigs pa rnams bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ji ltar rigs pa rnams bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate how it is tenable, he says:

original: skad cig 'jig ces bya ba smos te /
analyzed: skad cig 'jig ces bya ba smos te /
translated: The destruction of momentariness.

original: gser por gyi bdag nyid kyi dngos po ni gser gyi phor pa 'di dngos po'o //
analyzed: gser por gyi bdag nyid kyi dngos po ni gser gyi phor pa 'di dngos po'o //
translated: The entity that has the nature of a golden pot is this entity, a golden pot.

original: de yang khyad par ji lta bu zhe na /üîΩgser gyi bdag nyid de rang bzhin de gang la yod pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: de yang khyad par ji lta bu zhe na / gser gyi bdag nyid de rang bzhin de gang la yod pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: Moreover, what is its distinction?üîΩThe nature of gold is the essence that exists in that.

original: de rang nyid las te /
analyzed: de rang nyid las te /
translated: The phrase is to be analyzed in this way.üîΩWhen it is destroyed by itself,

original: rang gi dang gis 'jig pa na de don du gnyer ba 'ga' zhig pa mya ngan skye'o //
analyzed: rang gi dang gis 'jig pa na de don du gnyer ba 'ga' zhig pa mya ngan skye'o //
translated: some who desire it will experience sorrow.

original: snga na med pa'i gdu bu @80a * //
analyzed: snga na med pa'i gdu bu @80a * //
translated: When the nature of a bracelet that did not exist previously

original: zhes bya ba'i ngo bo de'i bdag nyid de de gser gyi bdag nyid skye ba 'byung ba na gdu bu 'dod pa 'ga' zhig dga' ba skye bar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i ngo bo de'i bdag nyid de de gser gyi bdag nyid skye ba 'byung ba na gdu bu 'dod pa 'ga' zhig dga' ba skye bar 'gyur gyi /
translated: arises, some who desire a bracelet will experience joy.

original: gser gyi bdag nyid kyi bstan pa 'ga' yang yod pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gser gyi bdag nyid kyi bstan pa 'ga' yang yod pa ni ma yin te /
translated: But the nature of gold does not exist at all.

original: skye ba dang 'jig pa dag ni rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye ba dang 'jig pa dag ni rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because arising and destruction are not related.

original: 'o na gal te de lta na bar mar gnas pa'i blo ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na gal te de lta na bar mar gnas pa'i blo ji ltar zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then how does the cognition of the present state arise?

original: gang gi tshe rmongs pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe rmongs pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The present state arises due to the delusion of those whose minds are confused.

original: gang gi tshe rmongs pa'i blo can gyis gser gyi bdag nyid de /
analyzed: gang gi tshe rmongs pa'i blo can gyis gser gyi bdag nyid de /
translated: When those whose minds are confused see a gold vessel,

original: gser gyi rang bzhin gyi gser phor dang / gdu bu zhes bya ba'i dngos po dag rim gyis mthong ste /
analyzed: gser gyi rang bzhin gyi gser phor dang / gdu bu zhes bya ba'i dngos po dag rim gyis mthong ste /
translated: a gold ring, and so on, they see them as having the nature of gold, and they see them as having the nature of a gold vessel, a gold ring, and so on.üîΩWhen they see the nature of gold, they see it as having the nature of gold, and they see it as having the nature of a gold ring, and so on.

original: rang bzhin dben  par mthong na yang 'dra ba gzhan byung bas 'khrul pas rnam par dbye bar mi nus pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rang bzhin dben  par mthong na yang 'dra ba gzhan byung bas 'khrul pas rnam par dbye bar mi nus pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because they are confused, they are unable to distinguish the nature of gold from the nature of a gold ring, and so on.

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'dra ba gzhan gyi ngo bo 'khrul pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis 'khrul pa na gnas skabs gnyi ga la yang gser bstan pa nyid du sems so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'dra ba gzhan gyi ngo bo 'khrul pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis 'khrul pa na gnas skabs gnyi ga la yang gser bstan pa nyid du sems so //
translated: Therefore, when they are confused due to the cause of confusion, the nature of a gold ring, and so on, they think that the nature of gold is present in both states.

original: 'dra ba gzhan ngo bos zhes bya ba ni gser ma yin pa las ldog pa tsam du chos mthun bas dra ba gzhan gyi ngo bo skye ba ni 'dra ba gzhan gyi ngo bo'o //
analyzed: 'dra ba gzhan ngo bos zhes bya ba ni gser ma yin pa las ldog pa tsam du chos mthun bas dra ba gzhan gyi ngo bo skye ba ni 'dra ba gzhan gyi ngo bo'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe nature of another that is similar‚Äù is the arising of the nature of another that is similar, due to the similarity of the mere opposite of what is not gold.

original: yang ji ltar 'dra ba gzhan gyi ngo bos 'khrul pa bstan par rlom pa yin gyi /
analyzed: yang ji ltar 'dra ba gzhan gyi ngo bos 'khrul pa bstan par rlom pa yin gyi /
translated: But how can you claim that you have demonstrated error through the nature of another that is similar?

original: dngos po nyid de lta bu yin pa'i phyir ni ma yin no zhes brjod par bya zhe na /
analyzed: dngos po nyid de lta bu yin pa'i phyir ni ma yin no zhes brjod par bya zhe na /
translated: You should say that it is because things themselves are like that.

original: gser brten zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gser brten zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúIf gold were permanent,‚Äù and so on.

original: gal te gser brtan pa nyid du gyur na de'i tshe de dang tha mi dad pa'i gdu bu la sogs pa yang gser phor la sogs pa'i gnas skabs su mthong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te gser brtan pa nyid du gyur na de'i tshe de dang tha mi dad pa'i gdu bu la sogs pa yang gser phor la sogs pa'i gnas skabs su mthong bar 'gyur te /
translated: If gold were permanent, then at that time, the bracelet, which is not different from it, would also be seen in the state of the golden pot,

original: dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would have the character of being observed.

original: de lta ma yin na gal te gdu bu ni gser phor gyi gnas skabs la ma mthong la dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa'i gser por yang gdu ba'i gnas skabs su ma mthong ba de'i tshe /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na gal te gdu bu ni gser phor gyi gnas skabs la ma mthong la dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa'i gser por yang gdu ba'i gnas skabs su ma mthong ba de'i tshe /
translated: If it were not so, then if the bracelet is not seen in the state of the golden pot, and the golden pot, which is characterized as the observed object, is not seen in the state of the bracelet,

original: de dag phan tshun tha dad pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag phan tshun tha dad pa yin no //
translated: then they are mutually different.

original: de lta yin dang de dag las tha mi dad pa'i phyir de'i rang gi ngo bo bzhin du gser yang tha dad par 'gyur ro zhes dpyad nas /
analyzed: de lta yin dang de dag las tha mi dad pa'i phyir de'i rang gi ngo bo bzhin du gser yang tha dad par 'gyur ro zhes dpyad nas /
translated: If that were so, then because they are not different from those, like their own nature, the gold also would be different.

original: gzhan du gcig nyid min zhes bya ba smos te /üîΩgang yang ldog mtshams dngos po las //
analyzed: gzhan du gcig nyid min zhes bya ba smos te / gang yang ldog mtshams dngos po las //
translated: Having analyzed in this way, he says, ‚ÄúOtherwise, they are not the same.‚ÄùüîΩAlso, that which is stated to prove difference, such as ‚ÄúThe boundary of difference is from the thing,‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas tha dad pa bsgrub pa brjod pa de la grub pa la bsgrub pa'i phyir sun 'byin pa brjod par mi bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas tha dad pa bsgrub pa brjod pa de la grub pa la bsgrub pa'i phyir sun 'byin pa brjod par mi bya'o //
translated: is to be refuted because it is a proof of what is already established.

original: de kho na nyid bsdus pa'i dka' 'grel las 'byung brtag pa ste nyi shu lnga pa'o /
analyzed: de kho na nyid bsdus pa'i dka' 'grel las 'byung brtag pa ste nyi shu lnga pa'o /
translated: This is the twenty-fifth chapter of the Commentary on the Compendium of Reality.

original: // / @80b mi 'je  zhes bya ba de bsgrub pa'i don du /
analyzed: // / @80b mi 'je  zhes bya ba de bsgrub pa'i don du /
translated: In order to prove that, he says:

original: sangs rgyas pa dag ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas pa dag ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: says:

original: brtan pa 'ga' yang yod ma yin //
analyzed: brtan pa 'ga' yang yod ma yin //
translated: There is no stability at all.

original: zhes bya ba 'di la 'di skad ces brgal te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di la 'di skad ces brgal te /
translated: Here, the following objection is raised:üîΩ‚ÄúBut it is said:

original: 'on te / brtan pa 'ga' yang yod ma yin //üîΩzhes bya ba 'di ltar brjod de /
analyzed: 'on te / brtan pa 'ga' yang yod ma yin // zhes bya ba 'di ltar brjod de /
translated: There is no stability at all.

original: gang gi phyir chos skyob la sogs pa sangs rgyas pa kha cig gis kyang gnas skabs tha dad pa'i phyir gser brtan pa 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir chos skyob la sogs pa sangs rgyas pa kha cig gis kyang gnas skabs tha dad pa'i phyir gser brtan pa 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Because some Buddhists, such as DharmapƒÅla, say that there is no stability at all, because gold and so on have different states.

original: rjes su 'gro ba dang chos mtshungs pas dngos po dus gsum du gnas par 'dod de //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba dang chos mtshungs pas dngos po dus gsum du gnas par 'dod de //
translated: They assert that things endure for three times through similarity of type.

original: 'di nyid tshigs su bcad pa gnyis pas ston to //üîΩde la dngos po gzhan du 'gyur bar smra ba ni btsun pa chos skyob yin te /
analyzed: 'di nyid tshigs su bcad pa gnyis pas ston to // de la dngos po gzhan du 'gyur bar smra ba ni btsun pa chos skyob yin te /
translated: This is taught in the second verse.üîΩThe one who advocates the transformation of things is Bhadanta DharmapƒÅla.

original: des na re chos dus rnams su 'jug pa na dngos po gzhan du 'gyur ba 'ba' zhig tu zad kyi rdzas ni ma yin no zhes zer ro zhes grag ste /
analyzed: des na re chos dus rnams su 'jug pa na dngos po gzhan du 'gyur ba 'ba' zhig tu zad kyi rdzas ni ma yin no zhes zer ro zhes grag ste /
translated: He says that when things engage the times, they merely transform into other things, but they are not substances.

original: dper na gser gyi rdzas kyi gdu bu dang dpung rgyan dang rna cha la sogs par brjod pa'i rgyu mtshan gyi yon tan gzhan du 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: dper na gser gyi rdzas kyi gdu bu dang dpung rgyan dang rna cha la sogs par brjod pa'i rgyu mtshan gyi yon tan gzhan du 'gyur gyi /
translated: For example, the color of a gold bracelet, necklace, or earring does not change due to the change in their shape.

original: kha dog ni ma yin pa de bzhin du chos skye ba ma 'ongs pa la sogs pa'i dngos po gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid yin te /
analyzed: kha dog ni ma yin pa de bzhin du chos skye ba ma 'ongs pa la sogs pa'i dngos po gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid yin te /
translated: Similarly, the future state of a phenomenon changes to the present state, and the present state changes to the past state, but the substance does not change.

original: 'di ltar chos rnams ma 'ongs pa'i dngos po yongs su spangs nas da ltar ba'i dngos por 'gyur ba dang / da ltar byung ba'i dngos po yongs su spangs nas kyang 'das pa'i dngos por 'gyur gyi /üîΩrdzas gzhan du 'gyur pa nyid ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar chos rnams ma 'ongs pa'i dngos po yongs su spangs nas da ltar ba'i dngos por 'gyur ba dang / da ltar byung ba'i dngos po yongs su spangs nas kyang 'das pa'i dngos por 'gyur gyi / rdzas gzhan du 'gyur pa nyid ni ma yin te /
translated: For example, a phenomenon abandons its future state and becomes a present state, and it abandons its present state and becomes a past state,

original: rdzas ni thams cad du 'khrul pa med pa'i phyir ro //üîΩde lta ma yin na ma 'ongs pa yang gzhan yin la /
analyzed: rdzas ni thams cad du 'khrul pa med pa'i phyir ro // de lta ma yin na ma 'ongs pa yang gzhan yin la /
translated: but it does not change its substance because substance is never confused.

original: da ltar byung ba yang gzhan yin zhing 'das pa yang gzhan yin no zhes bya ba thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: da ltar byung ba yang gzhan yin zhing 'das pa yang gzhan yin no zhes bya ba thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were not so, it would follow that the future would be one thing, the present would be another, and the past would be another.

original: gang gi 'das pa la sogs pa'i brjod pa dang shes pa 'jug pa des dngos po la yon tan gyi khyad par ci zhig 'dod /
analyzed: gang gi 'das pa la sogs pa'i brjod pa dang shes pa 'jug pa des dngos po la yon tan gyi khyad par ci zhig 'dod /
translated: What special quality of the thing is asserted by that by which the expressions and consciousnesses of past, etc.,üîΩare engaged?

original: mtshan nyid gzhan du 'gyur ba smras pa ni btsun pa dbyangs sgrogs yin te /
analyzed: mtshan nyid gzhan du 'gyur ba smras pa ni btsun pa dbyangs sgrogs yin te /
translated: Bhadanta Gho·π£aka is the proponent of the transformation of characteristics.

original: de na re chos dus rnams su 'jug pa na 'das pa 'das pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan la ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba dag gi mtshan nyid dang yang ldan te /
analyzed: de na re chos dus rnams su 'jug pa na 'das pa 'das pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan la ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba dag gi mtshan nyid dang yang ldan te /
translated: He says that when a phenomenon enters the times, it is past and possesses the characteristics of the past, and it is also the future and the present and possesses the characteristics of the future and the present.

original: dper na skyes bu bud med gcig la chags pa lhag ma la chags pa dang bral ba ma yin pa bzhin no //üîΩde bzhin du ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba dag la yang @81a * //
analyzed: dper na skyes bu bud med gcig la chags pa lhag ma la chags pa dang bral ba ma yin pa bzhin no // de bzhin du ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba dag la yang @81a * //
translated: For example, a man who is attached to one woman is not unattached to the remaining women.

original: brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: brjod par bya'o //
translated: So too, it is to be stated for the future and the present.

original: 'di ni 'das pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid 'jug pa thob pa la ltos nas tha snyad du byed pa'i phyir snga ma las tha dad par smra bar grag go //
analyzed: 'di ni 'das pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid 'jug pa thob pa la ltos nas tha snyad du byed pa'i phyir snga ma las tha dad par smra bar grag go //
translated: This is said to be different from the former because it is conventionally said to be the engagement of the characteristics of the past, etc., in dependence on the obtainment of the characteristics.

original: gnas skabs gzhan du 'gyur bar smra ba ni btsun pa dbyig bshes yin te /
analyzed: gnas skabs gzhan du 'gyur bar smra ba ni btsun pa dbyig bshes yin te /
translated: Bhadanta Vasumitra says that it is said to transform into another state.

original: de na re chos dus rnams su 'jug pa na gnas skabs dang gnas skabs su phyin nas gnas skabs gzhan gyi sgo nas gzhan dang gzhan du ston gyi rdzas kyi sgo nas ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de na re chos dus rnams su 'jug pa na gnas skabs dang gnas skabs su phyin nas gnas skabs gzhan gyi sgo nas gzhan dang gzhan du ston gyi rdzas kyi sgo nas ni ma yin te /
translated: He says that when a phenomenon enters the three times, it is said to be different through the state of being different, but not through substance,

original: rdzas ni dus gsum char du tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdzas ni dus gsum char du tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because substance is not different in the three times.

original: dper na 'ji ba'i ri lu gcig gcig gi shos mig tu gzhag na gcig ces bya la /üîΩbrgya'i shos mig tu gzhag na brgya /
analyzed: dper na 'ji ba'i ri lu gcig gcig gi shos mig tu gzhag na gcig ces bya la / brgya'i shos mig tu gzhag na brgya /
translated: For example, if one places a single clay bead on one‚Äôs eye, it is called one.üîΩIf one places a bead on one‚Äôs eye for every hundred, it is called a hundred.

original: stong gi shos mig tu gzhag na stong pa yin pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: stong gi shos mig tu gzhag na stong pa yin pa de bzhin du /
translated: If one places a bead on one‚Äôs eye for every thousand, it is called a thousand.

original: dngos po byed pa'i gnas skabs na da ltar yin la de zhig pa ni 'das pa yin la /
analyzed: dngos po byed pa'i gnas skabs na da ltar yin la de zhig pa ni 'das pa yin la /
translated: In the same way, when an entity is in the state of being produced, it is present. When it disintegrates, it is past.

original: de ma thob pa ni ma 'ongs pa yin no zhes zer ro zhes grag ste /
analyzed: de ma thob pa ni ma 'ongs pa yin no zhes zer ro zhes grag ste /
translated: When it has not yet been obtained, it is future.

original: 'di yang gnas skabs la ltos nas tha snyad du bya ba yin te /
analyzed: 'di yang gnas skabs la ltos nas tha snyad du bya ba yin te /
translated: This is said to be conventional designation in terms of state.

original: dper na 'ji ba'i gong bu bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na 'ji ba'i gong bu bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like a lump of clay.

original: de'i rang bzhin gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not that its intrinsic nature changes.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then?

original: gnas skabs kyi khyad par dang 'brel ba'i phyir grangs gsal bar byed pa'i ming gzhan 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: gnas skabs kyi khyad par dang 'brel ba'i phyir grangs gsal bar byed pa'i ming gzhan 'byung ba yin no //
translated: The name is changed in connection with the distinction of its states.

original: gzhan gzhan du 'gyur ba smra ba ni btsun pa sangs rgyas lha yin te /
analyzed: gzhan gzhan du 'gyur ba smra ba ni btsun pa sangs rgyas lha yin te /
translated: The Bhadanta, the Venerable Buddhadeva, maintains that it is the other that becomes other.

original: de na re chos dus gsum 'jug pa la snga ma dang phyi ma la ltos nas gzhan dang gzhan zhes brjod do //üîΩdper na bud med gcig la zhes kyang bya /
analyzed: de na re chos dus gsum 'jug pa la snga ma dang phyi ma la ltos nas gzhan dang gzhan zhes brjod do // dper na bud med gcig la zhes kyang bya /
translated: He says that a factor, passing through the three time periods, is said to be other in relation to the previous and subsequent time periods.üîΩFor example, a woman is called a daughter, and a man is called a father.

original: bu mo zhes bya ba bzhin no zhes zer ro zhes grag ste /
analyzed: bu mo zhes bya ba bzhin no zhes zer ro zhes grag ste /
translated: This is the opinion of the Bhadanta.

original: 'di ni snga ma dang phyi ma la ltos nas tha snyad du byed pa yin no //üîΩgang la snga ma kho na'ang yod la phyi ma med pa de ni ma 'ongs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni snga ma dang phyi ma la ltos nas tha snyad du byed pa yin no // gang la snga ma kho na'ang yod la phyi ma med pa de ni ma 'ongs pa yin no //
translated: This is a conventional expression in relation to the previous and subsequent time periods.üîΩThat which exists in the past and future is future.

original: gang la snga ma dang phyi ma yang de ni da ltar byung ba yin no //
analyzed: gang la snga ma dang phyi ma yang de ni da ltar byung ba yin no //
translated: That which exists in the past and future and present is present.

original: gang la phyi ma kho na yod kyi snga ma med pa de ni 'das pa yin no //üîΩde ltar na dngos po dang mtshan nyid dang gnas skabs dang gzhan te /
analyzed: gang la phyi ma kho na yod kyi snga ma med pa de ni 'das pa yin no // de ltar na dngos po dang mtshan nyid dang gnas skabs dang gzhan te /
translated: That which has only the latter, but not the former, is past.

original: gzhan la sogs pa'i ming can thams cad yod par smra ba rnam pa bzhi'o //üîΩde la dang po ni yongs su 'gyur bar smra ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan la sogs pa'i ming can thams cad yod par smra ba rnam pa bzhi'o // de la dang po ni yongs su 'gyur bar smra ba'i phyir /
translated: Thus, there are four kinds of realists: those who maintain that things, characteristics, states, and other exist.

original: grangs can gyi lugs las tha dad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: grangs can gyi lugs las tha dad pa ma yin te /
translated: The first is not different from the SƒÅ·πÉkhya system because he advocates transformation.

original: de 'gog pa gang yin pa 'di la yang blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: de 'gog pa gang yin pa 'di la yang blta bar bya ste /
translated: One should also consider the refutation of that.

original: 'di ltar snga ma'i rang bzhin yongs su ma dor bas @81b sam /
analyzed: 'di ltar snga ma'i rang bzhin yongs su ma dor bas @81b sam /
translated: Thus, is there transformation without relinquishing the former nature,

original: yongs su dor nas yongs su 'gyur ba yin grang /
analyzed: yongs su dor nas yongs su 'gyur ba yin grang /
translated: or is there transformation by relinquishing it?

original: gal te yongs su ma dor nas yin pa de'i tshe dus 'chol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te yongs su ma dor nas yin pa de'i tshe dus 'chol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If there is transformation without relinquishing it, then time would be confused.

original: ci ste yongs su dor nas yin na de'i tshe rtag tu yod pa nyid du 'gal lo //
analyzed: ci ste yongs su dor nas yin na de'i tshe rtag tu yod pa nyid du 'gal lo //
translated: But if there is transformation by relinquishing it, then it contradicts that it exists permanently.

original: rgol ba gnyis pa yang thams cad la mtshan nyid thams cad dang ldan pa'i phyir dus 'tshol bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: rgol ba gnyis pa yang thams cad la mtshan nyid thams cad dang ldan pa'i phyir dus 'tshol bar 'gyur te /
translated: The second opponent also would have to search for a time when all things have all their characteristics,

original: skyes bu don gzhan du 'gyur ba'i chags pa mngon du gyur pa'i phyir chags pa zhes bya la ldan pa tsam gyis ni ma chags pa yang yin gyi /
analyzed: skyes bu don gzhan du 'gyur ba'i chags pa mngon du gyur pa'i phyir chags pa zhes bya la ldan pa tsam gyis ni ma chags pa yang yin gyi /
translated: because a person who is attached to another object is called ‚Äúattached,‚Äù but one who is merely endowed with attachment is not attached.

original: chos kyi mtshan nyid mngon du gyur pa'am /
analyzed: chos kyi mtshan nyid mngon du gyur pa'am /
translated: Nor is one who is endowed with the characteristics of a dharma through the characteristic of possession.

original: thob pa'i mtshan nyid kyis ldan pa yod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: thob pa'i mtshan nyid kyis ldan pa yod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Nor is one who is endowed with the characteristic of possession.

original: mtshan nyid ni thob pa bzhin du gzhan nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba de'i phyir /
analyzed: mtshan nyid ni thob pa bzhin du gzhan nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba de'i phyir /
translated: Because it would follow that the characteristic would be different from the characterized, as is the case with possession.

original: dpe las byung ba'i don dang mtshungs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dpe las byung ba'i don dang mtshungs pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, this is not similar to the example.

original: gsum pa bya ba'i sgo nas dus rnam par gzhag pa'am rgyas par sun 'byin pa 'chad pa 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gsum pa bya ba'i sgo nas dus rnam par gzhag pa'am rgyas par sun 'byin pa 'chad pa 'gyur ro //
translated: The third refutation is the extensive refutation of the presentation of time in terms of activity.

original: bzhi pa la yang dus gcig nyid la dus gsum nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: bzhi pa la yang dus gcig nyid la dus gsum nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: The fourth is that the three times would be the same time.

original: 'di ltar 'das pa'i dus la snga ma dang phyi ma'i skad cig ma dag ni 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'das pa'i dus la snga ma dang phyi ma'i skad cig ma dag ni 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa yin la /
translated: Thus, in the past, the prior and subsequent moments are past and future,

original: dbus kyi skad cig ma ni da ltar byung ba yin no //
analyzed: dbus kyi skad cig ma ni da ltar byung ba yin no //
translated: and the middle moment is present.

original: 'di dag gi sun 'byin pa'i lan 'di ni gsal ba'i phyir gsum pa nyid nas brtsams na slar yang dus gsum brtags pa tsam mo //
analyzed: 'di dag gi sun 'byin pa'i lan 'di ni gsal ba'i phyir gsum pa nyid nas brtsams na slar yang dus gsum brtags pa tsam mo //
translated: The refutation of this is clear, so we will not elaborate.

original: gser gyi dpes grub pa'i mtha' nye bar bstan pa tsam byas kyi /
analyzed: gser gyi dpes grub pa'i mtha' nye bar bstan pa tsam byas kyi /
translated: The example of gold merely illustrates the tenets,

original: chos skyob kyi lta ba kho na 'dod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: chos skyob kyi lta ba kho na 'dod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: but it is not the case that we accept only the view of DharmatrƒÅta.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: As it will be explained:

original: gang phyir dus kyi rnam dbye 'di //üîΩbya ba'i sgo nas rab tu brtags //
analyzed: gang phyir dus kyi rnam dbye 'di // bya ba'i sgo nas rab tu brtags //
translated: Because this classification of time

original: zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: is posited from the perspective of activity.

original: 'di ltar bya ba'i sgo nas rnam par 'jog pa chos skyob kyi ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar bya ba'i sgo nas rnam par 'jog pa chos skyob kyi ni ma yin no //
translated: Thus it is not DharmatrƒÅta who posits time from the perspective of activity.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What is it then?

original: dbyig bshes kyi yin no //
analyzed: dbyig bshes kyi yin no //
translated: It is Vasumitra.

original: de la gal te 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa med pa gyur na rgyal po mang pos bkur ba byung bar gyur to //
analyzed: de la gal te 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa med pa gyur na rgyal po mang pos bkur ba byung bar gyur to //
translated: If the past and future did not exist, then the king Mahasammata would not have arisen.

original: 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po rgyal po 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dag gis shes pa dmigs pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po rgyal po 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dag gis shes pa dmigs pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the past and future did not exist, then the knowledge of the past and future would be non-existent, as in the statement, ‚ÄúThe king MahƒÅsa·πÉmata arose,‚Äù and ‚ÄúThe cakravartin king will arise.‚Äù

original: de lta yin dang dmar shes pa nyid du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta yin dang dmar shes pa nyid du mi 'gyur te /
translated: If that were so, it would not be knowledge,

original: dmigs pa med pa'i phyir snyam du bsam pa yin no //üîΩ'di ltar dngos po so sor nges pa rig pa'i bdag nyid rnam par shes pa yin la shes par bya ba med na 'dis cung zad kyang mi shes pa'i @82a * //
analyzed: dmigs pa med pa'i phyir snyam du bsam pa yin no // 'di ltar dngos po so sor nges pa rig pa'i bdag nyid rnam par shes pa yin la shes par bya ba med na 'dis cung zad kyang mi shes pa'i @82a * //
translated: because it would not have an object.

original: phyir rnam par shes pa nyid ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyir rnam par shes pa nyid ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus consciousness is the nature of the awareness of individual objects. If there is no object to be cognized, it would not be consciousness because it does not cognize anything.

original: gzhan yang bcom ldan 'das kyis rnam par shes pa ni gnyis la brten nas skye'o zhes gsungs pa la /
analyzed: gzhan yang bcom ldan 'das kyis rnam par shes pa ni gnyis la brten nas skye'o zhes gsungs pa la /
translated: Moreover, the BhagavƒÅn said, ‚ÄúConsciousness arises in dependence on two things.‚Äù

original: gnyis gang zhe na /
analyzed: gnyis gang zhe na /
translated: What are the two?

original: mig dang gzugs la sogs pa nas yid dang chos rnams zhes bya ba'i bar yin te /
analyzed: mig dang gzugs la sogs pa nas yid dang chos rnams zhes bya ba'i bar yin te /
translated: From eye and form up to mind and phenomena.

original: 'das pa dang ma 'ong pa dag med na de la dmigs pa'i rnam par shes pa gnyis la brten par mi 'gyur ba'i lung dang 'gal lo //
analyzed: 'das pa dang ma 'ong pa dag med na de la dmigs pa'i rnam par shes pa gnyis la brten par mi 'gyur ba'i lung dang 'gal lo //
translated: If the past and future did not exist, it would contradict scripture that consciousness is supported by two, that is, by the past and future.

original: gzhan yang tal te yod pa ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang tal te yod pa ma yin pa ste /
translated: Moreover, if the past does not exist,

original: yod pas stong par gyur na 'bras bu skyes ba'i dus na rnam par smin pa'i rgyu med pa'i phyir las 'das pa 'bras bu 'byin pa mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yod pas stong par gyur na 'bras bu skyes ba'i dus na rnam par smin pa'i rgyu med pa'i phyir las 'das pa 'bras bu 'byin pa mi 'gyur ro //
translated: then when the effect has arisen, the cause of karmic maturation would not exist, and therefore past karma would not yield its effect.

original: med pa las ni 'bras bu skyed pa'i nus pa yod pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: med pa las ni 'bras bu skyed pa'i nus pa yod pa yang ma yin te /
translated: And an effect does not arise from what does not exist,

original: med pa'i mtshan nyid ni nus pa thams cad dang bral ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: med pa'i mtshan nyid ni nus pa thams cad dang bral ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the definition of nonexistence is being devoid of all capacity.

original: gzhan yang rgyal po nga las nu byung bar gyur to //
analyzed: gzhan yang rgyal po nga las nu byung bar gyur to //
translated: Moreover, if the past does not exist, then the Buddha would not have said, ‚ÄúI was in the past the king Mandhatr.‚Äù

original: 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po dung dang de bzhin gshegs pa byams pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pas rnam par phye nas rnal 'byor gyi shes pa 'das pa la sogs par 'byed par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po dung dang de bzhin gshegs pa byams pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pas rnam par phye nas rnal 'byor gyi shes pa 'das pa la sogs par 'byed par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the consciousness of the yogin would not be differentiated as past, etc.

original: med pa la ni rnam par dbye ba yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: med pa la ni rnam par dbye ba yod pa ma yin te /
translated: And a non-existent thing cannot be differentiated.

original: de lta bas na rgyal lo dga' ba'i dpal la sogs pa 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i dngos po rnams rdzas dgag pa'i ngo bo ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta bas na rgyal lo dga' ba'i dpal la sogs pa 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i dngos po rnams rdzas dgag pa'i ngo bo ni ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, the past and future things, such as the glory of King Di≈õƒÅmpati, are not negated as to their substantial nature,

original: dus kyis bsdus pa'i gzugs la sogs pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir da ltar byung ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dus kyis bsdus pa'i gzugs la sogs pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir da ltar byung ba bzhin no //
translated: because they are taught to be form, etc., included in time, just like the present.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong dag gal te 'das pa'i gzugs shig yod par ma gyur na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong dag gal te 'das pa'i gzugs shig yod par ma gyur na /
translated: The Lord has said, ‚ÄúMonks, if past form did not exist,

original: 'phags pa nyan thos thos pa dang ldan pa 'das pa'i gzugs la mi lta bar yang mi 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: 'phags pa nyan thos thos pa dang ldan pa 'das pa'i gzugs la mi lta bar yang mi 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: the noble disciple who is a hearer would not look back on past form.‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir 'das pa'i gzugs yod pa de'i phyir 'phags pa nyan thos thos pa dang ldan pa 'das pa'i gzugs la mi lta ba yin zhes bya ba rgyas pa dang / de bzhin du gzugs gang cung zad 'das pa dang ma 'ong pa la sogs pa thams cad bsdus nas gzugs kyi phung po zhes bya ba'i grangs su 'gro zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'das pa'i gzugs yod pa de'i phyir 'phags pa nyan thos thos pa dang ldan pa 'das pa'i gzugs la mi lta ba yin zhes bya ba rgyas pa dang / de bzhin du gzugs gang cung zad 'das pa dang ma 'ong pa la sogs pa thams cad bsdus nas gzugs kyi phung po zhes bya ba'i grangs su 'gro zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: And similarly, ‚Äúany form whatsoever, whether past or future, is included in all and goes by the name of the form heap.‚Äù

original: dus kyis bsdus pa gang dag la yin la de dag ni dus kyis bsdus pa ste /
analyzed: dus kyis bsdus pa gang dag la yin la de dag ni dus kyis bsdus pa ste /
translated: Those that are subsumed by time are subsumed by the three times.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'o //
translated: They are form and so on.

original: @82b sogs pa'i sgras tshor ba la sogs pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: @82b sogs pa'i sgras tshor ba la sogs pa gzung ngo //
translated: The term ‚Äúand so on‚Äù includes feeling and so on.

original: de dag gi ngo bo ni gzugs la sogs pa nyid de /
analyzed: de dag gi ngo bo ni gzugs la sogs pa nyid de /
translated: Their nature is form and so on.

original: 'dir yang sogs pa'i sgras sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung dang mi rtag pa dang bdag med pa la sogs pa nyid du nye bar bstan pa nyid du gzung ngo //
analyzed: 'dir yang sogs pa'i sgras sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung dang mi rtag pa dang bdag med pa la sogs pa nyid du nye bar bstan pa nyid du gzung ngo //
translated: Here, the term ‚Äúand so on‚Äù also includes the truths of suffering, origin, impermanence, and selflessness.

original: yang ci ste 'o na nam mkha' bzhin du rtag tu gnas pa'i phyir ji ltar 'das pa la sogs pa rnam par gzhag snyam na /
analyzed: yang ci ste 'o na nam mkha' bzhin du rtag tu gnas pa'i phyir ji ltar 'das pa la sogs pa rnam par gzhag snyam na /
translated: But if you think that, since it would exist permanently like space, how can the past, etc. be established?

original: dus tha dad ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: dus tha dad ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: He says, ‚Äúbecause of the distinction of time, etc.‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir bya ba thob pa ni da ltar zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir bya ba thob pa ni da ltar zhes bya ba la /
translated: Since the acquisition of activity is the present,

original: bya ba zhig pa ni 'das pa yin zhing zhing bya ba ma thob pa ni mi 'ongs pa yin pa'i phyir bya ba'i sgo nas dus rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: bya ba zhig pa ni 'das pa yin zhing zhing bya ba ma thob pa ni mi 'ongs pa yin pa'i phyir bya ba'i sgo nas dus rnam par gzhag go //
translated: the past is the termination of activity, and the future is the non-acquisition of activity, time is established by way of activity.

original: yang 'di bya ba ci la 'dod //
analyzed: yang 'di bya ba ci la 'dod //
translated: But what is this activity that is accepted?

original: gal te dper na gang gi phyir mig gis mthong ngo //
analyzed: gal te dper na gang gi phyir mig gis mthong ngo //
translated: If it is like the statement, ‚ÄúBecause of the eye one sees,

original: rna bas thos so //
analyzed: rna bas thos so //
translated: because of the ear one hears,

original: snas tshor ro //
analyzed: snas tshor ro //
translated: because of the nose one smells,

original: lces myang ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa la sogs pa la mig la sogs pa lnga rnams kyi lta ba la sogs pa dang / rnam par shes par byed pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa'i yang shes pa po nyid do //
analyzed: lces myang ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa la sogs pa la mig la sogs pa lnga rnams kyi lta ba la sogs pa dang / rnam par shes par byed pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa'i yang shes pa po nyid do //
translated: because of the tongue one tastes,‚Äù etc., then the five such as the eye are the seer, etc. and consciousness is the knower because of the awareness of form, etc.

original: gzugs la sogs pa yang dbang po'i spyod yul yin pa ltar mthong ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi bya ba yin no //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa yang dbang po'i spyod yul yin pa ltar mthong ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi bya ba yin no //
translated: and visible form, etc. are the objects of the sense faculties.

original: de ltar yin la da ltar byung ba'i ming de dang mtshungs pa gnyis log pa'i gnas skabs na bya ba med pa'i phyir da ltar byung ba nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar yin la da ltar byung ba'i ming de dang mtshungs pa gnyis log pa'i gnas skabs na bya ba med pa'i phyir da ltar byung ba nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: But if it is as you say, then the present would not be present, because the name ‚Äúpresent‚Äù would be absent in the state of the past and future.

original: ci ste bya ba'i mtshan nyid ni 'bras bu 'byin pa dang 'dzin pa yin te /üîΩdper na mig gi skye ba la sogs pa'i chos lhan cig 'byung ba rnams ni skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu yin la /
analyzed: ci ste bya ba'i mtshan nyid ni 'bras bu 'byin pa dang 'dzin pa yin te / dper na mig gi skye ba la sogs pa'i chos lhan cig 'byung ba rnams ni skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu yin la /
translated: If you say that the characteristic of the present is the production of an effect and the holding of an effect,üîΩthen the eye and the other faculties would be the effect of the person‚Äôs action, because they are produced by the action of the person.

original: mjug thogs su byung ba'i mig gi dbang po ni skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu dang bdag po'i 'bras bu dang rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu yin pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: mjug thogs su byung ba'i mig gi dbang po ni skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu dang bdag po'i 'bras bu dang rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu yin pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: And the eye that arises immediately after the eye is the effect of the person‚Äôs action, the effect of dominance, and the homogeneous cause.

original: 'di ni 'bras bu skyed par byed pa'i phyir 'byin par byed pa yin la rgyu'i dngos por gnas pa'i phyir 'dzin pa yin pas mig da ltar byung ba zhes bya'o zhe na /
analyzed: 'di ni 'bras bu skyed par byed pa'i phyir 'byin par byed pa yin la rgyu'i dngos por gnas pa'i phyir 'dzin pa yin pas mig da ltar byung ba zhes bya'o zhe na /
translated: It is called present because it is that which casts or projects, since it generates its effect, and it is that which holds or grasps, since it exists as the entity of a cause.

original: 'o na de ltar na skal ba mnyam pa dang kun du 'gro ba dang rnam par smin pa rgyu 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa rnams kyang 'bras bu 'byin par khas len pa'i phyir ltar byung ba nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'o na de ltar na skal ba mnyam pa dang kun du 'gro ba dang rnam par smin pa rgyu 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa rnams kyang 'bras bu 'byin par khas len pa'i phyir ltar byung ba nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If that is so, then homogeneous, omnipresent, and ripening causes that are past and future would also be present, since you accept that they project their effects.

original: ci ste 'bras bu 'byin ba dang 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid kyi bya ba mtha' dag la yod par 'dod na /
analyzed: ci ste 'bras bu 'byin ba dang 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid kyi bya ba mtha' dag la yod par 'dod na /
translated: If you assert that all activity that has the characteristics of projecting and holding effects exists in the present,

original: de lta na yang skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu la sogs pa 'das pa yang da lta bar thal bar 'gyur nas 'jigs nas /
analyzed: de lta na yang skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu la sogs pa 'das pa yang da lta bar thal bar 'gyur nas 'jigs nas /
translated: then it follows that even past homogeneous causes and so on would be present.

original: @83a * // slob dpon 'dus bzang gis smras pa /
analyzed: @83a * // slob dpon 'dus bzang gis smras pa /
translated: Master Sa·πÖghabhadra says:

original: 'bras bu 'phen pa'i nus pa chos rnams kyis bya bar brjod kyi /
analyzed: 'bras bu 'phen pa'i nus pa chos rnams kyis bya bar brjod kyi /
translated: The activity of phenomena is said to be the potency to project an effect,

original: 'bras bu skyed par ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu skyed par ni ma yin no //
translated: but not to generate an effect.

original: skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu la sogs pa 'das pa rnams la ni 'bras bu 'phen pa yod pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu la sogs pa 'das pa rnams la ni 'bras bu 'phen pa yod pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Past homogeneous causes and so on do not project results.üîΩ

original: da lta ba'i gnas skabs na 'phang zin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩ'phang zin pa yang 'phen par rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: da lta ba'i gnas skabs na 'phang zin pa'i phyir ro // 'phang zin pa yang 'phen par rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: Past homogeneous causes and so on do not project results because they have already projected them in the present.

original: thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is illogical that what has already been projected is projected again because it would then follow that projection would be endless.

original: de lta bas na 'das pa rnams la bya ba srid pa ma yin pa'i phyir mtshan nyid 'chol bar 'gyur ba ma yin no zhe'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'das pa rnams la bya ba srid pa ma yin pa'i phyir mtshan nyid 'chol bar 'gyur ba ma yin no zhe'o //
translated: Therefore, since action is not possible in the past, the characteristics are not confused.

original: de dag gis ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed de /
analyzed: de dag gis ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed de /
translated: He replies, they are not confused because of that, and so on.

original: bya ba de chos las gzhan nam gzhan ma yin pa zhes bya ba de dag gis khas blang bar bya dgos te /
analyzed: bya ba de chos las gzhan nam gzhan ma yin pa zhes bya ba de dag gis khas blang bar bya dgos te /
translated: One must accept that action is either different or not different from the phenomenon.

original: gzhan dang gzhan ma yin pa dag ni phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir gcig dgag pa ni gzhan sgrub pa med na mi 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir dngos po'i go skabs gzhan yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan dang gzhan ma yin pa dag ni phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir gcig dgag pa ni gzhan sgrub pa med na mi 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir dngos po'i go skabs gzhan yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Because difference and non-difference are characteristics that exclude each other, the negation of one is invariably concomitant with the affirmation of the other. Therefore, there is no other possibility for an entity.

original: de la gal te gzhan yin pa de'i tshe de ltar byung ba'i sngar dang phyis kyi gnas skabs dag rang bzhin med pa nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la gal te gzhan yin pa de'i tshe de ltar byung ba'i sngar dang phyis kyi gnas skabs dag rang bzhin med pa nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: In that regard, if it is different, then the prior and subsequent states of that which has arisen would be devoid of intrinsic reality.

original: rgyu nyid dang 'dus byas nyid la sogs pa'i phyir ni gtan tshigs so bya ba bzhin du ni dpe'o //
analyzed: rgyu nyid dang 'dus byas nyid la sogs pa'i phyir ni gtan tshigs so bya ba bzhin du ni dpe'o //
translated: The reason is because of being a cause and because of being a conditioned phenomenon, etc. The example is like an action.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni dngos po nyid la sogs pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni dngos po nyid la sogs pa gzung ngo //
translated: The word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù includes such things as being an entity.

original: de lta ma yin na gal te snga ma dang phyi ma rang bzhi med pa nyid du gyur na /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na gal te snga ma dang phyi ma rang bzhi med pa nyid du gyur na /
translated: If that were not so, if the prior and subsequent states were not devoid of intrinsic reality,

original: de'i tshe rang bzhin thams cad du gnas pa'i phyir 'dus byas thams cad rtag pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe rang bzhin thams cad du gnas pa'i phyir 'dus byas thams cad rtag pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: then, because intrinsic reality would remain in all cases, all conditioned phenomena would be permanent.

original: dus thams cad du yod pa las ma gtogs pa'i rtag pa'i mtshan nyid yod pa yang ma yin te /üîΩgang gi rang bzhin 'jig med pa //
analyzed: dus thams cad du yod pa las ma gtogs pa'i rtag pa'i mtshan nyid yod pa yang ma yin te / gang gi rang bzhin 'jig med pa //
translated: Apart from existing at all times, there is no other characteristic of permanence.üîΩThe wise say that which is not destroyed

original: de la mkhas rnams rtag ces brjod //
analyzed: de la mkhas rnams rtag ces brjod //
translated: by nature is permanent.

original: ces gang bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: ces gang bshad pa yin no //
translated: This is what is explained.

original: 'di snyam du gal te rtag pa dang nus pa dang rgyu nyid dang 'dus byas nyid la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs ji ltar bsgrub par bya ba'i mthun pa'i phyogs dang 'gal ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'di snyam du gal te rtag pa dang nus pa dang rgyu nyid dang 'dus byas nyid la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs ji ltar bsgrub par bya ba'i mthun pa'i phyogs dang 'gal ba yin zhe na /
translated: If one thinks, ‚ÄúHow can the reason, such as permanence, potentiality, causality, and being conditioned, be contradictory to the similar class of the probandum?‚Äù

original: rtag pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rtag pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The root text says, ‚ÄúThe characteristic of permanence,‚Äù and so on.

original: sngar zhes bya ba ni brtan pa'i dngos po rtag par de /
analyzed: sngar zhes bya ba ni brtan pa'i dngos po rtag par de /
translated: ‚ÄúPreviously‚Äù refers to the previously stated position that a permanent thing is stable.

original: 'dus byas thams cad mi rtag pa nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir rtag pa las 'dus byas nyid srid pa ma yin @83b zhes gsal bar nges par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dus byas thams cad mi rtag pa nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir rtag pa las 'dus byas nyid srid pa ma yin @83b zhes gsal bar nges par bya'o //
translated: Since it is accepted that all conditioned phenomena are impermanent, it should be clearly ascertained that being conditioned is impossible for the permanent.

original: gzhan yang phung po dang khams dang skye mched las ma gtogs pa'i bya ba brjod par byed na /
analyzed: gzhan yang phung po dang khams dang skye mched las ma gtogs pa'i bya ba brjod par byed na /
translated: Moreover, if one asserts that the action is not included in the aggregates, elements, and bases,

original: grub pa'i mtha' dang 'gal te /
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' dang 'gal te /
translated: This contradicts philosophical tenets,

original: 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis bram ze thams cad ces bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis bram ze thams cad ces bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: because the BhagavƒÅn has said, ‚ÄúBrahmin, all is as follows:

original: phung po lnga dang skye mched bcu gnyis dang khams bco brgyad do zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: phung po lnga dang skye mched bcu gnyis dang khams bco brgyad do zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: the five aggregates, the twelve sense spheres and the eighteen elements.‚Äù

original: ci ste bya ba zhes ma yin par khas len par byed pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: ci ste bya ba zhes ma yin par khas len par byed pa de'i tshe /
translated: If you accept that it is not action,

original: chos kyi rang gi ngo bo bzhin du de las tha mi dad pa'i phyir de yang dus thams cad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: chos kyi rang gi ngo bo bzhin du de las tha mi dad pa'i phyir de yang dus thams cad par 'gyur te /
