translated: then like the intrinsic reality of a phenomenon, it would be permanent because it would not be different from that.üîΩIf that were so, then the action that has ceased would be past, the obtainment of that would be present, and the nonobtainment of that would be future.

original: de lta yin dang bya ba zhig pa ni 'das pa dang de thob pa ni da ltar byung ba yin zhing de ma thob pa ni ma 'ongs pa zhes bya ba'i dbang gis dus la sogs pa'i rnam par dbye ba 'dir mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta yin dang bya ba zhig pa ni 'das pa dang de thob pa ni da ltar byung ba yin zhing de ma thob pa ni ma 'ongs pa zhes bya ba'i dbang gis dus la sogs pa'i rnam par dbye ba 'dir mi 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, this classification of time and so on would not occur.

original: gal te rang gi phyir bya ba 'di'i rnam par dbye bas zhig pa dang thob pa dang ma thob pa dag tu 'gyur ba de'i tshe dus kyi rnam par dbye ba 'dir 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te rang gi phyir bya ba 'di'i rnam par dbye bas zhig pa dang thob pa dang ma thob pa dag tu 'gyur ba de'i tshe dus kyi rnam par dbye ba 'dir 'gyur na /
translated: If, by the division of this action into its own parts, there were destruction, acquisition, and non-acquisition, then there would be a division of time.

original: de dag gi rnam par phye nas yod pa ma yin na ste /
analyzed: de dag gi rnam par phye nas yod pa ma yin na ste /
translated: But, since they do not exist by the division of their parts,

original: rtag tu gnas pas gcig gi ngo bo la rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: rtag tu gnas pas gcig gi ngo bo la rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: they are applied to a single nature, since they always remain.

original: de 'di la yod pas de dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: de 'di la yod pas de dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Since this exists for that, it is endowed with it.

original: bya ba rtag tu zhes bya ba la sogs pas phan tshun 'gal ba khas blangs pa'i sgo nas bzhad gad du byed pa yin no //
analyzed: bya ba rtag tu zhes bya ba la sogs pas phan tshun 'gal ba khas blangs pa'i sgo nas bzhad gad du byed pa yin no //
translated: By the phrase ‚Äúaction is always,‚Äù etc., he ridicules the opponent‚Äôs position by showing its mutual contradiction.

original: 'o na de ltar na gzugs la sogs pa'i chos rtag tu yod pa ma yin no zhes bya bar tsam yang yin la yod pa yang yin zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'o na de ltar na gzugs la sogs pa'i chos rtag tu yod pa ma yin no zhes bya bar tsam yang yin la yod pa yang yin zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: If that is so, then the phrase ‚Äúform, etc., is not always existent‚Äù should be construed as ‚Äúis not always existent, and yet is existent.‚Äù

original: de 'di la yod pas de dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: de 'di la yod pas de dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Since this exists for that, it is endowed with it.

original: bya ba rtag tu zhes bya ba la sogs pas phan tshun 'gal ba khas blangs pa'i sgo nas bzhad gad du byed pa yin no //
analyzed: bya ba rtag tu zhes bya ba la sogs pas phan tshun 'gal ba khas blangs pa'i sgo nas bzhad gad du byed pa yin no //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúalways engaged‚Äù and so on ridicules the opponent‚Äôs position by showing that it is internally contradictory.

original: 'o na de lta na gzugs la sogs pa'i chos rtag tu yod pa ma yin no zhes bya bar thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'o na de lta na gzugs la sogs pa'i chos rtag tu yod pa ma yin no zhes bya bar thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: If that is so, then it follows that such things as form do not exist permanently,

original: bya ba las tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro zhe na /üîΩchos ni rtag tu yod par brjod //
analyzed: bya ba las tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro zhe na / chos ni rtag tu yod par brjod //
translated: because they are not different from activity.

original: ces bya ba smos te /
analyzed: ces bya ba smos te /
translated: The root text states, ‚ÄúThe phenomenon is said to exist permanently.‚Äù

original: de lta na yang chos las bya ba gzhan nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na yang chos las bya ba gzhan nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Even so, it follows that activity is different from the phenomenon.

original: bshad par bya ba yang chos las gzhan ma yin /
analyzed: bshad par bya ba yang chos las gzhan ma yin /
translated: The root text states, ‚ÄúThe phenomenon is not different from activity.‚Äù

original: lha ni dbang phyug la sogs pa ste /üîΩde dag ni rigs pa dang mi rigs pa dang spyod pa med par rang dbang du 'jug ste /
analyzed: lha ni dbang phyug la sogs pa ste / de dag ni rigs pa dang mi rigs pa dang spyod pa med par rang dbang du 'jug ste /
translated: The gods are ƒ™≈õvara and so on.üîΩThey are said to engage in activity independently, without reason or purpose.

original: de dag ni 'dod pa ji lta ba bzhin du rang dbang du 'jug pa'i phyir rigs pa dang mi rigs pas lta bar mi byed de /
analyzed: de dag ni 'dod pa ji lta ba bzhin du rang dbang du 'jug pa'i phyir rigs pa dang mi rigs pas lta bar mi byed de /
translated: They are said to engage in activity independently, in accordance with their desires. Therefore, they do not engage in activity for a reason or purpose.

original: 'di yang de bzhin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'di yang de bzhin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is the meaning of the phrase ‚Äúit is the same here.‚Äù

original: gzhan yang bya ba gzhan gyis ma 'ongs pa la sogs pa nyid du 'dod na /
analyzed: gzhan yang bya ba gzhan gyis ma 'ongs pa la sogs pa nyid du 'dod na /
translated: Moreover, if you assert that the future and so on are established by a different action,

original: @84a * // 'o na bya ba'i sgo nas dus rnams rnams par gzhag go zhes brjod pa mi bya ste /
analyzed: @84a * // 'o na bya ba'i sgo nas dus rnams rnams par gzhag go zhes brjod pa mi bya ste /
translated: then you should not say that the times are established by action,

original: 'khrul ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khrul ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because that would be erroneous.

original: ci ste bya ba rang gi ngo bo yod pa la ltos nas ma 'ong pa la sogs pa yod pa nyid rnam par 'jog pa de bzhin du dngos po rnams kyang ma 'ong pa la sogs pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: ci ste bya ba rang gi ngo bo yod pa la ltos nas ma 'ong pa la sogs pa yod pa nyid rnam par 'jog pa de bzhin du dngos po rnams kyang ma 'ong pa la sogs pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: If you posit the existence of the future and so on in dependence on the existence of action that has its own nature, then things would also become future and so on.

original: bya ba rtags pas ci zhig bya //
analyzed: bya ba rtags pas ci zhig bya //
translated: What would be the point of positing action?

original: yang 'khrul ba'i skyon du 'gyur na mi rung ngo snyam pas bya ba la yang bya ba khas len par byed pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: yang 'khrul ba'i skyon du 'gyur na mi rung ngo snyam pas bya ba la yang bya ba khas len par byed pa de'i tshe /
translated: If you accept that action has action, thinking that it is not suitable to have the fault of error,

original: de la yang tha dad pa la sogs bsam pa'i brgal zhing brtag pa mtshungs pa dang / thug pa med pa nyes pa yod do //
analyzed: de la yang tha dad pa la sogs bsam pa'i brgal zhing brtag pa mtshungs pa dang / thug pa med pa nyes pa yod do //
translated: then the same analysis of difference and so on would apply to that, and the fault of infinite regress would ensue.

original: gzhan ma yin pa nyid yin na yang bya ba dus thams cad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan ma yin pa nyid yin na yang bya ba dus thams cad par 'gyur te /
translated: If it is not different, then action would be at all times,

original: khyad par med pa'i phyir chos kyi rang gi ngo bo bzhin no zhes gang smras pa 'di la /
analyzed: khyad par med pa'i phyir chos kyi rang gi ngo bo bzhin no zhes gang smras pa 'di la /
translated: because it would be without distinction, like the intrinsic reality of a phenomenon.

original: btsun pa 'dus bzang gis smra pa /
analyzed: btsun pa 'dus bzang gis smra pa /
translated: The Venerable Sa·πÉghabhadra says this:

original: rang gi ngo bo las tha mi dad kyang chos khyad par du byed par mthong ste /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo las tha mi dad kyang chos khyad par du byed par mthong ste /
translated: ‚ÄúAlthough it is not different from intrinsic reality, we see that it is distinguished as a phenomenon.

original: dper nas la sogs pa rnams kyi thogs pa dang bcas pa nyid la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper nas la sogs pa rnams kyi thogs pa dang bcas pa nyid la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the obstruction of earth, etc.

original: dper na de dag ni don ji lta ba bzhin du khyad par med kyang thogs pa dang bcas pa dang thogs pa med par bstan du yod pa dang bstan du med pa zhes bya ba'i rang gi ngo bo las tha mi dad pa'i chos kyi khyad par du
analyzed: dper na de dag ni don ji lta ba bzhin du khyad par med kyang thogs pa dang bcas pa dang thogs pa med par bstan du yod pa dang bstan du med pa zhes bya ba'i rang gi ngo bo las tha mi dad pa'i chos kyi khyad par du
translated: For example, although they are not distinguished in terms of their meaning, they are distinguished as phenomena that are not different from the intrinsic reality of the taught as having obstruction and being without obstruction, and as having demonstrable form and being without demonstrable form.üîΩJust as that is imagined, so too action is a phenomenon.‚Äù

original: byed pa rtog pa de bzhin du bya bas kyang chos yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni skabs nye bar mkho ba ma yin te /
analyzed: byed pa rtog pa de bzhin du bya bas kyang chos yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni skabs nye bar mkho ba ma yin te /
translated: This is not relevant to the present context.

original: 'di ltar 'dir dngos po las bya ba tha mi dad par khas blangs pa na gcig gi bdag nyid du gyur pa'i dngos po'i bya ba khyad par med pa'i phyir de'i dbang gis dus kyi rnam par dbye ba 'di mi 'thad pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di
analyzed: 'di ltar 'dir dngos po las bya ba tha mi dad par khas blangs pa na gcig gi bdag nyid du gyur pa'i dngos po'i bya ba khyad par med pa'i phyir de'i dbang gis dus kyi rnam par dbye ba 'di mi 'thad pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di
translated: Thus, if one accepts that action is not different from the thing, then because the action of a thing that is a single nature is undifferentiated, it is not tenable that time is differentiated on the strength of that.

original: ni skabs yin no //
analyzed: ni skabs yin no //
translated: This is the point.

original: sa la sogs pa ni phan tshun rang gi mtshan nyid tha dad pa'i phyir tha dad pa yin no zhes bya ba rigs te /
analyzed: sa la sogs pa ni phan tshun rang gi mtshan nyid tha dad pa'i phyir tha dad pa yin no zhes bya ba rigs te /
translated: It is logical to say that earth and so on are different because they have different intrinsic characteristics.

original: gang gi phyir las la ni thogs pa dang bcas par 'gyur la /üîΩdper na tshor ba la sogs pa lta bur kha cig ni thogs pa med pa nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: gang gi phyir las la ni thogs pa dang bcas par 'gyur la / dper na tshor ba la sogs pa lta bur kha cig ni thogs pa med pa nyid yin gyi /
translated: Because action is impeded,üîΩsome say that it is unimpeded,

original: thogs pa dang bcas pa gang yin pa de kho na thogs pa med pa yin no zhes bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: thogs pa dang bcas pa gang yin pa de kho na thogs pa med pa yin no zhes bya ba ma yin no //
translated: but it is not that that which is impeded is unimpeded.

original: gang gi phyir chos gang zhig res 'ga' thogs pa dang bcas pa nyid la sogs pa dang bcas par 'gyur ba la sa la sogs pa dngos po'i bdag nyid rjes su 'gro ba gcig po ni 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir chos gang zhig res 'ga' thogs pa dang bcas pa nyid la sogs pa dang bcas par 'gyur ba la sa la sogs pa dngos po'i bdag nyid rjes su 'gro ba gcig po ni 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Because there is no single nature of things such as earth, etc., that would be the universal of all things, which would sometimes be obstructed, etc.

original: @84b 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: @84b 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then?

original: dngos po cha shas med pa nyid de ltar te rigs mthun pa dang rigs mi mthun pa las ldog par bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: dngos po cha shas med pa nyid de ltar te rigs mthun pa dang rigs mi mthun pa las ldog par bstan pa yin te /
translated: The partless nature of things is taught to be the exclusion of the homogeneous and heterogeneous.

original: rang gi ngo bo las tha mi dad pa'i chos gcig tha dad par byed par rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo las tha mi dad pa'i chos gcig tha dad par byed par rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not reasonable that a single property that is not different from its own nature should be made different.

original: gal te rang gi ngo bo las tha mi dad pa mi dad pa'i chos tha dad du byed par gyur na /
analyzed: gal te rang gi ngo bo las tha mi dad pa mi dad pa'i chos tha dad du byed par gyur na /
translated: If a property that is not different from its own nature were made different,

original: ji ltar gzugs kyi thogs pa dang bcas pa zhes tha dad pa'i tha snyad yin zhe na /üîΩgzugs kyi de zhes bya ba'i sgras //
analyzed: ji ltar gzugs kyi thogs pa dang bcas pa zhes tha dad pa'i tha snyad yin zhe na / gzugs kyi de zhes bya ba'i sgras //
translated: how would the expression ‚Äúform is obstructed‚Äù be a different expression?üîΩThe expression ‚Äúits‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa mos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa mos te /
translated: is applied to the expression ‚Äúform.‚Äù

original: de zhes bya ba ni thogs pa dang bcas pa nyid do //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni thogs pa dang bcas pa nyid do //
translated: ‚ÄúIts‚Äù refers to obstruction.

original: sgra zhes bya ba ni gzugs kyi thogs pa dang bcas pa zhes bya ba 'dis so //
analyzed: sgra zhes bya ba ni gzugs kyi thogs pa dang bcas pa zhes bya ba 'dis so //
translated: The phrase sound is obstructed by form is an example.

original: khyad par gzhan mi 'phen pa yis //
analyzed: khyad par gzhan mi 'phen pa yis //
translated: Because it does not project another distinction,

original: zhes bya ba ni khyad par gzhan spangs nas zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni khyad par gzhan spangs nas zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: means having abandoned another distinction.

original: de ltar brjod ces bya ba ni tha mi dad pa lta bur ro //
analyzed: de ltar brjod ces bya ba ni tha mi dad pa lta bur ro //
translated: The phrase in that way, it is said means as if it were not different.

original: 'di la dpe bshad pa ni //
analyzed: 'di la dpe bshad pa ni //
translated: The example for this is stated in the line:

original: sems kyi bag chags kyang yang yin //üîΩzhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: sems kyi bag chags kyang yang yin // zhes bya ba ste /
translated: And the latent impressions of mind.üîΩThe phrase and the latent impressions of mind

original: kyang yang zhes bya ba'i tshig phrad gnyis tshogs nas lta bu'i don du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: kyang yang zhes bya ba'i tshig phrad gnyis tshogs nas lta bu'i don du blta bar bya'o //
translated: should be viewed as having the sense of the conjunction and.

original: yang de nyid kyis smras pa /
analyzed: yang de nyid kyis smras pa /
translated: Moreover, the same author says:

original: bya ba chos las gzhan ma yin te /
analyzed: bya ba chos las gzhan ma yin te /
translated: An action is not different from a dharma,

original: de las tha dad du rang bzhin dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las tha dad du rang bzhin dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because a nature that is different from it is not perceived.

original: chos tsam yang ma yin te /
analyzed: chos tsam yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not just a dharma,

original: rang bzhin yod na yang res 'ga' med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin yod na yang res 'ga' med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because even if it exists by way of its own nature, it is sometimes not perceived.

original: med pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: med pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not a non-existent,

original: khyad par med pa'i phyir dang / bya ba yang sngar med pa'i phyir rgyun bzhin no //
analyzed: khyad par med pa'i phyir dang / bya ba yang sngar med pa'i phyir rgyun bzhin no //
translated: because it is not different from a dharma and because, like a continuum, an action is not previously non-existent.

original: dper na chos par med par 'byung ba ni rgyun zhes bya la /
analyzed: dper na chos par med par 'byung ba ni rgyun zhes bya la /
translated: For example, it is like the statement, ‚ÄúThe arising of a dharma is called a continuum.‚Äù

original: 'di chos las tha dad pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di chos las tha dad pa yang ma yin te /
translated: This is not different from the dharma,

original: de dang ma phye bar gzung bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dang ma phye bar gzung bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is apprehended without distinction from that.

original: chos tsam yang ma yin te /
analyzed: chos tsam yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not just the dharma,

original: skad cig gcig nyid kyang rgyun nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skad cig gcig nyid kyang rgyun nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it follows that a single moment is a continuum.

original: med pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: med pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not nonexistent,

original: 'bras bu yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: because the effect exists.

original: yang bshad pa /
analyzed: yang bshad pa /
translated: Moreover, it is said:

original: 'bras bu'ang rgyun la mngon 'dod cing //
analyzed: 'bras bu'ang rgyun la mngon 'dod cing //
translated: The effect is also asserted in the continuum,

original: rgyun de'ang 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin //
analyzed: rgyun de'ang 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin //
translated: but that continuum does not exist at all.

original: bya ba sgo nas dus grub pa //
analyzed: bya ba sgo nas dus grub pa //
translated: Time is established from the perspective of activity.

original: de ltar rigs pas rtogs par gyis //
analyzed: de ltar rigs pas rtogs par gyis //
translated: Understand it in that way through reasoning.

original: zhes pa'o // 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: zhes pa'o // 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, someone says:

original: ci ste rgyun la sogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: ci ste rgyun la sogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: If it is said that the continuum and so on do not exist,

original: rgyun la sogs pa bzhin zhes bya ba'i sogs pa'i sgras tshogs pa la sogs pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: rgyun la sogs pa bzhin zhes bya ba'i sogs pa'i sgras tshogs pa la sogs pa gzung ngo //
translated: the words and so on in the phrase ‚Äúthe continuum and so on‚Äù include collections and so on.

original: ji ltar rgyun can las de nyid dang gzhan du brjod du med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ji ltar rgyun can las de nyid dang gzhan du brjod du med pa'i phyir /
translated: Just as the continuum is inexpressible as either the same as or different from its members,

original: gang zag dang rgyun rang bzhin med pa de bzhin du bya ba yang rang bzhin med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang zag dang rgyun rang bzhin med pa de bzhin du bya ba yang rang bzhin med par 'gyur ro //
translated: so too action is essenceless, just like the person and the continuum.

original: @85a * // rang bzhin zhig yin na ni gdon mi za bar de nyid dam gzhan du 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: @85a * // rang bzhin zhig yin na ni gdon mi za bar de nyid dam gzhan du 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: If it had an essence, then it would have to be either the same as or different from its members.

original: de lta yin dang bya ba de brtags pa yin pa'i phyir rgyun bzhin du 'bras bu 'ga' la yang nye bar sbyor ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta yin dang bya ba de brtags pa yin pa'i phyir rgyun bzhin du 'bras bu 'ga' la yang nye bar sbyor ba ma yin no //
translated: But since it is like that, since it is imputed, like the continuum, it is not connected to any effect.

original: brtags pa'i rgyu ni 'bras bu 'ga' zhig la yang nye bar sbyor ba yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: brtags pa'i rgyu ni 'bras bu 'ga' zhig la yang nye bar sbyor ba yod pa ma yin te /
translated: An imputed cause is not connected to any effect.

original: de ni rang bzhin med pa yin pa'i phyir la 'bras bu skye ba ni rang bzhin dang 'brel ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni rang bzhin med pa yin pa'i phyir la 'bras bu skye ba ni rang bzhin dang 'brel ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it is essenceless, and the arising of the effect is related to an essence.

original: de lta bas na rgyun can gyi rang bzhin gyis dngos po'i rang bzhin nyid don byed par nus pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de lta bas na rgyun can gyi rang bzhin gyis dngos po'i rang bzhin nyid don byed par nus pa yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, the essence of the members of the continuum is the essence of the thing that is able to perform a function.

original: rgyun brtags pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyun brtags pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The continuum is not imputed.

original: de lta yin dang bya ba rtogs su yod pa yin pa'i phyir snga ma bzhin du phyis kyang don dam par yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir de'i dbang gis dus gsum rnam par gzhag na yang brtags pa nyid du 'gyur gyi yang dag pa ni ma yin no
analyzed: de lta yin dang bya ba rtogs su yod pa yin pa'i phyir snga ma bzhin du phyis kyang don dam par yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir de'i dbang gis dus gsum rnam par gzhag na yang brtags pa nyid du 'gyur gyi yang dag pa ni ma yin no
translated: Because in that case, since the activity would be observed, like before, it would not ultimately exist later, and therefore, even if the three times were posited through its power, they would be only imputed and not real.

original: // yang ci ste bya ba rtags su yod pa dang des byas pa'i dus rnam par gzhag pa yang brtags su yod pa yin la rag mod de las skyon cir 'gyur snyam na /
analyzed: // yang ci ste bya ba rtags su yod pa dang des byas pa'i dus rnam par gzhag pa yang brtags su yod pa yin la rag mod de las skyon cir 'gyur snyam na /
translated: But if activity is observed and the time that is produced by it is posited as imputed, so what?

original: bya bar brjod pa zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: bya bar brjod pa zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The response to that is ‚ÄúThe so-called activity.‚Äù

original: 'bras bu 'phen pa'i nus pa ni chos rnams kyi bya ba yin no zhes bya bar khyed cag gis brjod la /
analyzed: 'bras bu 'phen pa'i nus pa ni chos rnams kyi bya ba yin no zhes bya bar khyed cag gis brjod la /
translated: You say that the activity of phenomena is the potency that projects an effect.

original: 'bras bu 'phen pa'i nus pa gang yin pa ste dngos po'i rang gi mtshan nyid las gzhan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu 'phen pa'i nus pa gang yin pa ste dngos po'i rang gi mtshan nyid las gzhan ni ma yin no //
translated: The potency that projects an effect is not different from the intrinsic character of things.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: Well then, what is it?

original: de nyid yin no //
analyzed: de nyid yin no //
translated: It is that itself.

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'di sgra'i spyod yul ma yin te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'di sgra'i spyod yul ma yin te /
translated: Therefore it is not the domain of words.

original: thun mong ma yin pa yin pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: thun mong ma yin pa yin pa'i phyir la /
translated: because it is not shared in common,

original: rang bzhin mtshan nyid la sgra mi 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin mtshan nyid la sgra mi 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and because the term ‚Äúnature‚Äù is not applied to characteristics.

original: de lta yin dang nus pa nyid dngos po yin gyi gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir ji ltar nus pa de tha snyad du yod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta yin dang nus pa nyid dngos po yin gyi gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir ji ltar nus pa de tha snyad du yod par 'gyur te /
translated: If that is so, then since only potency is a real thing and not anything else, how could potency exist conventionally, just as it is?

original: mi 'gyur ba kho na'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mi 'gyur ba kho na'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is said that it does not exist at all.

original: de bas na de'i dbang gis dus rnam par gzhag pa de kho na nyid du 'dod par bya dgos so snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na de'i dbang gis dus rnam par gzhag pa de kho na nyid du 'dod par bya dgos so snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is thought that the presentation of time must be accepted as it is.

original: gzhan yang gang me la sogs pa'i ngo bo bsreg pa dang 'tshed pa la sogs pa don bya ba byed par dmigs pa nyid ci 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i gnas skabs yin nam /
analyzed: gzhan yang gang me la sogs pa'i ngo bo bsreg pa dang 'tshed pa la sogs pa don bya ba byed par dmigs pa nyid ci 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i gnas skabs yin nam /
translated: Moreover, that which is observed to perform a function, such as the nature of fire, which is to burn and cook, is it the present state of the past and future?

original: 'on te gzhan yin /
analyzed: 'on te gzhan yin /
translated: Or is it something else?

original: gal te de nyid yin na khyad par med pa'i dngos po gcig la gang gis go rims bzhin du ma 'ongs pa dang / 'das pa dang da ltar rnam par 'jog par 'gyur ba ji ltar mi byed pa la sogs @85b pa'i chos phan tshun 'gal ba'i chos yod par 'gyur /
analyzed: gal te de nyid yin na khyad par med pa'i dngos po gcig la gang gis go rims bzhin du ma 'ongs pa dang / 'das pa dang da ltar rnam par 'jog par 'gyur ba ji ltar mi byed pa la sogs @85b pa'i chos phan tshun 'gal ba'i chos yod par 'gyur /
translated: If it is the same, then why is it that one thing, which is not different, is not posited as future, past, and present, respectively? There would be mutually contradictory attributes such as ‚Äúnot being produced‚Äù and so on.

original: gal te 'gal ba'i chos dang ldan pa yang gcig tu gyur na /
analyzed: gal te 'gal ba'i chos dang ldan pa yang gcig tu gyur na /
translated: If something that possesses contradictory attributes were one,

original: 'o na de tha dad par rnam par mi gzhag go //
analyzed: 'o na de tha dad par rnam par mi gzhag go //
translated: then it would not be posited as different.

original: de lta yin dang 'gro ba thams cad gcig nyid du 'gyur la /
analyzed: de lta yin dang 'gro ba thams cad gcig nyid du 'gyur la /
translated: If that were so, all transmigrators would be one.

original: gcig nyid yin na yang lhan cig skye la sogs par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gcig nyid yin na yang lhan cig skye la sogs par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: And if they were one, it follows that they would be born simultaneously and so on.üîΩBut if you think that the thing is not different in the three times, because it is different in terms of the abandonment and possession of the state,

original: yang ci ste gnas skabs spangs pa dang yongs su 'dzin pa'i bye brag gis tha dad pa'i phyir dus rnams su dngos po khyad par med do zhes rtog na /
analyzed: yang ci ste gnas skabs spangs pa dang yongs su 'dzin pa'i bye brag gis tha dad pa'i phyir dus rnams su dngos po khyad par med do zhes rtog na /
translated: then how could it be tenable to say that it is not different?

original: de ltar na yang ci gnas skabs de dag dngos po las tha dad pa yin pa yin na na ma 'on te tha mi dad pa yin zhes bya ba brjod par bya dgos so //
analyzed: de ltar na yang ci gnas skabs de dag dngos po las tha dad pa yin pa yin na na ma 'on te tha mi dad pa yin zhes bya ba brjod par bya dgos so //
translated: But in that case, it must be said whether those states are different from things or not different.

original: pha rol pos ma yin zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: pha rol pos ma yin zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The opponent says, ‚ÄúNo.‚Äù

original: dngos po las tha dad pa yin zhes 'brel te //
analyzed: dngos po las tha dad pa yin zhes 'brel te //
translated: It is connected to ‚Äúthey are not different from things.‚Äù

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: dngos po byed po mi thob phyir te /
analyzed: dngos po byed po mi thob phyir te /
translated: Because a thing does not obtain the status of an agent.

original: byed pa po ma yin pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byed pa po ma yin pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it would follow that it is not an agent.

original: gnas skabs de dag nyid du rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag gis 'bras bu nus pa grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas skabs de dag nyid du rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag gis 'bras bu nus pa grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the states are established as the effects of the capacity of following and reversing.

original: 'dir skyon bshad pa ni /üîΩji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'dir skyon bshad pa ni / ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Here the explanation of the error is:üîΩ‚ÄúHow could it be known that the states are not different from things?‚Äù

original: ji ltar gnas skabs dngos po las tha mi dad par shes par 'gyur rtogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: ji ltar gnas skabs dngos po las tha mi dad par shes par 'gyur rtogs par 'gyur te /
translated: How could it be known that the states are not different from things?

original: mi 'gyur ba kho na'o //
analyzed: mi 'gyur ba kho na'o //
translated: It could not be known at all.

original: gang gi phyir gnas skabs ma byung ba las byung zhing byung nas kyang 'jig par 'gyur ba de ltar dngos po ni mi 'dod de /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gnas skabs ma byung ba las byung zhing byung nas kyang 'jig par 'gyur ba de ltar dngos po ni mi 'dod de /
translated: Because you do not accept that things arise from a non-arisen state and having arisen, they are destroyed,

original: thams cad du yod pa nyid du khas len pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad du yod pa nyid du khas len pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because you accept that they exist at all times.

original: de lta yin dang de'i bdag nyid de dag ni ma byung ba las byung ba dang byung nas kyang 'jig pa ji ltar rigs pa yin //
analyzed: de lta yin dang de'i bdag nyid de dag ni ma byung ba las byung ba dang byung nas kyang 'jig pa ji ltar rigs pa yin //
translated: If that were so, how could it be tenable that they arise from a non-arisen state and having arisen, they are destroyed?

original: ma yin pa kho na ste /
analyzed: ma yin pa kho na ste /
translated: It is not tenable.

original: grub pa dang bde ba tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: grub pa dang bde ba tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the established and the happy are different.

original: de lta ma yin te /üîΩde'i bdag nyid yin na de dag kyang rtag tu yod pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin te / de'i bdag nyid yin na de dag kyang rtag tu yod pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: If that were not so,

original: dngos po'i rang bzhin de las tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po'i rang bzhin de las tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: then it would follow that they would always exist, because their nature would not be different from that.

original: dngos po yin na yang ma byung ba las byung ba la sogs pa thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: dngos po yin na yang ma byung ba las byung ba la sogs pa thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: If they were things, it would follow that they arise from a non-arisen state and so on,

original: gnas skabs kyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: gnas skabs kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: because their nature is a state.

original: gnas skabs tha dad pa yongs su brtags pa yin du chug mod /
analyzed: gnas skabs tha dad pa yongs su brtags pa yin du chug mod /
translated: Even if you imagine that they are different states,

original: de lta na yang 'gal ba'i chos dang ldan pa ma spangs pa kho na yin te /üîΩ'di ltar dbus kyi gnas skabs kyi dngos po ci rang gi ngo bos byed pa yin nam /
analyzed: de lta na yang 'gal ba'i chos dang ldan pa ma spangs pa kho na yin te / 'di ltar dbus kyi gnas skabs kyi dngos po ci rang gi ngo bos byed pa yin nam /
translated: But still, it is not the case that he has abandoned the possession of contradictory properties.üîΩIn this way, is the entity of the present state

original: 'on te gzhan gyi ngo bos yin /
analyzed: 'on te gzhan gyi ngo bos yin /
translated: made by its own nature, or is it made by another nature?

original: gang lte rang gi ngo bos yin na /
analyzed: gang lte rang gi ngo bos yin na /
translated: If it is made by its own nature,

original: ngo bo de nyid 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i gnas skabs gzhan dag la yod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ngo bo de nyid 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i gnas skabs gzhan dag la yod pa'i phyir /
translated: then that nature exists in the other states of the past and future,

original: @86a * // 'di'i byed pa'i rang bzhin mi byed pa dang byed pa zhig pa ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: @86a * // 'di'i byed pa'i rang bzhin mi byed pa dang byed pa zhig pa ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: so how could the nature of its activity be non-activity and the cessation of activity?

original: ci ste gzhan gyi ngo bo yin na de'i tshe /
analyzed: ci ste gzhan gyi ngo bo yin na de'i tshe /
translated: But if it is made by another nature,

original: yang 'di'i byed pa po ma yin pa thob par 'gyur bas dngos po med pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang 'di'i byed pa po ma yin pa thob par 'gyur bas dngos po med pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then it would follow that it would not be an agent, and so it would be a non-entity.

original: de ltar re zhig me la sogs pa'i rang bzhin de nyid 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa la sogs pa'i gnas skabs su mi rigs so //
analyzed: de ltar re zhig me la sogs pa'i rang bzhin de nyid 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa la sogs pa'i gnas skabs su mi rigs so //
translated: Thus, the nature of fire and so on is not tenable in the states of the past and future.

original: 'on te gzhan yin na phyogs 'di la gcig la byed pa dang mi byed pa la sogs pa phan tshun 'gal ba'i chos 'chol ba la sogs pa'i skyon du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'on te gzhan yin na phyogs 'di la gcig la byed pa dang mi byed pa la sogs pa phan tshun 'gal ba'i chos 'chol ba la sogs pa'i skyon du mi 'gyur te /
translated: But if they are different, then in this system, the faults of the absurd consequence of the random quality of mutually contradictory attributes such as the action and nonaction of a single thing, and so on, would not arise,

original: dngos po tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the things would be different.

original: 'on kyang sreg pa dang 'tshed pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu la rung ba'i me la sogs pa'i dngos po gang yin pa de ma byung ba las byung zhing byung nas kyang 'jig par 'gyur ba'i phyir de'i che yod pa nyid du khas len pa dang 'gal bar
analyzed: 'on kyang sreg pa dang 'tshed pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu la rung ba'i me la sogs pa'i dngos po gang yin pa de ma byung ba las byung zhing byung nas kyang 'jig par 'gyur ba'i phyir de'i che yod pa nyid du khas len pa dang 'gal bar
translated: But if the thing that is suitable as the result of burning or boiling is something that arises from what was nonexistent and having arisen, it is destroyed, then it would contradict the assertion that it exists,

original: 'gyur te / rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgal te yang 'di snyam du 'bras bu la byung ba nyid ma byung ba las byung zhing byung nas kyang 'jig par 'gyur ba de lta na yang na 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i gnas skabs kyi 'bras bu la rung ba ma yin pa'i dngos po yod pa
analyzed: 'gyur te / rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir ro // gal te yang 'di snyam du 'bras bu la byung ba nyid ma byung ba las byung zhing byung nas kyang 'jig par 'gyur ba de lta na yang na 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i gnas skabs kyi 'bras bu la rung ba ma yin pa'i dngos po yod pa
translated: because it would not be a subsequent state.

original: nyid yin la /
analyzed: nyid yin la /
translated: But if you think that although the existent result arises from what was nonexistent and having arisen, it is destroyed, then even so, the thing that is not suitable as the result in the past and future states exists.

original: de lta yin dang rtag tu yod pa nyid du khas blangs pa dang 'gal ba ma yin no snyam du sems na /
analyzed: de lta yin dang rtag tu yod pa nyid du khas blangs pa dang 'gal ba ma yin no snyam du sems na /
translated: If you think that it is not contradictory to maintain that it always exists,

original: don byed nus pa zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: don byed nus pa zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: he says, ‚Äúthat which is able to perform a function,‚Äù

original: de nyid ces bya ba ni don byed nus pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid ces bya ba ni don byed nus pa'o //
translated: ‚Äúthat itself‚Äù refers to that which is able to perform a function.

original: de dag la zhes bya ba ni 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i gnas skabs dag la'o //
analyzed: de dag la zhes bya ba ni 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i gnas skabs dag la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn those‚Äù refers to the states of the past and future.

original: gang yod ces bya ba ni 'bras bu la rung ba ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: gang yod ces bya ba ni 'bras bu la rung ba ma yin pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúWhat exists‚Äù is not suitable as an effect.

original: yang ci ste skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu la sogs pa 'das pa 'bras bu la rung ba nyid du 'dod de /
analyzed: yang ci ste skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu la sogs pa 'das pa 'bras bu la rung ba nyid du 'dod de /
translated: But if you think that past homogeneous causes, etc., are asserted to be suitable as effects,

original: de bas na de las 'bras bu mi 'byung zhes bya ba 'di ma grub pa yin no snyam na /
analyzed: de bas na de las 'bras bu mi 'byung zhes bya ba 'di ma grub pa yin no snyam na /
translated: then this statement, ‚ÄúAn effect does not arise from that which does not exist,‚Äù is not established.

original: ma byung ba las zhes bya ba smos te /üîΩres 'ga' ba ni nyid kyis kyang zhes bya ba ni /üîΩgzhan bzhin gsal bar da ltar 'gyur //
analyzed: ma byung ba las zhes bya ba smos te / res 'ga' ba ni nyid kyis kyang zhes bya ba ni / gzhan bzhin gsal bar da ltar 'gyur //
translated: He says, ‚ÄúFrom what has not yet arisen,‚ÄùüîΩ‚ÄúSometimes‚Äù refers to the present.üîΩ‚ÄúLike the other‚Äù refers to the present.

original: zhes bya ba dang sbrel bar bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba dang sbrel bar bya'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIt becomes clear‚Äù is connected to the above.

original: gzhan bzhin zhes bya ba ni rtsod pa'i gzhir ma gyur ba'i da ltar ba bzhin no //
analyzed: gzhan bzhin zhes bya ba ni rtsod pa'i gzhir ma gyur ba'i da ltar ba bzhin no //
translated: ‚ÄúLike the other‚Äù means like the present that is not a basis of dispute.

original: gtan tshigs 'di rjes su 'gro ba med pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gtan tshigs 'di rjes su 'gro ba med pa yang ma yin te /
translated: This reason is not unestablished.

original: 'di ltar rgyu dang rkyen gyis bskyed pa'i don gang yin pa de ni da ltar zhes bya ba la gang yang res 'ga' ba ni gdon mi za bar rgyu dang rkyen dag gis bskyed pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar rgyu dang rkyen gyis bskyed pa'i don gang yin pa de ni da ltar zhes bya ba la gang yang res 'ga' ba ni gdon mi za bar rgyu dang rkyen dag gis bskyed pa yin no //
translated: Thus, any object that is generated by causes and conditions is called ‚Äúpresent.‚Äù Whatever is occasional must be generated by causes and conditions.

original: 'di ltar rgyu med pa la ni @86b go skabs gnyis yod de /
analyzed: 'di ltar rgyu med pa la ni @86b go skabs gnyis yod de /
translated: Thus, there are two possibilities for that which is causeless:

original: rtag tu yod pa'am med pa nyid de /
analyzed: rtag tu yod pa'am med pa nyid de /
translated: it is either permanent or nonexistent.

original: gzhan la mi ltos pa'i phyir ro //üîΩde lta bas na gang res 'ga' ba yin pa de ni gdon mi za bar rgyu dang rkyen gyis bskyed pa yin la /
analyzed: gzhan la mi ltos pa'i phyir ro // de lta bas na gang res 'ga' ba yin pa de ni gdon mi za bar rgyu dang rkyen gyis bskyed pa yin la /
translated: Because it does not depend on another.üîΩTherefore, whatever is occasional must be generated by causes and conditions.

original: gang yang rgyu dang rkyen gyis bskyed pa'i yod pa de ni gdon mi za bar da ltar byung ba yin pa'i phyir da ltar byung bas res 'ga' ba nyid la khyab par grub po //
analyzed: gang yang rgyu dang rkyen gyis bskyed pa'i yod pa de ni gdon mi za bar da ltar byung ba yin pa'i phyir da ltar byung bas res 'ga' ba nyid la khyab par grub po //
translated: And whatever exists as generated by causes and conditions must be present. Thus it is established that the present is pervaded by occasionality.

original: gzhan yang gal te 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa rdzas su yod pa yin pa de'i tshe 'dus byas thams cad rtag pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: gzhan yang gal te 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa rdzas su yod pa yin pa de'i tshe 'dus byas thams cad rtag pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur la /
translated: Moreover, if the past and future exist substantially, then it follows that all conditioned states would be permanent.

original: de lta yin dang gzugs la sogs pa so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa la sogs pa las khyad par du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta yin dang gzugs la sogs pa so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa la sogs pa las khyad par du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: And if that is so, then the analytical cessations of form and so on would not differ from form and so on.

original: ci ste gzugs la sogs pa 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i phyir 'dus byas nyid yin gyi nam mkha' la sogs pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: ci ste gzugs la sogs pa 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i phyir 'dus byas nyid yin gyi nam mkha' la sogs pa ni ma yin te /
translated: If others assert that conditioned states are conditioned because they possess the characteristics of conditioned states such as form, but space and so on do not,

original: des na gzugs la sogs pa las so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa mi 'dra bar 'gyur ro zhes bya bar gzhan dag gis 'dod na de ni yang dag pa ma yin te /
analyzed: des na gzugs la sogs pa las so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa mi 'dra bar 'gyur ro zhes bya bar gzhan dag gis 'dod na de ni yang dag pa ma yin te /
translated: then the analytical cessations of form and so on would differ from form and so on.

original: 'di ltar skye ba dang rga ba dang gnas pa dang mi rtag pa zhes bya ba bzhi po 'di dag ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid dag yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar skye ba dang rga ba dang gnas pa dang mi rtag pa zhes bya ba bzhi po 'di dag ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid dag yin no //
translated: But that is not correct, because these four: arising, aging, enduring, and impermanence, are the characteristics of conditioned states.

original: de la skye bas skyed par byed do //
analyzed: de la skye bas skyed par byed do //
translated: Among them, arising generates.

original: gnas pas gnas par byed do //
analyzed: gnas pas gnas par byed do //
translated: Enduring causes endurance.

original: rgas pas rgas par byed do //
analyzed: rgas pas rgas par byed do //
translated: Aging causes aging.üîΩImpermanence causes destruction.

original: mi rtag pas 'jig par byed do zhes bya ba 'di dag gi bya ba ni skyed pa la sogs pa 'di dag yin no //
analyzed: mi rtag pas 'jig par byed do zhes bya ba 'di dag gi bya ba ni skyed pa la sogs pa 'di dag yin no //
translated: These are the functions of arising, etc.üîΩAmong them, arising is that which causes the generation of something that did not exist previously.

original: de la re zhig skye ba ni khyab par gang zhig skyed par byed pa na gzugs la sogs pa'i skyed par byed pa zhes brjod pa /üîΩci gzugs la sogs pa de las gzhan te tha dad pa'am /
analyzed: de la re zhig skye ba ni khyab par gang zhig skyed par byed pa na gzugs la sogs pa'i skyed par byed pa zhes brjod pa / ci gzugs la sogs pa de las gzhan te tha dad pa'am /
translated: Is the generation of form, etc.üîΩthe generation of something different from it, or is it the generation of something that is not different?

original: 'on te gzhan ma yin pa ste tha mi dad pa'i khyad par skyed par byed pa yin zhes bya ba phyogs rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: 'on te gzhan ma yin pa ste tha mi dad pa'i khyad par skyed par byed pa yin zhes bya ba phyogs rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: These are the two possibilities.

original: de la re zhig tha mi dad pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de la re zhig tha mi dad pa ni ma yin te /
translated: First, it is not the generation of something that is not different.

original: gang gi phyir khyad par 'di skye ba'i bya ba las sngar yang grub pa'i phyir bya bar mi nus te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir khyad par 'di skye ba'i bya ba las sngar yang grub pa'i phyir bya bar mi nus te /
translated: Because this difference would be established prior to the activity of arising, it could not be generated.

original: grub pa'i dus phyis bzhin no //
analyzed: grub pa'i dus phyis bzhin no //
translated: It would be like the time after it is established.

original: grub zin pa ni bya bar rigs pa ma yin te ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: grub zin pa ni bya bar rigs pa ma yin te ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not reasonable that what is already established is generated, because that would lead to an absurd consequence.

original: khyad par tha dad pa byed pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: khyad par tha dad pa byed pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it a different characteristic of that which is different,

original: tha dad na ni gzugs la sogs pa 'di'i khyad par 'di zhes bya ba'i 'brel pa ma grub pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: tha dad na ni gzugs la sogs pa 'di'i khyad par 'di zhes bya ba'i 'brel pa ma grub pa'i phyir te /
translated: because if it were different, the relation of this difference of this form, etc. would not be established.

original: 'di ltar de re zhig de'i bdag nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pa med de /
analyzed: 'di ltar de re zhig de'i bdag nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pa med de /
translated: In this way, first, there is no relation of the characteristic of its own nature,

original: tha dad par khas blangs pa'i phyir ram /üîΩkhas mi len na yang sngar @87a * //
analyzed: tha dad par khas blangs pa'i phyir ram / khas mi len na yang sngar @87a * //
translated: because it is accepted as different,

original: bshad pa'i skyon du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bshad pa'i skyon du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: or if it is not accepted, the previously explained error would ensue.

original: de las byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyang med de skye ba nyid las de byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyang med de skye ba nyid las de byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Nor is there a relation of origination from it, because it originates from mere origination.

original: 'brel ba gzhan yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'brel ba gzhan yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: There is no other relation,

original: rten dang brten pa nyid la sogs pa ni de las byung ba'i khongs su 'dus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rten dang brten pa nyid la sogs pa ni de las byung ba'i khongs su 'dus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because support and supported, etc. are included in origination from it.

original: yang de las byung bar khas len na /
analyzed: yang de las byung bar khas len na /
translated: Moreover, if it is accepted that it originates from that,

original: de tsam las byung ba'i khyad par ni rtag tu skye bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de tsam las byung ba'i khyad par ni rtag tu skye bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: then it would follow that it would always originate from mere that.

original: da ni skye ba ci zhig byed par 'gyur /
analyzed: da ni skye ba ci zhig byed par 'gyur /
translated: Now, what would birth do?

original: skye ba la ltos nas skyed par byed pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: skye ba la ltos nas skyed par byed pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is the producer in dependence on birth,

original: phan 'dogs par mi byed pa'i skye ba la ltos pa ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: phan 'dogs par mi byed pa'i skye ba la ltos pa ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: it is not logical that it is in dependence on birth that does not benefit it,

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because that would lead to the absurdity that anything could be the cause of anything.

original: phan 'dogs par byed na yang phan pa de khyad par bzhin du de nyid dang gzhan nyid kyis bsams pa na thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phan 'dogs par byed na yang phan pa de khyad par bzhin du de nyid dang gzhan nyid kyis bsams pa na thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If it does benefit it, then just as the benefit is considered to be that very thing or something else, the absurdity would follow that there would be an infinite regress of benefits.

original: de lta bas na tha dad pa yin na 'brel ba mi 'grub po //
analyzed: de lta bas na tha dad pa yin na 'brel ba mi 'grub po //
translated: Thus, if they are different, the relation is not established.

original: gzhan yang khyad par de sngar med pa'i phyir 'bras bu med par khas blangs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan yang khyad par de sngar med pa'i phyir 'bras bu med par khas blangs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, because that difference would not exist previously, it would be accepted that the effect does not exist.

original: de bzhin du rga bas gzhan du 'gyur bar byed la /
analyzed: de bzhin du rga bas gzhan du 'gyur bar byed la /
translated: Similarly, aging causes it to become otherwise.

original: gnas pas gnas pa dang / mi rtag pas 'jig par byed pa na gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid la sogs pa 'di dag ni gzhan dang gzhan ma yin par rnam par brtags pa na skyon gang yin pa de dag ni skye ba bzhin du rga ba la sogs pa la yang brjod par bya'o
analyzed: gnas pas gnas pa dang / mi rtag pas 'jig par byed pa na gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid la sogs pa 'di dag ni gzhan dang gzhan ma yin par rnam par brtags pa na skyon gang yin pa de dag ni skye ba bzhin du rga ba la sogs pa la yang brjod par bya'o
translated: The faults that are stated when otherness and non-otherness are investigated are to be stated in the same way with regard to aging, etc., as they are with regard to arising.

original: // rang gi 'bras bu las rigs pa la sogs pa yod pa nyid gang yin pa de nus pa'i rang bzhin nges pa'i phyir 'dod de /
analyzed: // rang gi 'bras bu las rigs pa la sogs pa yod pa nyid gang yin pa de nus pa'i rang bzhin nges pa'i phyir 'dod de /
translated: The existence of the capacity of a cause to produce its effect, etc., is accepted because the nature of its capacity is ascertained.

original: de dag ni nus pa'i rang bzhin de yang thams cad du yod pa'i phyir thams cad du 'bras bu rtsom pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag ni nus pa'i rang bzhin de yang thams cad du yod pa'i phyir thams cad du 'bras bu rtsom pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: But if that nature of capacity exists in all cases, then it follows that the effect would be produced in all cases.

original: rgyu dang rkyen ma tshang ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen ma tshang ba yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it the case that the cause and conditions are incomplete,

original: de dag kyang rtag tu gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag kyang rtag tu gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they always endure.

original: de lta yin dang 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i gnas skabs dag tu skye ba la sogs pas skyed pa la sogs pa'i bya ba byed pa'i phyir dus gcig nyid la dus dpag tu med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta yin dang 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i gnas skabs dag tu skye ba la sogs pas skyed pa la sogs pa'i bya ba byed pa'i phyir dus gcig nyid la dus dpag tu med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were so, then in the past and future, arising, etc. would perform the action of giving rise, etc. and it would follow that one moment would be an infinite number of moments.

original: gzhan yang 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dag skad cig ma nyid yin na /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dag skad cig ma nyid yin na /
translated: Moreover, if the past and future are momentary,

original: skad cig ma ma yin pa nyid yin zhes bya ba phyogs rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: skad cig ma ma yin pa nyid yin zhes bya ba phyogs rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: then there are two alternatives: they are momentary or they are not momentary.

original: de la gal te dang po ste skad cig ma zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de la gal te dang po ste skad cig ma zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: If the first, then they are momentary, that is, they are present.

original: de'i tshe dus dpag tu med par 'gyur ba so na 'dug pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i tshe dus dpag tu med par 'gyur ba so na 'dug pa yin no //
translated: Then it would follow that they would remain for an infinite time.

original: de la skad cig gang zhes bya bas de nyid ston pa yin no //üîΩ@87b ci ste skad cig ma ma yin pa zhes bya ba'i phyogs yin na /
analyzed: de la skad cig gang zhes bya bas de nyid ston pa yin no // @87b ci ste skad cig ma ma yin pa zhes bya ba'i phyogs yin na /
translated: In that case, what is a moment?

original: de lta yin na grub pa'i mtha' dang 'gal te /
analyzed: de lta yin na grub pa'i mtha' dang 'gal te /
translated: If the second, then it contradicts our tenets.

original: grub pa'i mtha' ni nges pa'i mtha' la brjod do //
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' ni nges pa'i mtha' la brjod do //
translated: For our tenets are stated in the Abhidharma.

original: de skad du yang 'dus byas thams cad skad cig ma yin no zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha' yin no //
analyzed: de skad du yang 'dus byas thams cad skad cig ma yin no zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha' yin no //
translated: Thus, the thesis that all conditioned things are momentary is established.

original: gzhan yang grub pa'i mtha' dang 'gal ba 'ba' zhig tu ma zad /
analyzed: gzhan yang grub pa'i mtha' dang 'gal ba 'ba' zhig tu ma zad /
translated: Moreover, this thesis is not only contrary to your tenets,

original: dam bca' ba rjes su dpag pa dang yang 'gal ba yin te /
analyzed: dam bca' ba rjes su dpag pa dang yang 'gal ba yin te /
translated: but it also contradicts your own syllogism.

original: 'di ltar gang yod pa de thams cad ni skad cig ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar gang yod pa de thams cad ni skad cig ma yin te /
translated: For, whatever exists is momentary,

original: da ltar ba bzhin no //
analyzed: da ltar ba bzhin no //
translated: like the present.

original: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dag kyang yod pa yin no zhes nges pa'i phyir skad cig ma 'jig par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dag kyang yod pa yin no zhes nges pa'i phyir skad cig ma 'jig par 'gyur ro //
translated: Since it is ascertained that the past and future exist, they are momentary and disintegrate.

original: gtan tshigs 'di'i 'brel pa skad cig ma 'jig pa brtags par bsgrubs zin pa'i phyir ma nges pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: gtan tshigs 'di'i 'brel pa skad cig ma 'jig pa brtags par bsgrubs zin pa'i phyir ma nges pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: This reason is not indeterminate, because the relation of the reason to the thesis has been established in the examination of momentariness.

original: 'di ltar yod pa'i mtshan nyid ni don bya ba byed pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar yod pa'i mtshan nyid ni don bya ba byed pa yin te /
translated: The definition of existence is the performance of a function,

original: skad cig ma ma yin pa yang rim dang cig car dag gis don byed pa 'gal ba'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: skad cig ma ma yin pa yang rim dang cig car dag gis don byed pa 'gal ba'i phyir ro ;
translated: because it is contradictory for what is not momentary to perform a function either gradually or instantaneously.

original: / don byed pa log na de'i mtshan nyid can gyi yod pa ldog pa'i phyir bsgrub bya'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis yod pa la khyab po //
analyzed: / don byed pa log na de'i mtshan nyid can gyi yod pa ldog pa'i phyir bsgrub bya'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis yod pa la khyab po //
translated: If the performance of function is negated, then existence, which is characterized by that, is also negated. Therefore, existence is pervaded by the predicate of the negandum.

original: gzhan yang 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa 'di dag don byed par nus pa zhig gam mi nus pa zhig ces bya ba phyogs rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: gzhan yang 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa 'di dag don byed par nus pa zhig gam mi nus pa zhig ces bya ba phyogs rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: Moreover, these past and future are either able to perform a function or not able to perform a function.

original: gal te nus na de'i tshe nus pa yod pa na da ltar bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te nus na de'i tshe nus pa yod pa na da ltar bar 'gyur te /
translated: If they are able, then at that time, since the ability exists, they would be present,

original: rtsod pa'i gzhir ma gyur ba'i da ltar ba bzhin no //
analyzed: rtsod pa'i gzhir ma gyur ba'i da ltar ba bzhin no //
translated: like a present that is not a basis of dispute.

original: sbyor ba ni gang dang gang don bya ba byed par nus pa de dag ni da ltar ba yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang dang gang don bya ba byed par nus pa de dag ni da ltar ba yin te /
translated: The syllogism is: Whatever is able to perform a function is present,

original: rtsod pa'i gzhir ma gyur ba'i da ltar bzhin no //
analyzed: rtsod pa'i gzhir ma gyur ba'i da ltar bzhin no //
translated: like a present that is not a basis of dispute.

original: 'das pa la sogs pa yang don byed par nus pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi thal bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: 'das pa la sogs pa yang don byed par nus pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi thal bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: That the past, etc., are able to perform a function is the consequence of the autonomous reason.

original: 'di ma nges pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ma nges pa yang ma yin te /
translated: This is not indeterminate,üîΩbecause

original: 'di ltar da ltar ba log pa na zhig pa dang ma skyes pa rnams nus pa thams cad dang bral bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di ltar da ltar ba log pa na zhig pa dang ma skyes pa rnams nus pa thams cad dang bral bar 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, when the present is refuted, the past and future would be devoid of all ability,

original: nam mkha'i pad mo bzhin no //
analyzed: nam mkha'i pad mo bzhin no //
translated: like a sky-lotus.

original: sbyor ba ni gang dag da ltar byung ba yang ma yin pa de dag ni 'ga' zhig tu nus par yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang dag da ltar byung ba yang ma yin pa de dag ni 'ga' zhig tu nus par yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: The syllogism is: Those which are not present do not have any ability whatsoever,

original: nam mkha'i pad ma bzhin no //
analyzed: nam mkha'i pad ma bzhin no //
translated: like a sky-lotus.

original: 'das pa la sogs pa rnams kyang da ltar ma yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o //üîΩ'dus ma byas nam mkha' dang so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa dang so sor brtags pa ma yin pa'i @88a * //
analyzed: 'das pa la sogs pa rnams kyang da ltar ma yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o // 'dus ma byas nam mkha' dang so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa dang so sor brtags pa ma yin pa'i @88a * //
translated: The past, etc., are not present. This is an observation of the non-observation of the omnipresent.

original: 'gog pa rnams kyis ma nges par 'gyur ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'gog pa rnams kyis ma nges par 'gyur ba yang ma yin te /
translated: The unconditioned, space, analytical cessations, and non-analytical cessations, are not indeterminate,

original: de dag kyang phyogs su byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag kyang phyogs su byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are included in the subject position.

original: de'i phyir de dag ma nges pa nyid du brtags pa'i rgyu mtshan ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag ma nges pa nyid du brtags pa'i rgyu mtshan ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, they are not a reason for the indetermination of the past, etc.

original: 'di ltar gang dngos po rnams kyi so sor nges pa'i don byed pa'i nus pa de ni byin las byung ba yin no zhes khas blang par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar gang dngos po rnams kyi so sor nges pa'i don byed pa'i nus pa de ni byin las byung ba yin no zhes khas blang par bya ste /
translated: Thus, one must accept that the specific ability of things to perform a function arises from a cause.

original: de lta ma yin te gal te rgyu med par gyur na /
analyzed: de lta ma yin te gal te rgyu med par gyur na /
translated: If it were not so, if it arose without a cause,

original: de'i tshe nges pa'i rgyu med pa'i phyir dngos po rnams kyi nus pa so sor nges par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe nges pa'i rgyu med pa'i phyir dngos po rnams kyi nus pa so sor nges par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: then at that time, because there would be no cause for certainty, the specific ability of things would not be ascertained.

original: de lta yin dang thams cad 'bras bu thams cad la nye bar sbyor bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta yin dang thams cad 'bras bu thams cad la nye bar sbyor bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were so, everything would be connected to every effect.

original: de lta bas na nam mkha' la sogs pa ma byas pa'i nus pa nges par mi rigs pa'i phyir de dag ni ma nges pa nyid du brtags pa'i rgyu mtshan ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na nam mkha' la sogs pa ma byas pa'i nus pa nges par mi rigs pa'i phyir de dag ni ma nges pa nyid du brtags pa'i rgyu mtshan ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, because it is not tenable that the ability of unproduced things such as space is ascertained, they are not the reason for positing the uncompounded as indeterminate.

original: gtan tshigs dang po mi mthun pa'i phyogs la ldog pa la the tshom za ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gtan tshigs dang po mi mthun pa'i phyogs la ldog pa la the tshom za ba yang ma yin te /
translated: The first reason is not uncertain with regard to the opposite.

original: ji ltar nges pa'i don bya ba la nus pa gang yin pa de'i skye ba gang yin pa 'di ni rgyu dang rkyen gyis bskyed pa yin la de nyid da ltar ba'i mtshan nyid yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar nges pa'i don bya ba la nus pa gang yin pa de'i skye ba gang yin pa 'di ni rgyu dang rkyen gyis bskyed pa yin la de nyid da ltar ba'i mtshan nyid yin no //
translated: Whatever is the capacity of a thing to perform a function, that is its arising, which is generated by causes and conditions, and that is the characteristic of the present.

original: da ltar byung ba'i mtshan nyid ma tshang ba med pa 'di yang 'das pa la sogs pa la yang yod pa'i phyir rgyu mtshan gzhan med pas /
analyzed: da ltar byung ba'i mtshan nyid ma tshang ba med pa 'di yang 'das pa la sogs pa la yang yod pa'i phyir rgyu mtshan gzhan med pas /
translated: Since this complete characteristic of the present also exists in the past and future, there is no other reason for it.

original: ci'i phyir da ltar byung bar thal bar mi 'gyur /
analyzed: ci'i phyir da ltar byung bar thal bar mi 'gyur /
translated: Why would it not follow that the past and future are also present?

original: gzhan yang gang gi ltar na 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa rdzas su yod pa de'i ltar na 'bras bu yang rtag tu yod pa'i phyir mtho ris dang byang grol thob par bya ba'i don du 'bad pa 'bras bu med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan yang gang gi ltar na 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa rdzas su yod pa de'i ltar na 'bras bu yang rtag tu yod pa'i phyir mtho ris dang byang grol thob par bya ba'i don du 'bad pa 'bras bu med par 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, for those who assert that the past and future substantially exist, the effect would always exist. Therefore, striving to obtain heaven and liberation would be pointless,

original: 'di bsgrub par bya ba la 'bras bu cung zad kyang med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di bsgrub par bya ba la 'bras bu cung zad kyang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there would be no effect to be achieved.

original: 'di la brtul zhugs dang nges pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid mi g-yo ba ci zhig la nus par 'gyur /
analyzed: 'di la brtul zhugs dang nges pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid mi g-yo ba ci zhig la nus par 'gyur /
translated: What is the use of defining the soul as being endowed with the qualities of courage, determination, etc.?

original: skye ba la nus pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: skye ba la nus pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is not capable of producing the effect,

original: 'o na skye ba ma byung ba las byung ba yin no zhes bya bar grub po //üîΩci ste de yang yod na de ni gang zhig gang du nus pa yin da ltar byed pa la nus pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na skye ba ma byung ba las byung ba yin no zhes bya bar grub po // ci ste de yang yod na de ni gang zhig gang du nus pa yin da ltar byed pa la nus pa yin no zhe na /
translated: then it is established that the effect arises from what is not arisen.üîΩIf you say that it is capable of producing the effect when it exists,üîΩthen what is it capable of producing? It is capable of producing the present.

original: da ltar la byed pa zhes bya ba 'di ci'i yin yul gzhan du 'gugs pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: da ltar la byed pa zhes bya ba 'di ci'i yin yul gzhan du 'gugs pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is capable of attracting the present,

original: 'o na dngos po rtag par thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'o na dngos po rtag par thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: then it follows that the soul is permanent,

original: thams cad du gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad du gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it remains everywhere.

original: tshor ba la sogs pa'i gzugs can ma yin pa rnams la byed pa med pa'i phyir 'gugs par 'gyur /
analyzed: tshor ba la sogs pa'i gzugs can ma yin pa rnams la byed pa med pa'i phyir 'gugs par 'gyur /
translated: Since feeling, etc., which are not material, are not capable of attracting,

original: gang yang de 'gugs pa de yang ma byung ba las byung @88b ba yin no zhes bya bar grub po //
analyzed: gang yang de 'gugs pa de yang ma byung ba las byung @88b ba yin no zhes bya bar grub po //
translated: it is established that what attracts is produced from what is not arisen.

original: mtho ris ni /
analyzed: mtho ris ni /
translated: Heaven is

original: ri rab kyi steng la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ri rab kyi steng la sogs pa'o //
translated: the summit of Mount Meru, etc.

original: byang grol ni thar pa ste /
analyzed: byang grol ni thar pa ste /
translated: Liberation is freedom.

original: de dag thob pa ni 'brel ba'o //
analyzed: de dag thob pa ni 'brel ba'o //
translated: Their attainment is the connection.

original: de la 'bad pa ni brtul zhugs dang nges pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la 'bad pa ni brtul zhugs dang nges pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Effort in that is the discipline, the certainty, and so on.

original: ci ste don byed par mi nus pa yin no zhes bya ba'i phyogs gnyis pa la brten na /
analyzed: ci ste don byed par mi nus pa yin no zhes bya ba'i phyogs gnyis pa la brten na /
translated: If you rely on the second position, that is, that they are not able to perform a function,

original: 'o na de ltar na don byed nus pas stong pa de nyid kyi phyir nam mkha'i me tog bzhin du med pa nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'o na de ltar na don byed nus pas stong pa de nyid kyi phyir nam mkha'i me tog bzhin du med pa nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: then in that case, because they are empty of the ability to perform a function, they are just like a flower in the sky, they are nonexistent.

original: med pa nyid kyi mtshan ni don byed nus pa thams cad kyis dben pa yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩde ltar 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dag gis med par sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma brjod nas yod pa sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma dgag pa'i phyir /
analyzed: med pa nyid kyi mtshan ni don byed nus pa thams cad kyis dben pa yin pa'i phyir ro // de ltar 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dag gis med par sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma brjod nas yod pa sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma dgag pa'i phyir /
translated: The definition of nonexistence is that which is devoid of all ability to perform a function.

original: med pa'i chos kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: med pa'i chos kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Having stated the means of valid cognition that prove that past and future do not exist, in order to refute the means of valid cognition that prove that they exist, he says, A nonexistent phenomenon, etc.

original: sngar bshad pa'i dus kyis bsdus pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs rnams ni gzhi ma grub pa yin te /
analyzed: sngar bshad pa'i dus kyis bsdus pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs rnams ni gzhi ma grub pa yin te /
translated: The reasons, such as ‚Äúbecause they are included in the times that were explained earlier,‚Äù are not established bases.

original: 'das pa la sogs pa'i chos can ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'das pa la sogs pa'i chos can ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the subject, such as the past, is not established.

original: ji skad du /üîΩma grub pa la yod chos med //
analyzed: ji skad du / ma grub pa la yod chos med //
translated: As it is said:

original: ces bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: ces bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat which is not established does not have a property.‚Äù

original: gal te grub par gyur pa de lta na yang da ltar byung ba nyid du grub pa'i phyir chos kyi rang gi ngo bo phyin ci log tu grub pas gtan tshigs 'gal ba dag yin no //
analyzed: gal te grub par gyur pa de lta na yang da ltar byung ba nyid du grub pa'i phyir chos kyi rang gi ngo bo phyin ci log tu grub pas gtan tshigs 'gal ba dag yin no //
translated: Even if it were established, since it is established as present, the intrinsic nature of the property is established in a distorted way, so the reasons are contradictory.

original: da ni 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i gzugs la sogs pa dus kyis bsdus pa nyid du bstan te /
analyzed: da ni 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i gzugs la sogs pa dus kyis bsdus pa nyid du bstan te /
translated: Now, past and future form, etc. are shown to be included in time.

original: ri bong gi rva la sogs pa gtan med pa ni 'das pa'am ma 'ongs pa rnam par 'jog pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: ri bong gi rva la sogs pa gtan med pa ni 'das pa'am ma 'ongs pa rnam par 'jog pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: Since the horns of a rabbit, etc. are utterly nonexistent, they are not posited as past or future.

original: ngo bo gang zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ngo bo gang zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúWhatever entity‚Äù and so on are stated.

original: go bar zad do //
analyzed: go bar zad do //
translated: The meaning is understood.

original: 'o na ji ltar gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa'i dngos po rnams bstan zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa'i dngos po rnams bstan zhe na /
translated: Well then, how are things such as form and feeling taught?

original: 'das sogs 'di'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'das sogs 'di'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúPast, etc. of this‚Äù and so on are stated.

original: gnas skabs de zhes bya ba ni skabs de'o //
analyzed: gnas skabs de zhes bya ba ni skabs de'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat state‚Äù means that occasion.

original: 'o na ji ltar rnam par shes pa gnyis pa brten par gsungs she na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar rnam par shes pa gnyis pa brten par gsungs she na /
translated: Well then, how is it that the second consciousness is said to be supported?

original: de nyid gzugs pas zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de nyid gzugs pas zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says, ‚Äúbecause it is based on that form.‚Äù

original: rnam par shes pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Consciousness is of two kinds:

original: dmigs pa dang bcas pa dang dmigs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa dang bcas pa dang dmigs pa med pa'o //
translated: with an object and without an object.

original: dmigs pa dang bcas pa gang yin pa de la dgongs nas bcom ldan 'das kyis rnam par shes pa gnyis la brten par gsungs so //
analyzed: dmigs pa dang bcas pa gang yin pa de la dgongs nas bcom ldan 'das kyis rnam par shes pa gnyis la brten par gsungs so //
translated: With regard to that which has an object, the Lord said that it is supported by two.

original: ci ste rnam par shes pa dmigs pa med pa yang yod do zhes ji ltar nges par bya zhe na /üîΩrtag @89a * //
analyzed: ci ste rnam par shes pa dmigs pa med pa yang yod do zhes ji ltar nges par bya zhe na / rtag @89a * //
translated: But if there is a consciousness without an object, how can it be ascertained?

original: pa'i dbang phyug ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: pa'i dbang phyug ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚Äúbecause of the eternal nature of God, etc.‚Äù

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni gtso bo dang dus la sogs pa gzhan gyis kun du brtags pa bzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni gtso bo dang dus la sogs pa gzhan gyis kun du brtags pa bzung ngo //
translated: The word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù includes other imagined entities such as primal substance and time.

original: blo 'di dag sgra la dmigs pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di yang bsam par mi bya ste /
analyzed: blo 'di dag sgra la dmigs pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di yang bsam par mi bya ste /
translated: It should not be thought that these cognitions have sound as their object,

original: sgra dang ming zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so ;
analyzed: sgra dang ming zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so ;
translated: because he says, ‚Äúsound, name, etc.‚Äù

original: / sgra'am mi ldan pa'i 'du byed kyi khyad par gyi ming ni dbang phyug la sogs pa de'i rnam pa rtag pa nyid dang srid pa gzugs kyi rgyu nyid la sogs pa'i blo des nges par bya ba'i rnam pa gang yin pa de dang bral ba'i phyir ro
analyzed: / sgra'am mi ldan pa'i 'du byed kyi khyad par gyi ming ni dbang phyug la sogs pa de'i rnam pa rtag pa nyid dang srid pa gzugs kyi rgyu nyid la sogs pa'i blo des nges par bya ba'i rnam pa gang yin pa de dang bral ba'i phyir ro
translated: The name of a particular non-associated compositional factor, such as ‚Äúƒ™≈õvara,‚Äù is divorced from the aspect of the cognition that ascertains its permanent nature and its causal nature for the existence of form, etc.

original: // sogs pa'i sgras ni rgyu mtshan la sogs pa gzhan gyis khas blangs pa'i don gyis gzugs brnyan gyi rang bzhin gzung ngo //
analyzed: // sogs pa'i sgras ni rgyu mtshan la sogs pa gzhan gyis khas blangs pa'i don gyis gzugs brnyan gyi rang bzhin gzung ngo //
translated: The word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù includes the nature of a reflection, which is accepted by others as the cause, etc.

original: gal te shes pa yul med pa yang yod na /
analyzed: gal te shes pa yul med pa yang yod na /
translated: If there is a cognition that does not have an object,

original: de ji ltar shes pa zhes tha snyad du byed /
analyzed: de ji ltar shes pa zhes tha snyad du byed /
translated: how can it be called a cognition?

original: de bzhin du rnam par shes par byed pas rnam par shes pa zhes brjod la /
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam par shes par byed pas rnam par shes pa zhes brjod la /
translated: In the same way, consciousness is called consciousness because it makes conscious.

original: shes par bya ba med na /
analyzed: shes par bya ba med na /
translated: If there is nothing to be conscious of,

original: yang ci zhig rnam par shes pas rnam par shes par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: yang ci zhig rnam par shes pas rnam par shes par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: what is it that consciousness is conscious of?

original: rtog pa'i rjes su 'gro ba rtsam gyis //
analyzed: rtog pa'i rjes su 'gro ba rtsam gyis //
translated: It is merely a convention that follows thought.

original: zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Thus he says,

original: rtog pa'i rjes su 'gro ba yang rtogs par bya bar med par mi srid do zhe na /
analyzed: rtog pa'i rjes su 'gro ba yang rtogs par bya bar med par mi srid do zhe na /
translated: And it is not possible that the subsequent conceptualization does not exist as something to be realized.

original: 'di'i zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: 'di'i zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúThis‚Äù

original: rnam par shes pa 'di'i rtog pa rjes su 'brang ba de yang ngo //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa 'di'i rtog pa rjes su 'brang ba de yang ngo //
translated: The subsequent conceptualization of this consciousness is also that.

original: ci zhig brjod ce na /
analyzed: ci zhig brjod ce na /
translated: What is it?

original: bems po ma yin pa'i ngo bo gang yin pa de'o //
analyzed: bems po ma yin pa'i ngo bo gang yin pa de'o //
translated: It is the nature that is not insentient.

original: gsal bar bya ba'i dngos po gzhan med pa'i phyir dang / gsal bar byed pa gzhan dang bral ba'i phyir nam mkha'i dkyil na yod pa'i snang ba bzhin du gsal ba smos pa'i phyir rtog pa'i ngo bo de yin no zhes bya bar brjod do //
analyzed: gsal bar bya ba'i dngos po gzhan med pa'i phyir dang / gsal bar byed pa gzhan dang bral ba'i phyir nam mkha'i dkyil na yod pa'i snang ba bzhin du gsal ba smos pa'i phyir rtog pa'i ngo bo de yin no zhes bya bar brjod do //
translated: Because there is no other entity to be illuminated and because it is free from another illuminator, it is said to be the nature of conceptualization, like the illumination that exists in the center of space, because it is said to illuminate.üîΩHow is it that past karma produces a result?

original: ji ltar 'das pa'i las 'bras bu 'byin pa yin zhes bya ba 'di la 'bras bu 'byin pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ji ltar 'das pa'i las 'bras bu 'byin pa yin zhes bya ba 'di la 'bras bu 'byin pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Here he says, ‚ÄúThe production of a result‚Äù and so on.

original: dgos pa'i brgyud nas 'bras bu skyed pa'i nus pa grub pa'o //
analyzed: dgos pa'i brgyud nas 'bras bu skyed pa'i nus pa grub pa'o //
translated: The power to generate a result is established through a necessary connection.

original: gal te de ltar na ji ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis zad pa dang 'gags pa dang yongs su gyur pa'i las gang yin pa de ni yod de zhes gsungs she na /
analyzed: gal te de ltar na ji ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis zad pa dang 'gags pa dang yongs su gyur pa'i las gang yin pa de ni yod de zhes gsungs she na /
translated: If that is so, how could the Bhagav√•n say, ‚ÄúThat karma which has been exhausted and ceased exists‚Äù?

original: sems kyi rgyud la zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: sems kyi rgyud la zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The root text says, ‚ÄúIn the continuum of mind.‚Äù

original: nye bar brtags nas zhes bya ba ni phal bar ro //
analyzed: nye bar brtags nas zhes bya ba ni phal bar ro //
translated: ‚ÄúHaving examined‚Äù means in the sutras of definitive meaning.

original: ji ltar rgyu'i rdzas las byung ba'i dbyig pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu'i rgyun yon zhig na yang rgyu'i rdzes ma zhig go zhes brjod pa de bzhin du las rnams kyang yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar rgyu'i rdzas las byung ba'i dbyig pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu'i rgyun yon zhig na yang rgyu'i rdzes ma zhig go zhes brjod pa de bzhin du las rnams kyang yin no //
translated: Just as a result such as a stick that has arisen from a cause is said to cease when its continuum is severed, so too is karma.
