original: @89b nye bar brtags nas bstan pa la dgos pa ci yod ce na /üîΩde ltar zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: @89b nye bar brtags nas bstan pa la dgos pa ci yod ce na / de ltar zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: What is the purpose of teaching this having examined?

original: las 'das pa med de zhes gsungs na /
analyzed: las 'das pa med de zhes gsungs na /
translated: The root text says, ‚ÄúBecause it is said that karma does not expire.‚ÄùüîΩIf karma does not expire,

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu bskyed pa'i nus pa 'das pa'i las des bsgos pa gang yin pa de yang med pa nyid du go bar 'gyur bas gdul bya chad par blta bar 'gyur ba'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis las yod do zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu bskyed pa'i nus pa 'das pa'i las des bsgos pa gang yin pa de yang med pa nyid du go bar 'gyur bas gdul bya chad par blta bar 'gyur ba'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis las yod do zhes gsungs so //
translated: Therefore the BhagavƒÅn said, ‚ÄúKarma exists.‚Äù

original: da ltar ma yin te /
analyzed: da ltar ma yin te /
translated: It is not present.

original: gal te 'das pa rang gi ngo bo yod par gyur na de'i tshe don dam pa stong pa nyid kyi mdo las /
analyzed: gal te 'das pa rang gi ngo bo yod par gyur na de'i tshe don dam pa stong pa nyid kyi mdo las /
translated: If the past had an existent essence, then how could the s≈´tra The S≈´tra of Ultimate Emptiness be interpreted?üîΩIt says: When the eye arises, it does not come from anywhere. When it ceases, it does not go anywhere.

original: mig skye ba na yang gang nas kyang ma 'ongs 'gag pa na yang gang du yang ma song zhes mig ma byung ba las byung ba dang byung nas kyang 'jig par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa ji ltar drang bar bya /
analyzed: mig skye ba na yang gang nas kyang ma 'ongs 'gag pa na yang gang du yang ma song zhes mig ma byung ba las byung ba dang byung nas kyang 'jig par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa ji ltar drang bar bya /
translated: The eye arises from what was not previously existent and having arisen, it disintegrates.

original: da ltar byung ba'i dus na ma byung ba las byung ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: da ltar byung ba'i dus na ma byung ba las byung ba yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that it arises from what was not present in the present,

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: that is not so.

original: dus dngos po las don gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: dus dngos po las don gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because time is not a different object from things.

original: de dag nyid dus gtam gzhi dang // zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag nyid dus gtam gzhi dang // zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are explained as ‚Äúthe past, future, and present.‚Äù

original: ji ste rang gi bdag nyid na byung ba las byung ba nyid yin pa de'i tshe mig ma 'ongs pa med do zhes bya bar grub po //
analyzed: ji ste rang gi bdag nyid na byung ba las byung ba nyid yin pa de'i tshe mig ma 'ongs pa med do zhes bya bar grub po //
translated: If it exists through its own nature, then it is arisen from arising, and in that case, it is established that future eye does not exist.

original: gzhan yang rtag tu gnas pa nyid yin na 'dus byas rnams kyi rgyu dang 'bras bu dag med pa'i phyir sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba'i bden pa med pa dang / de med pa'i phyir 'gog pa dang lam yang med la ;
analyzed: gzhan yang rtag tu gnas pa nyid yin na 'dus byas rnams kyi rgyu dang 'bras bu dag med pa'i phyir sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba'i bden pa med pa dang / de med pa'i phyir 'gog pa dang lam yang med la ;
translated: Moreover, if it were to endure permanently, then the cause and effect of conditioned states would not exist, and therefore the truths of suffering and origination would not exist. And because they do not exist, the truths of cessation and path would not exist.

original: de ltar yin dang bden pa bzhi med pa'i phyir yongs su shes pa dang spangs pa dang mngon du bya ba dang bsgom pa yang mi 'thad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar yin dang bden pa bzhi med pa'i phyir yongs su shes pa dang spangs pa dang mngon du bya ba dang bsgom pa yang mi 'thad par 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were so, then because the four truths would not exist, complete understanding, abandonment, realization, and cultivation would not be tenable.

original: de med pas kyang 'bras bu gnas pa rnams dang zhugs pa'i gang zag rnams med pa'i phyir gsungs rab mtha' dag dang 'gal bas 'das pa la sogs pa'i dngos po yod par brtags pa ni legs pa yin no //
analyzed: de med pas kyang 'bras bu gnas pa rnams dang zhugs pa'i gang zag rnams med pa'i phyir gsungs rab mtha' dag dang 'gal bas 'das pa la sogs pa'i dngos po yod par brtags pa ni legs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is good to consider that past things, etc., exist.

original: rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i shes pa rnam par dbye ba ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i shes pa rnam par dbye ba ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: How is it that yogins have knowledge of the past and future?

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, the opponent says:üîΩ‚ÄúThe past and future are real, because they are objects of knowledge, like the present.

original: dngos sam zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /üîΩ'das pa'i don la ltos nas 'bras bur 'gyur la ;
analyzed: dngos sam zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste / 'das pa'i don la ltos nas 'bras bur 'gyur la ;
translated: The phrase ‚Äúin reality‚Äù and so on.üîΩüîΩIn relation to the past object, it is the effect.üîΩ

original: ma 'ongs pa la ltos nas rgyur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa la ltos nas rgyur 'gyur ro //
translated: The past is the result of the present, and the future is the cause of the present.

original: de nyid du na yul med kyang //
analyzed: de nyid du na yul med kyang //
translated: Therefore, the past and future are real.üîΩThe past and future are not real, because they are not directly perceived, like the present.üîΩThe present is directly perceived, but the past and future are not directly perceived.üîΩTherefore, the past and future are not real.

original: zhes bya ba ni mngon par brjod pa can gyi shes pas rang gi mtshan nyid yul du mi byed pa'i phyir ro //üîΩrnam rtog rjes 'brel bdag nyid kyi //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni mngon par brjod pa can gyi shes pas rang gi mtshan nyid yul du mi byed pa'i phyir ro // rnam rtog rjes 'brel bdag nyid kyi //
translated: The past and future are real, because they are objects of knowledge, like the present.

original: zhes bya ba ni rtog pa dang bcas pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rtog pa dang bcas pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The present is an object of knowledge, but the past and future are also objects of knowledge.

original: @90a * // des na ni de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: @90a * // des na ni de'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, the past and future are real.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu dag gis rgyun 'byung ba dang 'byung bar 'gyur ba la brtan nas yongs su ma dag pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams 'das pa la sogs pa ston pa la 'jug go //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu dag gis rgyun 'byung ba dang 'byung bar 'gyur ba la brtan nas yongs su ma dag pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams 'das pa la sogs pa ston pa la 'jug go //
translated: The yogis who are not completely pure, on the basis of the continuum of cause and effect that has arisen and will arise, engage in teaching the past, etc.

original: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa la ni 'jig rten pa'i shes pa yang mnga' ba ma yin te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa la ni 'jig rten pa'i shes pa yang mnga' ba ma yin te /
translated: The Bhagavat, the Tathagata, does not have mundane knowledge,

original: rtag tu mnyam par gzhag pas ma rig pa thams cad spangs pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: rtag tu mnyam par gzhag pas ma rig pa thams cad spangs pa'i phyir la /
translated: because he is always in equipoise and has abandoned all ignorance,

original: rnam par rtog pa yang ma rig pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa yang ma rig pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and because discursive thought is of the nature of ignorance.

original: rtog pa 'di ni rang nyid kyis ma rig pa'i ngo bor 'gyur /
analyzed: rtog pa 'di ni rang nyid kyis ma rig pa'i ngo bor 'gyur /
translated: This discursive thought itself becomes the nature of ignorance.

original: gang phyir rang gi rnam pa ni //
analyzed: gang phyir rang gi rnam pa ni //
translated: Because its aspect

original: phyi rol ngo bos sgro brtags 'jug / ces gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: phyi rol ngo bos sgro brtags 'jug / ces gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: is engaged in superimposing an external nature.

original: sngon gyi smon lam dang bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs kyi stobs kyis thob pa'i yid bzhin nor bu lta ba'i sku can de'i bstan pa ni lhun gyis grub par bar 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: sngon gyi smon lam dang bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs kyi stobs kyis thob pa'i yid bzhin nor bu lta ba'i sku can de'i bstan pa ni lhun gyis grub par bar 'jug pa yin no //
translated: The teaching of that one who has a body like a wish-fulfilling gem, obtained by the power of former prayers, merit, and the accumulation of knowledge, is spontaneously active.

original: de kho na nyid bsdus pa'i dka' 'grel las dus gsum brtags pa ste /
analyzed: de kho na nyid bsdus pa'i dka' 'grel las dus gsum brtags pa ste /
translated: This is the examination of the three times in the Commentary on the Compendium of Principles.

original: nyi shu drug pa'o /
analyzed: nyi shu drug pa'o /
translated: This is the twenty-sixth chapter.

original: // / thog ma mtha' med pa zhes bya ba de bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: // / thog ma mtha' med pa zhes bya ba de bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to prove the statement ‚Äúwithout beginning or end,‚Äù

original: rgol ba bkod pa sngon du 'gro ba can gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /üîΩ'ga' yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rgol ba bkod pa sngon du 'gro ba can gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / 'ga' yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: the opponent‚Äôs position is set forth in the lines beginning ‚ÄúIf you say that consciousness . . .‚ÄùüîΩThe response to that is stated in the lines beginning ‚ÄúIf you say that consciousness . . .‚Äù

original: de la bdag sngar bkag pa'i phyir med pa nyid kyis rjes su 'gro ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de la bdag sngar bkag pa'i phyir med pa nyid kyis rjes su 'gro ba ma yin te /
translated: Since the self has been refuted earlier, it does not exist and therefore cannot be a subsequent state.

original: rnam par shes pa la sogs pa yang skad cig ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa la sogs pa yang skad cig ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Consciousness and so on are also not subsequent states because they are momentary.

original: dus gsum brtag par rjes su 'gro ba bkag pa'i phyir yang rjes su 'gro ba med do //
analyzed: dus gsum brtag par rjes su 'gro ba bkag pa'i phyir yang rjes su 'gro ba med do //
translated: Since it has been refuted that they are subsequent states in the examination of the three times, they are not subsequent states.

original: 'on te lus la sogs pa 'jig rten pha rol por mi 'gyur ram zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te lus la sogs pa 'jig rten pha rol por mi 'gyur ram zhe na /
translated: But is it not the case that the body, etc. do not go to the next world?

original: lus dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: lus dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúThe body, etc.‚Äù

original: sogs pa'i sgras tshor ba dang 'du shes dang 'du byed rnams gzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras tshor ba dang 'du shes dang 'du byed rnams gzung ngo //
translated: The word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù includes feeling, conceptualization, and volitional dispositions.

original: gzhan yang khas ni ma blangs so zhes bya ba ni bdag go //
analyzed: gzhan yang khas ni ma blangs so zhes bya ba ni bdag go //
translated: Moreover, it is not accepted that the self is other than the body, etc.

original: de lta bas na 'jig rten rgyang pan pa'i phyogs 'di rjes su mthun pa yin par grub po //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'jig rten rgyang pan pa'i phyogs 'di rjes su mthun pa yin par grub po //
translated: Therefore, it is established that this position of the Lokayatas is consistent.üîΩThus, because the next world does not exist, the next world does not exist.

original: 'di ltar 'jig rten pha rol po med pa'i phyir 'jig rten pha rol med do zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du de kho na nyid ni sa dang chu dang me dang rlung zhes bya ba bzhi po 'di dag yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'jig rten pha rol po med pa'i phyir 'jig rten pha rol med do zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du de kho na nyid ni sa dang chu dang me dang rlung zhes bya ba bzhi po 'di dag yin la /
translated: And, in the same way, reality is just these four: earth, water, fire, and air.

original: de dag las ni sems pa can no zhes bya ba 'di ni de'i mdo'i don yin no //
analyzed: de dag las ni sems pa can no zhes bya ba 'di ni de'i mdo'i don yin no //
translated: And, a sentient being is from these. This is the meaning of that S≈´tra.

original: de la 'grel ba byed pa kha cig ni de dag las sems pa can skye ba yin par @90b smras la gzhan dag ni mngon par gsal ba yin par smra'o /
analyzed: de la 'grel ba byed pa kha cig ni de dag las sems pa can skye ba yin par @90b smras la gzhan dag ni mngon par gsal ba yin par smra'o /
translated: Some commentators on this passage say that the mind is generated from those elements, while others say that it is manifested from them.

original: de'i phyir bskyed pa'am gsal bar byed //
analyzed: de'i phyir bskyed pa'am gsal bar byed //
translated: Therefore, it is said that the mind is generated or manifested from the elements.

original: ces phyogs gnyis bshad do //
analyzed: ces phyogs gnyis bshad do //
translated: This is the explanation of the two positions.

original: tshva ni sgyur bo'o //
analyzed: tshva ni sgyur bo'o //
translated: ‚ÄúSalt‚Äù means ‚Äúchange.‚Äù

original: chang zhes bya ba ni skyos pa skyed par byed pa'i nus pa'o //
analyzed: chang zhes bya ba ni skyos pa skyed par byed pa'i nus pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúAlcohol‚Äù means the power to generate intoxication.

original: sogs pa'i skras brgyal ba la sogs pa skyed pa'i nus pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa'i skras brgyal ba la sogs pa skyed pa'i nus pa gzung ngo //
translated: The ‚Äúetc.‚Äù includes the power to generate fainting and so on.

original: 'on te mig la sogs pa dang gzugs la sogs pa'i yul la brten nas rnam par shes pa skye bar 'gyur ro zhes pa 'di shin tu grags pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'on te mig la sogs pa dang gzugs la sogs pa'i yul la brten nas rnam par shes pa skye bar 'gyur ro zhes pa 'di shin tu grags pa ma yin nam /
translated: But isn‚Äôt it well known that consciousness arises in dependence on such things as the eye and such things as form?

original: de'i phyir de dag kho na las rnam par shes pa skye zhes ji skad du brjod ce na /
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag kho na las rnam par shes pa skye zhes ji skad du brjod ce na /
translated: Therefore, why is it said that consciousness arises from those alone?

original: sa la sogs pa'i bkod pa'i zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: sa la sogs pa'i bkod pa'i zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The root text says, ‚ÄúThe arrangement of earth and so on.‚Äù

original: de skad du yang ;
analyzed: de skad du yang ;
translated: This is also said:

original: de tshogs pa la lus dang dbang po dang yul gyi tha snyad 'dogs so zhes bya ba ni de dag gi mdo yin no //
analyzed: de tshogs pa la lus dang dbang po dang yul gyi tha snyad 'dogs so zhes bya ba ni de dag gi mdo yin no //
translated: The SautrƒÅntika theory is that the body, sense faculties, and objects are designated in dependence upon the collection of the primary elements.

original: 'byung ba chen po las ma gtogs pa'i dbang po la sogs pa yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po las ma gtogs pa'i dbang po la sogs pa yod pa ma yin te /
translated: The sense faculties and so on do not exist apart from the primary elements,

original: de'i gnas lugs kyi khyad par nyid la de btags pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: de'i gnas lugs kyi khyad par nyid la de btags pa'i phyir la /
translated: because they are imputed to the particular arrangement of the primary elements.

original: bkod pa zhes bya ba bkod pa can las gzhan yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bkod pa zhes bya ba bkod pa can las gzhan yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: And the term ‚Äúarrangement‚Äù does not refer to anything other than the arrangement itself.

original: 'byung ba chen po bzhi po 'di yang mngon sum gyis grub ste /
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po bzhi po 'di yang mngon sum gyis grub ste /
translated: The four primary elements are established by direct perception.

original: de kho na nyid mngon sum gyis grub pa 'di las gzhan yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de kho na nyid mngon sum gyis grub pa 'di las gzhan yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: There is no other way to establish reality than by direct perception.

original: gang gis 'jig rten pha rol la sogs pa gzhan 'grub par 'gyur ba mngon sum las gzhan pa'i tshad ma yod pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gis 'jig rten pha rol la sogs pa gzhan 'grub par 'gyur ba mngon sum las gzhan pa'i tshad ma yod pa yang ma yin no //
translated: And there is no other means of valid knowledge apart from direct perception that can establish other things, such as the world beyond.

original: gzhan yang gal te 'das pa'i lus la gnas pa'i sems skye ba'i dang po'i sems dang / 'chi ba'i sems las 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i sems la rgyu'i dngos por gyur na de'i tshe sems rgyun mi 'chad pa'i phyir 'jig rten pha rol rtag par 'gyur na ;üîΩ'di ltar re zhig rtsod pa'i gzhir gyur pa'i sems dang po 'di dag gi rgyu dang 'bras bu yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang gal te 'das pa'i lus la gnas pa'i sems skye ba'i dang po'i sems dang / 'chi ba'i sems las 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i sems la rgyu'i dngos por gyur na de'i tshe sems rgyun mi 'chad pa'i phyir 'jig rten pha rol rtag par 'gyur na ; 'di ltar re zhig rtsod pa'i gzhir gyur pa'i sems dang po 'di dag gi rgyu dang 'bras bu yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Moreover, if the mind that is located in the body of the past were to be the cause of the mind that arises at the beginning of birth and the mind that occurs at death, then the world beyond would be permanent because the mind would be uninterrupted.

original: lus tha dad pa la gnas pa'i phyir rta dang ba lang la gnas pa'i rnam par shes pa dag bzhin no //
analyzed: lus tha dad pa la gnas pa'i phyir rta dang ba lang la gnas pa'i rnam par shes pa dag bzhin no //
translated: In this way, the mind that is the basis of the dispute does not exist as the effect of a cause, because it is located in different bodies, like the consciousnesses located in horses and cows.

original: yang na skye ba'i blo rnams ni chos can no //
analyzed: yang na skye ba'i blo rnams ni chos can no //
translated: Or, the minds of birth are the subject.

original: 'das pa'i lus la gnas pa'i tha ma'i rnam par shes pa'i bskyed par bya ba nyid dgag pa ni de'i bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: 'das pa'i lus la gnas pa'i tha ma'i rnam par shes pa'i bskyed par bya ba nyid dgag pa ni de'i bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: The refutation of the production of the final consciousness located in the body of the past is the proposition.

original: shes pa yin phyir zhes bya ba'i sbyin ni gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: shes pa yin phyir zhes bya ba'i sbyin ni gtan tshigs so //
translated: The reason is ‚Äúbecause it is consciousness.‚Äù

original: rgyud gzhan la gnas pa'i blo dag ni dpe'o //
analyzed: rgyud gzhan la gnas pa'i blo dag ni dpe'o //
translated: The minds located in other continuums are the example.

original: sbyor ba ni 'di ltar bya ste /üîΩgang rnam par shes pa yin pa de ni brjod par 'dod pa'i @91a * //
analyzed: sbyor ba ni 'di ltar bya ste / gang rnam par shes pa yin pa de ni brjod par 'dod pa'i @91a * //
translated: The syllogism is to be formulated as follows:

original: 'das pa'i lus la gnas pa'i tha ma'i shes pa'i bskyed par bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: 'das pa'i lus la gnas pa'i tha ma'i shes pa'i bskyed par bya ba ma yin te /
translated: Whatever is consciousness is not the effect of the final moment of consciousness abiding in the body of the past

original: shes pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: shes pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: because it is consciousness,

original: rgyud gzhan la gnas pa'i shes pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rgyud gzhan la gnas pa'i shes pa bzhin no //
translated: like the consciousness abiding in another continuum.

original: brjod par 'dod pa'i lus la gnas pa'i skye ba'i blo 'di dag kyang shes pa'i ngo bo yin no zhes bya ba ni 'gal bas khyab pa dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: brjod par 'dod pa'i lus la gnas pa'i skye ba'i blo 'di dag kyang shes pa'i ngo bo yin no zhes bya ba ni 'gal bas khyab pa dmigs pa ste /
translated: The consciousnesses that are the awarenesses of the body of the past and the body of the future are also of the nature of consciousness. This is the observation of a pervasion by a contradiction,

original: brjod par 'dod pa'i rnam par shes pa bskyed par bya ba dang 'gal ba brjod par 'dod pa'i shes pas bskyed par bya ba nyid kyis shes pa nyid la khyab pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brjod par 'dod pa'i rnam par shes pa bskyed par bya ba dang 'gal ba brjod par 'dod pa'i shes pas bskyed par bya ba nyid kyis shes pa nyid la khyab pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the effect of the consciousness that is the object of the desire to speak is pervaded by consciousness itself because of being the effect of the consciousness that is the object of the desire to speak, which is contradictory with being the effect of the final moment of consciousness abiding in the body of the past.

original: de ltar re zhig 'das pa'i skye ba bkag pa byas nas da ni ma 'ongs pa'i skye ba dag pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar re zhig 'das pa'i skye ba bkag pa byas nas da ni ma 'ongs pa'i skye ba dag pa'i phyir /
translated: In this way, having refuted the past birth, now, in order to refute the future birth,

original: chags dang bcas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: chags dang bcas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúThe desirous one,‚Äù and so on.

original: chags pa dang bcas pa'i 'chi ba'i sems ni sems gzhan dang mtshams sbyor ba ma yin te /
analyzed: chags pa dang bcas pa'i 'chi ba'i sems ni sems gzhan dang mtshams sbyor ba ma yin te /
translated: A mind of death that is accompanied by attachment does not link with another mind,

original: 'chi ba'i sems yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'chi ba'i sems yin pa'i phyir /
translated: because it is a mind of death.üîΩIt is like the final mind of an arhat.

original: dgra bcom pa tha ma'i sems bzhin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa tha ma'i sems bzhin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
translated: This is the observation of a contradictory pervasion.

original: dper na nyon mongs bral ba zhes bya ba ni 'chi ba'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: dper na nyon mongs bral ba zhes bya ba ni 'chi ba'i shes pa'o //
translated: For example, the statement ‚Äúfree from affliction‚Äù is a mind of death.

original: 'o na shes pa gang las skye zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na shes pa gang las skye zhe na /
translated: If that is so, from what consciousness does it arise?

original: de'i phyir 'byung rngub ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /üîΩde skad du /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'byung rngub ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te / de skad du /
translated: Therefore it is said, ‚Äúinhalation and exhalation,‚Äù and so on.üîΩThe s≈´tra says,

original: lus nyid las zhes bya ba ni mdo ste /
analyzed: lus nyid las zhes bya ba ni mdo ste /
translated: ‚Äúfrom the body itself.‚Äù

original: la ba can dang rta mchog gnyis zer ro //
analyzed: la ba can dang rta mchog gnyis zer ro //
translated: The Ka≈õmƒ´reans say that the two, the KƒÅ≈õyapƒ´yas and the A≈õvaguptƒ´yas, are correct.

original: 'on te lus ma grub pa yang nur nur po la sogs pa'i gnas skabs su brgyal ba'i rnam par shes pa yod pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: 'on te lus ma grub pa yang nur nur po la sogs pa'i gnas skabs su brgyal ba'i rnam par shes pa yod pa nyid yin te /
translated: Or, if the body is not established, the consciousness of fainting exists in the state of kalala and so on.

original: de yang khyed cag la 'das pa'i rnam par shes pa bskyed par bya ba nyid du grub pa ste /
analyzed: de yang khyed cag la 'das pa'i rnam par shes pa bskyed par bya ba nyid du grub pa ste /
translated: That also is established for you as that which generates a past consciousness.

original: de'i phyir ji ltar lus kho na las nges pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir ji ltar lus kho na las nges pa yin zhe na /
translated: Therefore, how is it certain that it is only the body?

original: nur nur po la sogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: nur nur po la sogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The text says, ‚Äúat the stage of kalala, etc.‚Äù

original: shes pa skyed pa'i rgyu ni dbang po dang don dag yin te /
analyzed: shes pa skyed pa'i rgyu ni dbang po dang don dag yin te /
translated: The cause of the production of consciousness is the sense faculty and the object,

original: shes pa ni don rtogs pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: shes pa ni don rtogs pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir la /
translated: because consciousness is the essence of the realization of the object.üîΩSince the sense faculty and the object do not exist at the stage of kalala, etc., how could consciousness be their effect?

original: nur nur po la sogs pa'i gnas skabs na yang dbang po dang don dag med pa'i phyir ji ltar shes pa de'i 'bras bur 'gyur zhes bya ba'i rgyu mi dmigs pas brgyal ba'i gnas skabs ni rnam par shes pa med par grub po zhes bya ba ni spyi'iüîΩdon to // rnam par shes pa nus pa'i ngo bos yod do zhes rtag par rigs pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: nur nur po la sogs pa'i gnas skabs na yang dbang po dang don dag med pa'i phyir ji ltar shes pa de'i 'bras bur 'gyur zhes bya ba'i rgyu mi dmigs pas brgyal ba'i gnas skabs ni rnam par shes pa med par grub po zhes bya ba ni spyi'i don to // rnam par shes pa nus pa'i ngo bos yod do zhes rtag par rigs pa yang ma yin te /
translated: The general meaning of this argument is that the state of fainting is established as being without consciousness because the cause is not observed.

original: de'i tshe shes pa'i rten rigs pa can gyis brtags pa'i bdag gam @91b rnam par shes pa'i rgyun med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe shes pa'i rten rigs pa can gyis brtags pa'i bdag gam @91b rnam par shes pa'i rgyun med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is also not logical to say that consciousness exists in the form of a potential, because at that time there is no self imputed by the logicians as the basis of consciousness or any continuum of consciousness.

original: nus pa rten med pa yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: nus pa rten med pa yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is also not logical for a potential to be without a basis.

original: de lta bas na shugs kyis de'i tshe lus nyid rten yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na shugs kyis de'i tshe lus nyid rten yin no //
translated: Therefore, the body itself is the basis at that time.

original: gzhan shes pa'i rten gyi bdag ste /
analyzed: gzhan shes pa'i rten gyi bdag ste /
translated: The self is the basis of the consciousness of another.

original: shes pa'i rten gyi rang bzhin shes pa'i rgyun nam /
analyzed: shes pa'i rten gyi rang bzhin shes pa'i rgyun nam /
translated: The continuum of consciousness is the basis of consciousness.

original: bdag ni de'i tshe med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag ni de'i tshe med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The self does not exist at that time.

original: de lta yin dang tha mar de 'chi ba'i gnas skabs su rten lus log pa na ji ltar rten med pa'i rnam par shes pa gnas te /
analyzed: de lta yin dang tha mar de 'chi ba'i gnas skabs su rten lus log pa na ji ltar rten med pa'i rnam par shes pa gnas te /
translated: If that were so, then at the end, when the body as the basis of the self is destroyed at the time of death, how could consciousness remain without a basis?

original: de'i phyir ma 'ongs pa'i skye ba med par grub po //
analyzed: de'i phyir ma 'ongs pa'i skye ba med par grub po //
translated: Therefore, future birth is established as nonexistent.

original: yang ci ste 'chi ba'i de ma thag tu byung ba'i srid pa bar mdo'i lus la brten nas sems 'jug par 'gyur ro snyam na de ni yang dag pa ma yin te /
analyzed: yang ci ste 'chi ba'i de ma thag tu byung ba'i srid pa bar mdo'i lus la brten nas sems 'jug par 'gyur ro snyam na de ni yang dag pa ma yin te /
translated: Moreover, if you think that consciousness occurs in dependence on the body of the intermediate existence that arises immediately after death, that is not correct.

original: 'chi ba'i de ma thag tu lus gzhan skye bar ma mthong la /
analyzed: 'chi ba'i de ma thag tu lus gzhan skye bar ma mthong la /
translated: Because we have never seen a body arise immediately after death.

original: ma mthong ba yod pa nyid du nges par rigs pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: ma mthong ba yod pa nyid du nges par rigs pa yang ma yin te /
translated: And it is not reasonable to infer the existence of what has not been seen.

original: de ni med pa'i tha snyad kyi yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni med pa'i tha snyad kyi yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that is the object of the convention of nonexistence.

original: rgyud gcig la gnas pa'i sems lus gzhan la brten par rigs pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: rgyud gcig la gnas pa'i sems lus gzhan la brten par rigs pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is also unreasonable that the mind that exists in one continuum would depend on another body,

original: rta dang glang po la sogs pa'i sems bzhin du /
analyzed: rta dang glang po la sogs pa'i sems bzhin du /
translated: because, like the mind of a horse or elephant,

original: rgyud gcig dang 'brel ba nyid nyams par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyud gcig dang 'brel ba nyid nyams par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: it would not be connected to the same continuum.

original: sbyor ba ni gang zhig lus tha dad pa la 'jug pa'i shes pa de ni rgyud gcig dang 'brel pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang zhig lus tha dad pa la 'jug pa'i shes pa de ni rgyud gcig dang 'brel pa ma yin te /
translated: The syllogism is: ‚ÄúThe mind that enters different bodies is not connected to the same continuum,

original: dper na rta dang glang po'i sems bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na rta dang glang po'i sems bzhin no //
translated: like the mind of a horse or elephant.üîΩThe mind of the intermediate existence and the mind of death exist in different bodies.

original: srid pa bar ma dang 'chi ba'i srid pa dag gi sems kyang lus tha dad pa la 'jug pa yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'i thal bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: srid pa bar ma dang 'chi ba'i srid pa dag gi sems kyang lus tha dad pa la 'jug pa yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'i thal bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: ‚Äù This is a reductio argument that reveals a contradiction with what is accepted.

original: de ltar yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar yang ma yin te /
translated: This is not so,

original: de'i phyir bzlog pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir bzlog pa yin no //
translated: therefore, the reverse is true.

original: gang zhig rgyud gcig dang 'brel pa de ni lus tha dad pa la 'jug pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig rgyud gcig dang 'brel pa de ni lus tha dad pa la 'jug pa ma yin te /
translated: That which is connected to the same continuum does not enter different bodies,

original: dper na glang po'i sems rta'i lus la mi brten pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na glang po'i sems rta'i lus la mi brten pa bzhin no //
translated: like the mind of an elephant that does not depend on the body of a horse.

original: srog chags rnams kyi sems kyang rgyud gcig dang 'brel pa yin no zhes bya ba ni 'gal bas khyab pa dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: srog chags rnams kyi sems kyang rgyud gcig dang 'brel pa yin no zhes bya ba ni 'gal bas khyab pa dmigs pa ste /
translated: The minds of living beings are related to a single continuum.üîΩThis is a pervasion by observation of a contradiction.

original: lus tha dad pa la 'jug pa nyid dang 'gal ba lus tha mi dad pa la 'jug pa nyid kyis rgyud gcig dang 'brel ba nyid la khyab pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus tha dad pa la 'jug pa nyid dang 'gal ba lus tha mi dad pa la 'jug pa nyid kyis rgyud gcig dang 'brel ba nyid la khyab pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The minds of living beings are connected to a single continuum. This is a contradiction, because being connected to a single continuum is pervaded by being nondifferent from the body, which is contradictory to being engaged in different bodies.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pas mjug sdud par byed de /
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pas mjug sdud par byed de /
translated: He concludes with ‚ÄúTherefore, etc.‚Äù

original: thog ma ni skye ba'o //
analyzed: thog ma ni skye ba'o //
translated: The beginning is birth.

original: mtha' ma ni 'jig pa'o //
analyzed: mtha' ma ni 'jig pa'o //
translated: The end is destruction.

original: gang la thog ma dang tha ma yod pa ma yin pa 'di ni thog mtha' med pa'o //
analyzed: gang la thog ma dang tha ma yod pa ma yin pa 'di ni thog mtha' med pa'o //
translated: That which does not have a beginning and end is beginningless and endless.

original: skyes bu zhes bya ba ni bdag go //
analyzed: skyes bu zhes bya ba ni bdag go //
translated: The person is the self.

original: yang na med pa @92a * //üîΩnyid khas long zhes bya ba 'dis ni 'jig rten pha rol med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yang na med pa @92a * // nyid khas long zhes bya ba 'dis ni 'jig rten pha rol med pa'i phyir /
translated: Or, accept nonexistence.

original: 'jig rten pha rol med do zhes bya ba'i mdo 'di bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol med do zhes bya ba'i mdo 'di bstan pa yin no //
translated: This shows that the sutra teaches that there is no afterlife because there is no world beyond.

original: des 'dir zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed de /
analyzed: des 'dir zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed de /
translated: He replies, ‚ÄúIn this regard, etc.‚Äù

original: gang zhig khyed cag dgag byed pa //
analyzed: gang zhig khyed cag dgag byed pa //
translated: What is this so-called ‚Äúother world‚Äù that you deny?

original: 'jig rten pha rol zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig / ci rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i phung po bzhi po nye bar len pa dang nye bar blangs pa nyid kyis rgyu dang 'bras bur gyur pa las gzhan yin nam /
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig / ci rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i phung po bzhi po nye bar len pa dang nye bar blangs pa nyid kyis rgyu dang 'bras bur gyur pa las gzhan yin nam /
translated: Is it something other than the four aggregates of consciousness and so on, which are the cause and effect of appropriating and being appropriated?

original: 'on te de nyid yin /
analyzed: 'on te de nyid yin /
translated: Or is it just that?

original: re zhig phyogs dang po ni ma yin te /
analyzed: re zhig phyogs dang po ni ma yin te /
translated: First, it is not the former,

original: de khas mi len pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de khas mi len pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not accepted.

original: gang zhig khas blang bar bya ba nye bar len pa dang nye bar blang bar 'gyur ba'i rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i rgyun las gzhan pa'i 'jig rten pha rol zhes bya ba yod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang zhig khas blang bar bya ba nye bar len pa dang nye bar blang bar 'gyur ba'i rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i rgyun las gzhan pa'i 'jig rten pha rol zhes bya ba yod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: There is no so-called other world that is something other than the continuum of consciousness and so on, which is the cause and effect of appropriating and being appropriated.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: Well then, what is it?

original: thog ma dang tha ma med pa'i shes pa la sogs pa'i rgyun de lo brgya la sogs par chad pa'i ngo bo nges bar bzung nas gnas skabs 'ga' zhig nyid 'jig rten phyi ma dang snga ma dang 'di zhes kyang rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: thog ma dang tha ma med pa'i shes pa la sogs pa'i rgyun de lo brgya la sogs par chad pa'i ngo bo nges bar bzung nas gnas skabs 'ga' zhig nyid 'jig rten phyi ma dang snga ma dang 'di zhes kyang rnam par gzhag go //
translated: The continuum of consciousness that is beginningless and endless is ascertained to be the entity that is interrupted for a hundred years, and some of its states are posited as the prior world, the later world, and this world.

original: ji ltar khyed kyis mthong ba tsam gyis bde ba la mngon par chags pa'i phyir dbang po dang yul 'di dag nyid yul gzhan la sogs pa 'jig rten pha rol la sogs pa nyid du brtags te /
analyzed: ji ltar khyed kyis mthong ba tsam gyis bde ba la mngon par chags pa'i phyir dbang po dang yul 'di dag nyid yul gzhan la sogs pa 'jig rten pha rol la sogs pa nyid du brtags te /
translated: Just as you imagine that these sense faculties and objects are the other world, the world beyond, because you are attached to pleasure merely on the basis of seeing them,

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: as it is said:

original: ji srid dbang po dang spyod yul //
analyzed: ji srid dbang po dang spyod yul //
translated: As long as there are sense faculties and objects,

original: de nyid gcig nyid skyes bu yin //
analyzed: de nyid gcig nyid skyes bu yin //
translated: that very unity is a person.

original: de bzhin du yang bshad pa /üîΩyul gzhan nam /
analyzed: de bzhin du yang bshad pa / yul gzhan nam /
translated: And it is also said:üîΩThe other world is another place,

original: dus gzhan nam gnas skabs gzhan ni 'jig rten pha rol yin no zhes smras pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dus gzhan nam gnas skabs gzhan ni 'jig rten pha rol yin no zhes smras pa lta bu'o //
translated: another time, or another state.

original: gal te rgyu dang 'bras bur gyur pa'i rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i rgyun las tha mi dad pa'i 'jig rten pha rol 'gegs par byed na /
analyzed: gal te rgyu dang 'bras bur gyur pa'i rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i rgyun las tha mi dad pa'i 'jig rten pha rol 'gegs par byed na /
translated: If you refute the world beyond, which is not different from the continuum of consciousness and so on, which are causes and effects,

original: de'i tshe grub pa la sgrub par byed pa'i phyir sgrub par byed pa don med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i tshe grub pa la sgrub par byed pa'i phyir sgrub par byed pa don med par 'gyur te /
translated: then at that time, because you would be proving what is already established, your proof would be pointless,

original: de lta bur gyur ba'i 'jig rten pha rol khas ma blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta bur gyur ba'i 'jig rten pha rol khas ma blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because you do not accept such a world beyond.

original: 'on te rgyun dngos po med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'on te rgyun dngos po med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Or, if you say, ‚ÄúBecause the continuum is a nonentity,‚Äù

original: der rnam par gzhag pa'i gnas skabs kyi khyad par gang yin pa de yang dngos po med pa nyid ma yin nam /
analyzed: der rnam par gzhag pa'i gnas skabs kyi khyad par gang yin pa de yang dngos po med pa nyid ma yin nam /
translated: then is not the specific state that is posited in that continuum also a nonentity?

original: de lta yin dang de rgyun de la gnas skabs kyi khyad par rnam par gzhag pa'i 'jig rten pha rol 'di yang don dam par byed par mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de lta yin dang de rgyun de la gnas skabs kyi khyad par rnam par gzhag pa'i 'jig rten pha rol 'di yang don dam par byed par mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then this world beyond, which is posited as a specific state in that continuum, would not be ultimately existent.

original: @92b skyon 'di ni med de /
analyzed: @92b skyon 'di ni med de /
translated: This error does not exist.

original: rgyun gyi sgras ni dngos por gyur ba'i skad cig ma rgyun can rnams tshogs chung bar bya ba'i phyir mtha' dag gis cig car bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: rgyun gyi sgras ni dngos por gyur ba'i skad cig ma rgyun can rnams tshogs chung bar bya ba'i phyir mtha' dag gis cig car bstan pa yin te /
translated: The word ‚Äúcontinuum‚Äù is used to indicate that the collection of moments that are real things is a single unit.

original: nags la sogs pa'i sgras dha ba la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: nags la sogs pa'i sgras dha ba la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: The word ‚Äúforest‚Äù is used to indicate the collection of trees.

original: 'o na ci ltar /
analyzed: 'o na ci ltar /
translated: But how is it that the continuum is not a real thing?

original: ci ste rgyu la sogs pa bzhin //
analyzed: ci ste rgyu la sogs pa bzhin //
translated: If it is not like cause, etc.

original: zhes bya ba'i skabs 'dir sngar rgyun dngos po med pa nyid du bstan zhe na /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i skabs 'dir sngar rgyun dngos po med pa nyid du bstan zhe na /
translated: If it is asked how it was previously taught that the continuum is not a real thing in the context of the verse that states, ‚ÄúIf it is not like cause, etc.,‚Äù

original: gcig pu nyid du brtags zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gcig pu nyid du brtags zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: the response is that it is because it is imputed as a single unit, etc.

original: gcig nyid du brtags pa'i rgyun gang yin pa de ni de nyid dang gzhan du brjod du med pa'i phyir dngos po med pa nyid du mngon par 'dod de /
analyzed: gcig nyid du brtags pa'i rgyun gang yin pa de ni de nyid dang gzhan du brjod du med pa'i phyir dngos po med pa nyid du mngon par 'dod de /
translated: That which is imputed as a single unit is accepted as being unreal because it cannot be described as being either the same as or different from that continuum.

original: nam mkha'i me tog gi phreng ba bzhin no //
analyzed: nam mkha'i me tog gi phreng ba bzhin no //
translated: It is like a garland of flowers in the sky.

original: de'i gnas skabs kyi khyad par la kho bo cag 'jig rten pha rol du rnam par gzhag par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i gnas skabs kyi khyad par la kho bo cag 'jig rten pha rol du rnam par gzhag par byed pa yin no //
translated: We posit that the difference in its condition is the next world.

original: ci ste 'jig rten pha rol gyi ming can shes pa la sogs pa'i rgyun 'di dgag par byed pa de'i tshe re zhig de'i rang gi ngo bo dgag pa'i sgo nas 'jig rten pha rol dgag par bya bar mi nus te /
analyzed: ci ste 'jig rten pha rol gyi ming can shes pa la sogs pa'i rgyun 'di dgag par byed pa de'i tshe re zhig de'i rang gi ngo bo dgag pa'i sgo nas 'jig rten pha rol dgag par bya bar mi nus te /
translated: But if you refute the continuum of consciousness, etc., which is called ‚Äúthe next world,‚Äù then you cannot refute the next world by refuting its intrinsic reality.

original: mthong ba ni bsnyon par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mthong ba ni bsnyon par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because what is seen cannot be denied.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then?

original: thog ma dang tha ma med pa'i chos dgag pa'i sgo nas te /
analyzed: thog ma dang tha ma med pa'i chos dgag pa'i sgo nas te /
translated: By refuting the absence of beginning and end.üîΩBut how can that absence of beginning and end be established?

original: thog ma dang tha ma med pa de yang ji ltar 'grub par 'gyur gal te thog ma med pa nyid du 'dod pa gang yin pa de rgyu med par 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: thog ma dang tha ma med pa de yang ji ltar 'grub par 'gyur gal te thog ma med pa nyid du 'dod pa gang yin pa de rgyu med par 'gyur ba'am /
translated: If you assert that it has no beginning, then it would be causeless,

original: shes pa rtag pa can gyi dbang phyug la sogs pa'i rgyu las byung ba'am /
analyzed: shes pa rtag pa can gyi dbang phyug la sogs pa'i rgyu las byung ba'am /
translated: or it would arise from a cause such as a permanent Almighty,

original: yang na rang nyid kyis rtag pa'am /
analyzed: yang na rang nyid kyis rtag pa'am /
translated: or it would be permanent by itself,

original: 'byung ba tsam gyis bskyed pa'am /
analyzed: 'byung ba tsam gyis bskyed pa'am /
translated: or it would be produced by mere elements,

original: rgyud gzhan gyi shes pa'i rgyud can yin zhes bya bar phyogs lnga'o //
analyzed: rgyud gzhan gyi shes pa'i rgyud can yin zhes bya bar phyogs lnga'o //
translated: or it would be a continuum of consciousness that is a different continuum.

original: gal te sems thams cad rang gi rgyud la gnas pa'i shes pa snga ma snga ma'i rgyu can du gyur na de'i tshe sems kyi rgyun thog ma med pa can du 'gyur gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes bsams nas phyogs 'di rnams nye bar bkod do
analyzed: gal te sems thams cad rang gi rgyud la gnas pa'i shes pa snga ma snga ma'i rgyu can du gyur na de'i tshe sems kyi rgyun thog ma med pa can du 'gyur gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes bsams nas phyogs 'di rnams nye bar bkod do
translated: If all minds are caused by their own former moments of consciousness existing in their own continuums, then the continuum of consciousness would be beginningless, but not otherwise.

original: // de la re zhig phyogs dang po ni ma yin te /
analyzed: // de la re zhig phyogs dang po ni ma yin te /
translated: The first position is not correct,

original: rtag tu yod pa la sogs par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir re //
analyzed: rtag tu yod pa la sogs par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir re //
translated: because it would follow that consciousness would always exist and so on.

original: ltos pa'i dngos po rnams ni res 'ga' ba 'gyur ba yin la /
analyzed: ltos pa'i dngos po rnams ni res 'ga' ba 'gyur ba yin la /
translated: Things that are dependent sometimes change,

original: gang rgyu med pa de ni cung zad kyang mi ltos pas ci'i phyir ma tshang bar 'gyur /
analyzed: gang rgyu med pa de ni cung zad kyang mi ltos pas ci'i phyir ma tshang bar 'gyur /
translated: but that which is causeless does not depend on anything at all, so why would it be incomplete?

original: phyogs gnyis pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: phyogs gnyis pa yang ma yin te /
translated: The second position is also not correct,

original: rtag tu yod par thal bar 'gyur ba de nyid kyi phyir ro //üîΩrgyu ma tshang @93a * //
analyzed: rtag tu yod par thal bar 'gyur ba de nyid kyi phyir ro // rgyu ma tshang @93a * //
translated: because it would follow that consciousness would always exist.üîΩBecause its causes are incomplete,

original: ba'i phyir 'bras bu rnams med pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: ba'i phyir 'bras bu rnams med pa nyid yin te /
translated: the effect does not exist.

original: rgyu ma tshang ba med pa gang yin pa de ci'i phyir mi 'gyur zhes brjod par bya dgos so //
analyzed: rgyu ma tshang ba med pa gang yin pa de ci'i phyir mi 'gyur zhes brjod par bya dgos so //
translated: Why should it not be so?

original: phyogs gsum pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: phyogs gsum pa yang ma yin no //
translated: It is not a third alternative.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /üîΩde med phyir te /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na / de med phyir te /
translated: Why is that?üîΩBecause it does not exist.

original: rtag tu yod pa de nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag tu yod pa de nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That very permanent existence does not exist.

original: rnam shes pa rtag pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas de med pa de nyid ston par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: rnam shes pa rtag pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas de med pa de nyid ston par byed pa yin te /
translated: ‚Äú Consciousness is permanent, etc.‚Äù shows that it does not exist.

original: 'dis ni dam bca' ba mngon sum dang 'gal bar bshad do //
analyzed: 'dis ni dam bca' ba mngon sum dang 'gal bar bshad do //
translated: This explains the contradiction of the thesis with direct perception.

original: sa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas phyogs bzhi pa sel bar byed de sa ni sa'o //
analyzed: sa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas phyogs bzhi pa sel bar byed de sa ni sa'o //
translated: The fourth alternative is eliminated by ‚Äúearth, etc.‚Äù

original: rtag pa'i dbang phyug la sogs pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i phyogs bzhin du 'dir yang skyon mtshungs te /
analyzed: rtag pa'i dbang phyug la sogs pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i phyogs bzhin du 'dir yang skyon mtshungs te /
translated: Just as in the case of the thesis that the effect arises from a permanent cause, such as the Almighty, the error is the same here.

original: 'di ltar gzhan gyi 'byung ba chen po bzhi brtan pa'i ngo bor 'dod la /
analyzed: 'di ltar gzhan gyi 'byung ba chen po bzhi brtan pa'i ngo bor 'dod la /
translated: Thus, the other party asserts that the four great elements are the essence of the stable.

original: lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu la ltos nas rim gyis rtag pa las skye ba zhes brjod par rigs pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu la ltos nas rim gyis rtag pa las skye ba zhes brjod par rigs pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not correct to say that it arises gradually from a permanent cause in dependence on the cooperating conditions.

original: rtag pa ni phan 'dogs pa la ltos pa ma yin no zhes phal cher dpyad zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag pa ni phan 'dogs pa la ltos pa ma yin no zhes phal cher dpyad zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For it has been analyzed in most part that permanence does not depend on benefit.

original: yang ji skad du bshad pa'i skyon gyis 'jigs nas gzhan dag gis te tshu rol mdzes pa rnams kyis kyang 'byung ba chen po bzhi po 'di skad cig ma nyid du khas len par byed pa de'i tshe yang skyon can nyid yin no snyam du bsams pa yin
analyzed: yang ji skad du bshad pa'i skyon gyis 'jigs nas gzhan dag gis te tshu rol mdzes pa rnams kyis kyang 'byung ba chen po bzhi po 'di skad cig ma nyid du khas len par byed pa de'i tshe yang skyon can nyid yin no snyam du bsams pa yin
translated: Moreover, when others, the LokƒÅyatas, accept that the four great elements are momentary, fearing the faults explained above, then also they are faulty.

original: no // 'di ltar re zhig gang gis de'i tha snyad grub par 'gyur ba lus dang blo dag rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po grub pa la tshad ma cung zad kyang med do //
analyzed: no // 'di ltar re zhig gang gis de'i tha snyad grub par 'gyur ba lus dang blo dag rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po grub pa la tshad ma cung zad kyang med do //
translated: Thus, first of all, there is not the slightest valid cognition that establishes the body and mind as having the nature of cause and effect, by which the convention of momentariness would be established.

original: sbyor ba ni gang du dngos po gang zhig grub par bya ba'i phyir tshad ma cung zad kyang med pa de ni der rtog pa dang ldan pas tha snyad bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang du dngos po gang zhig grub par bya ba'i phyir tshad ma cung zad kyang med pa de ni der rtog pa dang ldan pas tha snyad bya ba ma yin te /
translated: The syllogism is: Whatever does not have the slightest valid cognition for establishing a thing, in that regard, a convention by a conceptual consciousness is not to be made.

original: me la grang ba'i tha snyad bzhin no //
analyzed: me la grang ba'i tha snyad bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the convention of cold in relation to fire.

original: lus dang blo dag la yang rgyu dang 'bras bu grub par bya ba'i tshad ma cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: lus dang blo dag la yang rgyu dang 'bras bu grub par bya ba'i tshad ma cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: And there is not the slightest valid cognition that establishes a cause and effect in regard to the body and mind.üîΩThis is a pervasion by non-apprehension.

original: gtan tshigs ma grub pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gtan tshigs ma grub pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is the reason unestablished.

original: 'di ltar rgyu dang 'bras bu'i sgrub par byed pa ni mngon sum dang mi dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar rgyu dang 'bras bu'i sgrub par byed pa ni mngon sum dang mi dmigs pa yin no //
translated: For, the proof of cause and effect is by means of perception and non-apprehension.

original: de yang khyad par can gyi rjes su 'gro ba'am /
analyzed: de yang khyad par can gyi rjes su 'gro ba'am /
translated: And that is ascertained either by the pervasion of the specific or

original: ldog pa nyid las nges pa yin gyi /
analyzed: ldog pa nyid las nges pa yin gyi /
translated: by the mere reversal.

original: mthong ba dang ma mthong ba tsam gyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mthong ba dang ma mthong ba tsam gyis ni ma yin no //
translated: But not by mere seeing or not seeing.

original: de la rjes su 'gro ba las 'bras bu nges par bya ba la gang dag dmigs na dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur @93b pa snga ma dmigs pa na dmigs pa zhes bya ba de lta bu la rten par byed de /
analyzed: de la rjes su 'gro ba las 'bras bu nges par bya ba la gang dag dmigs na dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur @93b pa snga ma dmigs pa na dmigs pa zhes bya ba de lta bu la rten par byed de /
translated: In that regard, in ascertaining the effect by the pervasion, one relies on the mere fact of the apprehension of the specific, which is the characteristic of the apprehension, as in the statement, ‚ÄúWhen the prior is apprehended, the latter is apprehended.‚ÄùüîΩIf it were not so,

original: de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin te /
translated: then,

original: gal te dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa mi dmigs pa zhes bya ba de lta bu la mi ltos pa de'i tshe de la 'bras bu dang po nas yod pa'am /
analyzed: gal te dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa mi dmigs pa zhes bya ba de lta bu la mi ltos pa de'i tshe de la 'bras bu dang po nas yod pa'am /
translated: If non-apprehension, which is the non-apprehension of that which has the characteristic of being apprehended, does not depend on that, then either the effect would exist from the beginning,

original: yul gzhan nas 'ongs pa'am gang dag rgyu las sngar gnas pa'i rtsig pa dang re lde la sogs pa de dag rgyu yin pa ma bkag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yul gzhan nas 'ongs pa'am gang dag rgyu las sngar gnas pa'i rtsig pa dang re lde la sogs pa de dag rgyu yin pa ma bkag par 'gyur ro //
translated: or it would come from another place, or those things that exist prior to the cause, such as walls, fences, etc., would not be refuted as causes.

original: dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa mi dmigs pa nye bar bstan pas ni de bkag par 'gyur te /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa mi dmigs pa nye bar bstan pas ni de bkag par 'gyur te /
translated: But by teaching non-apprehension, which is the non-apprehension of that which has the characteristic of being apprehended, that is refuted,

original: de de las 'khrul pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de de las 'khrul pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no error in that.

original: de ltar re zhig rjes su 'gro ba las 'bras bu nges pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar re zhig rjes su 'gro ba las 'bras bu nges pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the effect is ascertained from the positive concomitance.

original: ldog pa las kyang 'bras bu nges par bya ba ni de las gzhan pa'i nus pa'i rgyu dag yod na yang gang zhig gcig med na mi 'byung ba zhes bya ba de lta bu la brten par bya ste /
analyzed: ldog pa las kyang 'bras bu nges par bya ba ni de las gzhan pa'i nus pa'i rgyu dag yod na yang gang zhig gcig med na mi 'byung ba zhes bya ba de lta bu la brten par bya ste /
translated: The effect is ascertained from the negative concomitance in the following way: If there are other potential causes, then it is to be based on that which is called ‚Äúthat which does not occur when this is absent.‚ÄùüîΩIf it were not so,

original: de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin te /
translated: then,

original: de med na mi 'byung ba zhes bya ba 'ba' zhig nye bar brtan pas ni 'dir de'i nus pa la the tshom za ba nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de med na mi 'byung ba zhes bya ba 'ba' zhig nye bar brtan pas ni 'dir de'i nus pa la the tshom za ba nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: If it is not established that the effect does not occur in the absence of the cause, then the mere statement that the effect does not occur in the absence of the cause would give rise to doubt about its power.

original: de la nus pa gzhan yang yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la nus pa gzhan yang yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is another power.

original: de lta yin dang 'di ltar srid pa yin te /
analyzed: de lta yin dang 'di ltar srid pa yin te /
translated: If that were so, it would be possible in this way:

original: de la nus pa ni gzhan nyid yin te /
analyzed: de la nus pa ni gzhan nyid yin te /
translated: The power is different from the effect.

original: de med pas de mi 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: de med pas de mi 'byung ba yin no //
translated: Because of the absence of that, the effect does not occur.

original: gang yang 'di ldog pa na ldog pa dmigs pa de ni 'dod rgyal ba'i mi slu ba yin te /
analyzed: gang yang 'di ldog pa na ldog pa dmigs pa de ni 'dod rgyal ba'i mi slu ba yin te /
translated: And that which is observed to cease when this ceases is a nondeceptive observation of the effect of chance.

original: ma bag mar len par 'ongs pa'i yul du skye ba'i 'brag go ma bag mar len pa med pa'i yul gzhan du med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma bag mar len par 'ongs pa'i yul du skye ba'i 'brag go ma bag mar len pa med pa'i yul gzhan du med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because when a man comes to take a bride, the sound of the drum is observed in the country where he was born, but not in another country where he did not take a bride.

original: de lta bas na nus pa yod kyang zhes bya bar khyad par du bya ba yin te /
analyzed: de lta bas na nus pa yod kyang zhes bya bar khyad par du bya ba yin te /
translated: Therefore, the qualification ‚Äúeven though the power exists‚Äù should be added.

original: de ltar na de nyid rgyu nyid du nges te de ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar na de nyid rgyu nyid du nges te de ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus, that alone is ascertained to be the cause, because it follows the cessation of the effect.

original: phan mi 'dogs pa ni ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa 'ga' yang med de /
analyzed: phan mi 'dogs pa ni ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa 'ga' yang med de /
translated: That which does not benefit is never observed to follow the cessation of another.

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow, absurdly, that all things would be the cause of all things.üîΩThus, through positive and negative concomitance, cause and effect are ascertained without a doubt.

original: de ltar rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag gis the tshom med par rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid du nges kyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag gis the tshom med par rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid du nges kyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //
translated: But in other cases, they are not.

original: de dag la 'di 'dra ba'i rjes su 'gro ba'am ldog pa nges pa ni nam yang yod pa ma yin te ;
analyzed: de dag la 'di 'dra ba'i rjes su 'gro ba'am ldog pa nges pa ni nam yang yod pa ma yin te ;
translated: In those cases, there is never a certainty of positive or negative concomitance.

original: 'di ltar re zhig rang gi lus dang blo dag rjes su 'gro ba nges par nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar re zhig rang gi lus dang blo dag rjes su 'gro ba nges par nus pa ma yin te /
translated: For example, it is not possible to ascertain the positive concomitance of one's body and mind,

original: mngal la sogs par skye ba las sngar 'bras bu 'ga' zhig dmigs pa med pa'i phyir la sems med par dmigs par 'gyur ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: mngal la sogs par skye ba las sngar 'bras bu 'ga' zhig dmigs pa med pa'i phyir la sems med par dmigs par 'gyur ba yang ma yin te /
translated: because prior to birth from the womb and so on, no effect is observed. Nor is it the case that the mind is observed to exist without the body,

original: gzhan gyi lus la yang sems dmigs @94a * //
analyzed: gzhan gyi lus la yang sems dmigs @94a * //
translated: because the mind is not observed to exist in the body of another.

original: pa'i mtshan nyid du ma gyur ba'i phyir snga ma dang phyi ma 'dzin pa med pas de'i phyir rjes su 'gro ba nges pa ma yin te /
analyzed: pa'i mtshan nyid du ma gyur ba'i phyir snga ma dang phyi ma 'dzin pa med pas de'i phyir rjes su 'gro ba nges pa ma yin te /
translated: Since there is no memory of former and later births, there is no positive concomitance.

original: ldog pa nges pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: ldog pa nges pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is there a negative concomitance.

original: de la yang re zhig rang gi lus ldog pas rang gi blo ldog pa nyid du shes par nus pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de la yang re zhig rang gi lus ldog pas rang gi blo ldog pa nyid du shes par nus pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Moreover, it is not possible to know that the cessation of one‚Äôs own body is the cessation of one‚Äôs own mind,

original: rang nyid rnam pa thams cad du med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang nyid rnam pa thams cad du med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one‚Äôs own body is completely nonexistent.

original: gzhan gyi blo log pas de dang 'brel ba'i blo ldog par nges par nus pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi blo log pas de dang 'brel ba'i blo ldog par nges par nus pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it possible to know that the cessation of another‚Äôs mind is the cessation of the mind that is connected to it,

original: de'i blo dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du ma gyur ba nyid kyis lus log na yang blo ldog par the tshom za ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i blo dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du ma gyur ba nyid kyis lus log na yang blo ldog par the tshom za ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the mind of another is not the characteristic of the object of perception, and so there is doubt that the mind ceases when the body ceases.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rtsig pa la sogs pa la lus med kyang blo ldog par nges pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rtsig pa la sogs pa la lus med kyang blo ldog par nges pa ma yin te /
translated: For this very reason, it is not certain that the mind ceases when the body is absent from a wall, etc.,

original: de yod pa dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du ma gyur ba nyid kyis the tshom za ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yod pa dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du ma gyur ba nyid kyis the tshom za ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is doubt that it exists, since it is not the characteristic of the object of perception.

original: g-yo ba la sogs pa'i 'bras bu ma mthong ba'i phyir yang med par nges par rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: g-yo ba la sogs pa'i 'bras bu ma mthong ba'i phyir yang med par nges par rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it reasonable to ascertain that it does not exist because the effect of movement, etc., is not seen,

original: rgyu rnams ni gdon mi za bar 'bras bu dang ldan pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyu rnams ni gdon mi za bar 'bras bu dang ldan pa ma yin no //
translated: because causes are not necessarily endowed with effects.

original: gzhan yang spyi'i lus kyi khyad par 'dzin pa'i rgyu srid pa phyin ci log gi mtshan nyid rang gi rgyu med pa'i phyir rtsig pa la sogs pa de la blo med pa yin nam /
analyzed: gzhan yang spyi'i lus kyi khyad par 'dzin pa'i rgyu srid pa phyin ci log gi mtshan nyid rang gi rgyu med pa'i phyir rtsig pa la sogs pa de la blo med pa yin nam /
translated: Moreover, in general, one would doubt whether the wall, etc. are devoid of awareness because of the absence of a cause for apprehending a special body, since the cause of existence, which has the characteristic of error, is not its own cause.

original: 'on te lus ldog pa las yin zhes the tshom za'o //
analyzed: 'on te lus ldog pa las yin zhes the tshom za'o //
translated: Or, is it that the body is devoid of awareness?

original: de lta bas na gtan tshigs ma grub pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na gtan tshigs ma grub pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the reason is not established.

original: 'gal ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'gal ba yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it contradictory,

original: mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it exists in the similar class.

original: ma nges pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: ma nges pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it inconclusive,

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / rtog pa dang ldan pa nyid nyams par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / rtog pa dang ldan pa nyid nyams par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because of the absurd consequence that it would follow that there would be no awareness at all, and because it would follow that the possession of conceptualization would be lost.

original: 'o na khyed la lus blo'i rgyu ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di la gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma ci zhig yod ce na /
analyzed: 'o na khyed la lus blo'i rgyu ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di la gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma ci zhig yod ce na /
translated: Well, what is the valid cognition that refutes your statement, ‚ÄúThe body is not the cause of awareness?‚Äù

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: It is not so,

original: tshad ma yod pa nyid de /
analyzed: tshad ma yod pa nyid de /
translated: because there is a valid cognition.

original: de skad du yang yid kyi blo'i rgyu lus ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di la /
analyzed: de skad du yang yid kyi blo'i rgyu lus ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di la /
translated: In this regard, it is said: ‚ÄúThe body is not the cause of mental awareness.‚Äù

original: yid kyi blo ni rang dbang can //
analyzed: yid kyi blo ni rang dbang can //
translated: The mind is independent.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas tshad ma ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas tshad ma ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, he demonstrates the validity of the mind.

original: de nyid srid pa gzhan du mtshams sbyor ba la bdag po yin pa'i phyir lus la mi brten pa nyid du grub pa na 'jig rten pha rol grub po //
analyzed: de nyid srid pa gzhan du mtshams sbyor ba la bdag po yin pa'i phyir lus la mi brten pa nyid du grub pa na 'jig rten pha rol grub po //
translated: Since the mind is the master in the rebirth in another existence, it is established that it is not dependent on the body.üîΩMoreover, if the body is the cause of the mind, is it the cause of the mind as a whole or of the mind as a collection of atoms?üîΩOr is it the cause of the mind as a collection of sense faculties?

original: gzhan yang yid kyi blo'i rgyu lus yin pa na yan lag can gyi ngo bo gcig yin nam /üîΩrdul phra rab tu ma 'dus pa'i bdag nyid dam /üîΩyang na dbang po dang bcas pa'am /üîΩdbang po med pa'am /
analyzed: gzhan yang yid kyi blo'i rgyu lus yin pa na yan lag can gyi ngo bo gcig yin nam / rdul phra rab tu ma 'dus pa'i bdag nyid dam / yang na dbang po dang bcas pa'am / dbang po med pa'am /
translated: Or is it the cause of the mind as a collection of sense faculties and objects?

original: ci nye bar len pa'i rgyu'am /üîΩ'on te lhan cig byed pa'i @94b rgyu yin no zhes rnam par brtag go //üîΩde la re zhig yan lag can gcig rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ci nye bar len pa'i rgyu'am / 'on te lhan cig byed pa'i @94b rgyu yin no zhes rnam par brtag go // de la re zhig yan lag can gcig rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: Or is it the cause of the mind as a collection of sense faculties, objects, and sense consciousnesses?üîΩOr is it the cause of the mind as a collection of the four great elements?üîΩOr is it the cause of the mind as a collection of the four great elements and the sense faculties?üîΩOr is it the cause of the mind as a collection of the four great elements, the sense faculties, and the sense objects?

original: de ni sngar bkag zin pa'i phyir dang / 'byung ba chen po bzhi'i bdag nyid nyams par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni sngar bkag zin pa'i phyir dang / 'byung ba chen po bzhi'i bdag nyid nyams par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Or is it the cause of the mind as a collection of the four great elements, the sense faculties, the sense objects, and the sense consciousnesses?üîΩOr is it the cause of the mind as a collection of the four great elements, the sense faculties, the sense objects, the sense consciousnesses, and the mind?üîΩOr is it the cause of the mind as a collection of the four great elements, the sense faculties, the sense objects, the sense consciousnesses, the mind, and the mental factors?üîΩOr is it the cause of the mind as a collection of the four great elements, the sense faculties, the sense objects, the sense consciousnesses, the mind, the mental factors, and the body?üîΩOr is it the cause of the mind as a collection of the four great elements, the sense faculties, the sense objects, the sense consciousnesses, the mind, the mental factors, the body, and the life faculty?üîΩOr is it the cause of the mind as a collection of the four great elements, the sense faculties, the sense objects, the sense consciousnesses, the mind, the mental factors, the body, the life faculty, and the sense faculty of thought?üîΩOr is it the cause of the mind as a collection of the four great elements, the sense faculties, the sense objects, the sense consciousnesses, the mind, the mental factors, the body, the life faculty, the sense faculty of thought, and the sense faculty of thought consciousness?üîΩOr is it the cause of the

original: gcig la rang bzhin bzhi rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gcig la rang bzhin bzhi rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not logical for a single thing to have four natures.

original: du ma'i tha snyad tshad mar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: du ma'i tha snyad tshad mar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it would follow that the convention of multiplicity would be valid.

original: de lta bas na rdul phra rab tu ma 'dus pa'i bdag nyid du khas blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na rdul phra rab tu ma 'dus pa'i bdag nyid du khas blang bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it should be accepted that the self is not composed of subtle particles.

original: rdul phra rab de dag kyang re re rgyu yin nam /
analyzed: rdul phra rab de dag kyang re re rgyu yin nam /
translated: Are those subtle particles the cause individually,

original: tshogs pa rgyu yin grang /
analyzed: tshogs pa rgyu yin grang /
translated: or is the collection the cause?

original: re zhig re re ni ma yin te /
analyzed: re zhig re re ni ma yin te /
translated: First, they are not individually.

original: sa bon re re myu gu bskyed pa bzhin du rdul phra rab re re rnam par rtog pa skyed par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sa bon re re myu gu bskyed pa bzhin du rdul phra rab re re rnam par rtog pa skyed par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it would follow that each subtle particle would generate a conception, just as each seed generates a sprout.

original: tshogs pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: tshogs pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Also, the collection is not.

original: sna tshogs pa'i yan lag gcig ma tshang na yang mi skye bar 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: sna tshogs pa'i yan lag gcig ma tshang na yang mi skye bar 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because it would not be generated even if one part of the various parts were missing.

original: sa la sogs pa gang yang rung ba ma tshang na myu gu mi skye ba bzhin no //
analyzed: sa la sogs pa gang yang rung ba ma tshang na myu gu mi skye ba bzhin no //
translated: Because a sprout is not generated if any of the parts such as soil are missing.

original: tshogs pa la rag las ba'i 'bras bu ni gang yang rung ba med pa ni 'gyur ba ma yin te /
analyzed: tshogs pa la rag las ba'i 'bras bu ni gang yang rung ba med pa ni 'gyur ba ma yin te /
translated: An effect that depends on a collection is not generated if any part is missing.

original: de la rag las pa nyid nyams par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la rag las pa nyid nyams par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow that the body would be destroyed.

original: ci ste ji ltar yod pa bzhin du thams cad kyang sems kyi rgyur rtog par byed na /
analyzed: ci ste ji ltar yod pa bzhin du thams cad kyang sems kyi rgyur rtog par byed na /
translated: If you imagine that everything is the cause of the mind, just as it exists,

original: 'o na de lta na lus kyi yan lag tshang ba dang ma tshang ba las byung ba'i rnam par rtog pa de dag tha dad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'o na de lta na lus kyi yan lag tshang ba dang ma tshang ba las byung ba'i rnam par rtog pa de dag tha dad par 'gyur te /
translated: then in that case, the conceptions that arise from a complete or incomplete body would be different,

original: rgyu tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because their causes would be different.

original: de lta ma yin na 'bras bu'i tha dad pa rgyu med pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na 'bras bu'i tha dad pa rgyu med pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were not so, then the difference in the effect would be causeless.

original: yan lag ma tshang ba med pa las phyis yan lag ma tshang bar gyur ba na yid kyi blo 'ga' zhig khyad par du 'gyur ba ni yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: yan lag ma tshang ba med pa las phyis yan lag ma tshang bar gyur ba na yid kyi blo 'ga' zhig khyad par du 'gyur ba ni yod pa ma yin te /
translated: But it is not the case that some mental cognition is different later when the body becomes incomplete, after it was complete earlier,

original: thos pa la sogs pa'i legs par byas pa ni de'i tshe yang ma tshang ba med par 'jig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thos pa la sogs pa'i legs par byas pa ni de'i tshe yang ma tshang ba med par 'jig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the good actions such as hearing are not incomplete at that time.

original: glang po la sogs pa'i lus la gnas pa'i yid kyi blo khyad par du 'phags par 'gyur gyi ma'i blo ni ma yin no //
analyzed: glang po la sogs pa'i lus la gnas pa'i yid kyi blo khyad par du 'phags par 'gyur gyi ma'i blo ni ma yin no //
translated: The mind of the elephant, etc., which is located in the body of the mother, is superior to the mind of the mother, but not the mind of the mother.

original: gang yang lus chung ba'i ma'i skye ba de dag blo dman pa dang / lus chen po ni blo gsal bar 'gyur te ;
analyzed: gang yang lus chung ba'i ma'i skye ba de dag blo dman pa dang / lus chen po ni blo gsal bar 'gyur te ;
translated: And those who are born from a mother with a small body have a small mind, and those with a large body have a clear mind.

original: rgyu chung ba dang khyad par du 'phags pa las 'bras bu chung ba dang khyad par du 'phags par mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu chung ba dang khyad par du 'phags pa las 'bras bu chung ba dang khyad par du 'phags par mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because a small cause and a superior cause are seen to have a small and superior result.

original: gang zhig tha dad pas gang tha dad par mi 'gyur ba de ni de'i 'bras bu yin par rigs pa ma yin te /üîΩha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / 'bras bu'i tha dad pa yang rgyu @95a * //
analyzed: gang zhig tha dad pas gang tha dad par mi 'gyur ba de ni de'i 'bras bu yin par rigs pa ma yin te / ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / 'bras bu'i tha dad pa yang rgyu @95a * //
translated: It is not reasonable that what is different from something is the result of that,

original: med pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: med pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because of the absurdity of the consequence, and because the difference of the result would be without a cause.

original: dbang po dang bcas pa zhes bya ba'i phyogs kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: dbang po dang bcas pa zhes bya ba'i phyogs kyang ma yin te /
translated: It is not the position that it is together with the sense faculty,

original: 'di ltar yid kyi blo dbang po re re las sam /
analyzed: 'di ltar yid kyi blo dbang po re re las sam /
translated: because in that case, the mind of the elephant, etc., would be located in the sense faculty of the eye, etc., of the mother.

original: tshogs pa las yin grang re zhig re re las ni ma yin te /
analyzed: tshogs pa las yin grang re zhig re re las ni ma yin te /
translated: But it is not from each individual.üîΩ

original: dbang po re re nyams na yang yid kyi blo ma tshang ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang po re re nyams na yang yid kyi blo ma tshang ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not from each sense faculty individually, because even when one sense faculty is impaired, the mental cognition is not impaired.

original: 'di ltar nyams byed ces bya ba la sogs pa'i nad la sogs pas lus kyi dbang po la sogs pa la gnod kyang yid kyi blo ma tshang ba med pa nyid du yod par nyams su myong ngo //
analyzed: 'di ltar nyams byed ces bya ba la sogs pa'i nad la sogs pas lus kyi dbang po la sogs pa la gnod kyang yid kyi blo ma tshang ba med pa nyid du yod par nyams su myong ngo //
translated: Thus, we experience that even when the body sense faculty, etc. are impaired by such diseases as jaundice, etc., the mental cognition is not impaired.

original: gang 'gyur na yang gang mi 'gyur ba de ni de'i 'bras bur rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang 'gyur na yang gang mi 'gyur ba de ni de'i 'bras bur rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: And it is not reasonable that what changes is the result of what does not change,

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because that would lead to an absurd consequence.

original: gzhan yang mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa bzhin du so sor nges pa'i don 'dzin pa dang rtogs pa med pa dang / don nye ba la ltos nas 'jug pa dang res 'ga' bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan yang mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa bzhin du so sor nges pa'i don 'dzin pa dang rtogs pa med pa dang / don nye ba la ltos nas 'jug pa dang res 'ga' bar 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, like the visual consciousness, etc., it would not have a specific object, it would not be a comprehender, it would engage its object in dependence on the presence of its object, and it would sometimes not occur,

original: rgyu tha mi dad pa'i phyir dang / cig car du ma skyes par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu tha mi dad pa'i phyir dang / cig car du ma skyes par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because its cause would not be different and because it would follow that it would not be produced all at once.

original: tshogs pa las zhes bya ba'i phyogs kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: tshogs pa las zhes bya ba'i phyogs kyang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it the position that the sense faculty is the collection of the sense-spheres,

original: dbang po gcig med pa na yang med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: dbang po gcig med pa na yang med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
translated: because it would follow, absurdly, that when one sense faculty is absent, the other sense faculties would also be absent.

original: lhan cig byed pa gcig med pa na myu gu la sogs pa nyams pa bzhin no //
analyzed: lhan cig byed pa gcig med pa na myu gu la sogs pa nyams pa bzhin no //
