translated: This is just like the fact that when one of the cooperating causes of a sprout is absent, the sprout will not arise.

original: dbang po med pa zhes bya ba'i phyogs kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: dbang po med pa zhes bya ba'i phyogs kyang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it the position that the sense faculty is that which is without sense faculty,

original: lus la bcang ba'i lag pa la sogs pa yang de'i rgyu nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus la bcang ba'i lag pa la sogs pa yang de'i rgyu nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow, absurdly, that even the hand and so on that are held in the body would be its cause.

original: khyad par can rgyu nyid yin na dbang po dang bcas pa nyid 'dod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: khyad par can rgyu nyid yin na dbang po dang bcas pa nyid 'dod par 'gyur te /
translated: If it were the cause of the special, then it would have to be accepted that it is the sense faculty itself,

original: dbang po dang bcas pa las gzhan khyad par can bstan par nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dbang po dang bcas pa las gzhan khyad par can bstan par nus pa ma yin no //
translated: because it is not possible to teach that the special is anything other than that which possesses the sense faculty.

original: nye bar len pa'i rgyu zhes bya ba'i phyogs kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: nye bar len pa'i rgyu zhes bya ba'i phyogs kyang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it the position that the sense faculty is the cause of the appropriated,üîΩbecause it would follow, absurdly, that the sense faculty would be the cause of the body.

original: 'di ltar 'bras bur gtogs pa'i khyad par mtha' dag gi rjes su 'gro ba'i rang bzhin gyi rgyu gang zhig rtag tu bdag nyid yod pa nye ba'i phyir de la phan 'dogs par byed pa gang zhig 'gyur bar ma byas par 'bras bu 'gyur bar mi nus pa'i
analyzed: 'di ltar 'bras bur gtogs pa'i khyad par mtha' dag gi rjes su 'gro ba'i rang bzhin gyi rgyu gang zhig rtag tu bdag nyid yod pa nye ba'i phyir de la phan 'dogs par byed pa gang zhig 'gyur bar ma byas par 'bras bu 'gyur bar mi nus pa'i
translated: What is that cause? It is the cause that is not made to be a helper of the effect, but without which the effect cannot be made.

original: rgyu'i khyad par de nyid nye bar len pa nyid du grags te /
analyzed: rgyu'i khyad par de nyid nye bar len pa nyid du grags te /
translated: That very cause is known as the appropriator.

original: dper na 'jim pa'i bdag nyid kyi tshogs pa snga ma snga ma bum pa'i ming can gyi 'bras bu'i tshogs pa phyi ma phyi ma'i nye bar len par 'dod pa nyid bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na 'jim pa'i bdag nyid kyi tshogs pa snga ma snga ma bum pa'i ming can gyi 'bras bu'i tshogs pa phyi ma phyi ma'i nye bar len par 'dod pa nyid bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is just like the prior collection of the nature of clay being asserted to be the appropriator of the subsequent collection of the effect that is called a pot.

original: gang zhig gang rnam par 'gyur bar byed 'dod pa de de'i nye bar len pa rnam par 'gyur bar @95b byas pa nyid kyis de rnam par 'gyur bar byed kyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang zhig gang rnam par 'gyur bar byed 'dod pa de de'i nye bar len pa rnam par 'gyur bar @95b byas pa nyid kyis de rnam par 'gyur bar byed kyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //
translated: Whatever is asserted to be the maker of the transformation of something is the appropriator of that, because it is made to be the transformation of that. It is the maker of the transformation of that, but not anything else.

original: nus pa thogs pa med pa'i nye bar len pa snga ma yod na de'i 'bras bu phyis skye bar 'dod pa gang gis gnod par bya bar nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: nus pa thogs pa med pa'i nye bar len pa snga ma yod na de'i 'bras bu phyis skye bar 'dod pa gang gis gnod par bya bar nus pa ma yin te /
translated: If the prior appropriation has unimpeded power, then how can the later arising of its effect be impeded?

original: dper na skye bar 'dod pa'i 'bras bu bum pa la sogs pa phyi ma 'ji ba'i bdag nyid snga ma la gegs ma byas par nus pa med pa'i skad cig skyed pa'i phyir 'gyur bar byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dper na skye bar 'dod pa'i 'bras bu bum pa la sogs pa phyi ma 'ji ba'i bdag nyid snga ma la gegs ma byas par nus pa med pa'i skad cig skyed pa'i phyir 'gyur bar byed pa ma yin no //
translated: For example, the later effect, such as a pot, which is asserted to arise, is not made to arise by the prior moment of clay, because it is not possible for the later moment to arise without power, without having been impeded.

original: thams cad du 'gyur bar byed pa'i tshul ni 'di nyid yin te /
analyzed: thams cad du 'gyur bar byed pa'i tshul ni 'di nyid yin te /
translated: This is the way that all things arise.

original: nye bar len pa'i skad cig phyi ma nus pa med pa nyid du skyed pa'o //
analyzed: nye bar len pa'i skad cig phyi ma nus pa med pa nyid du skyed pa'o //
translated: The later moment of appropriation arises without power.

original: gzhan du na dngos su ni 'gal ba 'ga' yang srid pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan du na dngos su ni 'gal ba 'ga' yang srid pa ma yin no //
translated: Otherwise, it would be impossible for there to be any contradiction in reality.

original: gal te rgyu'i 'gyur ba byed pa bzhin du 'bras bu yang dngos su rnam par 'gyur bar byed par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: gal te rgyu'i 'gyur ba byed pa bzhin du 'bras bu yang dngos su rnam par 'gyur bar byed par 'gyur gyi /
translated: If the effect were to arise in the same way that the cause transforms, then the effect would directly transform.

original: nye bar len pa 'gyur bar byed pa'i sgo nas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: nye bar len pa 'gyur bar byed pa'i sgo nas ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not that the effect transforms by way of the transformation of the appropriation.

original: gang yang sgron ma la sogs pa'i dbang du byas nas de'i 'od yul gzhan du 'jug pa'i bar du sgrib g-yogs kyis 'gyur bar byed pa de ni de'i dngos kyi nye bar len pa'i rgyu sgron ma ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang yang sgron ma la sogs pa'i dbang du byas nas de'i 'od yul gzhan du 'jug pa'i bar du sgrib g-yogs kyis 'gyur bar byed pa de ni de'i dngos kyi nye bar len pa'i rgyu sgron ma ni ma yin no //
translated: But when, for example, a lamp is the cause, the light of the lamp is not the substantial cause of the change in the light that is caused by the screen, since the light is obstructed from entering another place.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What is it then?

original: 'od kyi skad cig snga ma snga ma ste /
analyzed: 'od kyi skad cig snga ma snga ma ste /
translated: It is the preceding moment of light.

original: de nyid nus pa med pa'i skad cig gzhan skyed pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'gyur ba bsgrub pa'i phyir sgrib g-yogs kyis 'od nyams par byed do //
analyzed: de nyid nus pa med pa'i skad cig gzhan skyed pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'gyur ba bsgrub pa'i phyir sgrib g-yogs kyis 'od nyams par byed do //
translated: The screen obstructs the light in order to produce a change in the light, that is, in order to produce another moment of light that is devoid of potentiality.

original: yang dngos po gang zhig gi dbang du byas nas gang 'gyur bar byed pa de ni de'i nye bar len pa ma yin te /
analyzed: yang dngos po gang zhig gi dbang du byas nas gang 'gyur bar byed pa de ni de'i nye bar len pa ma yin te /
translated: Moreover, that which is the cause of the change of a thing is not the substantial cause of that thing.

original: dper na ba men gyi dbang du byas nas ba lang rnam par 'gyur ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na ba men gyi dbang du byas nas ba lang rnam par 'gyur ba bzhin no //
translated: For example, a cow is the cause of the change of a bull, but it is not the substantial cause of the bull.

original: mi 'dod pa spyod pa la sogs pas yid mi bde ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'gyur ba sgrub par byed pa'i yid kyi blo yang lus kyi dbang du byas pa yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: mi 'dod pa spyod pa la sogs pas yid mi bde ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'gyur ba sgrub par byed pa'i yid kyi blo yang lus kyi dbang du byas pa yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
translated: The mental cognition that produces the change characterized by mental dissatisfaction, etc., due to undesirable conduct, etc., is also dependent on the body. This is the observation of a contradictory pervasion.

original: 'on te zas dang gnyid la sogs pas lus rgyas pa la sogs pa'i rnam par 'gyur ba na 'dod chags la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi yid kyi blo'i rnam par 'gyur ba sgrub par byed par mthong ba kho na'o //
analyzed: 'on te zas dang gnyid la sogs pas lus rgyas pa la sogs pa'i rnam par 'gyur ba na 'dod chags la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi yid kyi blo'i rnam par 'gyur ba sgrub par byed par mthong ba kho na'o //
translated: Or, when the body is nourished by food, sleep, etc., and its changes are seen to be produced, the mental cognition characterized by attachment, etc., is also seen to be produced.

original: gal te mthong mod /
analyzed: gal te mthong mod /
translated: If this is seen,

original: de las cir 'gyur /üîΩde tsam gyis ni gtan tshigs ma grub pa nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: de las cir 'gyur / de tsam gyis ni gtan tshigs ma grub pa nyid ma yin te /
translated: what follows from it?üîΩIt is not the case that the reason is not established merely by this.

original: 'di ltar gang zhig rnam par mi 'gyur na yang gang rnam par 'gyur bar byed pa de ni de'i nye bar len pa ma yin no zhes bya ba de tsam zhig 'dir brjod @96a * //üîΩpar 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar gang zhig rnam par mi 'gyur na yang gang rnam par 'gyur bar byed pa de ni de'i nye bar len pa ma yin no zhes bya ba de tsam zhig 'dir brjod @96a * //üîΩpar 'dod pa yin no //
translated: For it is merely this that is intended to be stated here: that which does not change is not the appropriator of that which changes.

original: gnas skabs 'ga' zhig tu mi 'dod pa spyod pa la sogs pas lus rnam par 'gyur bar byed pa med par yang blo 'gyur bar byed par srid pa'i phyir gtan tshigs ma grub pa ga las yin /
analyzed: gnas skabs 'ga' zhig tu mi 'dod pa spyod pa la sogs pas lus rnam par 'gyur bar byed pa med par yang blo 'gyur bar byed par srid pa'i phyir gtan tshigs ma grub pa ga las yin /
translated: Sometimes, without any change in the body, such as the performance of undesirable actions, it is possible for the mind to change.

original: res 'ga' de lta bur gyur pas de'i rnam par 'gyur ba'i rjes su byed pa'i phyir de'i nye bar len pa nyid du rigs pa yang ma yin te /üîΩha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: res 'ga' de lta bur gyur pas de'i rnam par 'gyur ba'i rjes su byed pa'i phyir de'i nye bar len pa nyid du rigs pa yang ma yin te / ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Sometimes, because of that, it is not logical that the mind is the appropriator of the body, because it follows the change of the body.

original: de lta na ni yul yang nye bar len pa nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta na ni yul yang nye bar len pa nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: This is because it would follow, absurdly, that the object would be the appropriator of the mind.

original: 'di ltar stag dang khra la sogs pa'i 'jigs su rung ba'i yul mthong ba la sogs pa'i stobs kyis kyang res 'ga' sngar ma'i yid rmugs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi yid kyi 'gyur pa 'byung ba kho na'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar stag dang khra la sogs pa'i 'jigs su rung ba'i yul mthong ba la sogs pa'i stobs kyis kyang res 'ga' sngar ma'i yid rmugs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi yid kyi 'gyur pa 'byung ba kho na'o //
translated: This is because sometimes, by the power of seeing such objects as terrifying tigers and hawks, etc. , a change in the mind, which is characterized by fear, occurs.

original: de tsam gyis ni yid kyi blo de de la brten par 'gyur ba yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de tsam gyis ni yid kyi blo de de la brten par 'gyur ba yang ma yin no //
translated: But that does not mean that the mental consciousness is based on the body.

original: 'dod pa dang mya ngan la sogs pa'i rnam par spyad pas kyang yid nyams pa na lus rnam par 'gyur ba mthong ba'i phyir de lus kyi yang nye bar len par thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa dang mya ngan la sogs pa'i rnam par spyad pas kyang yid nyams pa na lus rnam par 'gyur ba mthong ba'i phyir de lus kyi yang nye bar len par thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Also, when the mind is impaired by the experience of desire, sorrow, and so on, the body is seen to change. Therefore it follows that the mind would also appropriate the body.

original: 'on kyang nges par dngos su gang zhig gang 'gyur ba'i rjes su byed pa de ni de'i nye bar len par rigs pa yin zhing 'dod chags la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi rnam par 'gyur ba nges par lus yongs su rgyas pa la sogs pa las 'gyur baüîΩma yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang nges par dngos su gang zhig gang 'gyur ba'i rjes su byed pa de ni de'i nye bar len par rigs pa yin zhing 'dod chags la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi rnam par 'gyur ba nges par lus yongs su rgyas pa la sogs pa las 'gyur ba ma yin te /
translated: However, it is reasonable that the mind appropriates the body, since the mind definitely changes in accordance with the body. The change in the characteristics of desire and so on definitely does not arise from the body‚Äôs growth and so on.

original: so sor rtogs pa dang ldan pa 'ga' zhig lus yongs su rgyas na yang de med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: so sor rtogs pa dang ldan pa 'ga' zhig lus yongs su rgyas na yang de med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because when the body grows, some people who are discerning do not have desire and so on.

original: de bzhin du tshul bzhin ma yin pa mang du yid la byed pa'i gang zag lus shin tu rings pa'am /
analyzed: de bzhin du tshul bzhin ma yin pa mang du yid la byed pa'i gang zag lus shin tu rings pa'am /
translated: Similarly, when a person who frequently brings to mind what is improper has a very emaciated body,

original: dud 'gror gtogs pa 'ga' zhig lus shin tu nyam chung yang 'dod chags la sogs pa shas chen por mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dud 'gror gtogs pa 'ga' zhig lus shin tu nyam chung yang 'dod chags la sogs pa shas chen por mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because some animals have very weak bodies, but it is seen that their attachment and so on are strong.

original: gang med na yang de yod pa de ni de'i 'bras bur rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang med na yang de yod pa de ni de'i 'bras bur rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: And it is not reasonable that what exists when something does not exist is its effect,

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because that would lead to absurdity.

original: lus las dngos su 'dod chags la sogs pa srid par yang ma yin te /
analyzed: lus las dngos su 'dod chags la sogs pa srid par yang ma yin te /
translated: And attachment and so on do not directly exist in the body,

original: tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa la sogs pas bar du gcod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa la sogs pas bar du gcod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are obstructed by incorrect mental activity and so on.

original: 'di ltar lus rgyas na nang gi reg bya'i yul gyi skad cig gis skyed pa'i bde ba la sogs pa nyams su myong la /
analyzed: 'di ltar lus rgyas na nang gi reg bya'i yul gyi skad cig gis skyed pa'i bde ba la sogs pa nyams su myong la /
translated: Thus, when the body grows, one experiences pleasure and so on generated by the momentary object of tactile consciousness.

original: de las bdag dang bde ba la sogs pa de dang de grub par byed pa las sred pa dang ldan pa rtag pa @96b la sogs pa'i phyin ci log dang ldan pa'i yid can 'di ni bdag la phan 'dogs pa'am /
analyzed: de las bdag dang bde ba la sogs pa de dang de grub par byed pa las sred pa dang ldan pa rtag pa @96b la sogs pa'i phyin ci log dang ldan pa'i yid can 'di ni bdag la phan 'dogs pa'am /
translated: From that, one who is endowed with craving and who has the error of permanence and so on thinks, ‚ÄúThis is established for me, for my pleasure and so on,‚Äù and thinks, ‚ÄúThis benefits me.‚Äù

original: gnod pa byed pa yin zhes bdag la phan pa dang gnod par rnam par rtog go //
analyzed: gnod pa byed pa yin zhes bdag la phan pa dang gnod par rnam par rtog go //
translated: The self is imagined to be beneficial or harmful.

original: de las de la yongs su dga' ba dang yid bde ba la sogs pa 'byung la /üîΩde las bde ba la sogs pa'i yul can 'di mngon par shes pa la sogs pa skye'o zhes bya ba 'di ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag las rtogs pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: de las de la yongs su dga' ba dang yid bde ba la sogs pa 'byung la / de las bde ba la sogs pa'i yul can 'di mngon par shes pa la sogs pa skye'o zhes bya ba 'di ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag las rtogs pa nyid yin te /
translated: From that, there is delight and mental satisfaction, and so on.üîΩFrom that, there is the arising of the consciousnesses that have pleasure, etc. as their objects.

original: yid bde ba la sogs pa srid pa nyid na 'dod chags la sogs pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yid bde ba la sogs pa srid pa nyid na 'dod chags la sogs pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is understood from the process of concomitance and reversal, because desire, etc. are seen to exist when mental satisfaction, etc. exist.

original: rgyas pa la sogs pa yod kyang de med na ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyas pa la sogs pa yod kyang de med na ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Even when there is inflation, etc. , they are not seen when mental satisfaction, etc. do not exist.

original: de'i phyir rgyas pa la sogs pa ni dngos su yod kyi blo 'gyur ba byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyas pa la sogs pa ni dngos su yod kyi blo 'gyur ba byed pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, inflation, etc. are not the direct cause of the transformation of consciousness.

original: de nyid kyi phyir dngos su phan 'dogs par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir lus de'i lhan cig byed pa yang ma yin no zhes bya bar grub bo //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir dngos su phan 'dogs par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir lus de'i lhan cig byed pa yang ma yin no zhes bya bar grub bo //
translated: For this very reason, they are not the cooperating conditions of that body, because they do not directly benefit it.

original: myu gu la sogs pa las la sogs pa'i phan 'dogs pa rnams dngos su ltan cig byed pa nyid du grags pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: myu gu la sogs pa las la sogs pa'i phan 'dogs pa rnams dngos su ltan cig byed pa nyid du grags pa'i phyir te /
translated: because the sprout and so on are well known to be directly co-present with the benefit of the action.

original: de lta ma yin na ha cang thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na ha cang thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were not so, there would be an absurd consequence.

original: de lta bas na rigs mthun pa'i sa bon sad nas 'jug pa can nyid kyi 'dod chags la sogs pa dang / lus rgyas pa dang lang tsho dang dus la sogs pa ni so sor rtog pa goms pa dang bral ba 'ga' zhig gi de bag chags sad pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na rigs mthun pa'i sa bon sad nas 'jug pa can nyid kyi 'dod chags la sogs pa dang / lus rgyas pa dang lang tsho dang dus la sogs pa ni so sor rtog pa goms pa dang bral ba 'ga' zhig gi de bag chags sad pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: Therefore, the seed of a similar type, having been activated, is the cause of the activation of the latent impressions of attachment and so on, of the growth of the body, of youth, and of time, and so on, for some who are devoid of the cultivation of discernment.

original: lus rang gi nye bar len pas 'jug pa'i yid kyi blo res 'ga' dngos su phan 'dogs par byed pa yin du chug mod /
analyzed: lus rang gi nye bar len pas 'jug pa'i yid kyi blo res 'ga' dngos su phan 'dogs par byed pa yin du chug mod /
translated: Let it be granted that the mind that engages the body through its own appropriation sometimes directly benefits it.

original: de lta na yang lus ldog na yang de ldog pa 'grub par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta na yang lus ldog na yang de ldog pa 'grub par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Even so, when the body ceases, it is not established that it ceases.

original: dper na me log kyang bum pa la sogs pa mi ldog pa bzhin te /
analyzed: dper na me log kyang bum pa la sogs pa mi ldog pa bzhin te /
translated: For example, when a lamp is extinguished, a pot and so on are not extinguished.

original: rang gi nye bar len pa ma log pa'i phyir mi 'dod par 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: rang gi nye bar len pa ma log pa'i phyir mi 'dod par 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: It is not the case that it is not accepted because its own appropriation has not ceased.

original: gtan tshigs ma nges pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gtan tshigs ma nges pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is the reason uncertain,

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because of the absurd consequence that it would follow that the body and mind would not be simultaneous.

original: 'gal ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'gal ba yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it contradictory,

original: mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa'i phyir ro //üîΩde'i phyir lus nye bar len pa'i rgyu ma yin zhing /
analyzed: mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa'i phyir ro // de'i phyir lus nye bar len pa'i rgyu ma yin zhing /
translated: because it exists in what is similar to it.

original: lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu yang ma yin pa'i phyir yid kyi blo snga ma snga ma'i blo'i stobs kyis byung ba can yin par grub po //
analyzed: lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu yang ma yin pa'i phyir yid kyi blo snga ma snga ma'i blo'i stobs kyis byung ba can yin par grub po //
translated: Therefore, it is established that the prior mind of the mental faculty arises by the power of the prior mind, because it is not the cause of appropriating the body and is not a co-originating cause.

original: 'di snyam du gang dag lhan cig gnas par nges pa de dag ni nye bar blang bar bya bar 'gyur ba dag yin @97a * //
analyzed: 'di snyam du gang dag lhan cig gnas par nges pa de dag ni nye bar blang bar bya bar 'gyur ba dag yin @97a * //
translated: If you think that those that are definitely simultaneous are that which is to be appropriated,

original: te ; mar me dang 'od dag bzhin no //
analyzed: te ; mar me dang 'od dag bzhin no //
translated: like a lamp and its light,

original: lus dang yid kyi rnam par shes pa dag kyang lhan cig gnas pa nges pa yod pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: lus dang yid kyi rnam par shes pa dag kyang lhan cig gnas pa nges pa yod pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: and that the body and the mind consciousness are definitely simultaneous, this is a reason based on the nature of things.

original: de'i phyir 'di ni gtan tshigs gang yang rung ba la ma grub pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di ni gtan tshigs gang yang rung ba la ma grub pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, this is not established with regard to any of the reasons.

original: gzugs med pa'i khams na lus med kyang yid kyi blo'i gnas skabs khas len pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams na lus med kyang yid kyi blo'i gnas skabs khas len pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For, although there is no body in the formless realm, you accept that there is a mental cognition.

original: 'dod pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dod pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not tenable to say that they are different,

original: yid kyi blo yang lus kyi nye bar len pa can du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yid kyi blo yang lus kyi nye bar len pa can du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would then follow that mental cognition would also have a body.

original: ma nges pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: ma nges pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not indeterminate,

original: rgyu tha mi dad pas kyang lhan cig gnas pa srid pa'i phyir me dang zangs kyi zhu ba nyid bzhin te /
analyzed: rgyu tha mi dad pas kyang lhan cig gnas pa srid pa'i phyir me dang zangs kyi zhu ba nyid bzhin te /
translated: because it is possible that they coexist, since their causes are not different, like the burning of copper and the heat of fire.

original: 'di ltar me lhan cig byed pa can gyi zangs zhu bar rtsom gyi 'ba' zhig pa ni ma yin no /
analyzed: 'di ltar me lhan cig byed pa can gyi zangs zhu bar rtsom gyi 'ba' zhig pa ni ma yin no /
translated: Thus, copper begins to melt due to the simultaneous causes of fire, but not by itself.

original: de bzhin du 'di la yang lus kyi nye bar len pa nur nur po la sogs pa yid kyi rnam par shes pa lhan cig byed pa can gyi lus rtsom pas de'i phyir de dag lhan cig gnas pa yin gyi nye bar len pa dang nye bar blangüîΩba'i dngos pos ni ma yin pa'i phyir ma nges pa nyid yin no /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'di la yang lus kyi nye bar len pa nur nur po la sogs pa yid kyi rnam par shes pa lhan cig byed pa can gyi lus rtsom pas de'i phyir de dag lhan cig gnas pa yin gyi nye bar len pa dang nye bar blangüîΩba'i dngos pos ni ma yin pa'i phyir ma nges pa nyid yin no /
translated: In the same way, the mental consciousness begins a body that is the simultaneous cause of the body, such as the embryo in the kalala stage, and therefore they coexist. But it is not indeterminate because they are not related as that which is appropriated and the appropriator.

original: yang ci ste gal te yang dus phyi ma'i yid kyang blo snga ma snga ma'i stobs kyis 'byung ba de lta na yang lus dang por byung ba gang yin pa de'i nye bar len pa nyid yin pas de'i phyir thog ma med pa nyid du ma grub po
analyzed: yang ci ste gal te yang dus phyi ma'i yid kyang blo snga ma snga ma'i stobs kyis 'byung ba de lta na yang lus dang por byung ba gang yin pa de'i nye bar len pa nyid yin pas de'i phyir thog ma med pa nyid du ma grub po
translated: But if the later mind arises due to the power of the earlier mind, then the body that first arose would be the appropriated object of the later mind, and therefore it is not established that the body is beginningless.

original: snyam na / de ni yang dag pa ma yin te /
analyzed: snyam na / de ni yang dag pa ma yin te /
translated: This is not correct.

original: rtog pa 'di'i sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma cung zad kyang yod pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni bstan zin to /
analyzed: rtog pa 'di'i sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma cung zad kyang yod pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni bstan zin to /
translated: We have already explained that there is no valid cognition that establishes this idea.

original: // / gnod par byed pa yang med do zhe na /
analyzed: // / gnod par byed pa yang med do zhe na /
translated: But there is no evidence to refute this.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: This is not so.

original: gnod par byed pa yod pa nyid do //
analyzed: gnod par byed pa yod pa nyid do //
translated: There is evidence to refute this.

original: de ltar yid kyi blo lan cig lus las byung la phyis rigs mthun pa las byung bar gyur na de'i tshe dus phyis thams cad du yid kyi rnam par shes pa snga ma snga ma kho na las 'byung bar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de ltar yid kyi blo lan cig lus las byung la phyis rigs mthun pa las byung bar gyur na de'i tshe dus phyis thams cad du yid kyi rnam par shes pa snga ma snga ma kho na las 'byung bar 'gyur gyi /
translated: If the mind arises from the body once and later arises from a mind of a similar type, then later the mental consciousness would arise from the previous mental consciousness alone.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa rigs mi mthun pa las byung ba ni ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa rigs mi mthun pa las byung ba ni ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: the visual consciousness, etc., would not arise from a homogeneous cause.

original: du ba me las lan cig byung nas phyis rigs mi mthun pa gzhan yang 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: du ba me las lan cig byung nas phyis rigs mi mthun pa gzhan yang 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
translated: Once smoke has arisen from fire, it does not later arise from another cause.

original: dus phyis yid kyi blo yid kyi rnam par shes pa las byung ba kho nar nyams su myong ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dus phyis yid kyi blo yid kyi rnam par shes pa las byung ba kho nar nyams su myong ba ni ma yin no //
translated: The mental consciousness, which is later than the visual consciousness, does not arise from the visual consciousness.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What is the cause of the mental consciousness?

original: mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen ma nges pa las byung ba can yin no//
analyzed: mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen ma nges pa las byung ba can yin no//
translated: It arises from a condition as an immediately antecedent, which is not specific to it.

original: @97b gang zhig gang las dang por skye ba bsgrub par dmigs pa de ni de las gzhan las 'byung bar 'os pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: @97b gang zhig gang las dang por skye ba bsgrub par dmigs pa de ni de las gzhan las 'byung bar 'os pa yang ma yin te /
translated: When a certain factor arises from a certain factor, it is not fitting that it should arise from another.

original: rgyu med pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu med pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: For then it would arise without a cause.

original: dang por yid kyi blo mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen ma nges pa las skye bar nyams su myong bas de'i phyir ma nges pa'i rnam par shes pa tsam las byung bar grub po //
analyzed: dang por yid kyi blo mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen ma nges pa las skye bar nyams su myong bas de'i phyir ma nges pa'i rnam par shes pa tsam las byung bar grub po //
translated: First, the mental eye consciousness and so on arise from the condition of the immediately preceding equivalent mind, which is not ascertained. Therefore, it is established that they arise from mere consciousness, which is not ascertained.

original: gzhan yang gal te lus dus dang po nyid du yid kyi blo'i nye bar len pa'i rgyu yin la dus phyis ma yin pa de'i tshe ci'i phyir de lus la mi ltos par 'jug par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: gzhan yang gal te lus dus dang po nyid du yid kyi blo'i nye bar len pa'i rgyu yin la dus phyis ma yin pa de'i tshe ci'i phyir de lus la mi ltos par 'jug par mi 'gyur /
translated: Moreover, if the body is the cause of appropriating the mind at the first moment, but not at later times, then why does the mind not operate without depending on the body?

original: de ni phan mi 'dogs pa'i lus la 'ga' yang ltos par rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni phan mi 'dogs pa'i lus la 'ga' yang ltos par rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not reasonable for anything to depend on a body that does not benefit it.

original: khyed cag gang gi ltar na blo ni gzhan sngon du 'gro ba can yin pa de'i ltar na yang ci'i phyir de 'ga' zhig mi 'jug ce na /
analyzed: khyed cag gang gi ltar na blo ni gzhan sngon du 'gro ba can yin pa de'i ltar na yang ci'i phyir de 'ga' zhig mi 'jug ce na /
translated: If, according to your view, the mind is preceded by another mind, then why does it not operate at all?

original: 'jug pa nyid ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'jug pa nyid ma yin nam /
translated: Is it not the case that it does operate?

original: dper na gzugs med pa'i khams na lta bu'o ;
analyzed: dper na gzugs med pa'i khams na lta bu'o ;
translated: For example, it is like the formless realm.

original: / gang gzugs la chags pa dang ldan pa de ni de la ltos nas 'jug pa yin pa'i phyir rtsod pa med pa nyid do //
analyzed: / gang gzugs la chags pa dang ldan pa de ni de la ltos nas 'jug pa yin pa'i phyir rtsod pa med pa nyid do //
translated: And if one is attached to form, then one is engaged in that, and so there is no dispute.

original: ci ste lus kyang dus phyis phan 'dogs par byed pa khas len par byed pa de'i tshe rnam par shes pa'i rgyun du mi skye ba thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: ci ste lus kyang dus phyis phan 'dogs par byed pa khas len par byed pa de'i tshe rnam par shes pa'i rgyun du mi skye ba thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: But if one accepts that the body is helpful at a later time, then it follows that the continuum of consciousness is not produced.

original: rnam par shes pa'i nye bar len par gyur ba ma tshang ba med pa'i lus gzhan yang de skyed par byed pa nyid du gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i nye bar len par gyur ba ma tshang ba med pa'i lus gzhan yang de skyed par byed pa nyid du gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the body, which is the appropriator of consciousness, is incomplete, and another body is not produced.

original: 'di ltar rnam par shes pa gang zhig lus gang kho na las skyes pa de ni de las gzhan pa'i shes pa so so so sor bskyed pa'i phyir srog chags gcig gi skad cig re re la rnam par shes pa'i rgyun dpag tu med pa skye bar 'gyur
analyzed: 'di ltar rnam par shes pa gang zhig lus gang kho na las skyes pa de ni de las gzhan pa'i shes pa so so so sor bskyed pa'i phyir srog chags gcig gi skad cig re re la rnam par shes pa'i rgyun dpag tu med pa skye bar 'gyur
translated: Thus, the consciousness that is produced from a particular body is not produced from any other consciousness, and so the continuum of consciousness is not produced in each moment of a single living being.

original: la / de ltar nyams su myong ba yod pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: la / de ltar nyams su myong ba yod pa yang ma yin no //
translated: And this is not experienced.

original: yang na ci ste dus phyis lus nye bar len pa'i rgyu nyid kyis logs shig tu phan 'dogs par byed par mi 'dod do //
analyzed: yang na ci ste dus phyis lus nye bar len pa'i rgyu nyid kyis logs shig tu phan 'dogs par byed par mi 'dod do //
translated: Or else, why not maintain that the body is a cause that separately benefits the mental faculty at a later time?

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What do you maintain?

original: rgyun gyis rang gi nye bar len pa las yid kyi blo rnams 'jug pa phyi ma phyi ma'i 'bras bu skye ba la lus lhan cig byed pa yin pas de'i phyir de lus la mi ltos par 'jug pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba de yang mi
analyzed: rgyun gyis rang gi nye bar len pa las yid kyi blo rnams 'jug pa phyi ma phyi ma'i 'bras bu skye ba la lus lhan cig byed pa yin pas de'i phyir de lus la mi ltos par 'jug pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba de yang mi
translated: The mental faculty arises from its own cause, the immediately preceding condition, and the body is a cooperative condition for the arising of the later result. Therefore, the mental faculty does not arise independently of the body.üîΩThat is not so.

original: bden te / gang zhig gang gi ji ltar skyed par byed pa nyid du grags pa de ni de skyed par byed kyi rnam par gzhan du ni ma yin @98a * //üîΩte ; khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bden te / gang zhig gang gi ji ltar skyed par byed pa nyid du grags pa de ni de skyed par byed kyi rnam par gzhan du ni ma yin @98a * // te ; khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Whatever is known to generate something in a certain way generates that in just that way, not in another way, because there is no difference.

original: 'di ltar snang ba la sogs pa mig gi rnam par shes pa ma nyams pa la dmigs pa'i ngo bo skyed par byed pa nyid du nyams su myong na yang de rnam pa gzhan du skyed par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar snang ba la sogs pa mig gi rnam par shes pa ma nyams pa la dmigs pa'i ngo bo skyed par byed pa nyid du nyams su myong na yang de rnam pa gzhan du skyed par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: For example, light and so on are known to generate eye consciousness that is unimpaired and focused on them. They do not generate eye consciousness in another way.

original: gzung bar bya ba'i mtshan nyid la //
analyzed: gzung bar bya ba'i mtshan nyid la //
translated: The characteristic of the object to be grasped

original: gzung bya las gzhan skyed byed min //
analyzed: gzung bya las gzhan skyed byed min //
translated: is not a producer of anything other than the object to be grasped.

original: gzugs sogs blo yi dngos su ni //
analyzed: gzugs sogs blo yi dngos su ni //
translated: Form, etc. is the actual benefit for the awareness,

original: phan 'dogs yin gyi gzhan du min //
analyzed: phan 'dogs yin gyi gzhan du min //
translated: not for anything else.

original: zhes gang bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes gang bshad pa yin no //
translated: This is what is explained.

original: de lta ma yin na 'bras bu rgyus byas pa'i rang bzhin tha mi dad pa dang tha dad pa'i rnam par gzhag par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na 'bras bu rgyus byas pa'i rang bzhin tha mi dad pa dang tha dad pa'i rnam par gzhag par mi 'gyur te /
translated: If it were not so, the nature of the effect produced by the cause would not be established as either the same as or different from the cause,

original: der gtogs pa'i phan 'dogs pa'i rjes su mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: der gtogs pa'i phan 'dogs pa'i rjes su mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would not follow the actual benefit that belongs to it.

original: de lta yin dang rgyu med pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta yin dang rgyu med pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were so, it would follow that it would be causeless.

original: dus dang por lus rnam par shes pa la dngos su skyed par byed pa las ma gtogs pa gzhan nye bar len pa nyid du khyod kyis gzung ba yang ma yin no //
analyzed: dus dang por lus rnam par shes pa la dngos su skyed par byed pa las ma gtogs pa gzhan nye bar len pa nyid du khyod kyis gzung ba yang ma yin no //
translated: In the first period, the body is not grasped by you as the appropriator, apart from being the actual producer of the consciousness of the body.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: Well then, what is it?

original: dngos su phan 'dogs pa nyid yin la ;
analyzed: dngos su phan 'dogs pa nyid yin la ;
translated: It is the actual benefit,

original: de yang dus phyis kyang yod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de yang dus phyis kyang yod pa'i phyir /
translated: and that exists even later.

original: ci'i phyir nye bar len pa'i rgyu ma yin par 'gyur /
analyzed: ci'i phyir nye bar len pa'i rgyu ma yin par 'gyur /
translated: Why would it not be the cause of the appropriator?

original: de lta ma yin na sngar yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na sngar yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: If it were not so, it would not have been so previously,

original: phyis dang khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyis dang khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would not be different later.

original: dus phyis kyang rnam par shes pa snga ma lhan cig byed pa can gyi lus nyid blo phyi ma phyi ma'i nye bar len par 'gyur ro zhes kyang brjod par mi nus te /
analyzed: dus phyis kyang rnam par shes pa snga ma lhan cig byed pa can gyi lus nyid blo phyi ma phyi ma'i nye bar len par 'gyur ro zhes kyang brjod par mi nus te /
translated: And it cannot be said that the body, which is the prior consciousness that is the co-originator of the later consciousness, is the later consciousness‚Äôs appropriation, because

original: nye bar len pa nyid ni sngar rgyas par bkag zin pa'i phyir dang skye ba'i dang po'i blo yang blo gzhan sngon du 'gro ba can nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nye bar len pa nyid ni sngar rgyas par bkag zin pa'i phyir dang skye ba'i dang po'i blo yang blo gzhan sngon du 'gro ba can nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: appropriation has already been extensively refuted earlier, and because it would follow, absurdly, that the first moment of consciousness would have to have another consciousness as its antecedent.

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'byung ba rtog pa'i phyogs la /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'byung ba rtog pa'i phyogs la /
translated: Therefore, in the context of the theory of the origin of consciousness,üîΩthe master NƒÅgƒÅrjuna said:

original: lus las blo ni lhan cig byung //
analyzed: lus las blo ni lhan cig byung //
translated: The consciousness that arises from the body

original: phyi nas rang gi rigs las nges //
analyzed: phyi nas rang gi rigs las nges //
translated: is later ascertained to arise from its own type.

original: gal te lus nus yin zhe na //
analyzed: gal te lus nus yin zhe na //
translated: If you say that the body is the potential,

original: ma tshang ba ni ga las yin //
analyzed: ma tshang ba ni ga las yin //
translated: then why is it incomplete?

original: zhes gang bshad pa'i slob dpon gyis sun 'byin pa 'di ches rigs pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes gang bshad pa'i slob dpon gyis sun 'byin pa 'di ches rigs pa yin no //
translated: This refutation by the master NƒÅgƒÅrjuna is very reasonable.

original: de lta bas na yid kyi blo thog ma med pa nyid du grub pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na yid kyi blo thog ma med pa nyid du grub pa yin no //
translated: Thus the mind is established as beginningless.

original: yang na blo thams cad thog ma med par grub ste /
analyzed: yang na blo thams cad thog ma med par grub ste /
translated: Or else, all minds are established as beginningless.

original: 'di ltar dang po'i blo 'byung ba na dbang po'i blo'am yid kyi blo zhig yin /üîΩre zhig phyogs dang po ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar dang po'i blo 'byung ba na dbang po'i blo'am yid kyi blo zhig yin / re zhig phyogs dang po ni ma yin te /
translated: In this way, when the first mind arises, it is either a sense consciousness or a mental consciousness.

original: gnyid log pa dang brgyal ba dang sems med pa rnams kyi dbang po yod na /
analyzed: gnyid log pa dang brgyal ba dang sems med pa rnams kyi dbang po yod na /
translated: First, it is not the former because if the sense faculties exist for those who are asleep, unconscious, or mindless,

original: yang rjes su mthun pa'i yid la byed pa med pas dbang po'i blo mi skye @98b ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang rjes su mthun pa'i yid la byed pa med pas dbang po'i blo mi skye @98b ba'i phyir ro //
translated: the sense consciousnesses do not arise because they lack the mental factors that are compatible with them.

original: des na dbang po 'ba' zhig dbang po'i blo'i rgyu ma yin gyi 'on kyang yid la byed pa'i khyad par la ltos pa dang bcas pa yin no zhes bya bar nges te /
analyzed: des na dbang po 'ba' zhig dbang po'i blo'i rgyu ma yin gyi 'on kyang yid la byed pa'i khyad par la ltos pa dang bcas pa yin no zhes bya bar nges te /
translated: Therefore it is certain that the sense faculties alone are not the cause of sense consciousnesses but they are the cause in dependence on the specific mental factors.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pas rtogs par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pas rtogs par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the relationship of cause and effect is understood through positive and negative concomitance.

original: gang zhig gang las ches dang por skyed pa nyid du nges pa de ni de las gzhan las ches dang po skyed par byed pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig gang las ches dang por skyed pa nyid du nges pa de ni de las gzhan las ches dang po skyed par byed pa yang ma yin te /
translated: That which is ascertained to be produced first from a certain cause is not produced first from anything else.

original: rgyu med pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: rgyu med pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
translated: For then it would follow, absurdly, that it would have no cause.

original: me ma yin pa las du ba bzhin no //
analyzed: me ma yin pa las du ba bzhin no //
translated: Like smoke from that which is not fire.

original: dang por mig gi blo skye ba na rjes su mthun pa'i yid la byed pa la ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid skye bas /
analyzed: dang por mig gi blo skye ba na rjes su mthun pa'i yid la byed pa la ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid skye bas /
translated: When the eye consciousness is first produced, it is produced in dependence upon a mental process that is in conformity with it.

original: de lta bas na dbang po 'ba' zhig 'di'i nam mkha' yang rgyu ma yin no zhes bya bar grub bo //
analyzed: de lta bas na dbang po 'ba' zhig 'di'i nam mkha' yang rgyu ma yin no zhes bya bar grub bo //
translated: Therefore, it is established that the sense faculty alone is not the cause of the eye consciousness.

original: de lta ma yin na rgyu med pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba ni gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma'o //üîΩyid kyi blo zhes bya ba'i phyogs kyang ma yin te //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na rgyu med pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba ni gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma'o // yid kyi blo zhes bya ba'i phyogs kyang ma yin te //
translated: Otherwise, it would follow, absurdly, that it would have no cause. This is the refuting valid cognition.üîΩIt is not the case that the eye consciousness is produced from the mental faculty alone.

original: de dbang pos ma dmigs pa'i don la rang dbang du 'jug pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de dbang pos ma dmigs pa'i don la rang dbang du 'jug pa ni ma yin te /
translated: For the mental faculty does not operate independently of the sense faculties.

original: long ba dang 'on pa la sogs pa med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: long ba dang 'on pa la sogs pa med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Otherwise, it would follow, absurdly, that the blind and the deaf would be able to see and hear.

original: 'jug na yang ci ste rtog pa dang bcas pa'am /
analyzed: 'jug na yang ci ste rtog pa dang bcas pa'am /
translated: If it does engage, then is it with conceptual thought or without conceptual thought?

original: 'on te rtog pa med pa yin zhes bya bar brjod par bya'o //üîΩde la re zhig phyogs dang po ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'on te rtog pa med pa yin zhes bya bar brjod par bya'o // de la re zhig phyogs dang po ni ma yin te /
translated: This is what should be said.

original: 'di ltar rnam par rtog pa 'jug pa na thams cad rjod par byed pa sgra'i rnam pa'i rjes su byed pa nyid du 'jug ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar rnam par rtog pa 'jug pa na thams cad rjod par byed pa sgra'i rnam pa'i rjes su byed pa nyid du 'jug ste /
translated: First, the first position is not so, because when conceptual thought engages, it engages in the aspect of speech that expresses everything,

original: rtag tu nang du brjod pa'i rnam pa nyid du nyams su myong ba'i phyir ro //üîΩrnam par rtog pa'i brjod pa'i sgra'i rnam pa nyid de yang brda bstan pa'i dbang gis sam /üîΩyang na sgra'i ngo bo shes pa'i bdag nyid kyi chos yin pa'i phyir rtog pa'i ngo bo bzhin du rjod par byed pa'i bdag nyid yin nam /
analyzed: rtag tu nang du brjod pa'i rnam pa nyid du nyams su myong ba'i phyir ro // rnam par rtog pa'i brjod pa'i sgra'i rnam pa nyid de yang brda bstan pa'i dbang gis sam / yang na sgra'i ngo bo shes pa'i bdag nyid kyi chos yin pa'i phyir rtog pa'i ngo bo bzhin du rjod par byed pa'i bdag nyid yin nam /
translated: because it is always experienced in the aspect of inner speech.üîΩMoreover, that aspect of speech of conceptual expression is either the nature of the phenomenon that is the essence of sound cognition, like the nature of conceptual thought, because it is the nature of expression.

original: sgra dang bcas pa'i don bzung ba las yin zhes bya ba dag brtag go //
analyzed: sgra dang bcas pa'i don bzung ba las yin zhes bya ba dag brtag go //
translated: Or it is from apprehending the object with sound.üîΩThese should be investigated.

original: de la re zhig brda bzung ba las zhes bya ba'i phyogs ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de la re zhig brda bzung ba las zhes bya ba'i phyogs ni ma yin te /
translated: First, the position that it is from apprehending a sign is not so, because

original: sngar brda ma bzung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngar brda ma bzung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the sign was not previously apprehended.

original: phyogs gnyis pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: phyogs gnyis pa yang ma yin te /
translated: The second position is not tenable either.

original: 'di ltar sgra'i bdag nyid ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'di ltar sgra'i bdag nyid ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Because the nature of sound is twofold:

original: rang gi mtshan nyid kyi rang bzhin dang / spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi rang bzhin no //üîΩde la re zhig rang gi mtshan nyid kyi ngo bo gang yin pa de ni rjod par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir de'i rnam pa'i rjes su byed pa nyid kyis shes @99a * //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid kyi rang bzhin dang / spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi rang bzhin no // de la re zhig rang gi mtshan nyid kyi ngo bo gang yin pa de ni rjod par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir de'i rnam pa'i rjes su byed pa nyid kyis shes @99a * //
translated: the nature of its particular characteristic and the nature of its universal characteristic.üîΩFirst, that which is the nature of its particular characteristic is not a conceptual consciousness because it does not express it.

original: pa rtog pa dang bcas pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: pa rtog pa dang bcas pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: It is not a conceptual consciousness because it does not engage in the aspect of that.

original: 'di shes pa'i bdag nyid du rtogs pa'i chos kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di shes pa'i bdag nyid du rtogs pa'i chos kyang ma yin te /
translated: It is also not a phenomenon that is realized as having the nature of consciousness because

original: sngon po la sogs pa bzhin du phyi rol gyi ngo bor snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa bzhin du phyi rol gyi ngo bor snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: it appears as an external entity, like blue and so on.

original: de lta ma yin na sngon po la sogs pa yang shes pa'i chos nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na sngon po la sogs pa yang shes pa'i chos nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: If that were not so, then blue and so on would also be phenomena that are the nature of consciousness because

original: khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: there would be no difference.

original: de lta bas na sna tshogs rnam par shes pa tsam nyid du 'gyur gyi 'byung ba yongs su 'gyur ba'i ngo bo ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na sna tshogs rnam par shes pa tsam nyid du 'gyur gyi 'byung ba yongs su 'gyur ba'i ngo bo ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is the mere consciousness of various aspects, but not the nature of the transformation of the elements.

original: 'on te shes pa rnam pa dang bcas pa'i phyogs la sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid du rtogs pa nyid kyi chos phyi rol gyi ngo bor snang ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'on te shes pa rnam pa dang bcas pa'i phyogs la sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid du rtogs pa nyid kyi chos phyi rol gyi ngo bor snang ba ma yin nam /
translated: But in the case of consciousness with aspects, isn‚Äôt the nature of the object of knowledge, such as blue, perceived as the nature of the consciousness itself?

original: de'i phyir rol gyi ngo bor snang ba'i phyir shes pa'i chos su mi 'gyur ro zhes ci ste 'dod ce na /
analyzed: de'i phyir rol gyi ngo bor snang ba'i phyir shes pa'i chos su mi 'gyur ro zhes ci ste 'dod ce na /
translated: Therefore, since it appears as the nature of an external object, it is not a phenomenon that is of the nature of consciousness. Why do you assert that?

original: de ni bden mod kyi /
analyzed: de ni bden mod kyi /
translated: That is true.

original: phyi rol gyi don gyi bsgyur ba nyid kyis shes pa de ltar snang ba'i phyir shes pa 'di bdag nyid du gtogs pa'i zhes rnam par gzhag pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don gyi bsgyur ba nyid kyis shes pa de ltar snang ba'i phyir shes pa 'di bdag nyid du gtogs pa'i zhes rnam par gzhag pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But because that consciousness appears in that way due to the transformation of external objects, this consciousness is not established as belonging to its own nature.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What is it then?

original: phyi rol nyid kyis zhes bya ste /
analyzed: phyi rol nyid kyis zhes bya ste /
translated: It is external.

original: de nyid de'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: de nyid de'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir la /
translated: Because that is its nature.

original: shes pa ni don des nye bar bsgrub par byas pa nyid kyi glo bur ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes pa ni don des nye bar bsgrub par byas pa nyid kyi glo bur ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because cognition is adventitious, being produced by that object.

original: de lta bas na rang gi mtshan nyid kyi rang bzhin gyi sgra'i bdag nyid ni rjod par byed pa ma yin la /
analyzed: de lta bas na rang gi mtshan nyid kyi rang bzhin gyi sgra'i bdag nyid ni rjod par byed pa ma yin la /
translated: Thus, the nature of a word that is its own characteristic is not the expresser,

original: 'di shes pa'i bdag nyid chos kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di shes pa'i bdag nyid chos kyang ma yin no //
translated: and it is not the property of being the nature of cognition.

original: gal te yang spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi rang bzhin ni rjod par byed pa yin pa de lta na yang 'di shes pa'i bdag nyid kyi chos ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te yang spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi rang bzhin ni rjod par byed pa yin pa de lta na yang 'di shes pa'i bdag nyid kyi chos ni ma yin te /
translated: Even if the nature of a universal were the expresser, it would not be the property of being the nature of cognition,

original: rna bas nges par bya ba'i phyir rol rang gi mtshan nyid kho na la de sbyor ba'i phyir shes pa'i bdag nyid la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rna bas nges par bya ba'i phyir rol rang gi mtshan nyid kho na la de sbyor ba'i phyir shes pa'i bdag nyid la ni ma yin no //
translated: because it is applied to the specific characteristic that is to be ascertained by the ear, not to the nature of cognition.

original: gzhan du gtogs pa'i spyi ni shes pa gzhan la sbyor ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan du gtogs pa'i spyi ni shes pa gzhan la sbyor ba ni ma yin te /
translated: A universal that belongs to something else is not applied to another cognition,

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because that would lead to an absurd conclusion.

original: de lta na ni ba lang nyid rta la sogs pa la yang sbyor bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na ni ba lang nyid rta la sogs pa la yang sbyor bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, cowness would be applied to horses and so on.

original: sgra rang gi mtshan nyid kyi chos can ma bzung na chos de rjod par byed pa'i bdag nyid du sbyor bar nus pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: sgra rang gi mtshan nyid kyi chos can ma bzung na chos de rjod par byed pa'i bdag nyid du sbyor bar nus pa yang ma yin te /
translated: If the subject, the intrinsic identity of sound, is not apprehended, then it is not possible to connect it with the expression of that property.

original: chos rnams ni chos can gyi gzhan gyi dbang yin pa nyid kyis rang dgar mi 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos rnams ni chos can gyi gzhan gyi dbang yin pa nyid kyis rang dgar mi 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because properties are dependent on the subject, they are not apprehended independently.

original: rnam par rtog pas rang gi mtshan nyid kyi bdag nyid kyi chos can 'dzin par nus pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pas rang gi mtshan nyid kyi bdag nyid kyi chos can 'dzin par nus pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not possible for conceptual thought to apprehend the subject as having an intrinsic identity.

original: de'i yul ni spyi'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i yul ni spyi'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the object of that is a universal, not an intrinsic identity.

original: de @99b lta bas na rnam par rtog pa rnams ni thog ma med pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid nyams su myong bas bsgos pa'i bag chags sad pa las byung ba yin no zhes bya bar grub po //
analyzed: de @99b lta bas na rnam par rtog pa rnams ni thog ma med pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid nyams su myong bas bsgos pa'i bag chags sad pa las byung ba yin no zhes bya bar grub po //
translated: Therefore, it is established that conceptual thoughts arise from the activation of habitual tendencies that are infused by the experience of intrinsic identity since beginningless time.

original: sgra dang bcas pa'i don 'dzin pa las zhes bya ba'i phyogs kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: sgra dang bcas pa'i don 'dzin pa las zhes bya ba'i phyogs kyang ma yin te /
translated: It is not the case that the position is that the apprehension of the object is accompanied by the word.

original: don la sgra yod pa'am /
analyzed: don la sgra yod pa'am /
translated: Because the word is not in the object,

original: de'i bdag nyid ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid ni ma yin te /
translated: nor is it the intrinsic identity of the object.

original: ma byang ba yang rtogs par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du don dag la sbyor ba med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma byang ba yang rtogs par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du don dag la sbyor ba med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow that even those who have not trained in the path would realize the object, and because it would follow that one could not engage in the object as one wishes.

original: gzhan yang rtag pa la sogs pa'i ngo bos don la khyad par med na yang rnam par rtog pa rnam pa thams cad cig car rtags par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang rtag pa la sogs pa'i ngo bos don la khyad par med na yang rnam par rtog pa rnam pa thams cad cig car rtags par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: Moreover, if the object has no difference in it by way of a permanent nature, etc., then the conceptual consciousnesses would not be produced in all aspects simultaneously.

original: rnam pa gzhan rnam par bcad pa'i sgo nas so sor nges pa'i rnam pa gcig bzung ba nyid kyis rnam par rtog pa skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan rnam par bcad pa'i sgo nas so sor nges pa'i rnam pa gcig bzung ba nyid kyis rnam par rtog pa skyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the conceptual consciousnesses are produced by apprehending just the individual aspect that is ascertained by way of the exclusion of other aspects.

original: de'i phyir yang gcig gi rnam pa can gyi rnam par rtog pa la rgyu brjod par bya dgos la /
analyzed: de'i phyir yang gcig gi rnam pa can gyi rnam par rtog pa la rgyu brjod par bya dgos la /
translated: Therefore, it is necessary to state the cause of the conceptual consciousness that has the aspect of one thing.

original: de ni goms pa las gzhan brjod par mi nus te /
analyzed: de ni goms pa las gzhan brjod par mi nus te /
translated: And that cannot be stated to be anything other than habituation.

original: ro la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ro la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa bzhin no //
translated: It is like the conceptual consciousnesses of taste, etc.

original: de lta yin dang rnam par rtog pa ni sngar goms pa'i bdag gis skye ba'i phyir rnam par rtog pa la sogs pa'i blo thog ma med pa yin no zhes bya bar grub po //
analyzed: de lta yin dang rnam par rtog pa ni sngar goms pa'i bdag gis skye ba'i phyir rnam par rtog pa la sogs pa'i blo thog ma med pa yin no zhes bya bar grub po //
translated: Thus, because conceptual consciousnesses arise due to the prior habituation of the self, it is established that the mind that is conceptual and so on is beginningless.

original: yang rtog pa med pa zhes bya ba'i phyogs yin na de'i tshe /
analyzed: yang rtog pa med pa zhes bya ba'i phyogs yin na de'i tshe /
translated: If the position is that there is no conceptual thought,

original: ji skad du bshad pa'i tshul gyis nam yang rnam par rtog pa'i blo skye bar 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa'i tshul gyis nam yang rnam par rtog pa'i blo skye bar 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: then, in accordance with the explanation, the conceptual mind would never arise.

original: brda'i dbang gis dus phyis skye ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: brda'i dbang gis dus phyis skye ba yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that it arises later through the power of signs,

original: rtog pa med pa'i shes pa mi gnas pa'i skye bo brda bya bar mi nus pa'i phyir te /üîΩ'di ltar ji srid sgra'i spyi'am don gyi spyi blo la mi snang ba de srid du brda bya bar nus pa ma yin zhing /
analyzed: rtog pa med pa'i shes pa mi gnas pa'i skye bo brda bya bar mi nus pa'i phyir te / 'di ltar ji srid sgra'i spyi'am don gyi spyi blo la mi snang ba de srid du brda bya bar nus pa ma yin zhing /
translated: then it would be impossible for a person who has no conceptual consciousness to make a sign becauseüîΩas long as the general term or the general object does not appear to the mind, it is impossible to make a sign.

original: rtog pa med pa'i shes pa la spyi snang ba yang ma yin la gang rang gi mtshan nyid snang ba de'am nges brda byed pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: rtog pa med pa'i shes pa la spyi snang ba yang ma yin la gang rang gi mtshan nyid snang ba de'am nges brda byed pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Moreover, a general object does not appear to a nonconceptual consciousness, and it is also impossible to make a sign of that which appears as a specific instance.

original: de'i tha snyad kyi don du yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i tha snyad kyi don du yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the referent of the convention.

original: brda'i dus na mthong ba'i rang gi mtshan nyid tha snyad kyi dus su yod pa srid pa yang ma yin pa'i phyir rang gi mtshan nyid la brda byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: brda'i dus na mthong ba'i rang gi mtshan nyid tha snyad kyi dus su yod pa srid pa yang ma yin pa'i phyir rang gi mtshan nyid la brda byed pa ma yin no //
translated: And because it is not possible for the intrinsic identity that is seen at the time of the convention to exist at the time of the convention, the convention is not made with respect to intrinsic identity.

original: de lta bas na brda byed pa las sngar gdon mi za bar rnam par rtog pa khas blang bar bya dgos la /
analyzed: de lta bas na brda byed pa las sngar gdon mi za bar rnam par rtog pa khas blang bar bya dgos la /
translated: Therefore, it must be admitted that prior to the convention, there must be a conceptual thought.

original: de yang goms pa med par mi 'grub pa'i phyir thog ma med pa nyid du grub po //üîΩgzhan yang gal te skye ba'i dang por byung ba'i blo skye ba snga ma la goms @100a * //
analyzed: de yang goms pa med par mi 'grub pa'i phyir thog ma med pa nyid du grub po // gzhan yang gal te skye ba'i dang por byung ba'i blo skye ba snga ma la goms @100a * //
translated: And because that is not established without habituation, it is established that it is beginningless.

original: ba'i bag chags kyi rjes su 'gro bar mi 'dod pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: ba'i bag chags kyi rjes su 'gro bar mi 'dod pa de'i tshe /
translated: Moreover, if you do not accept that the thought that occurs at the beginning of the arising of the thought of a pot is in the nature of the habitual tendency of a previous thought,üîΩthen when the infant first sees a pot,

original: de gang gis bde ba sgrub par byed pa nu ma la sogs pa'i tshol ba dang / de ma rnyed pa na ngu bar rtsom la /
analyzed: de gang gis bde ba sgrub par byed pa nu ma la sogs pa'i tshol ba dang / de ma rnyed pa na ngu bar rtsom la /
translated: it would not search for the breast and so on, which would bring about its pleasure, and when it does not find it, it would not begin to cry.

original: rnyed na yang de ma thag tu du ba btang nas tha snyad la sogs pa'i bya ba byed pa der skyes pa'i byis pa dang dud 'gror song ba yang 'di ni bde ba'i sgrub par byed pa'o //
analyzed: rnyed na yang de ma thag tu du ba btang nas tha snyad la sogs pa'i bya ba byed pa der skyes pa'i byis pa dang dud 'gror song ba yang 'di ni bde ba'i sgrub par byed pa'o //
translated: If they were to find it, they would immediately smoke it out and use it for ordinary purposes.

original: 'di ni sdug bsngal gyi'o zhes zhen pa ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: 'di ni sdug bsngal gyi'o zhes zhen pa ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: How could a child or animal born in that place be attached to it, thinking, ‚ÄúThis is the cause of pleasure,‚Äù or ‚ÄúThis is the cause of pain‚Äù?

original: 'di res 'ga' nu ma la sogs pa bkres pas nyen pa nye bar zhi ba la sogs pa'i rgyu nyid du nyams su ma myong la /
analyzed: 'di res 'ga' nu ma la sogs pa bkres pas nyen pa nye bar zhi ba la sogs pa'i rgyu nyid du nyams su ma myong la /
translated: Sometimes the breast is not experienced as the cause of the relief of hunger and so on.

original: gang gis der skyes pa'i spre'u la sogs pa'i phru gu g-yang du lhung ba las byung ba'i sdug bsngal dran nas 'jigs te ma la shin tu 'thams par byed cing g-yang sa la sogs pa'i gnas kyang 'dor bar byed pa g-yang du lhung ba la sogs pa gnodüîΩpa'i rgyu nyid du nyams su myong ba yang ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gis der skyes pa'i spre'u la sogs pa'i phru gu g-yang du lhung ba las byung ba'i sdug bsngal dran nas 'jigs te ma la shin tu 'thams par byed cing g-yang sa la sogs pa'i gnas kyang 'dor bar byed pa g-yang du lhung ba la sogs pa gnodüîΩpa'i rgyu nyid du nyams su myong ba yang ma yin no //
translated: And sometimes the child of a monkey born in a ravine does not experience the breast as the cause of the pain of falling into the ravine, because it remembers the fear of falling into the ravine and clings tightly to its mother and avoids the edge of the ravine and so on.

original: 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa'i sgrub par byed pa'i 'bras bu nyams su ma myong ba de dag ni 'dor ba'am len par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa'i sgrub par byed pa'i 'bras bu nyams su ma myong ba de dag ni 'dor ba'am len par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: Those who have not experienced the results of the practice of what is desirable and what is not desirable do not reject or accept.

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it would follow, absurdly, that they would be omnipresent.

original: khab len gyis lcags 'dren pa'i dpe yang mi rigs pa nyid de de rgyu med pa nyid ni ma yin te /
analyzed: khab len gyis lcags 'dren pa'i dpe yang mi rigs pa nyid de de rgyu med pa nyid ni ma yin te /
translated: The example of the magnet is not correct, because it is not without a cause.

original: thams cad du yod pa la sogs par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad du yod pa la sogs par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it would follow, absurdly, that it would be present everywhere.

original: rgyu dang bcas pa nyid yin na yang ji ltar rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa grub pa'i kha ba len de'i rgyu nyid du bstan pa de'i spong ba dang len pa'i rjes su sgrub pa'i rgyur brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang bcas pa nyid yin na yang ji ltar rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa grub pa'i kha ba len de'i rgyu nyid du bstan pa de'i spong ba dang len pa'i rjes su sgrub pa'i rgyur brjod par bya'o //
translated: Even if it had a cause, just as the magnet is taught to be the cause of the attraction and repulsion of the iron, you must explain what the cause is of the attraction and repulsion of the practice.

original: goms pa ma gtogs pa 'di bstan par nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: goms pa ma gtogs pa 'di bstan par nus pa ma yin no //
translated: This cannot be taught except through the word habituation.

original: de lta bas na byis pa rnams kyis 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa len pa dang spong ba'i mtshan nyid kyi tha snyad 'di goms pa snga mas byas pa nyid yin no zhes bya bar grub ste /
analyzed: de lta bas na byis pa rnams kyis 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa len pa dang spong ba'i mtshan nyid kyi tha snyad 'di goms pa snga mas byas pa nyid yin no zhes bya bar grub ste /
translated: Thus it is established that the convention of accepting and rejecting, which is characterized by the acceptance of what is desirable and the rejection of what is undesirable, is created by the former habituation of childish beings.

original: blo thog ma med pa zhes bya bar dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: blo thog ma med pa zhes bya bar dgongs pa'o //
translated: The meaning is that the mind is beginningless.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: And it is said:

original: yid kyi blo ni rang dbang can //
analyzed: yid kyi blo ni rang dbang can //
translated: The mind of the intellect is independent.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / gzhan yang /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / gzhan yang /
translated: And also:

original: nu ma 'thung ba la sogs pa //
analyzed: nu ma 'thung ba la sogs pa //
translated: Sucking at the breast and so on.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa thun mong gi sun 'byin pa 'chad par 'gyur ba'i phyir spros pas chog go //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa thun mong gi sun 'byin pa 'chad par 'gyur ba'i phyir spros pas chog go //
translated: And so on. Since this is a common refutation, it will be explained later. Therefore, it is sufficient to have merely mentioned it.

original: gzhan yang de dag gi ste tshu rol mdzes pa pa rnams kyi skad cig ma nyid du khas blangs na rang gi khas blangs pa @100b ste rang gi grub pa'i mtha' dang 'gal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan yang de dag gi ste tshu rol mdzes pa pa rnams kyi skad cig ma nyid du khas blangs na rang gi khas blangs pa @100b ste rang gi grub pa'i mtha' dang 'gal bar 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, if the LokƒÅyatas accept momentariness, then they contradict their own tenets, that is, their own philosophical position.

original: 'byung ba rnams rtag pa nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'byung ba rnams rtag pa nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because they accept that the primary elements are permanent.

original: ci ste rigs pas 'ongs pa nyid kyi phyir skad cig ma nyid du khas len pa de'i tshe 'o na rnam par rig pa tsam nyid kyi tshul mchog tu gyur pa khas blang bar gyis shig de la yang khas len pa'i rgyu rigs pas 'ongs pa nyid du
analyzed: ci ste rigs pas 'ongs pa nyid kyi phyir skad cig ma nyid du khas len pa de'i tshe 'o na rnam par rig pa tsam nyid kyi tshul mchog tu gyur pa khas blang bar gyis shig de la yang khas len pa'i rgyu rigs pas 'ongs pa nyid du
translated: If you accept momentariness because it is reasonable, then you should accept the supreme method of vij√±aptimƒÅtra.

original: mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The reason for accepting it is the same, because it is reasonable.

original: ci ltar zhe na /üîΩde dag yan lag can bdag min //
analyzed: ci ltar zhe na / de dag yan lag can bdag min //
translated: How so?

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: They are not the whole, the self, etc.

original: de dag ces bya ba ni 'byung ba chen po rnams so //
analyzed: de dag ces bya ba ni 'byung ba chen po rnams so //
translated: Here, ‚Äúthey‚Äù refers to the great elements.

original: 'chad par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni de ma thag tu phyi rol gyi don brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: 'chad par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni de ma thag tu phyi rol gyi don brtag par bya'o //
translated: ‚ÄúWill be explained‚Äù means immediately below in the examination of external objects.

original: gal te 'byung pa dag med na 'o na ji ltar de dag snang zhe na /
analyzed: gal te 'byung pa dag med na 'o na ji ltar de dag snang zhe na /
translated: If the elements do not exist, then how do they appear?

original: phyi rol de nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: phyi rol de nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: External reality is just that, etc.

original: gzhan las min zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa las gzhan du phyi rol zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gzhan las min zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa las gzhan du phyi rol zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: ‚ÄúNot from another‚Äù means not from something external to consciousness.

original: 'o na ji ltar sa la sogs pa'i tha snyad 'jig rten dang bstan bcos dag la yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar sa la sogs pa'i tha snyad 'jig rten dang bstan bcos dag la yin zhe na /
translated: Well then, how do conventions such as earth exist in the world and in treatises?

original: rnam shes nyid kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rnam shes nyid kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The response is ‚ÄúConsciousness itself . . . ‚Äù

original: gal te 'byung ba dag med na 'o na ci zhig shes pa'i rgyu yin zhe na /
analyzed: gal te 'byung ba dag med na 'o na ci zhig shes pa'i rgyu yin zhe na /
translated: If the elements do not exist, then what is the cause of consciousness?

original: de tshe de las zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de tshe de las zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The response is ‚ÄúAt that time, from that . . . ‚Äù

original: shes pa de las gzhan ni 'byung ba chen po bzhi'o //
analyzed: shes pa de las gzhan ni 'byung ba chen po bzhi'o //
translated: From that consciousness, the other is the four great elements.

original: de ltar re zhig dang po'i sems 'byung ba tsam las byung ba ma yin no zhes bstan nas /üîΩda ni / gzhan gyi shes pa tsam las skyes //
analyzed: de ltar re zhig dang po'i sems 'byung ba tsam las byung ba ma yin no zhes bstan nas / da ni / gzhan gyi shes pa tsam las skyes //
translated: Thus, first it has been demonstrated that mind does not arise from the elements alone.

original: zhes bya ba'i phyogs 'di bsal bar bya ba'i phyir rgyud gzhan gyi ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i phyogs 'di bsal bar bya ba'i phyir rgyud gzhan gyi ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Now, in order to eliminate the position that mind arises from the mere consciousness of another, it is said, ‚ÄúThe mind of another . . . ‚Äù

original: ma la sogs pa dang 'brel pa'i rgyud gzhan gyi sems nye bar len pa'am /
analyzed: ma la sogs pa dang 'brel pa'i rgyud gzhan gyi sems nye bar len pa'am /
translated: The mind of another is a continuum that is related to a mother and so on.

original: lhan cig byed pa yin /
analyzed: lhan cig byed pa yin /
translated: It is a cooperative condition.

original: re zhig nye bar len pa'i rgyu ni ma yin te /
analyzed: re zhig nye bar len pa'i rgyu ni ma yin te /
translated: First, it is not a substantial cause.

original: bu'i shes pa'i rgyud la yang pha dang ma'i thos pa la sogs pa'i 'du byed las khyad par skye bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bu'i shes pa'i rgyud la yang pha dang ma'i thos pa la sogs pa'i 'du byed las khyad par skye bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: and also in the son‚Äôs consciousness, a special creation would result from the formative forces of the father and mother‚Äôs learning, etc.

original: dper na pha ma nyid kyi dang po dang phyi ma'i blo dag la bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na pha ma nyid kyi dang po dang phyi ma'i blo dag la bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the former and latter cognitions of the father and mother themselves.

original: gang gi phyir skad cig phyi ma dag la skad cig snga ma'i 'du byed rjes su 'jug pa gang yin pa 'di nye bar len pa dang nye bar blang ba'i chos rnam par gzhag pa yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir skad cig phyi ma dag la skad cig snga ma'i 'du byed rjes su 'jug pa gang yin pa 'di nye bar len pa dang nye bar blang ba'i chos rnam par gzhag pa yin te /
translated: Because this is the way in which the formative forces of the former moment follow in the subsequent moments, there is the establishment of the dharmas that are to be appropriated and that appropriate.

original: rang gi rgyud la rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa / dag gis nges pa'i phyir ro //üîΩci ste dper na sgron ma gcig las sgron ma gzhan skyed pa na ras la @101a * //
analyzed: rang gi rgyud la rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa / dag gis nges pa'i phyir ro // ci ste dper na sgron ma gcig las sgron ma gzhan skyed pa na ras la @101a * //
translated: For, they are ascertained by their conformity and non-conformity with their own continuum.

original: sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi snga ma'i sgron ma'i 'du byed kyis sgron ma phyi ma'i khyad par du 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi snga ma'i sgron ma'i 'du byed kyis sgron ma phyi ma'i khyad par du 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
translated: If, for example, another lamp is produced from one lamp, the formative forces of the former lamp, which have the nature of cloth, etc., do not cause a special creation of the subsequent lamp.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then?

original: 'du mi byed pa'i sgron ma tsam skye ba yin no //
analyzed: 'du mi byed pa'i sgron ma tsam skye ba yin no //
translated: The mere lamp is produced without formative force.

original: bud shing dang bcas pa la sogs pa gzhan las sgron ma gzhan de khyad par can yin pa de bzhin du bu'i blo yang yin no zhes bya bar 'dod na /
analyzed: bud shing dang bcas pa la sogs pa gzhan las sgron ma gzhan de khyad par can yin pa de bzhin du bu'i blo yang yin no zhes bya bar 'dod na /
translated: If you maintain that the lamp is different from the fuel, etc., and that the lamp is the special basis of the cognition of lamp, then the cognition of son would be different from the cognition of man.

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.

original: gang gi phyir sgron ma la sogs pa'i 'du byed re zhig rang gi rten la yang rgyun rjes su mi 'jug ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir sgron ma la sogs pa'i 'du byed re zhig rang gi rten la yang rgyun rjes su mi 'jug ste /
translated: Because the formations such as the lamp do not continue in a series in their own support,

original: de ni mi brtan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni mi brtan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is unstable.

original: 'di ltar bud shing 'grib pa na sgron ma de nyid chung bar mthong la /
analyzed: 'di ltar bud shing 'grib pa na sgron ma de nyid chung bar mthong la /
translated: Thus, when the fuel diminishes, the lamp is seen to be small.

original: de ltar thos pa la sogs pa'i 'du byed mi brtan pa na mi yin te /
analyzed: de ltar thos pa la sogs pa'i 'du byed mi brtan pa na mi yin te /
translated: In the same way, when the formations such as hearing are unstable, the man is not.

original: de ni dus yun ring du gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni dus yun ring du gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he remains for a long time.

original: des na sgron ma la sogs pa bzhin du 'du byed med pa'i blo tsam 'byung bar mi rigs so //
analyzed: des na sgron ma la sogs pa bzhin du 'du byed med pa'i blo tsam 'byung bar mi rigs so //
translated: Therefore, it is not reasonable that the cognition of man arises without the formations such as the lamp.

original: gzhan yang sgron ma la sogs pa la chos mang ba dang nyung ba'i rdul phra rab bsags pa skye ba'i phyir khyad par dang / khyad par med pa brtags pa yin gyi /
analyzed: gzhan yang sgron ma la sogs pa la chos mang ba dang nyung ba'i rdul phra rab bsags pa skye ba'i phyir khyad par dang / khyad par med pa brtags pa yin gyi /
translated: Moreover, the lamp and so on are investigated as being different or not different because of the accumulation of many or few subtle particles.

original: dngos po'i skad cig gcig po de la khyad par dang khyad par med pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po'i skad cig gcig po de la khyad par dang khyad par med pa yod pa ma yin no //
