translated: But difference and non-difference do not exist in that one moment of a thing.

original: 'dir dngos po skad cig gcig la ni ma'i blo thos pa la sogs pa'i 'du byed kyi khyad par du 'jug la /
analyzed: 'dir dngos po skad cig gcig la ni ma'i blo thos pa la sogs pa'i 'du byed kyi khyad par du 'jug la /
translated: Here, the cognition of the mother engages in the difference of the formative factors such as hearing and so on in relation to the one moment of the thing.

original: bu'i blo ni khyad par med par 'jug pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bu'i blo ni khyad par med par 'jug pa'i phyir /
translated: But the cognition of the son engages in the absence of difference.

original: gang zhig gang dang mtshungs pa yin /
analyzed: gang zhig gang dang mtshungs pa yin /
translated: So how can one be the same as the other?

original: gzhan yang nye bar len pa'i rgyu nyid yin na thal bar 'gyur ba 'di brjod kyi /
analyzed: gzhan yang nye bar len pa'i rgyu nyid yin na thal bar 'gyur ba 'di brjod kyi /
translated: Moreover, if it were the substantial cause, this consequence would be stated:

original: sgron ma gzhan ni sgron ma gzhan gyi nye bar len pa'i rgyu ma yin te /
analyzed: sgron ma gzhan ni sgron ma gzhan gyi nye bar len pa'i rgyu ma yin te /
translated: The other lamp is not the substantial cause of the other lamp.

original: rgyu tha dad pa'i phyir de ni ci yang ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyu tha dad pa'i phyir de ni ci yang ma yin no //
translated: Because they are different causes, it is nothing at all.

original: gzhan yang yang dag drod gsher las skyes pa ma nyid med pa de dag ni blo ci ltar blo gzhan las skyes pa yin /
analyzed: gzhan yang yang dag drod gsher las skyes pa ma nyid med pa de dag ni blo ci ltar blo gzhan las skyes pa yin /
translated: Moreover, if the other conditions such as the mother, father, and so on, are not real, how could consciousness arise from them?

original: zhar la 'ongs pas chog go //
analyzed: zhar la 'ongs pas chog go //
translated: Let us stop this digression.

original: ci ste lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu yin no zhes bya ba'i phyogs yin na /
analyzed: ci ste lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu yin no zhes bya ba'i phyogs yin na /
translated: If you maintain that the four conditions are coemergent causes,

original: de'i tshe grub pa la sgrub pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i tshe grub pa la sgrub pa yin no //
translated: then you are proving what is already established for us.

original: de'i phyir thog ma med pa nyid du bsgrub pa'i phyir tshad ma byed de /
analyzed: de'i phyir thog ma med pa nyid du bsgrub pa'i phyir tshad ma byed de /
translated: Therefore, the four conditions are not valid proofs for establishing the beginninglessness of cyclic existence.

original: sbyor ba ni rnam par shes pa dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed kyi phung po bzhi'i rang bzhin gyi dngos po de ni rang gi nye bar len pa'i stobs kyis byung ba yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni rnam par shes pa dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed kyi phung po bzhi'i rang bzhin gyi dngos po de ni rang gi nye bar len pa'i stobs kyis byung ba yin te /
translated: The syllogism is: ‚ÄúThe entity that is the nature of the four aggregates of consciousness, feeling, perception, and mental formations arises by the power of its own appropriation,

original: rnam par shes pa la sogs pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa la sogs pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: because it is consciousness and so on,

original: lang tsho la sogs pa'i gnas skabs dag tu phung po bzhi po de dag nyid yin no //
analyzed: lang tsho la sogs pa'i gnas skabs dag tu phung po bzhi po de dag nyid yin no //
translated: just like the four aggregates in the states of youth and so on.‚Äù

original: skye ba dang po'i sems la sogs pa'i tshogs kyang rnam par @101b shes pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: skye ba dang po'i sems la sogs pa'i tshogs kyang rnam par @101b shes pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: The collection of the first mind and so on also has the nature of consciousness and so on. This is a reason from nature.

original: de la dang po'i shes pa zhes bya ba smos pa ni mtshon pa ste /
analyzed: de la dang po'i shes pa zhes bya ba smos pa ni mtshon pa ste /
translated: Here, the phrase ‚Äúthe first consciousness‚Äù is used as an illustration.

original: tshor ba la sogs pa yang gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: tshor ba la sogs pa yang gzung bar bya'o //
translated: Feeling and so on should also be included.

original: bsgrub par bya ba las zlog pa la gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma smras pa ni /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba las zlog pa la gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma smras pa ni /
translated: The valid cognition that refutes the opposite of the probandum is stated as follows:

original: gzhan du rgyu gzhan zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan du rgyu gzhan zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúOtherwise, there would be no cause.‚Äù

original: yid rtag pa dang / dus dang / phyogs dang / dbang phyug la sogs pa gzhan dag sngar spangs pa'i phyir dang / rang gi nye bar len pa khas mi len pa na rgyu med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yid rtag pa dang / dus dang / phyogs dang / dbang phyug la sogs pa gzhan dag sngar spangs pa'i phyir dang / rang gi nye bar len pa khas mi len pa na rgyu med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Since other things such as a permanent mind, time, direction, ƒ™≈õvara, and so on have already been refuted, and since we do not accept that they are appropriated by the self, they would be causeless.

original: de lta yin dang rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid nges pa'i chos 'dir mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta yin dang rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid nges pa'i chos 'dir mi 'gyur te /
translated: If that were so, this phenomenon that has the characteristics of consciousness and so on would not exist.

original: glo bur ba'i rang bzhin ni nges par byed pa med pas so sor nges pa mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: glo bur ba'i rang bzhin ni nges par byed pa med pas so sor nges pa mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The nature of the adventitious is not suitable to be individually determined because it is not definite.

original: de'i phyir rgyu med pa nyid yin na rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i chos nges pa mi 'thad pa dang / res 'ga' ba nyid mi 'thad pa ni gnod pa can gyi tshad ma'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyu med pa nyid yin na rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i chos nges pa mi 'thad pa dang / res 'ga' ba nyid mi 'thad pa ni gnod pa can gyi tshad ma'o //
translated: Therefore, if it is causeless, the determination of phenomena such as consciousness is not tenable, and the untenability of being occasional is the valid cognition that contradicts.

original: de ltar 'das pa'i skye ba bsgrubs nas /
analyzed: de ltar 'das pa'i skye ba bsgrubs nas /
translated: Having thus established past birth,

original: ma 'ongs pa bsgrub pa'i phyir tshad ma byed pa ni 'chi ba'i skad cig ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa bsgrub pa'i phyir tshad ma byed pa ni 'chi ba'i skad cig ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: in order to establish the future, the valid cognition that is the means of establishing it is stated in ‚Äúthe moment of death‚Äù and so on.

original: gang 'dod chags dang bcas pa'i sems yin pa de ni rang gi nye bar blang bar bya ba'i sems gzhan bskyed par nus pa yin te /
analyzed: gang 'dod chags dang bcas pa'i sems yin pa de ni rang gi nye bar blang bar bya ba'i sems gzhan bskyed par nus pa yin te /
translated: Any mind that is conjoined with attachment is able to generate another mind that is its own appropriated object,

original: chags pa dang bcas pa'i phyir sngar gyi gnas skabs kyi sems bzhin no //
analyzed: chags pa dang bcas pa'i phyir sngar gyi gnas skabs kyi sems bzhin no //
translated: because it is conjoined with attachment, like the mind in a previous state.

original: 'chi ba'i sems kyang 'dod chags dang bcas pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: 'chi ba'i sems kyang 'dod chags dang bcas pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: The mind of death is conjoined with attachment is a natural reason.

original: gtan tshigs ma grub pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gtan tshigs ma grub pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is the reason unestablished.

original: gang 'dod chags la sogs pa'i gnyen po bdag med pa mthong ba dang bral ba'i sems de ni thams cad 'dod chags dang bcas pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: gang 'dod chags la sogs pa'i gnyen po bdag med pa mthong ba dang bral ba'i sems de ni thams cad 'dod chags dang bcas pa nyid yin te /
translated: The mind that is devoid of the vision of selflessness, which is the antidote to attachment and so on, is all attachment,

original: gnyen po dang bral ba'i phyir 'dod pa la gzo ba'i sems bzhin no //
analyzed: gnyen po dang bral ba'i phyir 'dod pa la gzo ba'i sems bzhin no //
translated: because it is devoid of the antidote, like the mind that is desirous of sense objects.

original: ma nges pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: ma nges pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it indeterminate,

original: sems gzhan skye ba'i rgyu ni de tsam yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems gzhan skye ba'i rgyu ni de tsam yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that is the extent of the cause of the arising of another mind.

original: de ltar rgyu ma tshang ba mi 'thad pa ni gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma'o //üîΩde nyid bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de ltar rgyu ma tshang ba mi 'thad pa ni gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma'o // de nyid bstan pa ni /
translated: Thus, the non-establishment of the cause is the invalidating valid cognition.

original: de 'dzin ngo bo gang gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de 'dzin ngo bo gang gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: That itself is shown by ‚ÄúBy what nature is it apprehended?‚Äù and so on.

original: de 'dzin zhes bya ba ni ngo bo rang bzhin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de 'dzin zhes bya ba ni ngo bo rang bzhin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: ‚ÄúApprehended‚Äù means by what nature, which is synonymous with ‚Äúby what essence.‚Äù

original: gzhan gyi phyogs la zhes bya ba la sogs pas sbyor ba gnyi ga la yang dpe bsgrub bya ma tshang ba nyid du rtsod par byed de /
analyzed: gzhan gyi phyogs la zhes bya ba la sogs pas sbyor ba gnyi ga la yang dpe bsgrub bya ma tshang ba nyid du rtsod par byed de /
translated: By ‚Äúin the opponent‚Äôs position‚Äù and so on, he argues that in both syllogisms the example is not established.

original: 'di ltar rang gi nye bar len pa las byung ba nyid dang / rang gi nye bar blangs pa bskyed par nus pa nyid @102a * //üîΩni ba sgrub par bya ba'i chos so //
analyzed: 'di ltar rang gi nye bar len pa las byung ba nyid dang / rang gi nye bar blangs pa bskyed par nus pa nyid @102a * // ni ba sgrub par bya ba'i chos so //
translated: Thus, the property to be established is that it arises from its own appropriation and that it is capable of producing its own appropriation.

original: gong gi ltar na rnam par shes pa rtag tu lus nyid las skye'o zhes lta ba de'i ltar na gong du yang ji skad bshad pa'i bsgrub bya'i chos dang ldan pa'i dpe ma grub pa'i phyir ji ltar da ltar ba'i rnam shes bzhin no //
analyzed: gong gi ltar na rnam par shes pa rtag tu lus nyid las skye'o zhes lta ba de'i ltar na gong du yang ji skad bshad pa'i bsgrub bya'i chos dang ldan pa'i dpe ma grub pa'i phyir ji ltar da ltar ba'i rnam shes bzhin no //
translated: If, as you say, consciousness always arises from the body, then the example you give is not established as having the property to be established, as explained above.

original: sngar gyi rnam par shes pa bzhin no zhes bya ba'i dpe 'di gnyis nye bar bkod pa yin no //üîΩskyon 'di ni med de sems rnams ni /üîΩcig car 'byung bar thal bar 'gyur //
analyzed: sngar gyi rnam par shes pa bzhin no zhes bya ba'i dpe 'di gnyis nye bar bkod pa yin no // skyon 'di ni med de sems rnams ni / cig car 'byung bar thal bar 'gyur //
translated: The two examples, ‚Äúlike present consciousness‚Äù and ‚Äúlike past consciousness,‚Äù are presented.üîΩThis error does not exist, because it has already been refuted that the body is the cause of consciousness.

original: zhes bya ba 'dis dang po nyid du lus rgyu nyid yin pa bkag zin to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'dis dang po nyid du lus rgyu nyid yin pa bkag zin to //
translated: The consequence is that many minds would arise simultaneously.

original: ltos par bya ba'i lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu tha dad pa med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: ltos par bya ba'i lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu tha dad pa med pa'i phyir te /
translated: The reason is that there is no difference in the simultaneous conditions.

original: rtag pa ltos par mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag pa ltos par mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is untenable that a permanent thing relies on another.

original: mi rtag pa'i phyogs la yang sngar bshad pa dang da lta'i sun 'byin pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: mi rtag pa'i phyogs la yang sngar bshad pa dang da lta'i sun 'byin pa nyid yin no //
translated: Also, in the case of the position that it is impermanent, the refutation has already been explained above and in the present.

original: khas blangs pa tsam gyis tshad mas grub pa yang ma grub pa nyid du rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: khas blangs pa tsam gyis tshad mas grub pa yang ma grub pa nyid du rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not reasonable that what is established by valid knowledge is not established merely by assertion,

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow that anything would not be established by anything.

original: de lta yin dang 'ga' yang 'ga' zhig gi yang sgrub par byed par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta yin dang 'ga' yang 'ga' zhig gi yang sgrub par byed par mi 'gyur te /
translated: If that were the case, nothing would establish anything,

original: ci skad du /
analyzed: ci skad du /
translated: as it is said:

original: mi 'dod skyon kun ma yin no //üîΩzhes bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: mi 'dod skyon kun ma yin no // zhes bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is not all faults that are not accepted.‚Äù

original: gzhan yang gang gi tshe gzo ba'i sems kyi de ma thag tu dran pa dang / de bzhin du mi sdug pa la sogs pa'i sems las 'dod chags skye bar nges pa yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang gang gi tshe gzo ba'i sems kyi de ma thag tu dran pa dang / de bzhin du mi sdug pa la sogs pa'i sems las 'dod chags skye bar nges pa yin te /
translated: Moreover, when a mind that is skilled in crafts arises, it is certain that memory arises immediately after it, and likewise attachment definitely arises from a mind of repulsiveness and so on.

original: 'di ltar de ni gzugs mdzes pa zhes bya ba dang / dar la bab pa zhes bya ba dang / sked pa phra ba zhes bya ba dang / g-yo med pa zhes bya ba dang / bsgo ba nyan pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa sdug par sems pa'i chags pa can rnams la 'dod chags skye'o //üîΩde bzhin du bdag la gnod par byas so //üîΩgnod pa byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar de ni gzugs mdzes pa zhes bya ba dang / dar la bab pa zhes bya ba dang / sked pa phra ba zhes bya ba dang / g-yo med pa zhes bya ba dang / bsgo ba nyan pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa sdug par sems pa'i chags pa can rnams la 'dod chags skye'o // de bzhin du bdag la gnod par byas so // gnod pa byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, desire arises in those who are attached to the idea of beauty, youth, slenderness, fidelity, and obedience, etc.

original: 'dis bdag la gnod pa byed do zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sems las zhe sdang 'byung bar nges so //
analyzed: 'dis bdag la gnod pa byed do zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sems las zhe sdang 'byung bar nges so //
translated: Similarly, hatred arises from the idea that someone has harmed me, is harming me, or will harm me.

original: mngon sum tsam smra bas khyad par du de ji ltar bsnyon par nus /
analyzed: mngon sum tsam smra bas khyad par du de ji ltar bsnyon par nus /
translated: How can the mere assertion of direct perception be refuted?

original: de bzhin du sngar byung ba'i thos pa dang bzo la sogs pa goms pa'i khyad par dang 'phel ba dang 'grib pa dag gis blo phyi ma 'phel ba dang 'greb  par mthong ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du sngar byung ba'i thos pa dang bzo la sogs pa goms pa'i khyad par dang 'phel ba dang 'grib pa dag gis blo phyi ma 'phel ba dang 'greb  par mthong ngo //
translated: Similarly, we see that the mind increases and decreases through the increase and decrease of the special practice of learning, art, etc.

original: de bzhin du don gzhan la yengs pas yid la byed pa mi mthun pas don gzhan mi 'dzin par mthong ba'i phyir shes pa'i rgyu shes pa nyid rigs pa dang ldan pa yin pa'i phyir brtsad par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du don gzhan la yengs pas yid la byed pa mi mthun pas don gzhan mi 'dzin par mthong ba'i phyir shes pa'i rgyu shes pa nyid rigs pa dang ldan pa yin pa'i phyir brtsad par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: Likewise, because it is seen that the mind does not apprehend another object when it is distracted by another object, and because it is reasonable that consciousness itself is the cause of consciousness, this is not a matter for debate.

original: 'byung ba rnams ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'byung ba rnams ni ma yin te /
translated: The elements are not the cause of consciousness,

original: rigs pa dang 'gal ba'i phyir @102b ro //
analyzed: rigs pa dang 'gal ba'i phyir @102b ro //
translated: because that contradicts reason.

original: de nyid kyi phyir shes pa nyid shes pa'i rgyu yin par bstan pa'i phyir ro //üîΩrtsod pa'i gzhir sems dang ces bya ba la sogs pa'i sbyor ba dang po la /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir shes pa nyid shes pa'i rgyu yin par bstan pa'i phyir ro // rtsod pa'i gzhir sems dang ces bya ba la sogs pa'i sbyor ba dang po la /
translated: For that very reason, in order to demonstrate that consciousness itself is the cause of consciousness, he says:

original: tha dad lus la gnas pa'i phyir //
analyzed: tha dad lus la gnas pa'i phyir //
translated: In the first syllogism, ‚Äúbecause they exist in different bodies,‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs ma grub pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs ma grub pa nyid yin te /
translated: the reason is unestablished.

original: re zhig gal te 'jug pa brten pa'i mtshan nyid du mngon par 'dod na lhung ba med pa'i chos can gyi sems de ni /
analyzed: re zhig gal te 'jug pa brten pa'i mtshan nyid du mngon par 'dod na lhung ba med pa'i chos can gyi sems de ni /
translated: If you assert that the mind is characterized by engagement, then that mind, which is characterized by nonfalling,

original: lus la shin tu yang ma grub ste /
analyzed: lus la shin tu yang ma grub ste /
translated: is not at all established in the body.

original: de'i rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po yin na yang sems lus can ma yin pa nyid kyis mi ltung ba'i chos can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po yin na yang sems lus can ma yin pa nyid kyis mi ltung ba'i chos can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And even if it were the cause and effect of the body, the mind, being non-material, would not fall.

original: ltung ba med pa'i chos can yang brten par rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ltung ba med pa'i chos can yang brten par rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it logical that the non-falling is the support,

original: cung zad kyang mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: cung zad kyang mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it does not perform any function whatsoever.

original: 'o na chu la sogs pa ci zhig byed na brten par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na chu la sogs pa ci zhig byed na brten par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What function does water, etc. perform that it is the support?

original: chu la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: chu la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúWater, etc.

original: rang bzhin gyis lus can rang gi nye bar len pa'i yul yongs su spangs nas skye ba nye bar len pa'i yul du skye ba'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis lus can rang gi nye bar len pa'i yul yongs su spangs nas skye ba nye bar len pa'i yul du skye ba'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: are the cause of the birth of the body, which is material by nature, after the body has abandoned its own appropriated place and is about to appropriate a place of birth.

original: lhung ba'i gegs byed pas rten du rnam par gzhag gi / lus can ma yin pa ni de ltar rnam par gzhag par nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: lhung ba'i gegs byed pas rten du rnam par gzhag gi / lus can ma yin pa ni de ltar rnam par gzhag par nus pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, they are posited as supports because they prevent the body from falling, but the non-material cannot be posited in this way.

original: ci ste de'i bdag nyid kyi mtshan nyid 'jug par mngon par 'dod na de yang ma grub po //
analyzed: ci ste de'i bdag nyid kyi mtshan nyid 'jug par mngon par 'dod na de yang ma grub po //
translated: But if you maintain that the characteristic of its own nature engages, that is also unestablished.

original: phyi rol gyi don la mngon par zhen pa khyed cag gis rnam par shes pa lus kyi bdag nyid yin no zhes ni brjod par rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don la mngon par zhen pa khyed cag gis rnam par shes pa lus kyi bdag nyid yin no zhes ni brjod par rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: You who are attached to external objects should not say that consciousness is the nature of the body.

original: rnam par shes pa tsam du smra ba nged cag la ni rigs te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa tsam du smra ba nged cag la ni rigs te /
translated: It is reasonable for us who are Proponents of Consciousness

original: lus ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: lus ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: because the body is the nature of the foundation consciousness.

original: ci'i phyir mi rigs she na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir mi rigs she na /
translated: Why is it unreasonable?

original: de'i bdag nyid yin na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid yin na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: If it were of the nature of that, etc.

original: 'di ltar lus bzung ba na gzhan gyi 'dod chags la sogs pa yang 'dzin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di ltar lus bzung ba na gzhan gyi 'dod chags la sogs pa yang 'dzin par 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, when the body is grasped, the attachment of others would also be grasped

original: tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are not different.

original: dug gi nus pas ma nges pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: dug gi nus pas ma nges pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it uncertain due to the power of poison,

original: de ni de'i tshe mngon sum ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni de'i tshe mngon sum ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because at that time it is not direct perception.

original: sems pa can ni mngon sum ma yin te /
analyzed: sems pa can ni mngon sum ma yin te /
translated: The sentient being is not direct perception,

original: bdag nyid kyis kyang mi 'dzin par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyis kyang mi 'dzin par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow that it is not grasped even by itself.

original: gzhan yang gang dag gnyi gas nges pa dang gcig gis nges pa de dag ni tha dad pa yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang gang dag gnyi gas nges pa dang gcig gis nges pa de dag ni tha dad pa yin te /
translated: Moreover, those that are ascertained by both and those that are ascertained by one are different.

original: dper na pho gzer dang zlos gar bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na pho gzer dang zlos gar bzhin no //
translated: For example, like a man and a woman, or a dancer.

original: lus dang sems kyang gnyi ga dang gcig gis nges pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //üîΩrang nyid ces bya @103a * //
analyzed: lus dang sems kyang gnyi ga dang gcig gis nges pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so // rang nyid ces bya @103a * //
translated: The body and mind are ascertained by both and by one. This is a natural inference.

original: ba ni bdag nyid kyis so //
analyzed: ba ni bdag nyid kyis so //
translated: ‚ÄúBy itself‚Äù means by itself.

original: gal te de lta na gtan tshigs 'di nyid kyi rnam par shes pa tsam du smra ba spong bar byed pa bzlog par dka' bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de lta na gtan tshigs 'di nyid kyi rnam par shes pa tsam du smra ba spong bar byed pa bzlog par dka' bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If it is like that, this very inference is difficult to stop for the proponent of consciousness only.

original: de'i phyir / shes pa gnyis med ces bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / shes pa gnyis med ces bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it says ‚Äúnon-dual consciousness.‚Äù

original: gtan tshigs ma grub pa nyid kyi skyon du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: gtan tshigs ma grub pa nyid kyi skyon du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: The fault of the reason being unestablished would arise. This is the meaning.

original: 'di ltar gnyis kas nges pa nyid ni rnam par shes par smra ba yang ma grub ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar gnyis kas nges pa nyid ni rnam par shes par smra ba yang ma grub ste /
translated: Thus, even for the proponent of consciousness, the establishment of ascertainment by both is not established.

original: thams cad du rang gi snang ba kho na rig pa'i phyir rab rib can gyis zla ba gnyis mthong ba bzhin no //
analyzed: thams cad du rang gi snang ba kho na rig pa'i phyir rab rib can gyis zla ba gnyis mthong ba bzhin no //
translated: Because it is the case that one‚Äôs own appearances are cognized everywhere, just like the two moons seen by one with myodesopsia.

original: gzhan yang skad cig gzhan spyod pa'i dus na sems pa med par skye ba'i de ma thag tu 'jig par mtshon te /
analyzed: gzhan yang skad cig gzhan spyod pa'i dus na sems pa med par skye ba'i de ma thag tu 'jig par mtshon te /
translated: Moreover, when the other moment is engaged, the mind is generated without thought, and it is indicated that it is destroyed immediately after arising.

original: de lta yin dang lus de'i ngo bo nyid du khas len na skad cig ma nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta yin dang lus de'i ngo bo nyid du khas len na skad cig ma nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If that is the case, then if one accepts that it is the entity of that body, it follows that it is momentary.

original: de ltar re zhig 'jug pa de'i bdag nyid kyi mtshan nyid du ma grub bo //
analyzed: de ltar re zhig 'jug pa de'i bdag nyid kyi mtshan nyid du ma grub bo //
translated: Thus, to begin with, it is not established as the characteristic of the nature of engagement.

original: ci ste 'jug pa de las byung ba'i mtshan nyid yin na yid kyi rnam par shes pa de las byung ba de yang dper na mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa la mig la sogs pa la brten pa ltar de la brten pa'i sgo nas sam /
analyzed: ci ste 'jug pa de las byung ba'i mtshan nyid yin na yid kyi rnam par shes pa de las byung ba de yang dper na mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa la mig la sogs pa la brten pa ltar de la brten pa'i sgo nas sam /
translated: But if it is the characteristic of the origin of that engagement, then that origin of the mental consciousness, just as the visual consciousness and so on are based on the eyes and so forth, is based on that.

original: dper na du ba me la mi 'khrul pa bzhin du de la mi 'khrul pa las yin te /
analyzed: dper na du ba me la mi 'khrul pa bzhin du de la mi 'khrul pa las yin te /
translated: Or, like smoke that is not mistaken with regard to fire, it is not mistaken with regard to that.

original: de'i phyir 'di la 'jug pa rnam pa gnyi ga yang ma grub ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di la 'jug pa rnam pa gnyi ga yang ma grub ste /
translated: Therefore, neither of the two ways of entering is established in this case.

original: 'di ltar yid kyi blo dbang po'i blo bzhin du lus la brten pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar yid kyi blo dbang po'i blo bzhin du lus la brten pa ma yin te /
translated: Thus, the mental cognition is not based on the body, like the sense cognitions,

original: dngos su nges par 'gyur ba'i rjes su mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos su nges par 'gyur ba'i rjes su mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it does not follow the body in its transformation.

original: de med na mi 'byung ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de med na mi 'byung ba yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it that it does not occur without the body,

original: gzugs med pa'i khams su lus med par yang yod par khas len pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams su lus med par yang yod par khas len pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is accepted that it exists in the formless realm without a body.

original: gtan tshigs grub par khas blangs pa de lta na yang gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid du bshad pa /üîΩde la brten nas 'byung ba'am /
analyzed: gtan tshigs grub par khas blangs pa de lta na yang gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid du bshad pa / de la brten nas 'byung ba'am /
translated: Even if you accept that the reason is established, it is explained that the reason is not established:üîΩBecause it arises in dependence on that,

original: de dag 'khrul pa med pa'i phyir //üîΩzhes bya ste /
analyzed: de dag 'khrul pa med pa'i phyir // zhes bya ste /
translated: or because it is not mistaken.

original: 'di ltar lus tha dad pa la 'jug pa dang sems gzhan dang mtshams sbyor ba 'gal ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar lus tha dad pa la 'jug pa dang sems gzhan dang mtshams sbyor ba 'gal ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus, there is no contradiction in having different bodies and connecting with different minds.

original: dper na 'chi ba'i skad cig las snga ma'i gnas skabs gson pa'i gnas skabs na 'byung ba'i rnam par shes pa nyid mtshams sbyor bar byed pa de bzhin du lus skad cig ma nyid yin pa'i phyir lus tha dad pa la 'jug pa yang yin pa'i phyir gtan
analyzed: dper na 'chi ba'i skad cig las snga ma'i gnas skabs gson pa'i gnas skabs na 'byung ba'i rnam par shes pa nyid mtshams sbyor bar byed pa de bzhin du lus skad cig ma nyid yin pa'i phyir lus tha dad pa la 'jug pa yang yin pa'i phyir gtan
translated: In the same way, because the body is momentary, it is also the case that the body is different.

original: tshigs ma nges pa yin no //
analyzed: tshigs ma nges pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, your reason is not established.

original: yang rgyud gcig pa nyid kyis lus tha mi dad pa'i phyir tha mi dad pa'i lus la 'jug pa nyid du rtogs na de'i tshe srid pa bar ma'i lus la yang mtshungs so //
analyzed: yang rgyud gcig pa nyid kyis lus tha mi dad pa'i phyir tha mi dad pa'i lus la 'jug pa nyid du rtogs na de'i tshe srid pa bar ma'i lus la yang mtshungs so //
translated: Moreover, if you think that the body is not different because it is a single continuum, then the body of the intermediate existence would be the same.

original: 'di ltar skye mched @103b lnga'i mtshan nyid kyi rgyun tshe 'di'i lus dang phyi ma'i lus zhes bya ba 'di'i gnas skabs tha dad pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar skye mched @103b lnga'i mtshan nyid kyi rgyun tshe 'di'i lus dang phyi ma'i lus zhes bya ba 'di'i gnas skabs tha dad pa nyid yin te /
translated: Thus, the continuum that has the characteristic of the five aggregates is called the body of this life and the body of the next life. It is different in different states,

original: byis pa dang rgan po'i gnas skabs kyi dbye ba bzhin no //
analyzed: byis pa dang rgan po'i gnas skabs kyi dbye ba bzhin no //
translated: like the states of childhood and old age.

original: sbyor ba gnyis pa la yang shes pa yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs 'di bsgrub par bya ba las bzlog pa la gnod pa can gyi tshad ma bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sbyor ba gnyis pa la yang shes pa yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs 'di bsgrub par bya ba las bzlog pa la gnod pa can gyi tshad ma bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In the second syllogism, the reason ‚Äúbecause it is consciousness‚Äù is stated to show that the subject, the object of refutation by reasons, is invalidated by valid reasonings that refute the opposite of the probandum.

original: ma nges pa nyid du gsal bas ma brjod do //üîΩchags dang bcas pa'i 'chi ka'i sems //
analyzed: ma nges pa nyid du gsal bas ma brjod do // chags dang bcas pa'i 'chi ka'i sems //
translated: In the second syllogism, the reason ‚Äúbecause it is a consciousness‚Äù is not definite, because it is not established that the subject of the proposition is the opposite of the probandum.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas sbyor ba gsum pa'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas sbyor ba gsum pa'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: The third syllogism is stated in the lines beginning ‚ÄúThe mind at the death of one who is desirous . . .‚ÄùüîΩThe line ‚ÄúThe mind of one who has exhausted defilements . . .‚Äù

original: zag pa zad pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zag pa zad pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: refutes the reason ‚Äúbecause it is a consciousness‚Äù in the second syllogism.

original: gang la sems gzhan dang mtshams sbyor ba med pa de ni mtshams mi sbyor ba'o //üîΩ'dis ni bsgrub bya'i chos can gyi dpe gang yang rung ba lam grub pa bshad de /
analyzed: gang la sems gzhan dang mtshams sbyor ba med pa de ni mtshams mi sbyor ba'o // 'dis ni bsgrub bya'i chos can gyi dpe gang yang rung ba lam grub pa bshad de /
translated: The mind of one who has exhausted defilements does not link with another mind.

original: 'di ltar tshu rol mdzes pa bas //üîΩdgra bcom pa yi 'chi ba'i sems //
analyzed: 'di ltar tshu rol mdzes pa bas // dgra bcom pa yi 'chi ba'i sems //
translated: This explains the establishment of the example of the subject of the proposition in the third syllogism.üîΩThe example is stated in the lines beginning ‚ÄúThe mind of an arhat at death . . .‚Äù

original: sems gzhan dang mtshams mi sbyor ro //
analyzed: sems gzhan dang mtshams mi sbyor ro //
translated: The mind of an arhat at death does not link with another mind.

original: zhes bya ba gang las nges //
analyzed: zhes bya ba gang las nges //
translated: How is this known?

original: ci ste yang gzhan sangs rgyas pa'i grub pa'i mtha' khas blangs pa las te /
analyzed: ci ste yang gzhan sangs rgyas pa'i grub pa'i mtha' khas blangs pa las te /
translated: But if you think that one should establish the non-linking of the aggregates by accepting the tenets of another school,

original: bdag gi skye ba ni zad do //
analyzed: bdag gi skye ba ni zad do //
translated: the Buddha said, ‚ÄúMy births have been exhausted.

original: tshangs par spyod pa ni spyad do //
analyzed: tshangs par spyod pa ni spyad do //
translated: I have practiced pure conduct.

original: bya ba ni byas so //
analyzed: bya ba ni byas so //
translated: I have done what had to be done.üîΩI know of no other existence after this one.‚Äù

original: 'di las srid pa gzhan mi shes so zhes bya bas mtshams mi sbyor bar bsgrub po snyam na de ni rigs pa ma yin te /üîΩgzhan gyi grub pa'i mtha' tshad ma nyid du ma bzung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di las srid pa gzhan mi shes so zhes bya bas mtshams mi sbyor bar bsgrub po snyam na de ni rigs pa ma yin te / gzhan gyi grub pa'i mtha' tshad ma nyid du ma bzung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: That is illogical, because you do not accept the tenets of another school as valid.

original: 'jig rten rgyang pa na pa tshad ma nyid du yongs su ma bzung ba de las ji ltar nges te /
analyzed: 'jig rten rgyang pa na pa tshad ma nyid du yongs su ma bzung ba de las ji ltar nges te /
translated: How could you ascertain the non-existence of other worlds through a non-Buddhist school whose tenets are not valid?

original: 'jig rten pha rol yang nges par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol yang nges par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It would follow, absurdly, that you could ascertain the existence of other worlds as well.

original: ci ste tshad ma gzhan kho na las rtogs na 'o na de nyid ci'i phyir sgrub par byed par mi brjod /
analyzed: ci ste tshad ma gzhan kho na las rtogs na 'o na de nyid ci'i phyir sgrub par byed par mi brjod /
translated: If you think that you understand it through another valid cognition, then why do you not state that it is established by that very valid cognition?

original: go bar byed pa ma yin pa rmongs pas bstan pa nye bar bkod pas ci zhig bya ste /
analyzed: go bar byed pa ma yin pa rmongs pas bstan pa nye bar bkod pas ci zhig bya ste /
translated: What is the point of citing a non-understanding, confused person as a source?

original: gang gis de brjod par mi bya ba de sgrub par byed pa ma yin pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gis de brjod par mi bya ba de sgrub par byed pa ma yin pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not the case that what is not established does not express that.

original: grub pa'i mtha' la brten na yang sangs rgyas pa 'ga' zhig la bsgrub par bya ba'i chos dang ldan pa'i dpe mi 'grub po zhes bya ba bstan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' la brten na yang sangs rgyas pa 'ga' zhig la bsgrub par bya ba'i chos dang ldan pa'i dpe mi 'grub po zhes bya ba bstan pa'i phyir //
translated: Even if one relies on tenets, it is not the case that no example endowed with the property of the probandum is established for some Buddhists.üîΩIn order to demonstrate this, he says:

original: gang dag 'di la blo bzangs 'ga' //
analyzed: gang dag 'di la blo bzangs 'ga' //
translated: Some who are intelligent with regard to thisüîΩ.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The above is stated.üîΩ

original: 'di la zhes bya ba ni bde bar gshegs pa'i gsung rab la'o //
analyzed: 'di la zhes bya ba ni bde bar gshegs pa'i gsung rab la'o //
translated: With regard to this means with regard to the scriptures of the Sugata.

original: blo bzangs zhes bya ba ni theg pa chen po pa dag go //
analyzed: blo bzangs zhes bya ba ni theg pa chen po pa dag go //
translated: Those who are intelligent means those of the Mahayana.

original: 'ga' zhes bya ba ni dbu ma pa rnams so //
analyzed: 'ga' zhes bya ba ni dbu ma pa rnams so //
translated: Some means the Madhyamikas.

original: de dag ni sangs rgyas rnams mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das par smra ste /üîΩ'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa dag @104a * //
analyzed: de dag ni sangs rgyas rnams mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das par smra ste / 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa dag @104a * //
translated: They say that the Buddhas are in a nirvana that is not a nonabode,

original: la mi gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: la mi gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they do not abide in either samsara or nirvana.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa dag kyang /
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa dag kyang /
translated: The vehicles of the sravakas and pratyekabuddhas

original: sangs rgyas kyi theg pa gcig gi mthar thug pa smra ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi theg pa gcig gi mthar thug pa smra ste /
translated: They also claim that there is a single vehicle in the end.

original: theg pa ni 'di ni gcig kho na ste /
analyzed: theg pa ni 'di ni gcig kho na ste /
translated: There is only one vehicle,

original: 'di lta ste theg pa chen po'o zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di lta ste theg pa chen po'o zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: namely, the Great Vehicle.

original: de ltar dpe'i nyes pa bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar dpe'i nyes pa bstan nas /
translated: Thus, having demonstrated the fault of the example,

original: sgrub par byed pa'i skyon ma nges pa nyid ni /
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa'i skyon ma nges pa nyid ni /
translated: the fault of the proof, namely, uncertainty, is stated:üîΩBecause no contradiction has been stated.

original: gnod pa can yang ma brjod phyir //
analyzed: gnod pa can yang ma brjod phyir //
translated: Because no contradiction has been stated.

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: This is the reason.

original: gnod pa can yang ma brjod phyir //üîΩzhes bya ba ni /üîΩzlog pa la ni the tshom za //üîΩzhes bya ba 'di gtan tshigs yin la /
analyzed: gnod pa can yang ma brjod phyir // zhes bya ba ni / zlog pa la ni the tshom za // zhes bya ba 'di gtan tshigs yin la /
translated: The reason is uncertain because it is present when there is the negatee and also present when there is no negatee.üîΩThe reason is uncertain because it is present when there is the negatee and also present when there is no negatee.üîΩThe reason is uncertain because it is present when there is the negatee and also present when there is no negatee.üîΩThe reason is uncertain because it is present when there is the negatee and also present when there is no negatee.

original: rigs mi mthun pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'khrul pa can gyi gtan tshigs yin no //
analyzed: rigs mi mthun pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'khrul pa can gyi gtan tshigs yin no //
translated: The reason is uncertain because it is present when there is the negatee and also present when there is no negatee.

original: rigs mi mthun pa la yod pa ni rigs mi mthun pa la yod pa'o //üîΩgang zhe na gtan tshigs so zhes bya bar go'o //
analyzed: rigs mi mthun pa la yod pa ni rigs mi mthun pa la yod pa'o // gang zhe na gtan tshigs so zhes bya bar go'o //
translated: The reason is uncertain because it is present when there is the negatee and also present when there is no negatee.üîΩThe reason is uncertain because it is present when there is the negatee and also present when there is no negatee.üîΩThe reason is uncertain because it is present when there is the negatee and also present when there is no negatee.üîΩThe reason is uncertain because it is present when there is the negatee and also present when there is no negatee.üîΩThe reason is uncertain because it is present when there is the negatee and also present when there is no negatee.üîΩThe reason is uncertain because it is present when there is the negatee and also present when there is no negatee.üîΩThe reason is uncertain because it is present when there is the negatee and also present when there is no negatee.üîΩThe reason is uncertain because it is present when there is the negatee and also present when there is no negatee.üîΩThe reason is uncertain because it is present when there is the negatee and also present when there is no negatee.üîΩThe reason is uncertain because it is present when there is the negatee and also present when there is no negatee.üîΩThe reason is uncertain because it is present when there is the negatee and also present when there is no negatee.

original: 'di ni dgos pa yang yin la rigs mi mthun pa la yod pa yang yin no zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'di ni dgos pa yang yin la rigs mi mthun pa la yod pa yang yin no zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: The reason is uncertain because it is present when there is the negatee and also present when there is no negatee.üîΩThe reason is uncertain because it is present when there

original: mi 'chi ba nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba gnod pa can gyi tshad ma yin te /
analyzed: mi 'chi ba nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba gnod pa can gyi tshad ma yin te /
translated: The valid cognition that refutes that is the fact that a person does not die.

original: don dam par bdag la sogs pa 'ga' yang 'chi bar mi 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: don dam par bdag la sogs pa 'ga' yang 'chi bar mi 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
translated: This is because ultimately no person and so on dies.

original: rgyun mi 'dra ba'i khyad par skye ba sna skal ba mnyam par brjod pa'i khyad par can gyi rigs mi mthun pa'i gnas skabs kyi khyad par zhig pa'i phyir 'jig rten na bstan bcos de la de skad du tha snyad byed pa 'ba' zhig tu zad do //üîΩnur nur sogs las shes yod pa //
analyzed: rgyun mi 'dra ba'i khyad par skye ba sna skal ba mnyam par brjod pa'i khyad par can gyi rigs mi mthun pa'i gnas skabs kyi khyad par zhig pa'i phyir 'jig rten na bstan bcos de la de skad du tha snyad byed pa 'ba' zhig tu zad do // nur nur sogs las shes yod pa //
translated: The treatise is called that because it is a treatise that sets forth the mere cessation of the specific states of the dissimilar types of continuity that are distinguished by the specific features of the different stages of development, such as kalala.

original: zhes bya ba 'di yang gzu lums yin /üîΩzhes gang smras pa de la //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di yang gzu lums yin / zhes gang smras pa de la //
translated: The statement ‚ÄúIt is illogical to say that consciousness exists in the kalala and so on‚Äù is also rash.

original: nur nur sogs la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: nur nur sogs la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In response to that, the root text says, ‚ÄúIt is illogical to say that consciousness exists in the kalala and so on,‚Äù and so on.

original: gal te shes pa thams cad dbang po dang don gyi stobs kyis skye bar 'gyur na de'i tshe gzu lums su 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te shes pa thams cad dbang po dang don gyi stobs kyis skye bar 'gyur na de'i tshe gzu lums su 'gyur na /
translated: If all consciousnesses arise through the power of the sense faculties and objects, then it would be rash.

original: 'di ltar rmi lam la sogs pa'i gnas skabs na mig la sogs pa'i dbang po dang gzugs la sogs pa'i don med par yang sngon po la sogs pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa yang dag par rig pa yin na /
analyzed: 'di ltar rmi lam la sogs pa'i gnas skabs na mig la sogs pa'i dbang po dang gzugs la sogs pa'i don med par yang sngon po la sogs pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa yang dag par rig pa yin na /
translated: Thus, when one is in a dream state, etc., even though there is no sense-object such as form, etc., and no sense-faculty such as the eye, etc., the mental consciousness of blue, etc. is still cognized.

original: de de'i tshe lus kyi dbang po la brten pa yin no zhes kyang brjod par mi nus te /
analyzed: de de'i tshe lus kyi dbang po la brten pa yin no zhes kyang brjod par mi nus te /
translated: But it cannot be said that at that time it is based on the body sense-faculty,

original: sngon po la sogs par snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngon po la sogs par snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it appears as blue, etc.

original: lus kyi rnam par shes pa'i yul yang reg bya yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus kyi rnam par shes pa'i yul yang reg bya yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And the object of the body consciousness is a tangible object.

original: de lta bas na rnam par shes pa thams cad don rtogs pa'i ngo bo ma yin no zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de lta bas na rnam par shes pa thams cad don rtogs pa'i ngo bo ma yin no zhes bstan to //
translated: Therefore, it is shown that not all consciousnesses have the nature of cognizing objects.

original: de'i phyir brgyal ba'i gnas skabs na yang rnam par shes pa yod pa mi 'gal lo //
analyzed: de'i phyir brgyal ba'i gnas skabs na yang rnam par shes pa yod pa mi 'gal lo //
translated: Therefore, it is not contradictory that consciousness exists even in a state of fainting.

original: yang @104b ci ste rnam par shes pa nus pa'i ngo bos yod pa mi 'gal la /
analyzed: yang @104b ci ste rnam par shes pa nus pa'i ngo bos yod pa mi 'gal la /
translated: But if you think that it is not contradictory that consciousness exists by the nature of potentiality,

original: rang gi ngo bos ni 'gal ba yin no snyam na /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bos ni 'gal ba yin no snyam na /
translated: but it is contradictory that it exists by its own nature,

original: de tshe blo ni zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de tshe blo ni zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: then the root text states, ‚ÄúAt that time, the mind . . .‚Äù

original: gal te gnyid log pa dang brgyal ba dang ra ro ba'i gnas skabs na sems med do zhes nges par byed pa'i tshad ma cung zad kyang yod par gyur na 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te gnyid log pa dang brgyal ba dang ra ro ba'i gnas skabs na sems med do zhes nges par byed pa'i tshad ma cung zad kyang yod par gyur na 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If there were even the slightest valid cognition that ascertained that there is no mind in the states of sleep, fainting, or intoxication, then there would be a contradiction.

original: nges par byed pa'i tshad ma rang rig pa ma dmigs pa yod do zhe na /
analyzed: nges par byed pa'i tshad ma rang rig pa ma dmigs pa yod do zhe na /
translated: You may say, ‚ÄúThere is the non-observation of reflexive awareness, which is a valid cognition that ascertains that.‚Äù

original: rang rig pa mi dmigs pa gang las grub /
analyzed: rang rig pa mi dmigs pa gang las grub /
translated: What establishes the non-observation of reflexive awareness?

original: gnas skabs der rig pa med pa'i nges pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gnas skabs der rig pa med pa'i nges pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: There is no certainty that there is no awareness in those states.

original: gal te brgyal ba la sogs pa'i gnas skabs de dag tu khyod la sems rig pa med do zhes de lta bu'i rig pa 'jug pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gal te brgyal ba la sogs pa'i gnas skabs de dag tu khyod la sems rig pa med do zhes de lta bu'i rig pa 'jug pa de'i tshe /
translated: If, in those states of fainting and so on, you have the engagement of the awareness that thinks, ‚ÄúMy mind is not aware,‚Äù

original: de ltar 'jug pa'i nges pa de nyid kyis sems dang bcas pa nyid du grub po //
analyzed: de ltar 'jug pa'i nges pa de nyid kyis sems dang bcas pa nyid du grub po //
translated: then by that very engagement of awareness, the presence of mind is established.

original: ji ste yang gal te rmi lam la sogs pa'i gnas skabs na sems yod par gyur na /
analyzed: ji ste yang gal te rmi lam la sogs pa'i gnas skabs na sems yod par gyur na /
translated: If, on the other hand, you say, ‚ÄúIf there is a mind in the states of dreams and so on,

original: ci'i phyir skyes bu gnyid sad pa la sogs pa dran par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ci'i phyir skyes bu gnyid sad pa la sogs pa dran par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: why do the waking person and so on not remember it?‚Äù

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni brgyal ba las sangs pa dang ra ro ba las sangs pa rnams gzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni brgyal ba las sangs pa dang ra ro ba las sangs pa rnams gzung ngo //
translated: The words ‚Äúand so on‚Äù are meant to include the recovery from fainting and the recovery from intoxication.

original: nyams su myong ba med par grub par bya ba'i phyir dran pa ste rgyu ma yin te /
analyzed: nyams su myong ba med par grub par bya ba'i phyir dran pa ste rgyu ma yin te /
translated: Memory is not a cause for the establishment of experience, because memory arises even without experience.

original: gal te nyams su myong ba zhes bya ba de tsam gyi dran pa skye bar 'gyur na gang gi phyir nyams su myong ba yod pa na yang goms pa gsal ba dang / don du gnyer ba la sogs pa ma tshang ba'i phyir dran par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te nyams su myong ba zhes bya ba de tsam gyi dran pa skye bar 'gyur na gang gi phyir nyams su myong ba yod pa na yang goms pa gsal ba dang / don du gnyer ba la sogs pa ma tshang ba'i phyir dran par mi 'gyur te /
translated: If memory were to arise merely from experience, then memory would not arise from the existence of experience, because the conditions of clarity, desire, and so on are incomplete.

original: dper na skyes ma thag pa la sogs pa'i gnas skabs su nyams su myong ba'i sems bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na skyes ma thag pa la sogs pa'i gnas skabs su nyams su myong ba'i sems bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the mind that experiences the state of being immediately after birth.

original: 'o na yod pa nyid la yang khyod la tshad ma ci yod gal te dran pa mi 'jug na yang the tshom za'o zhes rtsod par byed na de lta na 'di zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'o na yod pa nyid la yang khyod la tshad ma ci yod gal te dran pa mi 'jug na yang the tshom za'o zhes rtsod par byed na de lta na 'di zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: If you argue that even though it exists, you have no means of knowing it, and that you doubt it, then we say:

original: 'di zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: 'di zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThis‚Äù refers to consciousness.

original: de dag la zhes bya ba ni gnyid la sogs pa'i gnas skabs na'o //
analyzed: de dag la zhes bya ba ni gnyid la sogs pa'i gnas skabs na'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn those‚Äù refers to the states of sleep, etc.

original: de la gong du bstan pa'i gtan tshigs ni skyes bu gnyid sad pa la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa ni rang gi nye bar len pa'i stobs kyis byung ba yin te /
analyzed: de la gong du bstan pa'i gtan tshigs ni skyes bu gnyid sad pa la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa ni rang gi nye bar len pa'i stobs kyis byung ba yin te /
translated: The reason stated above is that the consciousness of a person who has awakened from sleep arises by the power of its own antecedent condition,

original: rnam par shes pa yin pa'i phyir gzo ba la sogs pa'i de ma thag tu byung ba dran pa la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa yin pa'i phyir gzo ba la sogs pa'i de ma thag tu byung ba dran pa la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: because it is consciousness, like memory, etc., which immediately follows the consciousness of one who is awake.

original: gtan tshigs 'di ma nges pa yang yin te /
analyzed: gtan tshigs 'di ma nges pa yang yin te /
translated: This reason is not inconclusive,

original: rgyu gzhan sngar bkag pas 'brel pa bsgrub zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu gzhan sngar bkag pas 'brel pa bsgrub zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the relation has already been established by the refutation of other causes above.

original: gzhan yang gal te gnyid log pa'i gnas skabs na /
analyzed: gzhan yang gal te gnyid log pa'i gnas skabs na /
translated: Moreover, if in the state of sleep,

original: sems med par gyur na de'i tshe 'chi ba nyid du 'gyur ro //üîΩci ste de la de lta bur gyur ba'i @105a * //
analyzed: sems med par gyur na de'i tshe 'chi ba nyid du 'gyur ro // ci ste de la de lta bur gyur ba'i @105a * //
translated: consciousness were to become nonexistent, then death would occur.üîΩIf you assert that the body of one who has such a consciousness

original: rnam par shes pa can gyi lus de yang rnam par shes pa rgyu med par skye bar 'dod na /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa can gyi lus de yang rnam par shes pa rgyu med par skye bar 'dod na /
translated: arises without a cause,

original: de'i tshe skye ba 'dod na ni 'chi ba med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i tshe skye ba 'dod na ni 'chi ba med par 'gyur te /
translated: If you assert that it is produced at that time, then it would be immortal.

original: shi ba la yang rnam par shes pa yang skye bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: shi ba la yang rnam par shes pa yang skye bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
translated: And it would follow that consciousness would be produced even at death,

original: gnyid sad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: gnyid sad pa bzhin no //
translated: because it would be like the waking state.

original: yid kyi blo kho na skye ba gzhan du mtshams sbyor bar nus pa yin te /
analyzed: yid kyi blo kho na skye ba gzhan du mtshams sbyor bar nus pa yin te /
translated: Only the mental consciousness is able to link at the time of birth in another life.

original: de skad du yang /üîΩ'chad dang mtshams sbyor 'dod chags bral //
analyzed: de skad du yang / 'chad dang mtshams sbyor 'dod chags bral //
translated: As it is said:üîΩDeath, linking, freedom from attachment,

original: nyams dang 'chi 'phos skye ba ni //üîΩyid kyi rnam shes kho nar 'dod //
analyzed: nyams dang 'chi 'phos skye ba ni // yid kyi rnam shes kho nar 'dod //
translated: Retrogression, death and rebirth

original: ces bshad do //
analyzed: ces bshad do //
translated: Are asserted to be mental consciousness alone.üîΩTherefore, the mental consciousness is supported by the mere prior mind.

original: de'i phyir yid kyi blo ni blo snga ma tsam la brten pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de'i phyir yid kyi blo ni blo snga ma tsam la brten pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir //
translated: To demonstrate this, it says:

original: yid kyi blo ni rang dbang can //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: yid kyi blo ni rang dbang can // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The mental consciousness is independent.

original: ltos pa med pa nyid ni rang dbang can la gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: ltos pa med pa nyid ni rang dbang can la gtan tshigs so //
translated: The reason is that it is independent, not relying on anything else.

original: yid kyi blo 'di ni thams cad du rang gi nye bar len pa'i rgyu tsam las byung ba yin te /
analyzed: yid kyi blo 'di ni thams cad du rang gi nye bar len pa'i rgyu tsam las byung ba yin te /
translated: This mental consciousness arises from its own appropriated cause alone in all circumstances.

original: rang gi nye bar lan pa las ma gtogs pa'i mig la sogs pa'i rgyu gzhan la ltos pa'i phyir rmi lam gyi gnas skabs bzhin no //
analyzed: rang gi nye bar lan pa las ma gtogs pa'i mig la sogs pa'i rgyu gzhan la ltos pa'i phyir rmi lam gyi gnas skabs bzhin no //
translated: because they are dependent on other causes of the eye, etc., which are not their own selves, like the situation in a dream.

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba 'dis ni gtan tshigs ma grub pa nyid sel ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba 'dis ni gtan tshigs ma grub pa nyid sel ba yin no //
translated: By ‚Äúthus‚Äù he removes the fact that the reason is not established.

original: de'i bya ba med na yang yod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni dbang po dang don de dag gi bya ba med na yang zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de'i bya ba med na yang yod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni dbang po dang don de dag gi bya ba med na yang zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: ‚ÄúEven though its activity does not exist‚Äù means even though the activity of those sense-faculties and objects does not exist.

original: gang gi phyir bya ba med kyang gang byung ba de ni de'i rgyur rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir bya ba med kyang gang byung ba de ni de'i rgyur rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Because the activity does not exist, it is not reasonable that what arises is the cause of that.

original: 'di snyam du de med na yang yod pa'i phyir nam mkha'i autpala la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa dbang po dang don la mi ltos pa yin du chug mod /
analyzed: 'di snyam du de med na yang yod pa'i phyir nam mkha'i autpala la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa dbang po dang don la mi ltos pa yin du chug mod /
translated: ‚ÄúEven though it does not exist, it exists‚Äù means that the conceptualization of the sky-lotus, etc., does not depend on sense-faculties and objects.

original: gang gis gtan tshigs phyogs kyi phyogs gcig la ma grub par mi 'gyur ba /
analyzed: gang gis gtan tshigs phyogs kyi phyogs gcig la ma grub par mi 'gyur ba /
translated: But how can it be that the reason is not established with respect to one part of the subject?

original: mig ma nyams pa sngon po la sogs pa mdun na gnas pa'i rgyud pa la 'di ni sngon po'o //
analyzed: mig ma nyams pa sngon po la sogs pa mdun na gnas pa'i rgyud pa la 'di ni sngon po'o //
translated: When the eye is not impaired, the conception ‚ÄúThis is blue‚Äù occurs in the continuum of one who is in front of the cause, the blue, etc.

original: snyam du rnam par rtog pa 'jug pa de ji ltar dbang po dang don dag la ltos pa med pa yin snyam du sems na /
analyzed: snyam du rnam par rtog pa 'jug pa de ji ltar dbang po dang don dag la ltos pa med pa yin snyam du sems na /
translated: How can that be independent of the sense faculty and object?

original: de dag yod kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de dag yod kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúEven though they exist,‚Äù etc.

original: de dag ces bya ba ni dbang po dang don dag go //
analyzed: de dag ces bya ba ni dbang po dang don dag go //
translated: ‚ÄúThey‚Äù refers to the sense faculty and object.

original: don dam pa ni don gyi stong pa'o //
analyzed: don dam pa ni don gyi stong pa'o //
translated: The ultimate is the emptiness of the object.

original: snang ba ni rnam pa ste /
analyzed: snang ba ni rnam pa ste /
translated: The appearance is the aspect.

original: don la sogs pa zhen pa'i rnam par rtog pa gang yin pa /
analyzed: don la sogs pa zhen pa'i rnam par rtog pa gang yin pa /
translated: The conception that conceives the object, etc.

original: nam mkha'i autpala la sogs pa don med par snang ba'i rnam par rtog pa de mtshungs te /
analyzed: nam mkha'i autpala la sogs pa don med par snang ba'i rnam par rtog pa de mtshungs te /
translated: is similar to the conception that appears as the nonexistent object, such as a sky flower.

original: yul 'di yang zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yul 'di yang zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning of ‚Äúthis object.‚Äù

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: sgra'i rnam par 'jug pa'i rnam par rtog pa thams cad ni sgra'i don snang ba yin gyi /
analyzed: sgra'i rnam par 'jug pa'i rnam par rtog pa thams cad ni sgra'i don snang ba yin gyi /
translated: All conceptions that engage the term are the appearance of the meaning of the term.

original: der dngos po'i ngo bo snang ba ni ma yin @105b te /
analyzed: der dngos po'i ngo bo snang ba ni ma yin @105b te /
translated: The appearance of the entity is not there.

original: dngos po'i ngo bo la sgra mi 'jug pa'i phyir te /üîΩde la der brda ma byas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rgyas par sgra'i don rtag par bstan zin to //
analyzed: dngos po'i ngo bo la sgra mi 'jug pa'i phyir te / de la der brda ma byas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rgyas par sgra'i don rtag par bstan zin to //
translated: because a word does not apply to the nature of a thing,üîΩbecause a convention is not made in regard to that.

original: mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa'i phyir gtan tshigs 'gal ba yang ma yin la /üîΩma nges pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa'i phyir gtan tshigs 'gal ba yang ma yin la / ma nges pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not a contradictory logical reason because it exists in what is similar to the subject.

original: rang gi nye bar len pa las ma byung ba yin na rgyu med pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi nye bar len pa las ma byung ba yin na rgyu med pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not indeterminate because if it did not arise from its own material cause, it would follow that it is causeless.

original: lus la brten pa'i phyir rgyu med pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro zhes dogs pa bsu nas /
analyzed: lus la brten pa'i phyir rgyu med pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro zhes dogs pa bsu nas /
translated: Fearing that it might be thought that it is not causeless because it is based on the body, he says

original: ba lang gang ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ba lang gang ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúWhat cow?‚Äù and so on.

original: pags nad ces bya ba la sogs pa'i nad kyis gnod pa ma lus par rnam par 'gyur yang yid kyi blo mi 'gyur ba'i phyir yid kyi blo 'di lus la brten pa ma yin no //
analyzed: pags nad ces bya ba la sogs pa'i nad kyis gnod pa ma lus par rnam par 'gyur yang yid kyi blo mi 'gyur ba'i phyir yid kyi blo 'di lus la brten pa ma yin no //
translated: Because the mental awareness does not change even though the body is completely transformed by the affliction of such diseases as leprosy, this mental awareness is not based on the body.

original: gang 'gyur bas gang dngos su nges par mi 'gyur ba de ni de la brten pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang 'gyur bas gang dngos su nges par mi 'gyur ba de ni de la brten pa ma yin te /
translated: That which does not definitely change in reality due to the change of something else is not based on that.

original: dper na ba lang 'gyur bas rta mi 'gyur ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na ba lang 'gyur bas rta mi 'gyur ba bzhin no //
translated: For example, a horse does not change due to the change of a cow.

original: pags nad kyi gnas skabs na yang lus 'gyur bas yid kyi blo 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: pags nad kyi gnas skabs na yang lus 'gyur bas yid kyi blo 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: And even when the body is in a state of skin disease, the mental cognition does not change due to the change of the body.

original: khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: This is the non-observation of the pervader.

original: mig la sogs kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pas de la brten pa nyid la dngos su 'gyur na 'gyur ba nyid kyi khyad par ston par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: mig la sogs kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pas de la brten pa nyid la dngos su 'gyur na 'gyur ba nyid kyi khyad par ston par byed pa yin te /
translated: The phrase of the eye, etc. indicates that if it were based on that, it would change due to the change of that. This shows the distinction of non-change.

original: 'dir khyad par byed pa de med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dir khyad par byed pa de med pa'i phyir /
translated: Because that distinction is absent here,

original: blo lus la mi brten pa nyid du grub po //
analyzed: blo lus la mi brten pa nyid du grub po //
translated: it is established that cognition is not based on the body.

original: des na de'i phyir lus log na yang mi ldog par 'dod pa'i phyir 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: des na de'i phyir lus log na yang mi ldog par 'dod pa'i phyir 'gal ba med do //
translated: Therefore, because it is accepted that it does not revert even when the body is reversed, there is no contradiction.

original: gang zhig gang la brten pa ma yin pa de ni de log pa na de nges pa ldog pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig gang la brten pa ma yin pa de ni de log pa na de nges pa ldog pa ma yin te /
translated: That which is not based on something else does not definitely revert when that is reversed.

original: dper na ba lang log pa na ba men nges par ldog pa ma yin bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na ba lang log pa na ba men nges par ldog pa ma yin bzhin no //
translated: For example, when a cow is excluded, a gayal is not necessarily excluded.

original: yid kyi blo yang lus la brten pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni khyad par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: yid kyi blo yang lus la brten pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni khyad par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: And the mental cognition is not based on the body. This is the non-observation of a distinguishing feature.

original: de ma thag tu byung ba'i gal te lus gzhan la brten na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gnyis kyis gang smras pa de la /
analyzed: de ma thag tu byung ba'i gal te lus gzhan la brten na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gnyis kyis gang smras pa de la /
translated: In the two verses beginning with ‚ÄúIf it were to arise immediately, and if it were based on another body,‚Äù he says:

original: gang gi phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir /
translated: Because

original: yid blo zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: yid blo zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: the mental cognition is not based on the body,üîΩthe mental cognition is not based on the body.

original: 'dir bsam pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'dir bsam pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: The idea here is this:

original: 'dir 'jig rten pha rol bsgrub par 'dod la /
analyzed: 'dir 'jig rten pha rol bsgrub par 'dod la /
translated: Here, the other world is to be established.

original: de ji ltar grub ce na gal te blo thog ma dang tha ma med pa grub par gyur na de 'grub pa yin te /
analyzed: de ji ltar grub ce na gal te blo thog ma dang tha ma med pa grub par gyur na de 'grub pa yin te /
translated: And how is that established? If the beginningless and endless mental cognition is established, that is established,

original: 'di nyid kyi gnas skabs kyi khyad par la 'jig rten pha rol du gdags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di nyid kyi gnas skabs kyi khyad par la 'jig rten pha rol du gdags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the difference in state of this very [mental cognition] is designated as the other world.

original: lus ni ma yin te gzugs med pa'i khams na lus med na yang 'jig rten pha rol du khas len pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgal te sems @106a * //
analyzed: lus ni ma yin te gzugs med pa'i khams na lus med na yang 'jig rten pha rol du khas len pa'i phyir ro // gal te sems @106a * //
translated: But it is not the body, because even though there is no body in the formless realm, you accept that there is a world beyond.

original: kyi rgyud thog ma dang tha ma med pa nyid grub na 'jig rten pha rol zhes bya ba grub pa yin te /
analyzed: kyi rgyud thog ma dang tha ma med pa nyid grub na 'jig rten pha rol zhes bya ba grub pa yin te /
translated: If the continuum of mind is established as being without beginning or end, then so-called ‚Äúworld beyond‚Äù is established.

original: lus gzhan grub par bya ba'i phyir 'bad pa mi dgos so //
analyzed: lus gzhan grub par bya ba'i phyir 'bad pa mi dgos so //
translated: There is no need to strive to establish another body.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'bras bu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it would be without result.

original: de ni ma mthong ba tsam gyis dgag par nus pa ma yin te /üîΩ'di ltar mig dman pa khyed cag la rigs kyi khyad par dang goms pa la sogs pa ma tshang ba'i phyir du ba phra mo mi mthong ba bzhin du lus de yod na yang mi mthong bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ma dmigs pa tsam gyis dgag par grub pa
analyzed: de ni ma mthong ba tsam gyis dgag par nus pa ma yin te / 'di ltar mig dman pa khyed cag la rigs kyi khyad par dang goms pa la sogs pa ma tshang ba'i phyir du ba phra mo mi mthong ba bzhin du lus de yod na yang mi mthong bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ma dmigs pa tsam gyis dgag par grub pa
translated: It cannot be refuted by mere non-apprehension,üîΩbecause even if that body exists, it is not seen, just as you of inferior eyes do not see subtle smoke because of the incompleteness of the specific type and habituation.

original: ma yin no //
analyzed: ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not established that it is refuted by mere non-apprehension.

original: 'di ltar srid pa bar ma ni rigs mthun lha mig dag pas mthong bar brjod de /
analyzed: 'di ltar srid pa bar ma ni rigs mthun lha mig dag pas mthong bar brjod de /
translated: Thus it is said that the intermediate existence is seen by the divine eye of one of similar type.

original: de nyid kyi phyir grangs can gyis kun du brtags pa'i khur khyer ba'i lus kyang mi spangs so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir grangs can gyis kun du brtags pa'i khur khyer ba'i lus kyang mi spangs so //
translated: Therefore, the body that is the burden imagined by the Samkhyas is not abandoned.

original: sngon dus kyi srid pa yang yul gyis bskal ba'i phyir dmigs par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: sngon dus kyi srid pa yang yul gyis bskal ba'i phyir dmigs par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Also, the existence of the past is not perceived because it is separated by space,

original: ches ring bar skye ba'i phyir ram /
analyzed: ches ring bar skye ba'i phyir ram /
translated: because it is separated by a long time,

original: rang bzhin gyis bskal ba'i phyir sha za la sogs pa'i lus bzhin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis bskal ba'i phyir sha za la sogs pa'i lus bzhin no //
translated: or because it is separated by nature, like the body of a preta, etc.

original: ma bskal na yang tshu rol mthong ba rnams kyis srog chags 'di ni phye ma leb kyi bdag nyid du song ngo zhes nges par mi nus pa'i phyir nus pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i sman gyi sbyor bas bsgyur ba'i lus bzhin no //
analyzed: ma bskal na yang tshu rol mthong ba rnams kyis srog chags 'di ni phye ma leb kyi bdag nyid du song ngo zhes nges par mi nus pa'i phyir nus pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i sman gyi sbyor bas bsgyur ba'i lus bzhin no //
translated: Even if it is not separated, it cannot be ascertained by those who see only the present, like the body transformed by the application of an inconceivable medicine.

original: 'o na ji ltar lus tha dad pa la brten pa'i shes pa rgyud gcig dang 'brel par brjod ce na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar lus tha dad pa la brten pa'i shes pa rgyud gcig dang 'brel par brjod ce na /
translated: If that is so, how can consciousness, which is based on different bodies, be said to be connected to a single continuum?

original: tha dad lus la zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: tha dad lus la zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúIn different bodies,‚Äù

original: de yi khyad par rjes byed phyir //
analyzed: de yi khyad par rjes byed phyir //
translated: because it follows the particularities of those bodies.

original: zhes bya ba ni tshe 'di'i rnam par shes pa skyes ba gzhan du 'jug pa'i shes pa de'i khyad par gang yin pa de'i rjes su byed pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni tshe 'di'i rnam par shes pa skyes ba gzhan du 'jug pa'i shes pa de'i khyad par gang yin pa de'i rjes su byed pa yin te /
translated: The consciousness of this life that is born is the consciousness that enters another life and it is the subsequent state of whatever is its special feature.

original: de skad du /
analyzed: de skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: skyes bu rnams kyis dge dang mi dge la //
analyzed: skyes bu rnams kyis dge dang mi dge la //
translated: Through the practice of cultivating virtue and nonvirtue,

original: goms pa'i sbyor bas de yi bdag tu 'gyur //
analyzed: goms pa'i sbyor bas de yi bdag tu 'gyur //
translated: one becomes its nature.

original: gang phyir 'bad pa med pas lus med par //
analyzed: gang phyir 'bad pa med pas lus med par //
translated: Since one is born without a body without effort,

original: skye ba gzhan du rmi lam bzhin du dpyod //
analyzed: skye ba gzhan du rmi lam bzhin du dpyod //
translated: one should analyze other lives as if in a dream.üîΩIn this regard, the beautiful ones of this shore say: Since the bodies of this world and the next world are different, the minds that exist in them are not of the same continuum.

original: de las tshu rol mdzes pa bas 'jig rten 'di dang 'jig rten pha rol gyi lus dag tha dad pa'i phyir de la yod pa'i sems de dag rgyud gcig pa ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / mngal la sogs par rtsod pa'i yul du gyur pa'i dang po'i rnam par shes pa rgyud gcig pa zhes bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de las tshu rol mdzes pa bas 'jig rten 'di dang 'jig rten pha rol gyi lus dag tha dad pa'i phyir de la yod pa'i sems de dag rgyud gcig pa ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / mngal la sogs par rtsod pa'i yul du gyur pa'i dang po'i rnam par shes pa rgyud gcig pa zhes bya ba ma yin te /
translated: The first consciousness that is the object of dispute in the womb and so on is not called of the same continuum.

original: lus tha dad pa'i phyir ma he dang phag la sogs pa'i shes pa bzhin no zhes gang smras pa de ni 'dis bsal ba yin no //
analyzed: lus tha dad pa'i phyir ma he dang phag la sogs pa'i shes pa bzhin no zhes gang smras pa de ni 'dis bsal ba yin no //
translated: The response to the objection that the self is not the object of the notion ‚ÄúI‚Äù because it is different from the body is answered by this passage.

original: gzhan yang 'di las kyang 'jig rten @106b pha rol grub ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'di las kyang 'jig rten @106b pha rol grub ste /
translated: Moreover, the existence of other worlds is established by this passage.

original: gang dang gang rnam par rtog pa yin pa de ni sgra nyams su myong ba goms pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin te /
analyzed: gang dang gang rnam par rtog pa yin pa de ni sgra nyams su myong ba goms pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin te /
translated: Whatever is conceptualized is preceded by the experience of sound,

original: rnam par rtog pa yin pa'i phyir lang tsho la sogs pa'i gnas skabs su 'byung ba'i rnam par rtog pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa yin pa'i phyir lang tsho la sogs pa'i gnas skabs su 'byung ba'i rnam par rtog pa bzhin no //
translated: because it is conceptualized, like the conceptualization that occurs in the state of youth, etc.

original: skyes ma thag pa'i nu ma 'thung ba la sogs par 'dod pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: skyes ma thag pa'i nu ma 'thung ba la sogs par 'dod pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: The conceptualization of desire, etc., in regard to the sucking of the breast immediately after birth, etc. is a natural inference.

original: gtan tshigs 'di gzhi ma grub pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gtan tshigs 'di gzhi ma grub pa yang ma yin te /
translated: This reason is not unestablished.

original: gang gi phyir du ba dang nu ma 'thung ba la sogs pa'i 'bras bus skyes ma thag pa'i nu ma 'thung ba la sogs par mngon par 'dod pa la sogs pa'i chos can grub po //
analyzed: gang gi phyir du ba dang nu ma 'thung ba la sogs pa'i 'bras bus skyes ma thag pa'i nu ma 'thung ba la sogs par mngon par 'dod pa la sogs pa'i chos can grub po //
translated: Because smoke, nursing, and so on are established as the phenomena that are the objects of desire, and so on, of the one who is born immediately after the effect of nursing, and so on.

original: rnam par rtog pa ni nus pa'i khyad par la sogs pa'i ngo bos yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa ni nus pa'i khyad par la sogs pa'i ngo bos yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Imagination does not exist in the form of a special capacity, and so on.

original: 'di ltar du ba dang nu ma 'thung ba la sogs pa yod par rigs pa ma yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar du ba dang nu ma 'thung ba la sogs pa yod par rigs pa ma yin la /
translated: Thus, it is not reasonable that smoke, nursing, and so on exist.

original: rang gi ngo bo ma grub pa yang ma yin no zhes ston pa ni /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo ma grub pa yang ma yin no zhes ston pa ni /
translated: Nor is it the case that its own nature is not established.

original: de yang thams cad ldog pa'i bdag / ces bya'o //
analyzed: de yang thams cad ldog pa'i bdag / ces bya'o //
translated: This is taught by ‚Äúand that is the self of all reversals.‚Äù

original: nu ma 'thung bar 'dod pa la sogs pa thams cad ni rnam par rtog pa'i bdag nyid de /üîΩrnam par rtog pa'i rang bzhin yin te /
analyzed: nu ma 'thung bar 'dod pa la sogs pa thams cad ni rnam par rtog pa'i bdag nyid de / rnam par rtog pa'i rang bzhin yin te /
translated: All of the desires for nursing, and so on, are the nature of imagination.

original: don du gnyer ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa nyid du nyams su myong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don du gnyer ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa nyid du nyams su myong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: They are the nature of imagination because they are experienced in the form of the desire for an object, and so on.

original: ma nges pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: ma nges pa yang ma yin no //
translated: Nor is it the case that it is not ascertained.

original: zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate this, it is said:

original: de yang ming dang rjes 'brel can //
analyzed: de yang ming dang rjes 'brel can //
translated: And that is associated with names.

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says this.
