original: de zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa ste /
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa ste /
translated: That means conceptualization.

original: gang gi phyir rnam par rtog pa thams cad ni sgra'i rnam pas 'jug pa'i phyir ming dang rjes su 'brel pa yin la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rnam par rtog pa thams cad ni sgra'i rnam pas 'jug pa'i phyir ming dang rjes su 'brel pa yin la /
translated: Because all conceptualization is associated with names, since it engages through the aspect of words.üîΩAnd that conceptualization associated with names does not occur without the habituation to signs.

original: rnam par rtog pa ming dang rjes su 'brel pa de yang brda goms pa med par mi 'byung ngo zhes kho bo cag gis sngar rgyas par bstan zin to //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa ming dang rjes su 'brel pa de yang brda goms pa med par mi 'byung ngo zhes kho bo cag gis sngar rgyas par bstan zin to //
translated: We have already explained this extensively above.

original: yang ci ste ming dang rjes su 'brel pa goms pa mngon du 'gro ba can yin du chug mod /
analyzed: yang ci ste ming dang rjes su 'brel pa goms pa mngon du 'gro ba can yin du chug mod /
translated: But even if we allow that the habituation to what is associated with names is manifest,

original: de lta na yang 'di 'dod pa sgrub par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta na yang 'di 'dod pa sgrub par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: even so, this does not prove what the opponent wants to prove.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then?

original: 'jig rten 'dir goms pa sngon du 'gro ba can nyid kyi ldog pa bsgrub par byed pa yin no snyam na /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'dir goms pa sngon du 'gro ba can nyid kyi ldog pa bsgrub par byed pa yin no snyam na /
translated: The opponent thinks that the proof of the reversal of the universal of existence is preceded by habituation to the world.

original: ming gi ngo bos zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ming gi ngo bos zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: To this he says, ‚ÄúBy the nature of names, etc.‚Äù

original: 'di skad du /
analyzed: 'di skad du /
translated: This is what he says.

original: yang bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: yang bstan pa yin te /
translated: This is also taught.

original: skyes ma thag pa'i 'jig rten 'di'i goms pa ni tshad ma dang grags pas gnod pa yin te /
analyzed: skyes ma thag pa'i 'jig rten 'di'i goms pa ni tshad ma dang grags pas gnod pa yin te /
translated: The world‚Äôs habit of taking things to be real is contradicted by valid cognition and by what is commonly recognized.

original: dam bca' ba'i don la gnod pa'i gtan tshigs ni 'gal ba nyid du rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dam bca' ba'i don la gnod pa'i gtan tshigs ni 'gal ba nyid du rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: A reason that contradicts the meaning of a thesis is not a correct reason.

original: gnod pa med na 'gal ba yin //
analyzed: gnod pa med na 'gal ba yin //
translated: If there is no contradiction, then it is not a correct reason.

original: zhes bya ba'i rigs pas so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i rigs pas so //
translated: This is the correct principle.

original: ming gi ngo bo zhes bya ba @107a * //üîΩni ming gi rang bzhin smra bar byed pa'i rang bzhin te /
analyzed: ming gi ngo bo zhes bya ba @107a * // ni ming gi rang bzhin smra bar byed pa'i rang bzhin te /
translated: The nature of a name is

original: blo'i snang ba yin yang phyi rol gyi sgrar zhen pa'o //
analyzed: blo'i snang ba yin yang phyi rol gyi sgrar zhen pa'o //
translated: the nature of the expression, which is the appearance of the cognition, but is conceived to be an external sound.üîΩ‚ÄúThose‚Äù refers to the newly born.üîΩ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to the desire, etc.üîΩ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to the reason.

original: de dag ces bya ba ni skyes ma thag pa dag gi'o //
analyzed: de dag ces bya ba ni skyes ma thag pa dag gi'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to the name.üîΩ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to the cognition.üîΩ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to the object.

analyzed: de ni chad pa zhes bya ba ni mngon par 'dod pa la sogs pa de dag chad pa ni de chad pa'o //

original: des ming myong ba zhes bya ba la sogs pas ji skad du bshad pa'i tshad ma'i don mjug sdud par byed de /
analyzed: des ming myong ba zhes bya ba la sogs pas ji skad du bshad pa'i tshad ma'i don mjug sdud par byed de /
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to the appearance of the cognition.üîΩ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to the external sound.üîΩ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to the name.üîΩ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to the object.

original: des zhes bya ba ni de'i phyir gyi don to //
analyzed: des zhes bya ba ni de'i phyir gyi don to //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to the expression.üîΩ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to the appearance of the cognition

original: ming gi tha snyad ces bya ba la sogs pas tshad ma'i 'bras bu ston pa yin te /
analyzed: ming gi tha snyad ces bya ba la sogs pas tshad ma'i 'bras bu ston pa yin te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe result of valid cognition is the nominal convention‚Äù and so on teaches the result of valid cognition.

original: ming ni sgra'o //
analyzed: ming ni sgra'o //
translated: Name is sound.

original: tha snyad ni 'dris pa ste nyams su myong ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: tha snyad ni 'dris pa ste nyams su myong ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Convention is familiarity, which is to say, experience.

original: des bsgos pa'i bag chags gang yin pa de'i ngo bo yongs su smin pa rang dang rjes su mthun pa'i 'bras bu skyed pa la 'jug pa rnyed pa de las byung ba zhes bya ba ni skye ba'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: des bsgos pa'i bag chags gang yin pa de'i ngo bo yongs su smin pa rang dang rjes su mthun pa'i 'bras bu skyed pa la 'jug pa rnyed pa de las byung ba zhes bya ba ni skye ba'i rim pa'o //
translated: The essence of the latent impressions that are imbued by that, which is to say, the maturation of the latent impressions, is the attainment of the state of being able to produce a result that is in conformity with itself. The phrase ‚Äúarises from that‚Äù refers to the process of birth.

original: de dag gi zhes bya ba ni skyes ma thag pa rnams kyi'o //üîΩgal te de dag ming goms pa'i //
analyzed: de dag gi zhes bya ba ni skyes ma thag pa rnams kyi'o // gal te de dag ming goms pa'i //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthose‚Äù refers to those that have just been born.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas gzhan gyi thal ba'i sgrub pa byed pa'i dogs pa bsu pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas gzhan gyi thal ba'i sgrub pa byed pa'i dogs pa bsu pa yin te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúif they are familiar with the name‚Äù and so on responds to the objection that the opponent‚Äôs position is open to the same criticism.

original: gal te rnam par rtog pa sngar gyi brda goms pa las 'jug pa de'i tshe byis pa dang khye'u sngar gyi brda dran par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te rnam par rtog pa sngar gyi brda goms pa las 'jug pa de'i tshe byis pa dang khye'u sngar gyi brda dran par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If the engagement of conceptual thought is due to the familiarity with the prior symbolic conventions, then it follows that the child and the infant would remember the prior symbolic conventions.

original: goms pa'i rjes su 'jug pa ni dran pa med par rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: goms pa'i rjes su 'jug pa ni dran pa med par rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not reasonable that the subsequent engagement of the habitual pattern is without memory,

original: skad la byang ba bzhin du ngag gsal por 'jug par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skad la byang ba bzhin du ngag gsal por 'jug par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow that the speech would be clear, like the speech of one who is learned.

original: de lta yin dang brda byed pa don med par 'gyur na /
analyzed: de lta yin dang brda byed pa don med par 'gyur na /
translated: If that were so, then the use of conventional symbols would be pointless.

original: de lta bu yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta bu yang ma yin te /
translated: But that is not so.

original: de lta bas na dran pa med pa'i phyir dang / tshig gsal por mi 'jug pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de lta bas na dran pa med pa'i phyir dang / tshig gsal por mi 'jug pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, because there is no memory and because the speech is not clear,

original: goms pa snga ma sngon du 'gro ba can nyid du mi 'gal bas thal ba las bzlog pas chos kyi rang gi ngo bo sel ba'i sgo nas dam bca' ba'i nyes pa bshad do //
analyzed: goms pa snga ma sngon du 'gro ba can nyid du mi 'gal bas thal ba las bzlog pas chos kyi rang gi ngo bo sel ba'i sgo nas dam bca' ba'i nyes pa bshad do //
translated: it is not contradictory that the prior habitual pattern is the antecedent. Thus, the reverse of the absurd consequence is the thesis, and the fault of the thesis is the elimination of the intrinsic reality of things.

original: nye bar gnod pa gsal po yis //
analyzed: nye bar gnod pa gsal po yis //
translated: The statement, ‚ÄúThe clear harm . . .

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa thal bar 'gyur ba dang / thal ba las bzlog pa'i gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid du bstan te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa thal bar 'gyur ba dang / thal ba las bzlog pa'i gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid du bstan te /
translated: ‚Äù and so on teaches that the reason of the absurd consequence and the reverse of the absurd consequence is not established.

original: gang gis dran pa la sogs pa 'jug par byed pa'am /
analyzed: gang gis dran pa la sogs pa 'jug par byed pa'am /
translated: By what does one engage memory and so on?

original: de ldog pa na ldog par 'gyur ba thams cad du sngon goms pa la dran pa la sogs pas khyab pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ldog pa na ldog par 'gyur ba thams cad du sngon goms pa la dran pa la sogs pas khyab pa ni ma yin te /
translated: But it is not the case that all things that are stopped when that is stopped are pervaded by prior habituation, as in the case of memory, etc.

original: 'di ltar sngar goms pa nyams su myong bar yang 'gyur la dran par yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di ltar sngar goms pa nyams su myong bar yang 'gyur la dran par yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: For, in this way, there is the experience of prior habituation, but there is no memory,

original: dper na 'dus pa'i nad kyi gnas skabs bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na 'dus pa'i nad kyi gnas skabs bzhin no //
translated: as in the case of the condition of a disease of the humors.

original: de bzhin du rmi lam na yang goms pa snga ma rjes su 'jug pa yin la dran par yang yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du rmi lam na yang goms pa snga ma rjes su 'jug pa yin la dran par yang yin no //
translated: In the same way, in a dream, there is the continuation of prior habituation, but there is no memory.

original: @107b 'dus pa'i nad smos pa ni nye bar mtshon pa yin no //
analyzed: @107b 'dus pa'i nad smos pa ni nye bar mtshon pa yin no //
translated: The mention of a disease of the humors is an illustration.

original: gnod pa gsal po zhes bya ba ni mngal du gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnod pa gsal po zhes bya ba ni mngal du gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The words ‚Äúclear harm‚Äù refer to the embryo.

original: yongs su smin pa zhes bya ba ni bag chags yongs su smin pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su smin pa zhes bya ba ni bag chags yongs su smin pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúMaturation‚Äù refers to the maturation of the latent impressions.

original: 'khrul pa zhes bya ba ni nyams su myong ba ji lta ba bzhin du so sor nges pa'i yul dang dus dang rang bzhin la sogs pa'i khyad par gyi ngo bos mi 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khrul pa zhes bya ba ni nyams su myong ba ji lta ba bzhin du so sor nges pa'i yul dang dus dang rang bzhin la sogs pa'i khyad par gyi ngo bos mi 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúDelusion‚Äù means that it does not engage in the specific characteristics of the object, time, and nature, etc., as they are experienced.

original: gzhan yang 'jig rten pha rol grub par bya ba'i phyir 'thad pa gzhan bshad pa ni /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'jig rten pha rol grub par bya ba'i phyir 'thad pa gzhan bshad pa ni /
translated: The LokƒÅyata doctrine that memory of former lives is impossible is refuted by this.

original: 'dod chags zhe sdang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'dod chags zhe sdang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Attachment, hatred, etc.

original: sbyor ba ni 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / phra dog dang / rgyags pa dang / nga rgyal la sogs pa dang / de bzhin du shes rab dang / snying rje dang / byams pa la sogs pa dang / bzo'i gnas la sogs pa gang gsal ba de ni goms pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / phra dog dang / rgyags pa dang / nga rgyal la sogs pa dang / de bzhin du shes rab dang / snying rje dang / byams pa la sogs pa dang / bzo'i gnas la sogs pa gang gsal ba de ni goms pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin te /
translated: The application is that whatever is clear, such as attachment, hatred, pride, arrogance, and so on, or such as wisdom, compassion, love, and so on, or such as the arts, etc., is preceded by practice.

original: dper na skye ba 'di la sngar mi gsal ba goms pa'i dbang gis ji skad du bshad pa'i yon tan can gyi skyes bu mthong ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na skye ba 'di la sngar mi gsal ba goms pa'i dbang gis ji skad du bshad pa'i yon tan can gyi skyes bu mthong ba bzhin no //
translated: For example, in this life, by the power of previous practice, one sees a person who has the qualities as explained.

original: 'di la dang po skye ba 'dir 'jig rten 'di la goms par ma mthong ba'i skyes bu 'ga' zhig kyang de dang de la goms pa de yod pa yin no zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: 'di la dang po skye ba 'dir 'jig rten 'di la goms par ma mthong ba'i skyes bu 'ga' zhig kyang de dang de la goms pa de yod pa yin no zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs so //
translated: Here, even if one does not see a person who has not previously seen this world in this life, one should say that he has that practice. This is a syllogism of effect.

original: rjes su 'gro ba dang zlog pa dag gis rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po nges pa de'i phyir gtan tshigs ma grub pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba dang zlog pa dag gis rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po nges pa de'i phyir gtan tshigs ma grub pa ma yin te /
translated: Because the relationship of cause and effect is ascertained through positive and negative concomitance, the reason is not unestablished.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa las /
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa las /
translated: Through positive and negative concomitance,

original: gsal por byung ba yongs su nges //üîΩzhes smos so //
analyzed: gsal por byung ba yongs su nges // zhes smos so //
translated: the clear evidence is ascertained.

original: 'jig rten 'dir goms pa sngon du 'gro ba can nyid du grub pa'i phyir gtan tshigs 'gal ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'dir goms pa sngon du 'gro ba can nyid du grub pa'i phyir gtan tshigs 'gal ba yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that the reason is contradictory because it is established that the world is preceded by familiarity with desire and so on,

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: that is not so.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa @108a * //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa @108a * //
translated: Because desire and so onüîΩthat are clear and arise first are not preceded by familiarity with the world.

original: gsal po gang dag dang por byung ba de dag ni 'di la goms pa dang bral ba'i phyir 'jig rten 'dir goms pa sngon du 'gro ba nyid du sgrub par byed pa mi rigs la /üîΩrgyu med pa nyid du yang mi rigs te /
analyzed: gsal po gang dag dang por byung ba de dag ni 'di la goms pa dang bral ba'i phyir 'jig rten 'dir goms pa sngon du 'gro ba nyid du sgrub par byed pa mi rigs la / rgyu med pa nyid du yang mi rigs te /
translated: It is illogical to establish that they are preceded by familiarity with the world.

original: rtag tu yod pa la sogs par thal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rtag tu yod pa la sogs par thal ba'i phyir /
translated: It is also illogical that they arise without a cause because it would then follow that they would always exist and so on.

original: de lta bas na gal te srid pa gzhan yod par ma gyur na 'dod chags la sogs pa de dag gi skye ba ste 'byung ba'i rgyu gang zhig yin par 'gyur /
analyzed: de lta bas na gal te srid pa gzhan yod par ma gyur na 'dod chags la sogs pa de dag gi skye ba ste 'byung ba'i rgyu gang zhig yin par 'gyur /
translated: Therefore, if another existence did not exist, what would be the cause of the arising of those such as attachment?

original: de'i skye ba gzhan nyid du goms pa kho na rgyu yin pa'i phyir 'jig rten pha rol grub po /
analyzed: de'i skye ba gzhan nyid du goms pa kho na rgyu yin pa'i phyir 'jig rten pha rol grub po /
translated: Since the cause of their arising is only the habit of another arising, the existence of another world is established.

original: dmigs pa yang rgyu ma yin te /
analyzed: dmigs pa yang rgyu ma yin te /
translated: The object is not the cause,

original: dmigs pa yod na yang 'dod chags la sogs pa dag ni nges 'ga' mi sdug pa la sogs pa'i so sor rtog pa yod na mi skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dmigs pa yod na yang 'dod chags la sogs pa dag ni nges 'ga' mi sdug pa la sogs pa'i so sor rtog pa yod na mi skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because even when the object exists, those such as attachment do not arise when the discernment of repulsiveness, etc., exists.

original: mi sdug pa la sogs pa la dmigs pa 'dod chags la sogs pa'i gnyen por gyur pa'i shes rab ni so sor brtags pa ste /
analyzed: mi sdug pa la sogs pa la dmigs pa 'dod chags la sogs pa'i gnyen por gyur pa'i shes rab ni so sor brtags pa ste /
translated: The wisdom that is the antidote to attachment, etc., and that has as its object the repulsive, etc., is discernment.

original: dmigs pa med na yang 'dod chags la sogs pa'i skye bar mthong ba'i phyir dmigs pa'i dbang gis de yod par rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dmigs pa med na yang 'dod chags la sogs pa'i skye bar mthong ba'i phyir dmigs pa'i dbang gis de yod par rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Since the arising of attachment, etc., is seen even when the object does not exist, it is not logical that they exist due to the power of the object.

original: 'di ltar 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i yul la yang kun du rtogs pa'i dbang gis bde ba la sogs pa'i phyin ci log shin tu 'phel ba'i skyes bu so sor rtog pa log na 'dod chags la sogs pa de dag gis stobs 'phel bar mthong ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i yul la yang kun du rtogs pa'i dbang gis bde ba la sogs pa'i phyin ci log shin tu 'phel ba'i skyes bu so sor rtog pa log na 'dod chags la sogs pa de dag gis stobs 'phel bar mthong ste /
translated: Thus, when a person‚Äôs conceptualization of past and future objects is eliminated, it is seen that attachment and so on do not increase in strength.

original: gang yod pa dang med pa na gang yod pa dang med pa las bzlog pa de ni de'i rgyur rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang yod pa dang med pa na gang yod pa dang med pa las bzlog pa de ni de'i rgyur rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not logical that what exists or does not exist is the cause of what exists or does not exist,

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because that would lead to the absurdity that everything would be the cause of everything.

original: 'di las kyang dmigs pa'i dbang gis 'dod chags la sogs pa 'jug pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di las kyang dmigs pa'i dbang gis 'dod chags la sogs pa 'jug pa ma yin te /
translated: Also, attachment and so on do not engage through the power of the object.

original: 'di ltar gal te dmigs pa ji lta ba bzhin du 'jug par 'gyur ba de lta yin no /
analyzed: 'di ltar gal te dmigs pa ji lta ba bzhin du 'jug par 'gyur ba de lta yin no /
translated: If they did, they would engage in accordance with the object.

original: dmigs pa'i dbang gis 'jug par 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i dbang gis 'jug par 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: They do not engage through the power of the object,

original: dper na dbang po la sogs pa'i shes pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na dbang po la sogs pa'i shes pa bzhin no //
translated: like the consciousnesses of the sense faculties and so on.

original: de ltar 'jug pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar 'jug pa yang ma yin no //
translated: They do not engage in that way.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then?

original: bud med la sogs pa la bdag dang bdag gi dang rtag pa dang bde ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa gzhan mi bden pa nyid sgro btags nas 'jug pa ma yin te /
analyzed: bud med la sogs pa la bdag dang bdag gi dang rtag pa dang bde ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa gzhan mi bden pa nyid sgro btags nas 'jug pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not that one engages in women and so on by superimposing on them the aspects of self, mine, permanence, pleasure, and so on that do not exist.

original: yul rnams ni sdug pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo yang ma yin no //
analyzed: yul rnams ni sdug pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo yang ma yin no //
translated: The objects are not of the nature of the attractive and so on.

original: gang zhig gang gi rnam pas stong pa de ni de'i dmigs par rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig gang gi rnam pas stong pa de ni de'i dmigs par rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: That which is empty of a certain aspect is not suitable as the focal object of that aspect.

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it would follow that anything could be the focal object of anything.

original: des na ni de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des na ni de'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore means for that reason.

original: 'dod @108b chags la sogs pa ni sgra btags pa'i yul can yin pa nyid kyis dmigs pa med pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'dod @108b chags la sogs pa ni sgra btags pa'i yul can yin pa nyid kyis dmigs pa med pa nyid yin no //
translated: Attachment and so on are devoid of focal objects because they are subjects that superimpose.

original: de ltar yin dang dang po ste /
analyzed: de ltar yin dang dang po ste /
translated: This is so because

original: skye ba 'di'i dang por byung ba 'dod chags pa gang yin pa de dag rigs mthun pa goms pa'i dbang gis 'jug pa yin no zhes bya bar grub po //
analyzed: skye ba 'di'i dang por byung ba 'dod chags pa gang yin pa de dag rigs mthun pa goms pa'i dbang gis 'jug pa yin no zhes bya bar grub po //
translated: those who are attached at the beginning of this life engage in objects through the power of habituation to a concordant type. This is established.

original: 'o na gal te yul rgyu ma yin na ji ltar yul nye ba na 'dod chags la sogs pa skye bar mthong zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na gal te yul rgyu ma yin na ji ltar yul nye ba na 'dod chags la sogs pa skye bar mthong zhe na /
translated: But if the object is not the cause, how is it that attachment and so on are seen to arise when the object is present?

original: yul ni nye bar gyur pa dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: yul ni nye bar gyur pa dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The root text states, ‚ÄúWhen the object is present . . . ‚Äù and so on.

original: rim pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: rim pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: The process is as follows.

original: yul nye ba na dbang po las byung ba'i bde ba skye la /üîΩbde ba de las so sor rtog pa med pa na bdag la sogs pa phyin ci log gi mtshan nyid kyi tshul bzhin ma yin pa /
analyzed: yul nye ba na dbang po las byung ba'i bde ba skye la / bde ba de las so sor rtog pa med pa na bdag la sogs pa phyin ci log gi mtshan nyid kyi tshul bzhin ma yin pa /
translated: When the object is present, pleasure arises from the sense faculty.

original: yid la byed pa la gnas pa rnams sngar gyi 'dod chags la sogs pas bsgos pa'i bag chags yongs su smin par 'gyur la de las 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa 'jug pa'i phyir yul dngos su rgyu ma yin no //
analyzed: yid la byed pa la gnas pa rnams sngar gyi 'dod chags la sogs pas bsgos pa'i bag chags yongs su smin par 'gyur la de las 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa 'jug pa'i phyir yul dngos su rgyu ma yin no //
translated: From that pleasure, when there is no discernment, those who are grounded in the improper mental activity that is characterized by error with respect to self and so on will have the ripening of the latent propensities that have been infused by previous attachment and so on. From that, the affliction of attachment and so on will occur. Therefore the object is not the direct cause.

original: 'di snyam du rang gi grub pa'i mtha' brjod pa tsam 'ba' zhig tu zad kyi 'di la rigs pa 'ba' zhig yod pa ni ma yin no snyam na /
analyzed: 'di snyam du rang gi grub pa'i mtha' brjod pa tsam 'ba' zhig tu zad kyi 'di la rigs pa 'ba' zhig yod pa ni ma yin no snyam na /
translated: If you think that this is just a statement of our own philosophical tenet system and that there is no reasoning at all,

original: kun la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: kun la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The verse states, ‚ÄúIn all, etc.‚Äù

original: de'i zhes bya ba ni yul gyi'o //
analyzed: de'i zhes bya ba ni yul gyi'o //
translated: ‚Äú In that‚Äù refers to the object.

original: shes pa bzhin zhes bya ba ni sngon po la sogs pa 'dzin par byed pa'i rnam pa bzhin no //
analyzed: shes pa bzhin zhes bya ba ni sngon po la sogs pa 'dzin par byed pa'i rnam pa bzhin no //
translated: ‚Äú Like consciousness‚Äù means like the aspect that apprehends blue, etc.

original: de la zhes bya ba ni yul lo //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni yul lo //
translated: ‚Äú In that‚Äù refers to the object.

original: gcig ces bya ba ni gcig gi rnam pa can no //
analyzed: gcig ces bya ba ni gcig gi rnam pa can no //
translated: ‚Äú One‚Äù means having the aspect of one.

original: de la gcig gi rnam pa can gyi nyon mongs pa 'jug pa ma yin te /üîΩ'di ltar bud med kyi gzugs la kha cig chags la /
analyzed: de la gcig gi rnam pa can gyi nyon mongs pa 'jug pa ma yin te / 'di ltar bud med kyi gzugs la kha cig chags la /
translated: Afflictions do not operate in that way, having the aspect of one.

original: la la ni zhe sdang / kha cig ni phrag dog ces bya ba rnam pa du ma 'jug par mthong ngo //
analyzed: la la ni zhe sdang / kha cig ni phrag dog ces bya ba rnam pa du ma 'jug par mthong ngo //
translated: Thus, in regard to the form of a woman, one sees that many different aspects operate: some are attached, some are averse, and some are jealous.

original: 'di snyam du tshe 'di'i thog ma'i 'dod chags la sogs pa snga ma goms pa las ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di snyam du tshe 'di'i thog ma'i 'dod chags la sogs pa snga ma goms pa las ni ma yin no //
translated: One might think that this is not due to prior habituation to attachment, etc.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /üîΩgzhan dag 'khrig pa la sogs pa kun du spyod pa la sogs pa mthong ba las sam /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na / gzhan dag 'khrig pa la sogs pa kun du spyod pa la sogs pa mthong ba las sam /
translated: What then?üîΩIt is due to seeing others engaging in sexual intercourse, etc.

original: gzhan gyis nye bar bstan pa las so snyam na /
analyzed: gzhan gyis nye bar bstan pa las so snyam na /
translated: or due to being instructed by others.

original: gzhan dag 'jug pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gzhan dag 'jug pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Others say that the entry of others is called conduct.

original: gzhan dag gi 'jug pa ni kun du spyod pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gzhan dag gi 'jug pa ni kun du spyod pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The entry of others is synonymous with conduct.

original: 'khrul pa de nyid byung mtha' zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston par byed do //
analyzed: 'khrul pa de nyid byung mtha' zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston par byed do //
translated: That error is taught by the words ‚Äúthe end of emission,‚Äù etc.

original: byung ba'i mtha' ni 'khrig pa la sogs pa kun du spyod pa'o //
analyzed: byung ba'i mtha' ni 'khrig pa la sogs pa kun du spyod pa'o //
translated: The end of emission is the conduct of sexual intercourse, etc.

original: skal ba mnyam pa ni 'gro ba 'dra ba ste /
analyzed: skal ba mnyam pa ni 'gro ba 'dra ba ste /
translated: Homogeneity is the similarity of life.

original: phag la sogs pa gang dag la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //üîΩde dag @109a * //
analyzed: phag la sogs pa gang dag la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o // de dag @109a * //
translated: Those who have it are called pigs, etc.üîΩThey

original: dang lhan cig phrad pa ni sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: dang lhan cig phrad pa ni sbyor ba'o //
translated: are united with them.

original: rnam par 'gyur ba ni log par 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par 'gyur ba ni log par 'jug pa ste /
translated: Transformation is perverted entry.

original: 'khrig pa kun du spyod pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'khrig pa kun du spyod pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is synonymous with the conduct of sexual intercourse.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa rnams ni goms pa'i stobs nyid kyis rang gi ngang gis 'jug pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni gdon mi za bar nges par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa rnams ni goms pa'i stobs nyid kyis rang gi ngang gis 'jug pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni gdon mi za bar nges par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood without doubt that attachment, etc. are naturally engaged by the power of habit.

original: 'di ltar shes rab dang tshul khrims la sogs pa gang dag 'khor bar mi 'os pa 'khor bar ma goms pa de dag rang gi ngang gis 'bad pa med par 'jug par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar shes rab dang tshul khrims la sogs pa gang dag 'khor bar mi 'os pa 'khor bar ma goms pa de dag rang gi ngang gis 'bad pa med par 'jug par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, wisdom, morality, and so on, which are not accustomed to samsara, which are not suitable for samsara, would not enter samsara by their own nature without effort.

original: myos sogs bzhin zhes bya ba ni chos mi mthun pa'i dpe ste /
analyzed: myos sogs bzhin zhes bya ba ni chos mi mthun pa'i dpe ste /
translated: Like intoxication, etc. is an example of dissimilarity.

original: myos pa ni dregs pa'o //
analyzed: myos pa ni dregs pa'o //
translated: Intoxication is haughtiness.

original: 'di lta ma yin na myos pa la sogs pa bzhin du shes rab la sogs pa yang rang gi ngang gis 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di lta ma yin na myos pa la sogs pa bzhin du shes rab la sogs pa yang rang gi ngang gis 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were not so, then wisdom, etc. would enter by their own nature, like intoxication, etc.

original: kha cig na re bad kan las 'dod chags so //
analyzed: kha cig na re bad kan las 'dod chags so //
translated: Some say: Desire is from phlegm,

original: mkhris pa las zhe sdang ngo //
analyzed: mkhris pa las zhe sdang ngo //
translated: anger is from bile,

original: rlung las ni rmongs pa zhes zer ba de la /
analyzed: rlung las ni rmongs pa zhes zer ba de la /
translated: and delusion is from wind.

original: 'on te bad kan zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'on te bad kan zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: To that, he says, ‚ÄúBut if phlegm, etc.‚Äù

original: de la bad kan ni bad kan gyi nad do //
analyzed: de la bad kan ni bad kan gyi nad do //
translated: Therein, phlegm is a phlegm disease.

original: snga ma bzhin du zhes bya ba ni so sor rtog pa yod pa na /
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du zhes bya ba ni so sor rtog pa yod pa na /
translated: As before means that when there is discernment,

original: de yod kyang de mi 'byung phyir //
analyzed: de yod kyang de mi 'byung phyir //
translated: even if that exists, it does not arise.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas dper na yul la 'khrul pa brjod pa bzhin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas dper na yul la 'khrul pa brjod pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the statement that the object is mistaken.

original: gzhan yang bad kan la sogs pa 'phel ba dang 'grib pa dag gi 'dod chags la sogs pa 'phel ba dang 'grib par 'gyur ba ma yin la /
analyzed: gzhan yang bad kan la sogs pa 'phel ba dang 'grib pa dag gi 'dod chags la sogs pa 'phel ba dang 'grib par 'gyur ba ma yin la /
translated: Moreover, the increase and decrease of phlegm, etc., do not cause the increase and decrease of passion, etc.üîΩAnd that which does not increase and decrease when the other increases and decreases is not a cause, because it is not a condition.

original: gang zhig tha dad pas gang tha dad par mi 'gyur ba de ni de'i 'bras bur rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig tha dad pas gang tha dad par mi 'gyur ba de ni de'i 'bras bur rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: That which is not different from something else does not become different because of that, and it is not reasonable that it be the result of that,

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because that would lead to an absurd conclusion.

original: de bzhin du bad kan can yang zhe sdang shas che bar mthong gi 'dod chags drag po ni ma yin la /
analyzed: de bzhin du bad kan can yang zhe sdang shas che bar mthong gi 'dod chags drag po ni ma yin la /
translated: In the same way, one who is phlegmatic is seen to have a predominance of hatred, not of passion.

original: mkhris pa'i rgyu can yang 'dod chags bdo bar mthong gi zhe sdang la sogs pa shas che ba ni ma yin no zhes 'chol bar mthong ngo //
analyzed: mkhris pa'i rgyu can yang 'dod chags bdo bar mthong gi zhe sdang la sogs pa shas che ba ni ma yin no zhes 'chol bar mthong ngo //
translated: And one who is bilious is seen to have a predominance of passion, not of hatred, etc.

original: gang med kyang gang yod pa de ni de'i rgyur rigs pa ma yin zhing /
analyzed: gang med kyang gang yod pa de ni de'i rgyur rigs pa ma yin zhing /
translated: That which exists even when the other does not exist is not a cause of that,üîΩbecause it is not a condition.

original: gnas skabs gang du chags pa can du mthong ba de'i gnas skabs su zhe sdang yang yin pas de'i phyir yang 'khrul pas 'dod chags la sogs pa ni bad kan la sogs pas chos ma yin no //
analyzed: gnas skabs gang du chags pa can du mthong ba de'i gnas skabs su zhe sdang yang yin pas de'i phyir yang 'khrul pas 'dod chags la sogs pa ni bad kan la sogs pas chos ma yin no //
translated: Since one who is seen to be attached at one time is also seen to be hateful at another time, therefore, because of error, attachment and so on are not properties of phlegm and so on.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya bas ni mjug sdud pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya bas ni mjug sdud pa yin no //
translated: The word ‚Äútherefore‚Äù concludes the explanation.

original: gang goms sngon du 'gro ba zhes bya ba ni gang la sngon du 'gro ba ni gang goms pa sngon du 'gro ba ste /
analyzed: gang goms sngon du 'gro ba zhes bya ba ni gang la sngon du 'gro ba ni gang goms pa sngon du 'gro ba ste /
translated: That which is preceded by habituation means that which is preceded by what is habituated.

original: gang dag la rgyu snga ma yod pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //üîΩ'di la goms pa @109b sngon 'gro nyid //
analyzed: gang dag la rgyu snga ma yod pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro // 'di la goms pa @109b sngon 'gro nyid //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthat which has a prior cause‚Äù is to be supplied.

original: ces bya ba la sogs pas gzhan gyi klan ka dogs par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pas gzhan gyi klan ka dogs par byed pa yin no //
translated: The opponent‚Äôs objection is stated in the lines:üîΩHabituation is not a cause,üîΩbecause it is not a cause of that which is preceded by habituation.

original: de la klan ka ni 'di yin te /üîΩdang por byung ba dag 'jig rten 'di la goms pa sngon du 'gro ba can nyid bsgrub par bya ba yin nam /
analyzed: de la klan ka ni 'di yin te / dang por byung ba dag 'jig rten 'di la goms pa sngon du 'gro ba can nyid bsgrub par bya ba yin nam /
translated: The objection is as follows:üîΩIs it the case that that which arises first is preceded by habituation in this world?

original: 'jig rten pha rol du goms pa sngon du 'gro ba nyid dam /
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol du goms pa sngon du 'gro ba nyid dam /
translated: Or is it preceded by habituation in a previous world?

original: de grub pa na shugs kyis 'jig rten pha rol du goms pa sngon du song ba can nyid kyi 'dod pa grub par 'gyur ba khyad par med pa goms pa sngon du song ba tsam bsgrub par bya ba yin no zhes bya ba phyogs gsum mo //
analyzed: de grub pa na shugs kyis 'jig rten pha rol du goms pa sngon du song ba can nyid kyi 'dod pa grub par 'gyur ba khyad par med pa goms pa sngon du song ba tsam bsgrub par bya ba yin no zhes bya ba phyogs gsum mo //
translated: The third position is that it is to be established that the one who is born in the next world is merely one who has previously cultivated the habit.

original: de la phyogs dang po la mthong ba dang 'dod pas gnod de /üîΩ'dod chags la sogs pa dang por byung ba 'dod chags la sogs pa rnams ni tshe 'di la goms pa sngon du 'gro ba can nyid du ma mthong la /
analyzed: de la phyogs dang po la mthong ba dang 'dod pas gnod de / 'dod chags la sogs pa dang por byung ba 'dod chags la sogs pa rnams ni tshe 'di la goms pa sngon du 'gro ba can nyid du ma mthong la /
translated: The first position is undermined by perception and assertion.üîΩAt the beginning, attachment and so on do not arise due to the prior cultivation of attachment and so on in this life, and it is not asserted that they arise in the next world.

original: 'jig rten pha rol du smra ba 'dod pa yang ma yin pas mthong ba dang 'dod pa dag gis gnod do //
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol du smra ba 'dod pa yang ma yin pas mthong ba dang 'dod pa dag gis gnod do //
translated: Thus, the first position is undermined by perception and assertion.

original: phyogs gnyis pa la yang dpe bsgrub par bya ba ma tshang ba yin no //
analyzed: phyogs gnyis pa la yang dpe bsgrub par bya ba ma tshang ba yin no //
translated: The second position is undermined by the nonestablishment of the example.

original: 'jig rten rgyang pa na ba la 'jig rten pha rol du goms pa sngon du song ba nyid dang ldan pa dpe 'gar yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten rgyang pa na ba la 'jig rten pha rol du goms pa sngon du song ba nyid dang ldan pa dpe 'gar yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Nowhere is there an example of a LokƒÅyata who has previously cultivated the habit in the next world.

original: phyogs gsum pa la yang gtan tshigs 'gal ba yin te /
analyzed: phyogs gsum pa la yang gtan tshigs 'gal ba yin te /
translated: The third position is also contradictory.

original: de bzhin ni dpe bzhin du ste /
analyzed: de bzhin ni dpe bzhin du ste /
translated: ‚ÄúJust like that‚Äù means ‚Äújust like the example.‚Äù

original: srid pa gzhan du goms pa sngon du song ba nyid kyi 'dod pa med par sgrub par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: srid pa gzhan du goms pa sngon du song ba nyid kyi 'dod pa med par sgrub par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it proves that there is no desire that is preceded by prior habituation in another existence.

original: spyi tsam nyid kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed de /
analyzed: spyi tsam nyid kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed de /
translated: He replies, ‚ÄúIt is only a general statement, etc.‚Äù

original: 'dir phyogs gsum pa kho na mngon par 'dod la /
analyzed: 'dir phyogs gsum pa kho na mngon par 'dod la /
translated: Here, only the third position is accepted.

original: gtan tshigs 'gal ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gtan tshigs 'gal ba yang ma yin te /
translated: And the reason is not contradictory.

original: gang gi phyir gang gis 'jig rten pha rol du goms pa sngon du song ba nyid 'di zlog par byed pa 'dod chags la sogs pa 'di srid pa gzhan du goms pa sngon du song ba de dang 'gal ba 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir gang gis 'jig rten pha rol du goms pa sngon du song ba nyid 'di zlog par byed pa 'dod chags la sogs pa 'di srid pa gzhan du goms pa sngon du song ba de dang 'gal ba 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Because there is nothing that contradicts the prior habituation in another existence that is preceded by prior habituation in this world, and that is the cause of the arising of desire, etc.

original: gzhan yang 'jig rten 'di dang 'jig rten pha rol zhes tha dad du rnam par gzhag pa byas pa 'di ni rnam par gzhag pa tsam yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'jig rten 'di dang 'jig rten pha rol zhes tha dad du rnam par gzhag pa byas pa 'di ni rnam par gzhag pa tsam yin te /
translated: Moreover, this distinction between this world and another world is merely a conceptual distinction.

original: byis pa dang lang tsho'i bye brag bzhin no //
analyzed: byis pa dang lang tsho'i bye brag bzhin no //
translated: like the differences of childhood and youth.

original: rnam pa 'dis thog ma med pa nyid du bsgrub pa'i phyir 'di la mngon par zhen par mi bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa 'dis thog ma med pa nyid du bsgrub pa'i phyir 'di la mngon par zhen par mi bya'o //
translated: Since this is established as beginningless by this method, one should not cling to it.

original: de kho na nyid bsdus pa'i dka' 'grel las //
analyzed: de kho na nyid bsdus pa'i dka' 'grel las //
translated: In the Commentary on the Compendium of Reality,

original: 'jig rten rgyang pa na brtag pa ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten rgyang pa na brtag pa ste /
translated: the examination of LokƒÅyata is finished.

original: nyi shu bdun pa'o /
analyzed: nyi shu bdun pa'o /
translated: The twenty-seventh chapter.

original: // / de ni gzugs brnyan la sogs pa lta bu yin zhes bya ba'i rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i khyad par bsgrub par @110a * //üîΩbya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: // / de ni gzugs brnyan la sogs pa lta bu yin zhes bya ba'i rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i khyad par bsgrub par @110a * // bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to establish the particularity of dependent origination, which is said to be like a reflection and so on,

original: rnam par shes pa smra ba nye bar 'dod do //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa smra ba nye bar 'dod do //
translated: the Vij√±ƒÅnavƒÅdin is asserted.

original: de la kham gsum pa 'di ni rnam par rig pa tsam nyid do //
analyzed: de la kham gsum pa 'di ni rnam par rig pa tsam nyid do //
translated: Among those, this threefold morsel is mere representation.

original: rnam par shes pa de yang de kho na nyid ma rtogs pa rnams la sems can re re'i rgyud tha dad pa'i phyir mtha' med pa dang ma dag pa yin la /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa de yang de kho na nyid ma rtogs pa rnams la sems can re re'i rgyud tha dad pa'i phyir mtha' med pa dang ma dag pa yin la /
translated: And that consciousness, for those who have not realized reality, is endless and impure because of the separateness of the continuum of each sentient being.

original: sgrib pa spangs pa rnams kyi ni dag pa dang skad cig re re la tha dad par srog chags thams cad la skye ba yin gyi /
analyzed: sgrib pa spangs pa rnams kyi ni dag pa dang skad cig re re la tha dad par srog chags thams cad la skye ba yin gyi /
translated: But for those who have abandoned obscurations, it is pure and arises in every moment for all living beings.üîΩIt is not the same as the one that is secret, as the proponents of consciousness claim.

original: ji ltar gsang bar smra ba ltar mi 'gyur ba gcig nyid ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas pa'i rnam par shes par smra ba rnams kyi lugs yin no //üîΩde la sa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi gzung bar bya ba'i phyi rol med pa nyid kyis gzung bar bya ba med na 'dzin par byed pa yang med pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: ji ltar gsang bar smra ba ltar mi 'gyur ba gcig nyid ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas pa'i rnam par shes par smra ba rnams kyi lugs yin no // de la sa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi gzung bar bya ba'i phyi rol med pa nyid kyis gzung bar bya ba med na 'dzin par byed pa yang med pa'i phyir ram /
translated: This is the system of the Buddhists who are proponents of consciousness.

original: rgyud gzhan yod na yang gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid mi 'thad pa'i phyir rnam pa gnyis kyis rnam par rig pa tsam du 'dod do //
analyzed: rgyud gzhan yod na yang gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid mi 'thad pa'i phyir rnam pa gnyis kyis rnam par rig pa tsam du 'dod do //
translated: In this regard, the assertion of mere representation is twofold: because there is no object of apprehension due to the nonexistence of external objects such as earth, and because the existence of another mindstream is untenable due to the nonexistence of the characteristics of apprehended object and apprehending subject.

original: de la sbyor ba ni gang dang gang shes pa yin pa de dang de ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gnyis dang bral ba yin te /
analyzed: de la sbyor ba ni gang dang gang shes pa yin pa de dang de ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gnyis dang bral ba yin te /
translated: In this regard, the syllogism is as follows: Whatever is consciousness is necessarily free from the duality of apprehended object and apprehending subject.

original: shes pa yin pa'i phyir gzugs brnyan gyi shes pa bzhin no //
analyzed: shes pa yin pa'i phyir gzugs brnyan gyi shes pa bzhin no //
translated: because it is consciousness, like the consciousness of a reflection.

original: rtsod pa'i gzhir gyur pa'i rang bzhin du gnas pa'i mig la sogs pa'i shes pa 'di yang shes pa bzhin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: rtsod pa'i gzhir gyur pa'i rang bzhin du gnas pa'i mig la sogs pa'i shes pa 'di yang shes pa bzhin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: And this consciousness of the eye, etc., which is the basis of the dispute, is consciousness, like any other consciousness. This is a natural inference.

original: gtan tshigs 'di khyab pa med pa yin par bsam par mi bya ste /
analyzed: gtan tshigs 'di khyab pa med pa yin par bsam par mi bya ste /
translated: This inference should not be thought to be unestablished.

original: 'di ltar re zhig 'di'i gzung bar bya ba la sogs pa'i phyir rol gyi don ni yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar re zhig 'di'i gzung bar bya ba la sogs pa'i phyir rol gyi don ni yod pa ma yin te /
translated: For, first of all, the external object, which is the object of apprehension, etc., does not exist.

original: de ni gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin gyis stong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin gyis stong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is empty of the nature of one and many.

original: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin ma yin pa de ni rtog pa dang ldan pas yod pa nyid du gzung bar bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin ma yin pa de ni rtog pa dang ldan pas yod pa nyid du gzung bar bya ba ma yin te /
translated: The syllogism is as follows: Whatever is not of the nature of one or many is not apprehended as existent by those who are rational,

original: dper na nam mkha'i autpala bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na nam mkha'i autpala bzhin no //
translated: like a sky-lotus.

original: gzhan gyis mngon par 'dod pa'i sa la sogs pa yang gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin dang bral ba yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyis mngon par 'dod pa'i sa la sogs pa yang gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin dang bral ba yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: The other things that are desired by others, such as earth, are also devoid of the nature of one and many.

original: phung po gzhan gsum pa med pas gcig dang du ma dag gis yod pa la khyab pa'i phyir khyab par bya ba dang byed pa'i dngos po mi 'thad pa ni zlog pa la gnod pa can gyi tshad ma ma yin pa'i phyir de ma thag pa'i gtan tshigs
analyzed: phung po gzhan gsum pa med pas gcig dang du ma dag gis yod pa la khyab pa'i phyir khyab par bya ba dang byed pa'i dngos po mi 'thad pa ni zlog pa la gnod pa can gyi tshad ma ma yin pa'i phyir de ma thag pa'i gtan tshigs
translated: Since existence is pervaded by one and many, the other three aggregates do not exist. Therefore, the pervasion and the pervaded are not tenable. Since this is not a valid reason that contradicts the opponent, it is not the case that the reason is not established.

original: ma nges pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: ma nges pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: It is not uncertain.

original: 'gal ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'gal ba yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it contradictory,

original: mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it exists in the similar class.

original: 'dir gtan @110b tshigs 'di ma grub pa nyid du bstan pa dang / gang yang /
analyzed: 'dir gtan @110b tshigs 'di ma grub pa nyid du bstan pa dang / gang yang /
translated: Here, this reason is shown to be unestablished, and it is also said:üîΩThis supreme reasoning should be accepted:

original: 'byung ba nyid khyad yod min zhes //üîΩrigs pa'i mchog 'di 'dod par gyis //
analyzed: 'byung ba nyid khyad yod min zhes //üîΩrigs pa'i mchog 'di 'dod par gyis //
translated: The elements do not have different natures.

original: zhes bshad pa'i dam bca' ba mngon sum la sogs pa dang 'gal bar bstan pa dang gtan tshigs dang po khyab pa med pa nyid du bstan par 'dod nas /üîΩgzhan gyis / gal te shes pa ma gtogs pa'i //
analyzed: zhes bshad pa'i dam bca' ba mngon sum la sogs pa dang 'gal bar bstan pa dang gtan tshigs dang po khyab pa med pa nyid du bstan par 'dod nas / gzhan gyis / gal te shes pa ma gtogs pa'i //
translated: Having asserted that the thesis is contradicted by perception, etc., and that the first reason is not pervaded,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: the opponent says, ‚ÄúIf there is no object apart from consciousness, etc.‚Äù

original: rnam par chad dang zhes bya ba 'dis shes pa las tha dad pa'i gzung bar bya ba grub pa nyid du ston to //
analyzed: rnam par chad dang zhes bya ba 'dis shes pa las tha dad pa'i gzung bar bya ba grub pa nyid du ston to //
translated: This shows that the object of apprehension is established as different from consciousness.

original: nam gsal bar zhes bya ba 'dis ni mngon sum nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: nam gsal bar zhes bya ba 'dis ni mngon sum nyid du bstan to //
translated: ‚Äú When it is clear‚Äù shows that it is perception.

original: 'di nyid thal bar 'gyur ba'i sgo nas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di nyid thal bar 'gyur ba'i sgo nas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to show this very consequence,

original: de'i de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de'i de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: he says, ‚ÄúIf that is so, etc.‚Äù

original: phyi rol don 'di zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed de /
analyzed: phyi rol don 'di zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed de /
translated: He replies, ‚ÄúExternal objects are established by perception, etc.‚Äù

original: de la phyi rol gyi don mngon sum gyis grub pa yin na /
analyzed: de la phyi rol gyi don mngon sum gyis grub pa yin na /
translated: If external objects are established by perception,

original: rdul phra rab tha dad pa du ma'am /
analyzed: rdul phra rab tha dad pa du ma'am /
translated: are they many different atoms,

original: de dag gis brtsams pa'i yan lag can rags pa gcig gam /
analyzed: de dag gis brtsams pa'i yan lag can rags pa gcig gam /
translated: or is it a single gross object composed of them?

original: ma brtsams pa zhes bya ba'i phyogs rnams su 'gyur ba yin /
analyzed: ma brtsams pa zhes bya ba'i phyogs rnams su 'gyur ba yin /
translated: The other directions are called ‚Äúnot begun.‚ÄùüîΩ

original: de la re zhig phyogs dang po ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de la re zhig phyogs dang po ni ma yin te /
translated: The other three positions are the non-beginning, the beginning, and the end.

original: cha med pa'i lus can gyi rdul phra rab tu ma'i shes pa so sor rig pa med pa'i phyir dang / rtag tu shes pa rags pa'i rnam pa can nyid du nyams su myong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: cha med pa'i lus can gyi rdul phra rab tu ma'i shes pa so sor rig pa med pa'i phyir dang / rtag tu shes pa rags pa'i rnam pa can nyid du nyams su myong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The first position is not correct, because the consciousness of many atoms with partless bodies is not individually cognized, and because it is always experienced as having the aspect of gross consciousness.

original: yang na shes pa de dag rig pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bdun pa'i mtha' can du ston la bsdu bar bya'o //
analyzed: yang na shes pa de dag rig pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bdun pa'i mtha' can du ston la bsdu bar bya'o //
translated: Or, because those consciousnesses are not cognized, the end of the seventh is taught and should be included.

original: sbyor ba ni gang zhig mngon sum du mngon par 'dod pa'i shes la rang gi rnam pas mi snang ba de ni mngon sum nyid du gzung bar bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang zhig mngon sum du mngon par 'dod pa'i shes la rang gi rnam pas mi snang ba de ni mngon sum nyid du gzung bar bya ba ma yin te /
translated: The syllogism is: Whatever is not desired to be manifest in consciousness does not appear with its own aspect, and therefore it is not to be apprehended as manifest,

original: dper na nam mkha'i padmo bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na nam mkha'i padmo bzhin no //
translated: like, for example, a sky-lotus.

original: mngon sum du mngon par 'dod pa'i shes pa las rdul phra rab du ma'i lus can gyis rigs pa'i rnam pa dang ldan pa snang ba ma yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: mngon sum du mngon par 'dod pa'i shes pa las rdul phra rab du ma'i lus can gyis rigs pa'i rnam pa dang ldan pa snang ba ma yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa ste /
translated: The statement ‚ÄúThe appearance of a form endowed with aspects is not seen by a consciousness that is asserted to be directly perceiving and that has a body composed of many subtle particles‚Äù is a non-observation of a pervader.

original: rang gi rnam pa snang ba nyid kyis mngon sum nyid la khyab pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi rnam pa snang ba nyid kyis mngon sum nyid la khyab pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the appearance of its own aspect is a pervader of direct perception.

original: khyab pa de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: khyab pa de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that pervasion, he says,

original: cha'i dbye ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa snos so //
analyzed: cha'i dbye ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa snos so //
translated: ‚Äúbecause of the division of parts‚Äù and so on.

original: yang ci ste tshogs pa kho na skye ba dang 'jig go zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha' yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yang ci ste tshogs pa kho na skye ba dang 'jig go zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha' yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, if you think that only the collection arises and disintegrates, that is a tenet.

original: des na rdul phra rab re re snang ba ma yin no snyam du sems te /
analyzed: des na rdul phra rab re re snang ba ma yin no snyam du sems te /
translated: Therefore, each subtle particle does not appear.

original: ji skad du btsun pa dge srungs kyis //
analyzed: ji skad du btsun pa dge srungs kyis //
translated: As Bhadanta Shrƒ±ghna says:

original: rdul phran rnams kyi rang dbang du //
analyzed: rdul phran rnams kyi rang dbang du //
translated: The individual subtle particles

original: re re 'byung ba yod ma yin //
analyzed: re re 'byung ba yod ma yin //
translated: Do not arise individually.

original: 'di yi phyir yang @111a * //üîΩrdul phran rnams //
analyzed: 'di yi phyir yang @111a * // rdul phran rnams //
translated: For this reasonüîΩThe individual subtle particles

original: re re snang ba ma yin no //
analyzed: re re snang ba ma yin no //
translated: Do not appear.

original: zhes gang smras pa de ni lan nyid ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: zhes gang smras pa de ni lan nyid ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: This is not a proper response.

original: de dag lhan cig ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de dag lhan cig ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: To demonstrate this, he says, ‚ÄúThey are not simultaneous, etc.‚Äù

original: gnas skabs de rnams su zhes bya ba ni lhan cig pa'i gnas skabs su'o //üîΩgzhan yang gal te /
analyzed: gnas skabs de rnams su zhes bya ba ni lhan cig pa'i gnas skabs su'o // gzhan yang gal te /
translated: ‚ÄúIn those states‚Äù means in the state of simultaneity.

original: rdul phra rab rnams cha med pa yin na /
analyzed: rdul phra rab rnams cha med pa yin na /
translated: Moreover, if the partless particles are partless,

original: 'o na lus can zhes brjod par mi bya ba'i phyir dam bca' ba rang gi tshig dang 'gal bar 'chad pa ni /
analyzed: 'o na lus can zhes brjod par mi bya ba'i phyir dam bca' ba rang gi tshig dang 'gal bar 'chad pa ni /
translated: then the thesis that they are ‚Äúembodiments‚Äù is contradicted by your own words.

original: de dag phra ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de dag phra ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: To explain this, he says, ‚ÄúThey are not subtle, etc.‚Äù

original: ngo bo ste rang bzhin gang gi phra ba'i mthar thug par gyur pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: ngo bo ste rang bzhin gang gi phra ba'i mthar thug par gyur pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: ‚ÄúEssence‚Äù means nature.

original: 'di skad du bstan pa yin te /üîΩgal te phra ba'i yan lag gi rnam par dbye bas phra ba'i rang bzhin ma yin par mi 'gyur na ste /
analyzed: 'di skad du bstan pa yin te / gal te phra ba'i yan lag gi rnam par dbye bas phra ba'i rang bzhin ma yin par mi 'gyur na ste /
translated: This is what is being said:üîΩIf the subtle particles are not subtle by virtue of being divided into parts,

original: gal te cha med pa yin no snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te cha med pa yin no snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: then they are not partless.

original: de'i tshor ba la sogs pa bzhin du lus can du grub par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i tshor ba la sogs pa bzhin du lus can du grub par mi 'gyur te /
translated: It would not be established as having a body, like its feelings and so on,

original: khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no difference.

original: 'dra ba'i skad cig ces bya ba la sogs pas btsun pa dge srungs kyi lan 'debs par byed de de na re /
analyzed: 'dra ba'i skad cig ces bya ba la sogs pas btsun pa dge srungs kyi lan 'debs par byed de de na re /
translated: The venerable Vasumitra responds to this with ‚ÄúThe arising of similar moments,‚Äù and so on. He says:üîΩFor example, because of the arising of other similar moments, there is error even when sound and so on are apprehended by direct perception, and there is error in the conception of sound and so on.

original: dper na 'dra ba'i skad cig gzhan dang gzhan skye ba'i phyir 'khrul pas mngon sum gyis bzung na yang sgra la sogs pa la rtog pa nyid du 'khrul pa de bzhin du rigs mthun pa'i rdul phra rab yul bar ma med pa rnams cig car 'dzin pa na
analyzed: dper na 'dra ba'i skad cig gzhan dang gzhan skye ba'i phyir 'khrul pas mngon sum gyis bzung na yang sgra la sogs pa la rtog pa nyid du 'khrul pa de bzhin du rigs mthun pa'i rdul phra rab yul bar ma med pa rnams cig car 'dzin pa na
translated: In the same way, when the homogeneous subtle particles without an intervening space are apprehended simultaneously,

original: rags pa'o snyam pa'i yid kyi 'khrul pa 'byung ngo //üîΩde lta yin dang / cha med lus can rdul du ma'i //üîΩshes pa rig pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rags pa'o snyam pa'i yid kyi 'khrul pa 'byung ngo // de lta yin dang / cha med lus can rdul du ma'i // shes pa rig pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: there is the error of the mind thinking ‚ÄúIt is gross.‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs ma grub pa yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs ma grub pa yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: If that were so, the reason ‚Äúbecause it is not the cognition of a partless body composed of many particles‚Äù would not be established.

original: rang gi bya ba'i stobs zhes bya ba la sogs pas sun 'byin pa 'chad do //
analyzed: rang gi bya ba'i stobs zhes bya ba la sogs pas sun 'byin pa 'chad do //
translated: He explains the refutation with ‚ÄúThe power of its own action,‚Äù and so on.

original: rang gi bya ba'i stobs nyid kyis //üîΩzhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rang gi bya ba'i stobs nyid kyis // zhes bya ba ni /
translated: By the power of its own activity.

original: rtags dang lung gis bya ba la ltos pa med par zhes nges par gzung bas bstan to //
analyzed: rtags dang lung gis bya ba la ltos pa med par zhes nges par gzung bas bstan to //
translated: This is taught by the specification in the verse, ‚Äúwithout depending on the activity of a reason or scripture.‚Äù

original: 'di ltar mngon sum khyad par med par skye na yang ji ltar yongs su bzung ba'i rnam pa'i cha gang kho na la rtog pa skyed par byed pa de nyid mngon sum du 'dod de /
analyzed: 'di ltar mngon sum khyad par med par skye na yang ji ltar yongs su bzung ba'i rnam pa'i cha gang kho na la rtog pa skyed par byed pa de nyid mngon sum du 'dod de /
translated: Although perception arises without distinction, it is accepted that only that part of the aspect that is apprehended generates conception.

original: tha snyad du rung ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha snyad du rung ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it is suitable for conventional usage.

original: gang la skyed par mi byed pa de ni bzung du zin kyang ma zin pa dang mtshungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gang la skyed par mi byed pa de ni bzung du zin kyang ma zin pa dang mtshungs pa yin no //
translated: That which does not generate conception is like that which is not apprehended, even though it is apprehended.

original: de lta yin dang gtan tshigs ma grub pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta yin dang gtan tshigs ma grub pa ma yin te /
translated: If that is so, the reason is not unestablished.

original: 'di ltar shes pa rigs pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'di la mngon sum du mngon @111b bar 'dod pa'i shes pa la rtog pa'i rgyur mi snang ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don 'di mngon par 'dod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar shes pa rigs pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'di la mngon sum du mngon @111b bar 'dod pa'i shes pa la rtog pa'i rgyur mi snang ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don 'di mngon par 'dod pa ma yin no //
translated: This is because there is no cognition of that kind. This means that the cognition that is accepted as perception does not appear as the cause of conception.

original: gang yang rags pa'o snyam pa nyid kyi 'khrul pa yin no zhes bya ba'i de yang yang dag pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang yang rags pa'o snyam pa nyid kyi 'khrul pa yin no zhes bya ba'i de yang yang dag pa ma yin te /
translated: But that is not so, because

original: 'di ltar / 'di tshad mas grub pa yin na 'khrul bar rnam par gzhag par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di ltar / 'di tshad mas grub pa yin na 'khrul bar rnam par gzhag par 'gyur te /
translated: if it were established by a valid cognition, it would be posited as an error,

original: dper na skad cig ma nyid tshad mas grub pa'i phyir rtag pa nyid du 'dzin pa 'khrul ba nyid du rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: dper na skad cig ma nyid tshad mas grub pa'i phyir rtag pa nyid du 'dzin pa 'khrul ba nyid du rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
translated: just as, for example, the apprehension of momentariness as permanent is posited as an error because it is established by a valid cognition.

original: de bzhin du rdul phra rab rnams ni tshad mas grub pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du rdul phra rab rnams ni tshad mas grub pa ma yin te /
translated: In the same way, atoms are not established by a valid cognition,

original: de dag nyid dpyad par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag nyid dpyad par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they themselves are to be analyzed.

original: rags pa 'di yid kyi 'khrul pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: rags pa 'di yid kyi 'khrul pa yang ma yin te /
translated: And this gross object is not an error of the mind,

original: gsal bar snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsal bar snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it appears clearly.

original: rnam par rtog pa rjes su 'brel ba ni gsal ba'i rnam pa can du rigs pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa rjes su 'brel ba ni gsal ba'i rnam pa can du rigs pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is also not reasonable that it is associated with conceptualization, because it has the aspect of clarity.üîΩAnd it is not reasonable that conceptualization is without the aspect of generality,

original: spyi'i rnam pa can ni mi gsal ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spyi'i rnam pa can ni mi gsal ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the aspect of generality is unclear.

original: rnam par rtog pa spyi'i rnam pa med par yang rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa spyi'i rnam pa med par yang rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: It is also not reasonable that conceptualization is without the aspect of generality.

original: 'di snyam du mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa bzhin du rdul phra rab rnams kyang tshad mas grub pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: 'di snyam du mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa bzhin du rdul phra rab rnams kyang tshad mas grub pa nyid yin te /
translated: Just as impermanence and so on are established by valid cognition, so too are subtle particles.

original: 'di ltar gang dang gang rags pa yin pa de dang de ni phra mo 'dus pa'i bdag nyid yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar gang dang gang rags pa yin pa de dang de ni phra mo 'dus pa'i bdag nyid yin te /
translated: For whatever is gross is by nature an aggregation of subtle particles,

original: ri la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ri la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: just like a mountain and so on.

original: mig gis gzung bar bya ba phyi rol gyi yan lag can yang rags pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: mig gis gzung bar bya ba phyi rol gyi yan lag can yang rags pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: The external gross whole that is perceived by the eye is a reason by nature.

original: mig gis gzung bar bya ba smos pa ni mig gis gzung bar bya ba ma yin pa rdul phra rab gnyis 'byar ba la sogs pa rnam pa gcad pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: mig gis gzung bar bya ba smos pa ni mig gis gzung bar bya ba ma yin pa rdul phra rab gnyis 'byar ba la sogs pa rnam pa gcad pa'i don du'o //
translated: The statement that it is perceived by the eye is for the purpose of excluding the conjunction of two subtle particles and so on that are not perceived by the eye.

original: de'i phyir 'dir gal te rags pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i dngos po'i chos la brten nas don dam pa'i rags pa nyid gtan tshigs su brjod na de'i tshe phyir rgol ba bsgrub bya'i chos can dang dpe'i chos can gnyi ga la yang rags pa nyid ces bya ba
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dir gal te rags pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i dngos po'i chos la brten nas don dam pa'i rags pa nyid gtan tshigs su brjod na de'i tshe phyir rgol ba bsgrub bya'i chos can dang dpe'i chos can gnyi ga la yang rags pa nyid ces bya ba
translated: Therefore, if you state ultimate grossness as the reason based on the property of the thing called ‚Äúgrossness,‚Äù then at that time the opponent would say that the reason is not established for both the subject of the probandum and the subject of the example.

original: ma grub pa de'i tshe gtan tshigs ma grub pa nyid dang dpe yang sgrub par byed pa ma tshang ba yin no //üîΩci ste gang rdzi la sogs pa'i bar la grags pa ma brtags na nyams dga' ba yul la khyab par snang ba'i ngo bo gang yin pa de rags pa nyid du brjod na de'i tshe rmi lam la sogs pa'i shes pa 'khrul pa yang rdul phra rab bsags
analyzed: ma grub pa de'i tshe gtan tshigs ma grub pa nyid dang dpe yang sgrub par byed pa ma tshang ba yin no // ci ste gang rdzi la sogs pa'i bar la grags pa ma brtags na nyams dga' ba yul la khyab par snang ba'i ngo bo gang yin pa de rags pa nyid du brjod na de'i tshe rmi lam la sogs pa'i shes pa 'khrul pa yang rdul phra rab bsags
translated: When that is the case, the reason is not established, and the example is incomplete.

original: pa med kyang de ltar snang ba'i ngo bo yod pa'i phyir gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid yin no //üîΩci ste ma 'khrul pa nyid @112a * //
analyzed: pa med kyang de ltar snang ba'i ngo bo yod pa'i phyir gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid yin no // ci ste ma 'khrul pa nyid @112a * //
translated: But if you say that grossness is that which is the nature that appears to pervade the object, which is delightful when not examined, such as a mirage, then in that case, even a mistaken consciousness such as a dream consciousness would be gross because it has the nature of appearing in that way even though there is no aggregation of subtle particles. Therefore the reason is not established.

original: yin pa na /
analyzed: yin pa na /
translated: But if you say that it is not mistaken,üîΩthen it is not gross.

original: zhes khyad par khas len par byed pa de'i tshe rnam par shes pa smra ba la /
analyzed: zhes khyad par khas len par byed pa de'i tshe rnam par shes pa smra ba la /
translated: then for the proponents of consciousness,

original: ji srid du rang bzhin du gnas pa'i mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa'i rnam par rmi lam la sogs pa'i shes pa rnam pa las khyad par bye brag ma bsgrubs pa de srid du gang du yang ma 'khrul ba nyid du ma 'grub pa'i phyir khyad
analyzed: ji srid du rang bzhin du gnas pa'i mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa'i rnam par rmi lam la sogs pa'i shes pa rnam pa las khyad par bye brag ma bsgrubs pa de srid du gang du yang ma 'khrul ba nyid du ma 'grub pa'i phyir khyad
translated: as long as the consciousness of the eye faculty, etc. that exists naturally is not established as nonerroneous in any way, as long as it is not established as distinct from the aspect of consciousness in dreams, etc.,

original: par yang ma grub po //
analyzed: par yang ma grub po //
translated: then the distinction is not established.

original: 'di snyam du rang bzhin du gnas pa'i mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa rmi lam la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa las don bya ba byed pa la mi slu bas khyad par yod pa kho na'o snyam du sems na /
analyzed: 'di snyam du rang bzhin du gnas pa'i mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa rmi lam la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa las don bya ba byed pa la mi slu bas khyad par yod pa kho na'o snyam du sems na /
translated: If you think that the consciousness of the eye faculty, etc. that exists naturally is distinct from the consciousness in dreams, etc. because it is nondeceptive with regard to the performance of the function of objects,

original: de la don bya ba byed pa la mi slu ba zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig / gal te phyi rol gyi don thob pa yin na de ni ma grub po //
analyzed: de la don bya ba byed pa la mi slu ba zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig / gal te phyi rol gyi don thob pa yin na de ni ma grub po //
translated: then what is this so-called nondeceptiveness with regard to the performance of the function of objects? If it is the attainment of an external object, that is not established.

original: phyi rol gyi don grub par bya ba'i phyir te de nyid bsgrub par bya ba nyid kyi skabs yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don grub par bya ba'i phyir te de nyid bsgrub par bya ba nyid kyi skabs yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the occasion for establishing that very object.

original: ci ste mngon par 'dod pa'i don byed par snang ba'i shes pa nyid don byed pa la mi slu ba yin pa de'i tshe gzhan du yang ste phyi rol gyi don nyid dmigs pa med par yang 'di srid pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ci ste mngon par 'dod pa'i don byed par snang ba'i shes pa nyid don byed pa la mi slu ba yin pa de'i tshe gzhan du yang ste phyi rol gyi don nyid dmigs pa med par yang 'di srid pa'i phyir /
translated: But if the consciousness that appears to perform the function of the desired object is nondeceptive with regard to the performance of function, then it is possible that even in other cases, that is, even in the absence of external objects, it would perform the function of the object.üîΩEven so, the reason is not established.

original: de lta na yang gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid yin no ji ltar gzhan du yang srid ce na /
analyzed: de lta na yang gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid yin no ji ltar gzhan du yang srid ce na /
translated: How is it possible in other cases?

original: rgyu yi nus pa nges pa'i phyir //
analyzed: rgyu yi nus pa nges pa'i phyir //
translated: Because the power of the cause is ascertained.

original: zhes bya ba smos te /üîΩgtan tshigs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te / gtan tshigs so //
translated: This is the reason.

original: rgyu ni mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen te /
analyzed: rgyu ni mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen te /
translated: The cause is the equivalent immediately preceding condition.

original: mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyi nus pa'i khyad par nges pa'i phyir mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen kha cig kho na shes pa 'ga' zhig skyed par nus kyi thams cad ni ma yin te /
analyzed: mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyi nus pa'i khyad par nges pa'i phyir mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen kha cig kho na shes pa 'ga' zhig skyed par nus kyi thams cad ni ma yin te /
translated: Because the specific power of the equivalent immediately preceding condition is ascertained, some equivalent immediately preceding conditions are able to produce some consciousnesses, but not all.

original: dper na khyed cag gis phyi'i don bzhin no zhes bya ba de nyid las nges pa grub bo //üîΩrdul phran gnyis kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pas nam mkha'i gos can legs pa'i blo gros kyis /üîΩshes pa rigs pa med phyir ro //
analyzed: dper na khyed cag gis phyi'i don bzhin no zhes bya ba de nyid las nges pa grub bo // rdul phran gnyis kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pas nam mkha'i gos can legs pa'i blo gros kyis / shes pa rigs pa med phyir ro //
translated: For example, you say, ‚ÄúLike external objects,‚Äù and from that alone, you are certain.

original: zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs 'di ma grub par ston pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs 'di ma grub par ston pa yin te /
translated: With ‚ÄúTwo atoms,‚Äù and so on, Bhavaviveka teaches that the reason, ‚ÄúBecause consciousness of two is not reasonable,‚Äù is not established.

original: de ni 'di skad du zer te /üîΩdngos po thams cad ni spyi dang khyad par gyi bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ni 'di skad du zer te / dngos po thams cad ni spyi dang khyad par gyi bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: He says this:

original: rdul phra rab rnams ni 'dra ba dang mi 'dra ba'i ngo bo gnyis yin no //üîΩde la 'dra ba'i ngo bo gang yin pa de ni dbang pos gzung bar bya ba yin gyi /
analyzed: rdul phra rab rnams ni 'dra ba dang mi 'dra ba'i ngo bo gnyis yin no // de la 'dra ba'i ngo bo gang yin pa de ni dbang pos gzung bar bya ba yin gyi /
translated: ‚ÄúBecause all things have the nature of universals and particular instances, atoms have two natures: similar and dissimilar.

original: mi 'dra ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mi 'dra ba ni ma yin no //
translated: Among them, the similar nature is apprehended by the sense faculties, but not the dissimilar one.

original: de bas na gcig gi rnam pa can gyi shes pa ni rdul phra rab dag la mi 'gal ba'i phyir rdul phra rab rnams mngon sum gyis grub @112b pa yin no zhe'o //
analyzed: de bas na gcig gi rnam pa can gyi shes pa ni rdul phra rab dag la mi 'gal ba'i phyir rdul phra rab rnams mngon sum gyis grub @112b pa yin no zhe'o //
translated: Therefore, because there is no contradiction in a consciousness having the aspect of one with regard to atoms, atoms are established by direct perception.‚Äù

original: 'khrugs pa zhes bya ba ni mi gnas pa ste /
analyzed: 'khrugs pa zhes bya ba ni mi gnas pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúDisorder‚Äù means non-abiding,

original: ngo bo gcig nges pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ngo bo gcig nges pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no certainty of a single nature.

original: 'on te dngos po gnyis kyi ngo bo nyid do zhes nges pa'i ngo bor smras pa nyid ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te dngos po gnyis kyi ngo bo nyid do zhes nges pa'i ngo bor smras pa nyid ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: But isn‚Äôt it certain that the nature of a thing is twofold?

original: smras pa ni bden mod kyi mi rigs par smras so zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: smras pa ni bden mod kyi mi rigs par smras so zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: It is true that it is said to be so, but it is said in an unreasonable way.üîΩIn order to demonstrate this, he says, ‚ÄúBecause, how could it be . . . ‚Äù

original: gang phyir ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gang phyir ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: and so on.

original: dngos po'i ngo bos gnyis las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dngos po'i ngo bos gnyis las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the nature of a thing is not other than twofold,

original: dngos po gnyis nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: dngos po gnyis nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: it would be twofold.

original: ngo bo gnyis yin pa 'ba' zhig tu zad de /
analyzed: ngo bo gnyis yin pa 'ba' zhig tu zad de /
translated: It would be only twofold in nature,

original: phan tshun ngo bo ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phan tshun ngo bo ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are not mutually natures.

original: de ltar na gcig la ngo bo gnyis nyid rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na gcig la ngo bo gnyis nyid rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus, a twofold nature in one thing is unreasonable.

original: ngo bo gnyis phan tshun bdag nyid yin na yang dngos po gcig gi rang gi ngo bo bzhin du ngo bo gnyis dngos po gcig las tha mi dad pa'i phyir ji ltar gcig gnyis kyi ngo bo nyid du 'gyur /
analyzed: ngo bo gnyis phan tshun bdag nyid yin na yang dngos po gcig gi rang gi ngo bo bzhin du ngo bo gnyis dngos po gcig las tha mi dad pa'i phyir ji ltar gcig gnyis kyi ngo bo nyid du 'gyur /
translated: Although the two natures are mutually identical, just as the nature of a single thing is not different from a single thing, how could the two natures be the nature of one?

original: gzhan yang spyi'i ngo bo dang tha mi dad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan yang spyi'i ngo bo dang tha mi dad pa'i phyir /
translated: Moreover, because it is not different from the nature of generality,

original: khyad par gyi ngo bo dmigs pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khyad par gyi ngo bo dmigs pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: the nature of particularity would be observed.

original: de lta yin dang 'dra ba'i ngo bo ni dbang po'i shes pa'i spyod yul yin la /
analyzed: de lta yin dang 'dra ba'i ngo bo ni dbang po'i shes pa'i spyod yul yin la /
translated: If that were the case, then the nature of similarity would be the domain of the sense consciousnesses,üîΩand the nature of dissimilarity would be the domain of the yogic direct perception.

original: mi 'dra ba ni rnal 'byor gyi mngon sum du 'dod do zhes bya ba ni ma 'chol ba rnam par gzhag pa 'dir mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi 'dra ba ni rnal 'byor gyi mngon sum du 'dod do zhes bya ba ni ma 'chol ba rnam par gzhag pa 'dir mi 'gyur ro //
translated: This would not be a system that distinguishes between the two.

original: gzhan yang gcig gnyis kyi ngo bo yin no zhes bya ba 'di phan tshun 'gal ba yin pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad /
