analyzed: gzhan yang gcig gnyis kyi ngo bo yin no zhes bya ba 'di phan tshun 'gal ba yin pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad /
translated: Moreover, it is not only that the statement ‚ÄúIt is the nature of one and two‚Äù is contradictory.

original: phan tshun 'gal ba ngo bo gnyis kyis bdag nyid gcig yin no zhes bya ba gang yin pa 'di ni ches cher 'gal ba yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: phan tshun 'gal ba ngo bo gnyis kyis bdag nyid gcig yin no zhes bya ba gang yin pa 'di ni ches cher 'gal ba yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To demonstrate this, he says,

original: phan tshun zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: phan tshun zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Mutually exclusive, etc.

original: 'di ltar 'dra ba dang mi 'dra ba'i ngo bo phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid de'i bdag nyid de ji ltar gcig tu 'gyur /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'dra ba dang mi 'dra ba'i ngo bo phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid de'i bdag nyid de ji ltar gcig tu 'gyur /
translated: Thus, since the natures of similarity and dissimilarity are characteristics that exclude each other, how could they be the same nature?

original: gal te rig byed phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pas gzhon nu ma len gyi lugs dogs par byed de /
analyzed: gal te rig byed phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pas gzhon nu ma len gyi lugs dogs par byed de /
translated: In the passage beginning ‚ÄúBecause of the Vedas,‚Äù etc., Kumarila‚Äôs system is refuted.

original: de na re /
analyzed: de na re /
translated: He says:

original: dngos po gcig la phan tshun 'gal ba'i rnam pa rnams mi srid do zhes bya ba de lta bu yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po gcig la phan tshun 'gal ba'i rnam pa rnams mi srid do zhes bya ba de lta bu yod pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not possible for mutually exclusive aspects to exist in a single thing.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rigs phyir te rgyu'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rigs phyir te rgyu'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the reason.

original: 'di ltar dngos po gcig gis rnam pa gcig tu 'gyur bar bya dgos so zhes bya ba 'di rgyal po'i bka' ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar dngos po gcig gis rnam pa gcig tu 'gyur bar bya dgos so zhes bya ba 'di rgyal po'i bka' ni ma yin no //
translated: Thus, it is not the king‚Äôs decree that a single thing must be made into a single aspect.

original: 'on kyang gal te ji ltar dmigs pa de ltar khas blang bar bya ba dgos te /
analyzed: 'on kyang gal te ji ltar dmigs pa de ltar khas blang bar bya ba dgos te /
translated: But if you must accept that objects exist as they are perceived,

original: dngos po rnam par 'jog pa'i rgyu mtshan ni shes pa yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgcig dang du ma'i @113a * //
analyzed: dngos po rnam par 'jog pa'i rgyu mtshan ni shes pa yin pa'i phyir ro // gcig dang du ma'i @113a * //
translated: then the reason for positing things is consciousness.üîΩThe form of a single thing or a plurality of things is perceived as existing

original: rnam pa yang yod pa dang gzugs la sogs pa'i bye brag gis shes par 'gyur ba dmigs te /
analyzed: rnam pa yang yod pa dang gzugs la sogs pa'i bye brag gis shes par 'gyur ba dmigs te /
translated: and as having the distinctions of form, etc.

original: de'i phyir de kho na ltar rnam par gzhag pa yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir de kho na ltar rnam par gzhag pa yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Therefore, things are posited in accordance with that perception.

original: de min zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed de /
analyzed: de min zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed de /
translated: The response to that is, ‚ÄúThat is not so,‚Äù etc.

original: de lta na rnam par shes pa 'ga' yang 'khrul par mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: de lta na rnam par shes pa 'ga' yang 'khrul par mi 'gyur la /
translated: If that were so, then no consciousness would be mistaken.

original: tha dad pa'i tha snyad kyang 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tha dad pa'i tha snyad kyang 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: The convention of difference would also be explained.

original: ci ste gnod pa'i phyir 'ga' zhig 'khrul ba nyid du 'gyur na /
analyzed: ci ste gnod pa'i phyir 'ga' zhig 'khrul ba nyid du 'gyur na /
translated: But if some consciousness is mistaken because it is impaired,

original: dngos po gcig la gnod pa'i rnam par shes pa du ma ji ltar ma 'khrul bar 'gyur /
analyzed: dngos po gcig la gnod pa'i rnam par shes pa du ma ji ltar ma 'khrul bar 'gyur /
translated: how could a consciousness that is impaired with regard to a single thing not be mistaken?

original: de ltar re zhig rdul phra rab rnams mngon sum gyis ma grub la /
analyzed: de ltar re zhig rdul phra rab rnams mngon sum gyis ma grub la /
translated: Thus, the atoms are not established by direct perception.

original: rjes su dpag pas kyang ma grub pa'i phyir phyi rol gyi don la bsnyon pa la dam bca' ba mngon sum dang 'gal ba ma yin la /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pas kyang ma grub pa'i phyir phyi rol gyi don la bsnyon pa la dam bca' ba mngon sum dang 'gal ba ma yin la /
translated: Since it is not established by inference either, the thesis that refutes external objects is not contradicted by perception.

original: gtan tshigs ma grub pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: gtan tshigs ma grub pa yang ma yin no //
translated: Nor is the reason unestablished.

original: da ni gzhan gyis gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs 'di the tshom za ba'i ma grub pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni gzhan gyis gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs 'di the tshom za ba'i ma grub pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate that the reason ‚Äúbecause of being a nature of one and many‚Äù is unestablished due to doubt,

original: rdul phran tshad mas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: rdul phran tshad mas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: he says ‚Äúthe atom is not established by valid knowledge,‚Äù and so on.

original: 'byar ba dang ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed de /
analyzed: 'byar ba dang ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed de /
translated: He replies with ‚Äúif they are joined‚Äù and so on.

original: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin dang bral ba de ni med pa'i tha snyad du rung ba yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin dang bral ba de ni med pa'i tha snyad du rung ba yin te /
translated: The syllogism is: Whatever is devoid of a nature of one and many is suitable as a convention of nonexistence,

original: nam mkha'i padmo bzhin no //
analyzed: nam mkha'i padmo bzhin no //
translated: like a sky flower.

original: gzhan gyis mngon par 'dod pa'i rdul phra rab dag kyang gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin dang bral ba yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so /
analyzed: gzhan gyis mngon par 'dod pa'i rdul phra rab dag kyang gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin dang bral ba yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so /
translated: The subtle particles that others imagine are also devoid of the nature of one or many. This is a reason of nature.

original: gtan tshigs ma grub pa yin no zhes kyang bsam par mi bya ste /
analyzed: gtan tshigs ma grub pa yin no zhes kyang bsam par mi bya ste /
translated: One should not think that the reason is not established.

original: 'di ltar re zhig rdul phra rab rnam pa gcig nyid du ma grub ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar re zhig rdul phra rab rnam pa gcig nyid du ma grub ste /
translated: In this way, first, the subtle particles are not established as one kind.

original: bsags pa'i ngo bo'i ri la sogs pa la phyogs cha'i dbye ba yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsags pa'i ngo bo'i ri la sogs pa la phyogs cha'i dbye ba yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because a mountain, etc., which is the nature of an accumulation, has a division of parts.

original: ri la sogs pa'i rdul phra rab rnams kyi bsags pa gzhan du mi 'thad pas phyogs cha'i dbye ba de nyid thal bar 'gyur ba'i sgo nas re zhig gcig dgag pa bshad pa ni /
analyzed: ri la sogs pa'i rdul phra rab rnams kyi bsags pa gzhan du mi 'thad pas phyogs cha'i dbye ba de nyid thal bar 'gyur ba'i sgo nas re zhig gcig dgag pa bshad pa ni /
translated: Since it is not tenable that the subtle particles of a mountain, etc., are an accumulation in another way, that division of parts itself is explained as the refutation of one by way of consequence.üîΩIt is said:

original: 'byar ba dang ni bskor ba'am //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'byar ba dang ni bskor ba'am // zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: If they are joined or surrounded,üîΩetc.

original: de la kha cig na re /
analyzed: de la kha cig na re /
translated: Regarding that, someone says:

original: rdul phra rab rnams phan tshun 'byar ba yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: rdul phra rab rnams phan tshun 'byar ba yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: The subtle particles are mutually joined.

original: gzhan dag ni rtag tu bar dang bcas pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: gzhan dag ni rtag tu bar dang bcas pa nyid yin te /
translated: The other directions are always with intervals.

original: mi reg go zhes zer ro //
analyzed: mi reg go zhes zer ro //
translated: They do not touch.

original: gzhan dag ni bar med pa nyid la reg par 'du shes pa yin no zhes @113b zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni bar med pa nyid la reg par 'du shes pa yin no zhes @113b zer ro //
translated: Others say that they are perceived as touching, but without intervals.

original: de la phyogs gsum po de la yang mang pos bskor ba'i dbus na gnas pa'i rdul phra rab la gal te phyogs cha'i bye brag med par gyur na de'i tshe sems dang sems las byung ba'i tshogs bzhin du rgyas par mi 'gyur te /üîΩcha shas med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la phyogs gsum po de la yang mang pos bskor ba'i dbus na gnas pa'i rdul phra rab la gal te phyogs cha'i bye brag med par gyur na de'i tshe sems dang sems las byung ba'i tshogs bzhin du rgyas par mi 'gyur te / cha shas med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In the case of the three directions, if the subtle particle in the middle does not have directional parts, then it will not expand, like the collection of mind and mental factors, because it has no parts.üîΩIf the subtle particle in the middle has directional parts, then it will not be unitary.

original: 'di ltar gal te dbus na gnas pa'i rdul phra rab ngo bo gang kho nas rdul phra rab gcig la bltas pa'i ngo bo de nyid kyis rdul phra rab gzhan la yang bltas par gyur na de'i tshe bskor ba'i rdul phra rab rnams yul gcig pa nyid du
analyzed: 'di ltar gal te dbus na gnas pa'i rdul phra rab ngo bo gang kho nas rdul phra rab gcig la bltas pa'i ngo bo de nyid kyis rdul phra rab gzhan la yang bltas par gyur na de'i tshe bskor ba'i rdul phra rab rnams yul gcig pa nyid du
translated: Thus, if the nature of the subtle particle in the middle that faces one subtle particle is the same nature that faces another subtle particle, then the surrounding subtle particles would have the same location,

original: thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir rgyas par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir rgyas par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: because the middle subtle particle would not expand.

original: sbyor ba ni gang zhig rdul phra rab gcig gi ngo bo la bltas pa'i rang bzhin de ni yul gcig pa yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang zhig rdul phra rab gcig gi ngo bo la bltas pa'i rang bzhin de ni yul gcig pa yin te /
translated: The syllogism is: Whatever is the nature of the entity of one atom is the same object as that,

original: dper na de nyid shar gyi yul na gnas pa'i rdul phra rab gcig la bltas pa lta bu'am /
analyzed: dper na de nyid shar gyi yul na gnas pa'i rdul phra rab gcig la bltas pa lta bu'am /
translated: for example, just as one atom located in the east is seen,

original: shar gyi khang bzangs lta bu'o //
analyzed: shar gyi khang bzangs lta bu'o //
translated: or like an eastern mansion.

original: bskor nas gnas pa'i rdul phra rab thams cad kyang rdul phra rab kyi ngo bo gcig la bltas pa'i rang bzhin yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs yin te /
analyzed: bskor nas gnas pa'i rdul phra rab thams cad kyang rdul phra rab kyi ngo bo gcig la bltas pa'i rang bzhin yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs yin te /
translated: The nature of all atoms that surround it is the same as the nature of one atom.

original: des na rgyas par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na rgyas par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: This is a logical argument from nature, and therefore it does not expand.

original: ce ste ngo go gzhan gyis bltas na de'i tshe phyogs cha'i dbye ba yod pa'i phyir bum pa la sogs pa bzhin du gcig nyid du mi 'gyur ro / btsun pa dge srungs na re /
analyzed: ce ste ngo go gzhan gyis bltas na de'i tshe phyogs cha'i dbye ba yod pa'i phyir bum pa la sogs pa bzhin du gcig nyid du mi 'gyur ro / btsun pa dge srungs na re /
translated: But if it is seen by another person, then it is not one because it has directional parts, like a pot and so on.üîΩBhadanta KƒÅtyƒÅyanƒ´putra says:

original: dper na rang bzhin gcig la yod pa ma yin pa dang rdzas ma yin pa las ldog pa'i spyi dang du ma brtags pa yin gyi de kho na nyid ma yin pa de ltar 'dir yang rdul phra rab du ma'i bar na gnas pa'i phyir du ma nyidüîΩdu brtags pa yin gyi /
analyzed: dper na rang bzhin gcig la yod pa ma yin pa dang rdzas ma yin pa las ldog pa'i spyi dang du ma brtags pa yin gyi de kho na nyid ma yin pa de ltar 'dir yang rdul phra rab du ma'i bar na gnas pa'i phyir du ma nyid du brtags pa yin gyi /
translated: In the same way, here, the manifold is imagined to be the opposite of not existing between many subtle particles,

original: yang dag pa'i don ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i don ni ma yin no //
translated: but it is not the real meaning.

original: 'di ltar gzags zan la sogs pas brtags pa'i phyogs kyi dngos po zhes bya ba yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar gzags zan la sogs pas brtags pa'i phyogs kyi dngos po zhes bya ba yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Thus, the so-called directional entity imagined by the Lokayatas and so on does not exist.

original: de ni gcig yin pa'i phyir shar la sogs pa'i shes pa du ma'i ngo bor 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ni gcig yin pa'i phyir shar la sogs pa'i shes pa du ma'i ngo bor 'gyur te /
translated: Because it is one, it would become the nature of many cognitions such as east and so on.

original: rdul phra rab rnams nyid shar dang nub dang gnas pa na phyogs kyi sgras brjod pa 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
analyzed: rdul phra rab rnams nyid shar dang nub dang gnas pa na phyogs kyi sgras brjod pa 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
translated: The subtle particles themselves are merely expressed by the term direction when they are in the east, west, or center.

original: des lta bas na phyogs cha'i bye brag dang ldan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la mang po dag gis bskor ba nyid la bstan pa nyid yin pa 'ba' zhig tu zad kyi /
analyzed: des lta bas na phyogs cha'i bye brag dang ldan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la mang po dag gis bskor ba nyid la bstan pa nyid yin pa 'ba' zhig tu zad kyi /
translated: Therefore, it is said that because it possesses directional distinctions, it is merely taught that it is surrounded by many.

original: cha shas dang bcas pa nyid ni ma yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: cha shas dang bcas pa nyid ni ma yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: But they do not have parts.

original: de ni yang dag pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni yang dag pa ma yin te /
translated: This is not correct.

original: 'di ltar cha shas med pa'i phyir sems bzhin du rdul phra rab rnams don dam par steng dang 'og @114a * //
analyzed: 'di ltar cha shas med pa'i phyir sems bzhin du rdul phra rab rnams don dam par steng dang 'og @114a * //
translated: Because they are partless, like the mind, the atoms do not have an upper or lower part in the ultimate sense.

original: gi cha yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir mang po dag gis bskor ba nyid du yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gi cha yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir mang po dag gis bskor ba nyid du yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: And because of that, they cannot be surrounded by many atoms,

original: sems dang sems las byung ba la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: like the mind and mental factors.

original: de lta yin dang skor bar byed pa'i rdul phra rab rnams don dam par med pa'i phyir gang gi yul gyis byas pa'i gcig nyid du rtogs par byed pa ji ltar de'i sgo nas du ma'i dbus na gnas pa nyid yin /
analyzed: de lta yin dang skor bar byed pa'i rdul phra rab rnams don dam par med pa'i phyir gang gi yul gyis byas pa'i gcig nyid du rtogs par byed pa ji ltar de'i sgo nas du ma'i dbus na gnas pa nyid yin /
translated: If that were so, then since the atoms that surround it do not exist in the ultimate sense, how can the atom that is the object of that cognition be conceived as one, and how can it be conceived as existing in the middle surrounded by many?

original: ci ste don dam par steng 'og gi cha yod pa ma yin kyang dbus ma la mang pos yongs su bskor bar 'gyur na sems dang sems las byung ba rnams las yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ci ste don dam par steng 'og gi cha yod pa ma yin kyang dbus ma la mang pos yongs su bskor bar 'gyur na sems dang sems las byung ba rnams las yang 'gyur ro //
translated: If, in the ultimate sense, it has no upper or lower part, but the middle is surrounded by many, then the mind and mental factors would also be so surrounded.

original: de lta bas na rdul phra rab bzhin du sems la sogs pa rnams kyang yul na gnas pa nyid du 'gyur ba ma yin no zhe na ni rdul phra rab rnams kyang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta bas na rdul phra rab bzhin du sems la sogs pa rnams kyang yul na gnas pa nyid du 'gyur ba ma yin no zhe na ni rdul phra rab rnams kyang mi 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, like subtle particles, minds and so on would not exist as objects.

original: de ltar na sems la sogs pa bzhin du rgyas par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba nges so //
analyzed: de ltar na sems la sogs pa bzhin du rgyas par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba nges so //
translated: But if you say that subtle particles do not exist in that way, then like minds and so on, they would not increase.

original: 'di snyam du dper na da ltar byung ba'i sems kyi skad cig 'das pa dang ma 'ong pa'i sems kyi skad cig dag dus kyis byas pa'i bar med pa nyid yod cing /
analyzed: 'di snyam du dper na da ltar byung ba'i sems kyi skad cig 'das pa dang ma 'ong pa'i sems kyi skad cig dag dus kyis byas pa'i bar med pa nyid yod cing /
translated: You may think that just as the present moment of mind has no temporal interval between the past and future moments of mind,

original: yang da lta ba'i sems kyi skad cig dang yud tsam la sogs pa bzhin du cha dang bcas pa ma yin pa de bzhin du rdul phra rab rnams mang pos bskor ba yin na yang yul gyis byas pa'i cha dang bcas pa nyid du 'gyur ba ma yinüîΩno snyam du sems na /
analyzed: yang da lta ba'i sems kyi skad cig dang yud tsam la sogs pa bzhin du cha dang bcas pa ma yin pa de bzhin du rdul phra rab rnams mang pos bskor ba yin na yang yul gyis byas pa'i cha dang bcas pa nyid du 'gyur ba ma yin no snyam du sems na /
translated: and just as the present moment of mind and so on is not divisible, in the same way, even though many subtle particles surround it, the object would not have parts created by space.

original: de ni yang dag pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni yang dag pa ma yin te /
translated: That is not correct.

original: da ltar byung ba'i sems kyi skad cig snga ma dang phyi ma dang don dam par med par nyid yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: da ltar byung ba'i sems kyi skad cig snga ma dang phyi ma dang don dam par med par nyid yod pa ma yin te /
translated: The past and future moments of the present mind do not exist ultimately,

original: de'i tshe de dag med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe de dag med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because at that time they do not exist.

original: med pa dang lhan cig snga ma dang phyi ma yang dag par rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: med pa dang lhan cig snga ma dang phyi ma yang dag par rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not tenable that the past and future exist simultaneously with the present,

original: lhan cig 'byung ba dag la rgyud dang 'bras bu'i ngo bo med pa'i phyir snga ma dang phyis med pa bzhin du de'i sgo nas snga ma dang phyi ma'i skad cig dag gis yod pa brtags pas kun nas bslang ba 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
analyzed: lhan cig 'byung ba dag la rgyud dang 'bras bu'i ngo bo med pa'i phyir snga ma dang phyis med pa bzhin du de'i sgo nas snga ma dang phyi ma'i skad cig dag gis yod pa brtags pas kun nas bslang ba 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
translated: because, like the past and future, they do not have the nature of a continuum or result that arises simultaneously. Therefore, the imputation of the existence of the past and future moments of consciousness is merely a conceptual imputation.

original: de ltar rdul phra rab rnams kyis snga ma dang phyi ma'i yul gyis byas pa'i kun brtags pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar rdul phra rab rnams kyis snga ma dang phyi ma'i yul gyis byas pa'i kun brtags pa ma yin te /
translated: Thus, the past and future are not imputed to be objects of the present subtle particles.

original: rgyas par med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyas par med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it would follow that they would not exist.

original: gzhan yang re zhig dngos po rnams kyi rgyu med pa nyid ni rigs pa dang ldan pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang re zhig dngos po rnams kyi rgyu med pa nyid ni rigs pa dang ldan pa ma yin te /
translated: Moreover, it is not logical that things are causeless.

original: rtag tu yod pa la sogs par thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag tu yod pa la sogs par thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow that they would always exist and so on.

original: gang yang dngos @114b po rnams kun rdzob nyid du khas len pa des kyang gdon mi za bar dngos po thams cad rgyu dang bcas pa nyid du 'dod dgos so //
analyzed: gang yang dngos @114b po rnams kun rdzob nyid du khas len pa des kyang gdon mi za bar dngos po thams cad rgyu dang bcas pa nyid du 'dod dgos so //
translated: Also, those who accept that things are only conventional must certainly accept that all things have causes.

original: rgyu dang bcas pa nyid yin na /
analyzed: rgyu dang bcas pa nyid yin na /
translated: If they have causes,

original: re zhig rgyu dang 'bras bu dag ni dus mtshungs par rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: re zhig rgyu dang 'bras bu dag ni dus mtshungs par rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: it is not logical that cause and effect are simultaneous,

original: 'bras bu skye ba las rgyu med pa nyid kyis mi nus pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: 'bras bu skye ba las rgyu med pa nyid kyis mi nus pa'i phyir la /
translated: because if the effect is produced, it is not possible for the cause to be nonexistent,

original: phyis 'bras bu skyes na yang rgyu dgos pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyis 'bras bu skyes na yang rgyu dgos pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and if the effect is produced later, the cause is not necessary.

original: des na gdon mi za bar rgyu thams cad sngar yod par khas blang bar bya dgos te /
analyzed: des na gdon mi za bar rgyu thams cad sngar yod par khas blang bar bya dgos te /
translated: Therefore, one must certainly accept that all causes exist prior to their effects.

original: ci skad du /
analyzed: ci skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: med pa sngar nus med phyir dang // phyis kyang nye bar mi sbyor phyir //
analyzed: med pa sngar nus med phyir dang // phyis kyang nye bar mi sbyor phyir //
translated: Because the nonexistent is not able to produce prior to, and because it does not connect later,

original: rgyu rnams thams cad sngar yod yin //üîΩde'i phyir rang blo can don min //
analyzed: rgyu rnams thams cad sngar yod yin // de'i phyir rang blo can don min //
translated: all causes exist prior to.

original: zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: Therefore, those with their own minds do not have objects.

original: de'i phyir de ltar dngos po thams cad rigs pas rnam par gzhag pa'i cha med pa nyid yin na yang gal te cha dang bcas pa nyid du ma gyur na yul dang dus kyis byas pa'i snga ma dang phyi ma dag tu ji ltar 'gyur zhes rgol na
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar dngos po thams cad rigs pas rnam par gzhag pa'i cha med pa nyid yin na yang gal te cha dang bcas pa nyid du ma gyur na yul dang dus kyis byas pa'i snga ma dang phyi ma dag tu ji ltar 'gyur zhes rgol na
translated: Therefore, if all things are established by reasoning as partless, then if they do not possess parts, how could they be earlier or later in terms of place or time?

original: ci ste cha dang bcas pa nyid ma yin na yang sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kyang dus kyis byas pa'i snga ma dang phyi ma dag tu 'gyur te /
analyzed: ci ste cha dang bcas pa nyid ma yin na yang sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kyang dus kyis byas pa'i snga ma dang phyi ma dag tu 'gyur te /
translated: But if they do not possess parts, then minds and mental factors would be earlier and later in terms of time,

original: khyad par med pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan zin to //
analyzed: khyad par med pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan zin to //
translated: because they are not different.

original: lus can gyis byas pa'i khyad par yod do zhe na /
analyzed: lus can gyis byas pa'i khyad par yod do zhe na /
translated: If you say they are different due to the body,

original: ma yin te de nyid ma grub ste /
analyzed: ma yin te de nyid ma grub ste /
translated: that is not so, because that is not established.

original: cha shas dang bcas pa nyid yin na rnam grangs kyi cha dang bcas pa nyid du 'gyur ba kho nar zad kyi khyad par gzhan med pa'i phyir 'di ni ci yang ma yin no //
analyzed: cha shas dang bcas pa nyid yin na rnam grangs kyi cha dang bcas pa nyid du 'gyur ba kho nar zad kyi khyad par gzhan med pa'i phyir 'di ni ci yang ma yin no //
translated: If they possess parts, they would definitely possess parts that are enumerated, but there is no other difference, so this is nothing.

original: de lta bas na dngos po thams cad kyi dus kyis byas pa'i snga ma dang phyi ma'i rigs pa ma yin na 'ga' zhig la yul gyis byas pa'i snga ma dang phyi ma lhag par gzhan gang yin pa de cha dang bcas pa nyid med na mi sridüîΩpa'i phyir / gang la phyogs cha tha dad yod //
analyzed: de lta bas na dngos po thams cad kyi dus kyis byas pa'i snga ma dang phyi ma'i rigs pa ma yin na 'ga' zhig la yul gyis byas pa'i snga ma dang phyi ma lhag par gzhan gang yin pa de cha dang bcas pa nyid med na mi srid pa'i phyir / gang la phyogs cha tha dad yod //
translated: Therefore, if the sequence of all things in terms of time is not tenable, then how could the sequence of things in terms of place be tenable?

original: de ni gcig tu mi rung ngo //üîΩzhes bshad pa yang rigs pa yin te //
analyzed: de ni gcig tu mi rung ngo // zhes bshad pa yang rigs pa yin te //
translated: If it is not possible for something to exist without parts, then it is untenable to say that something is one.üîΩThis is also logical.

original: spros pas chog go //
analyzed: spros pas chog go //
translated: Enough with this elaboration.

original: de la kha cig na re /üîΩ'o na shin tu phra ba'i cha de dag nyid rdul phra rab yin du chug mod /
analyzed: de la kha cig na re / 'o na shin tu phra ba'i cha de dag nyid rdul phra rab yin du chug mod /
translated: In this regard, some say:üîΩWell, let us assume that those extremely subtle parts are subtle particles.

original: de lta na yang cha shas rtog pa na yang cha nyid du rdul phra rab tu 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta na yang cha shas rtog pa na yang cha nyid du rdul phra rab tu 'gyur te /
translated: However, when one conceives of parts, those parts would be subtle particles.

original: 'on kyang thug pa med pa nyid du 'gyur gyi cha shas dang bcas pa nyid du thal ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang thug pa med pa nyid du 'gyur gyi cha shas dang bcas pa nyid du thal ba ni ma yin no //
translated: But it would be infinite regress, it would not follow that they have parts.

original: rdul phra rab rnams brtags su yod pa nyid du bsgrub par nus pa ma yin la /
analyzed: rdul phra rab rnams brtags su yod pa nyid du bsgrub par nus pa ma yin la /
translated: It is not possible to prove that subtle particles exist as imputations.

original: ci ste brtags su @115a * //
analyzed: ci ste brtags su @115a * //
translated: But even if it does exist as an object of investigation,

original: yod pa de lta na yang /üîΩnges par gdags pa'i nye bar len pa khas blang bar bya dgos te /
analyzed: yod pa de lta na yang / nges par gdags pa'i nye bar len pa khas blang bar bya dgos te /
translated: thenüîΩyou must accept that it is the appropriated aggregates that are definitely designated as the self,

original: brtags pa'i nye bar len pa gang yin pa de nyid du rdul phra rab tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: brtags pa'i nye bar len pa gang yin pa de nyid du rdul phra rab tu 'gyur ro //
translated: because the appropriated aggregates are the very thing that is investigated as the self.

original: ci ste rdul phra rab rnams kyang med pa nyid du bsgrub pa de lta na yang /üîΩphyogs cha'i dbye ba yod pa'i phyir //
analyzed: ci ste rdul phra rab rnams kyang med pa nyid du bsgrub pa de lta na yang / phyogs cha'i dbye ba yod pa'i phyir //
translated: But if you establish that even the most subtle particles do not exist,

original: zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs ma grub pa yin te /üîΩgtan tshigs med pa'i bong bu'i rva la sogs pa la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs ma grub pa yin te / gtan tshigs med pa'i bong bu'i rva la sogs pa la /
translated: then the reason ‚Äúbecause they have directional parts‚Äù is not established.üîΩBecause a reason that does not exist cannot prove anything,

original: shar la sogs pa'i phyogs cha'i dbye ba dang ldan par 'gyur ba yang ma yin la /
analyzed: shar la sogs pa'i phyogs cha'i dbye ba dang ldan par 'gyur ba yang ma yin la /
translated: it is not the case that the horns of a donkey and so on have directional parts such as east and so on.

original: thal ba bsgrub pa yang ma yin te /üîΩphyogs cha'i dbye ba khas ma blangs pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: thal ba bsgrub pa yang ma yin te / phyogs cha'i dbye ba khas ma blangs pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
translated: Nor is it the case that the absurd consequence is established,üîΩbecause directional parts are not accepted.

original: 'di la lan 'debs pa ni gzhan gyis cha'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'di la lan 'debs pa ni gzhan gyis cha'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The response to this is as follows: The opponent says, ‚ÄúThe directional parts of the particles. . . .‚Äù

original: de smra bas gdon mi za bar mthar thug pa'i ngo bo'i dngos po cung zad cig rdul phra rab nyid du khas blang bar bya ste /
analyzed: de smra bas gdon mi za bar mthar thug pa'i ngo bo'i dngos po cung zad cig rdul phra rab nyid du khas blang bar bya ste /
translated: Therefore, one must definitely accept that the ultimate nature of things is some entity that is a subtle particle.

original: de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin te /
translated: If that were not so,

original: thug pa med pa nyid yin na ngo bo nges par ma bzung ba'i phyir rang nyid kyis nye bar brjod pa med pa nyid du bstan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: thug pa med pa nyid yin na ngo bo nges par ma bzung ba'i phyir rang nyid kyis nye bar brjod pa med pa nyid du bstan par 'gyur te /
translated: then since the ultimate nature of things would not be ascertained, it would be taught that it is not expressed by oneself.

original: de lta yin dang gzhan gyi 'dod pa bsgrub par bya ba nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta yin dang gzhan gyi 'dod pa bsgrub par bya ba nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were the case, it would be established as the assertion of another.

original: de lta bas na nges pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis rdul phra rab nyid du rnam par gzhag pa gang yin pa de nyid la ma brten par thug pa med pa'i rnam par rtog pa yin te /
analyzed: de lta bas na nges pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis rdul phra rab nyid du rnam par gzhag pa gang yin pa de nyid la ma brten par thug pa med pa'i rnam par rtog pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, the conception of an infinite regress that does not rely on the very subtle particle that is posited as the ascertained nature of things is untenable.

original: gang gi tshe spyod par byed pa de'i tshe ji ltar thug pa med par 'gyur /
analyzed: gang gi tshe spyod par byed pa de'i tshe ji ltar thug pa med par 'gyur /
translated: If one engages in that, then how could there be an infinite regress?

original: 'on kyang thug pa med pas rang gis khas blangs pa dang 'gal bar byas par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: 'on kyang thug pa med pas rang gis khas blangs pa dang 'gal bar byas par 'gyur gyi /
translated: However, because of the infinite regress, one would contradict one‚Äôs own assertion.

original: gzhan la mi 'dod pa cung zad bsgrub pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan la mi 'dod pa cung zad bsgrub pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not that a little of what is undesirable for others is accomplished.

original: 'di tsam nyid kyis gzhan gyi 'dod pa grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di tsam nyid kyis gzhan gyi 'dod pa grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For just this much, the desire of others is accomplished.

original: 'di ni thal ba bsgrub pa yin la /
analyzed: 'di ni thal ba bsgrub pa yin la /
translated: This is the proof of the reductio.

original: gtan tshigs ma grub pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gtan tshigs ma grub pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is the reason unestablished.

original: 'di ltar gzhan gyis rdul phra rab rnams 'byar ba nyid dang / bar med pa nyid dang / de bzhin du bar dang bcas pa mang pos yongs su bskor ba yin no zhes khas blangs pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar gzhan gyis rdul phra rab rnams 'byar ba nyid dang / bar med pa nyid dang / de bzhin du bar dang bcas pa mang pos yongs su bskor ba yin no zhes khas blangs pa yin te /
translated: For thus, others accept that the atoms are in contact, without interval, and likewise, surrounded by many with intervals.

original: de lta ma yin na ji ltar rgyas par 'gyur /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na ji ltar rgyas par 'gyur /
translated: If it were not so, how could they be extended?

original: de lta na gal te yang phyogs cha'i dbye ba brjod par mi bya bar khas blangs pa de lta na yag 'byar ba la sogs pa'i chos khas blangs pa'i stobs nyid las 'ongs ba yin no //
analyzed: de lta na gal te yang phyogs cha'i dbye ba brjod par mi bya bar khas blangs pa de lta na yag 'byar ba la sogs pa'i chos khas blangs pa'i stobs nyid las 'ongs ba yin no //
translated: Thus, even if one accepts that the spatial division is inexpressible, still, by the power of accepting the qualities of contact, etc.,

original: steng 'og gi cha la sogs pa'i phyogs @115b kyi dbye ba med na 'byar ba la sogs pa'i phyogs gsum rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: steng 'og gi cha la sogs pa'i phyogs @115b kyi dbye ba med na 'byar ba la sogs pa'i phyogs gsum rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: the three qualities of contact, etc., are not reasonable if there is no spatial division of upper and lower parts, etc.

original: sems la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bshad zin to //
analyzed: sems la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bshad zin to //
translated: We have already explained that this is like the case of the mind.

original: gang yang rdul phra rab btags su yod pa yin na gdon mi za bar nye bar len pa khas blang bar bya dgos la nye bar len pa gang yin pa de nyid du rdul phra rab tu 'gyur ro zhes smras pa de la /
analyzed: gang yang rdul phra rab btags su yod pa yin na gdon mi za bar nye bar len pa khas blang bar bya dgos la nye bar len pa gang yin pa de nyid du rdul phra rab tu 'gyur ro zhes smras pa de la /
translated: You also said that if the subtle particle exists as a nominal reality, then it must be accepted as a substantial reality, and that whatever is a substantial reality is a subtle particle.

original: 'dir log pa'i bstan bcos thos pa dang bsam pa las bsgos pa'i bag chags yongs su smin pa dang / skar khung la sogs pa'i rdul snang ba'i 'khrul ba'i blo'i rgyu mtshan yod pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'dir log pa'i bstan bcos thos pa dang bsam pa las bsgos pa'i bag chags yongs su smin pa dang / skar khung la sogs pa'i rdul snang ba'i 'khrul ba'i blo'i rgyu mtshan yod pa nyid do //
translated: Here, the cause of the erroneous cognition that perceives particles in a window opening, etc., is the ripening of the habitual tendencies infused by the study of and reflection upon false treatises.

original: btags pa gang yin pa de nyid rgyur regs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: btags pa gang yin pa de nyid rgyur regs pa ma yin te /
translated: That which is a nominal reality is not a cause,

original: btags su yod pa ma yin par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //üîΩde lta ma yin na bdag tu gdags pa'i rgyu bdag nyid yin par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: btags su yod pa ma yin par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro // de lta ma yin na bdag tu gdags pa'i rgyu bdag nyid yin par 'gyur gyi /
translated: because it would follow, absurdly, that it would not exist as a nominal reality.

original: phung po ni ma yin no //
analyzed: phung po ni ma yin no //
translated: If it were not so, then the cause of the imputation of self would be the self and not the aggregates.

original: de lta yin dang rdul phra rab bzhin du bdag gdags par yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta yin dang rdul phra rab bzhin du bdag gdags par yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were so, then just as the self is imputed, the subtle particle would not be imputed.

original: de ltar re zhig rdul phra rab rnams gcig nyid du ma grub po //
analyzed: de ltar re zhig rdul phra rab rnams gcig nyid du ma grub po //
translated: Thus, first, the atoms are not established as one.

original: de ma grub pas na du ma nyid kyang ma grub ste /
analyzed: de ma grub pas na du ma nyid kyang ma grub ste /
translated: Since that is not established, multiplicity is not established.

original: de ni de bsags pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ni de bsags pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because that is the nature of the accumulation of those.

original: rdul phra rab med pa'i tha snyad sgrub par byed pa'i gtan tshigs ma grub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rdul phra rab med pa'i tha snyad sgrub par byed pa'i gtan tshigs ma grub pa ma yin no //
translated: The reason that proves the nonexistence of atoms is not unestablished.

original: de ltar re zhig phyi rol gyi don du ma'i rang bzhin dang bral ba nyid du bsgrubs nas /
analyzed: de ltar re zhig phyi rol gyi don du ma'i rang bzhin dang bral ba nyid du bsgrubs nas /
translated: Thus, first, having proven that external objects are devoid of a nature of multiplicity,

original: da ni gcig gi rang bzhin dang bral ba nyid du bsgrub pa'i phyir /üîΩrdul phran mi rigs pa yi phyir //
analyzed: da ni gcig gi rang bzhin dang bral ba nyid du bsgrub pa'i phyir / rdul phran mi rigs pa yi phyir //
translated: now, in order to prove that they are devoid of a nature of singularity,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: he says, ‚ÄúBecause atoms are not tenable,‚Äù and so on.

original: gang dag rags pa rdul phra rab rnams kyis ma brtsams par 'dod pa de dag gi ltar na 'di yang rdul phra rab bzhin du gcig tu mi rigs te /
analyzed: gang dag rags pa rdul phra rab rnams kyis ma brtsams par 'dod pa de dag gi ltar na 'di yang rdul phra rab bzhin du gcig tu mi rigs te /
translated: Those who assert that the coarse is not composed of subtle atoms, for them, this is not tenable as one, like the subtle atoms.

original: phyogs cha tha dad pa'i phyir dang / lag pa la sogs pa g-yo ba na thams cad g-yo ba la sogs par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la ni lan mang du dpyad pas gsal ba'i phyir logs shig tu sun 'byin pa ma brjod do //
analyzed: phyogs cha tha dad pa'i phyir dang / lag pa la sogs pa g-yo ba na thams cad g-yo ba la sogs par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la ni lan mang du dpyad pas gsal ba'i phyir logs shig tu sun 'byin pa ma brjod do //
translated: Because of the different directions, and because if the hand and so on move, it would follow that all would move, and so on. Since this has been analyzed many times, and since it is clear, I will not state a separate refutation.üîΩTherefore, when proving the nonexistence of external objects in this way, the reason, ‚Äúbecause it is not a nature of one or many,‚Äù and so on, is not unestablished.

original: de'i phyir de ltar phyi rol gyi don med pa'i tha snyad du bsgrub pa na gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin du 'gyur ba ma yin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sbyor ba la sogs pa gtan tshigs ma grub pa ma yin pa'i phyir phyi rol saüîΩla sogs pa'i gzung bar bya ba med pa'i tha snyad du grub po //üîΩde med na de la ltos nas btags pa'i shes pa'i 'dzin par byed pa yang med pa'i phyir rnam par rig pa @116a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar phyi rol gyi don med pa'i tha snyad du bsgrub pa na gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin du 'gyur ba ma yin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sbyor ba la sogs pa gtan tshigs ma grub pa ma yin pa'i phyir phyi rol sa la sogs pa'i gzung bar bya ba med pa'i tha snyad du grub po // de med na de la ltos nas btags pa'i shes pa'i 'dzin par byed pa yang med pa'i phyir rnam par rig pa @116a * //
translated: Therefore, external objects such as form are established as nonexistent.

original: tsam nyid du grub po //
analyzed: tsam nyid du grub po //
translated: Since that does not exist, the apprehending consciousness that is imputed in dependence on that also does not exist. Therefore, consciousness only is established.

original: de'i phyir de ltar phyi rol gyi don mi 'thad pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa tsam du bstan nas /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar phyi rol gyi don mi 'thad pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa tsam du bstan nas /
translated: Therefore, because external objects are not tenable in this way, [the root text] declares that [consciousness] is mere imagination.

original: da ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid 'gal ba nyid du bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid 'gal ba nyid du bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate the contradiction between the characteristics of the apprehended and the apprehender, [the root text] states:

original: rnam pa med pa dang rnam pa bcas //
analyzed: rnam pa med pa dang rnam pa bcas //
translated: Without an aspect, with an aspect,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: and with another aspect,üîΩan external object is not apprehended.

original: rnam pa med pa'am /üîΩrnam pa dang bcas pa'am /
analyzed: rnam pa med pa'am / rnam pa dang bcas pa'am /
translated: An aspect does not exist separately.

original: gzhan gyi rnam pas kyang phyi rol gyi don 'dzin par rigs pa ma yin la /
analyzed: gzhan gyi rnam pas kyang phyi rol gyi don 'dzin par rigs pa ma yin la /
translated: Without an aspect, with an aspect, and with another aspect, an external object is not apprehended.

original: rnam pa gzhan yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: An aspect does not exist separately.

original: de'i phyir phyi rol gyi rgyu gzhan yod na yang shes pa ni bdag nyid rig pa tsam kho na yin pa'i phyir rnam par rig pa tsam du grub po //
analyzed: de'i phyir phyi rol gyi rgyu gzhan yod na yang shes pa ni bdag nyid rig pa tsam kho na yin pa'i phyir rnam par rig pa tsam du grub po //
translated: Therefore, even if there are external causes, consciousness is established as mere representation because it is only the self-awareness of consciousness.

original: kha cig ni shes pa gzhan gyi rnam pa can yang don gzhan gyi rnam par rig par 'dod de /
analyzed: kha cig ni shes pa gzhan gyi rnam pa can yang don gzhan gyi rnam par rig par 'dod de /
translated: Some assert that consciousness has the aspect of another and is the representation of another object.

original: dper na dkar po'i rnam pa can gyi shes pa yang dung ser por 'dzin pa yin no zhes grags pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na dkar po'i rnam pa can gyi shes pa yang dung ser por 'dzin pa yin no zhes grags pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is well known that a cognition having the aspect of white apprehends a yellow conch.

original: ci skad du ku m'a ra ri las /
analyzed: ci skad du ku m'a ra ri las /
translated: As Kumarila says:

original: skye ba gcig po de la ni //üîΩyul du gzhan gyi bdag nyid kyi //
analyzed: skye ba gcig po de la ni // yul du gzhan gyi bdag nyid kyi //
translated: In that one life,üîΩall external objects are perceived

original: phyi rol thams cad du dmigs te //
analyzed: phyi rol thams cad du dmigs te //
translated: as having the nature of something else,

original: de'i tshe dus gzhan du yang yin //
analyzed: de'i tshe dus gzhan du yang yin //
translated: and at that time, as at another time.

original: zhes smras pa'i phyir phyogs gsum po dgos par byas so //
analyzed: zhes smras pa'i phyir phyogs gsum po dgos par byas so //
translated: Thus, the third position is also necessary.

original: 'on te bdag rig pa la yang rnam pa med pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa ci'i phyir 'jug par mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te bdag rig pa la yang rnam pa med pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa ci'i phyir 'jug par mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: But why does the idea of a self-awareness that is without aspects, etc., not occur in regard to the awareness of the self?

original: rnam shes bems po'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rnam shes bems po'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúConsciousness is not like an inanimate . . . ,‚Äù and so on.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i ngo bos bdag nyid rig par 'dod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i ngo bos bdag nyid rig par 'dod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not asserted that the self is aware of itself in the manner of an object and an agent.

original: 'o na ci zhe na nam mkha'i dkyil du gnas pa'i snang ba bzhin du rang nyid rang bzhin gyis gsal ba yin no //
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na nam mkha'i dkyil du gnas pa'i snang ba bzhin du rang nyid rang bzhin gyis gsal ba yin no //
translated: But rather, like the light in the center of space, it is naturally clear.

original: yang ci'i phyir gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i ngo bor mi 'dod ce na /üîΩgcig pa cha med rang bzhin la //
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i ngo bor mi 'dod ce na / gcig pa cha med rang bzhin la //
translated: Why is it not accepted as having the nature of apprehended object and apprehending subject?

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúIn the nature of a single partless . . .‚Äù

original: gsum gyi rang bzhin ni rig bya dang rig byed dang / rig pa'i bye brag gis so //
analyzed: gsum gyi rang bzhin ni rig bya dang rig byed dang / rig pa'i bye brag gis so //
translated: The nature of the three is distinguished as that which is to be known, that which knows, and that which distinguishes.

original: yang ci ste phyi rol gyi bdag nyid rig pa bzhin du gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i ngo bo med na yang rig par 'gyur ro snyam na /üîΩde'i rang bzhin gzhan la med //
analyzed: yang ci ste phyi rol gyi bdag nyid rig pa bzhin du gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i ngo bo med na yang rig par 'gyur ro snyam na / de'i rang bzhin gzhan la med //
translated: If external things do not have the nature of apprehended object and apprehending subject, like awareness, then they would be awareness.

original: ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúIts nature does not exist in others . . .‚Äù

original: gal te yang dngos po rnams la med pa la sogs pa la ldog pa'i yod pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo gcig yin pa de lta na yang de dngos po re re la don dam par tha dad pa'i phyir gcig nyid du yod pa ma yin @116b no
analyzed: gal te yang dngos po rnams la med pa la sogs pa la ldog pa'i yod pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo gcig yin pa de lta na yang de dngos po re re la don dam par tha dad pa'i phyir gcig nyid du yod pa ma yin @116b no
translated: If nonexistence and so on are the same nature as existence and so on, which are the opposites of nonexistence and so on, then they would not exist as a single thing, because they are ultimately different in each thing.

original: zhe na / dam pa'i don du zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: zhe na / dam pa'i don du zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: He says, ‚ÄúIn the ultimate . . .‚Äù

original: gal te 'di snyam du phyi rol gyi don shes pa las tha dad pa de lta na yang shes pa bzhin du rig par 'gyur ro snyam du sems na rtog pa'i ngo bor zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: gal te 'di snyam du phyi rol gyi don shes pa las tha dad pa de lta na yang shes pa bzhin du rig par 'gyur ro snyam du sems na rtog pa'i ngo bor zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: If you think that even if external objects are different from consciousness, they would be cognized like consciousness, then the verse says, ‚ÄúThe nature of thought, etc.‚Äù

original: de ltar rang rig pa bsgrubs nas /
analyzed: de ltar rang rig pa bsgrubs nas /
translated: Having thus established reflexive awareness,

original: da ni ji ltar rnam pa med pa'i shes pas phyi rol rig par mi rigs pa de ltar bsgrub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni ji ltar rnam pa med pa'i shes pas phyi rol rig par mi rigs pa de ltar bsgrub pa'i phyir /
translated: now, in order to establish how it is illogical for a consciousness without aspects to cognize external objects,

original: shes pa rnam bcas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: shes pa rnam bcas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúConsciousness with aspects,‚Äù and so on.

original: gzugs brnyan ni shes pa'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs brnyan ni shes pa'i rnam pa'o //
translated: The reflection is the aspect of consciousness.

original: 'dra bas ni zhes bya ba ni don dang 'dra ba las so /
analyzed: 'dra bas ni zhes bya ba ni don dang 'dra ba las so /
translated: ‚ÄúLike‚Äù means like the object.

original: gdags pa zhes bya ba ni dngos ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: gdags pa zhes bya ba ni dngos ma yin pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúDesignation‚Äù means not real.

original: 'di yang zhes bya ba ni de dang 'dra bas nye bar gtags pas dngos ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'di yang zhes bya ba ni de dang 'dra bas nye bar gtags pas dngos ma yin pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThis also‚Äù means that because it is designated as similar to that, it is not real.

original: yang ci ste dper na ral gris glang po la sogs pa gsod pa dang yang ji ltar mes bud shing sreg par byed la ral gri la sogs pa de dag glang po la sogs pa'i ngo bo yang ma yin pa de bzhin du shes pa yul gyi rnam
analyzed: yang ci ste dper na ral gris glang po la sogs pa gsod pa dang yang ji ltar mes bud shing sreg par byed la ral gri la sogs pa de dag glang po la sogs pa'i ngo bo yang ma yin pa de bzhin du shes pa yul gyi rnam
translated: Again, just as a sword kills an elephant and so on, and just as fire burns fuel, the sword and so on are not the entity of the elephant and so on.üîΩ

original: par ma thob kyang yul yongs su gcod par 'gyur ro snyam na /
analyzed: par ma thob kyang yul yongs su gcod par 'gyur ro snyam na /
translated: Moreover, if one thinks that, for example, a sword kills an elephant, and also how fire burns fuel, and that sword, etc. are not the entity of the elephant, etc., in the same way, consciousness, not obtaining the aspect of the object, would apprehend the object.

original: brgya la zhes bya ba la sogs pas dogs pa bsu ba yin no //
analyzed: brgya la zhes bya ba la sogs pas dogs pa bsu ba yin no //
translated: If one thinks that, the response to that is ‚ÄúEven if it is like that, etc.‚Äù

original: 'di zhes bya ba ni shes pa 'di'o //
analyzed: 'di zhes bya ba ni shes pa 'di'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThis‚Äù refers to this consciousness.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni dper na sgron ma la sogs pa sngon po la sogs pa gsal bar byed pa la sogs pa bzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni dper na sgron ma la sogs pa sngon po la sogs pa gsal bar byed pa la sogs pa bzung ngo //
translated: The word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù includes, for example, a lamp, etc. that illuminate blue, etc.

original: 'di mi mtshungs dpe zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di mi mtshungs dpe zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan bshad pa yin te /
translated: The response to that is ‚ÄúThis is not similar, etc.‚Äù

original: ral gri la sogs pa ni glang po la sogs pa'i skyed par byed pa yin pas na gcod par byed pa la sogs pa nyid du grags te /
analyzed: ral gri la sogs pa ni glang po la sogs pa'i skyed par byed pa yin pas na gcod par byed pa la sogs pa nyid du grags te /
translated: Since a sword, etc. is the producer of an elephant, etc., it is renowned as the cutter, etc.

original: ral gri la sogs pa'i sogs brgyab pa na glang po khyad par can gyi tshigs tha dad pa skye ba dang / de bzhin du me dang phrad pa las bud shing sol ba la sogs pa'i ngo bor skye la /
analyzed: ral gri la sogs pa'i sogs brgyab pa na glang po khyad par can gyi tshigs tha dad pa skye ba dang / de bzhin du me dang phrad pa las bud shing sol ba la sogs pa'i ngo bor skye la /
translated: Similarly, when fuel meets fire, it is produced in the form of charcoal and so on.

original: de bzhin du bum pa la sogs pa yang snang ba'i dbang gis shes pa skyed par rung ba nyid du 'gyur ba de ltar shes pas yul la phan pa 'ga' zhig byed pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de bzhin du bum pa la sogs pa yang snang ba'i dbang gis shes pa skyed par rung ba nyid du 'gyur ba de ltar shes pas yul la phan pa 'ga' zhig byed pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: In the same way, a pot and so on is suitable to generate consciousness by the power of appearance. It is not that consciousness benefits the object in that way.

original: 'on kyang yul nyid kyis rnam par shes pa'i khyad par bskyed par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ji ltar cung zad kyang mi byed pa de'i rig par byed par 'gyur /
analyzed: 'on kyang yul nyid kyis rnam par shes pa'i khyad par bskyed par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ji ltar cung zad kyang mi byed pa de'i rig par byed par 'gyur /
translated: However, since the object itself generates a specific consciousness, how could it be the perceiver of that object without doing anything at all?

original: 'di mig la sogs pa rig par byed par yang 'gyur du 'ong bas shes pa de'i 'bras bu nyid de'i rig par byed par brtags par rig pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di mig la sogs pa rig par byed par yang 'gyur du 'ong bas shes pa de'i 'bras bu nyid de'i rig par byed par brtags par rig pa yang ma yin no //
translated: Since it could be that the eye and so on are the perceiver, it is not logical to impute that the result of consciousness is the perceiver.

original: btsun pa dge srungs na re /
analyzed: btsun pa dge srungs na re /
translated: Bhadanta Shrƒ±ya·π£as says:

original: rnam par shes @117a * //
analyzed: rnam par shes @117a * //
translated: Consciousness is the perceiver.

original: pa'i yul gyi rnam pa ma thob na yang yul rtogs par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: pa'i yul gyi rnam pa ma thob na yang yul rtogs par byed pa yin te /
translated: Even when the aspect of the object is not obtained, it causes the object to be cognized,

original: de yongs su gcod pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yongs su gcod pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the nature of determining it.

original: de lta bas na ji ltar yongs su gcod cing ci dang 'dra bar yongs su gcod ces dogs par bya ba ma yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de lta bas na ji ltar yongs su gcod cing ci dang 'dra bar yongs su gcod ces dogs par bya ba ma yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Therefore, it is not to be doubted, ‚ÄúHow does it determine? What is it like when it determines?‚Äù
